Reviews.Title: “Still a very nice resort but the rooms need an update”
Reviews.Author: john a
Reviews.Content: My wife and I haven't been to the Beach Club in about 10 years. While it is still very nice and just a short walk from EPCOT, the rooms are in need of an update. The rooms are very (Disney) clean and comfortable and the beds are the most comfortable in Disney. The staff is very nice and the service is impeccable. The whole resort is clean and pleasent as all of the Disney resorts are. My wife and I love the Beach Club Resort and will retun for the Internation Food and Wine Festival this Fall.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkHello
Reviews.Content: This is my first stay at the Disney's Beach Club Resort and loved it. I haven't been to Disney in 20 years (yes 20 years) and stayed at the Contemporary Resort. I did a lot of research on Beach Club and Yacht Club which paid off. The locale is the best. In walking distance to Epcot, you enter thru the back near the UK Pavilion which was great because I love Fish and Chips! It's a short boat ride to Disney Studios. You can also walk it if you like approx 20 minutes! The rooms were great and very clean! I only had a Standard room in the back but that was ok because it was nice an quiet there. The bus to Magic Kingdom is about 15 minutes and Animal Kingdom is about 20 minutes. I didn't pay for Club Service but felt I didn't need it. The staff was always very helpful and friendly and you can't beat the the Disney Magical Express. The buffet was excellent! I recommend to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Update of electrical Outage”
Reviews.Author: 2Meow
Reviews.Content: I did write to the Disney Vacation Club after my stay. They did follow up with me by telephone after meeting with the hotel staff. I was compensated for the poor service I received. I was VERY happy to see that Disney really does read its email and follows up. This greatly improved my opinion of them & the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Difficult choice but glad we chose this one.”
Reviews.Author: Alexia
Reviews.Content: As newcomers to Disney, it was difficult to choose a Disney resort. Should we be near the Magic Kingdom, Animal Kingdom, Epcot...? In the end we went on style and we were not disappointed. New England style with no real signs of Micky in the room. Perfect. Breakfasts were repetitive but OK. The kids enjoyed the pool but best of all the Beaches and Cream burger bar. Downsides for me was that it was impersonal. We would breakfast at the hotel every day and we would get the same old explanation about how the buffet was laid out. Unfortunately this hotel had the character dining each morning with the same characters every day so the novelty wore off for the children after a few days. Also as it is character breakfast there are massive queues. You have to book a table for breakfast in your own hotel via the concierge and he would often say it was fully booked. My suggestion is to get down to breakfast early to walk in. Another minor point but annoying was taht the A/c was on way too high in the public areas so take a cardi! However, if you just don´t know which hotel to choose and you don´t want to be "Mickeyed-out", I would say Disney´s Beach Club or Yacht Club. Both are neutrally stylish and they share the pool and the facilities. Beach Club is very slightly closer to Epcot, to which you can walk in 5 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: Ryan M
Reviews.Content: When you hear people talk about the Deluxe Disney Resorts, you always hear about The Contemporary, The Grand Floridian, The Polynesian, and even sometimes Animal Kingdom Lodge. We have never known anyone to stay at the Beach Club. WOW!! What a great resort!! We chose to stay here mainly for the pool. We had to check out the "sand bottom" pool. Amazing! I don't know how they do it, but it's absolutely amazing. Multiple hot tubs, large swimming areas, a huge water slide, and a lazy river make this the ultimate pool complex. The lobby was bright and welcoming and the resort layout wasn't as confusing as most resorts. Our room was nice. Understand that we were on the Club Level. Not because we're rich, but because that was all that was available when we booked. Two queen beds and a sofabed we're perfect for our family of 5 with children between ages 7 and 10. The Club Level was great. On the 5th and top floor, only accessible by entering your room key into the slot in the elevator, it had a cozy little lounge that was always stocked with some type of food, snacks, and/or drinks. The breakfast bar was the perfect way to start our day every morning. 2 concierges at your service between 6am and 10pm ready and willing to answer your every need and always greeting you with a smile. The location of the resort was perfect. Literally a 5 minute stroll to the International Gateway at Epcot, it's also within a stone's throw of the Boardwalk Resort and the Dolphin and Swan Resorts. Hop in a boat, and it's a short ride to Hollywood Studios. The bus service was the same as you would see at any of the resort hotels. You have to wait a while on a bus to arrive and then there's the slow, but steady ride to your destination. I will say that there were very few stops in-between (if any), which made for quicker bust trips. All things said, we hated to leave and we will be back to this beautiful resort.

Reviews.Title: “Beach Club Resort - Awesome”
Reviews.Author: CJ K
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort that is located within walking distance of Epcot or a short boat ride. It shares a the most fabulous pool in all of DisneyWorld with the Yatch Club Resort - luxurious sand bottom pool with a lazy river, slides, plenty of shade. Rooms were beautiful, well maintained, turn down service and animal towels left on your bed. Better than the Floridian with one exception you don't see the fireworks show from here, you don't have a monorail to take you to the Magic Kingdom. In the heat of a summer day before or after returning from the Kingdom it is soooooooo nice to be in this pool for adults and children. Arcade, Ice Cream Palors, hambergers and fries or a good sandwich shop is right there by the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but rooms need updating!”
Reviews.Author: JK1263
Reviews.Content: Positives: Location! Quick walk to Epcot, longer walk or a boat ride to Studios and close to Boardwalk. Outstanding service! We were on club level and everyone we encountered was wonderful. Great restaurants (although limited quick service choices). Spacious room with large balcony overlooking quiet pool and daybed. (Daybed is small and best for a younger child.) Super pool complex - the best in the park! Very quiet room HVAC system. Negatives: Room in need of rehab and a good cleanaing! We could write our name in the dust on the desk. Warped and damaged fridge cabinet, worn furnishings, broken over bed light and cracked lampshade on the desk lamp. Bathroom was a horror (and this was club level-deluxe room!). Stained grout, globs of caulk used around toilet base was stained brown GROSS! (Staff insisted it was clean.) Sinks were quite worn. Bus transportation can take a very long time so plan ahead so as not to miss dinner reservations! One ride back from Downtown Disney took more than an hour - not including time waiting for the bus to arrive! Club level lounge is VERY small and can get extremely crowded during breakfast and again between 5-6 PM. Don't use on-line check in if staying for the first time. We did, and missed out on the full intro speech as well as the first time visitor buttons for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: moweryteach
Reviews.Content: This was definitely the place to stay if traveling to the disney parks. It is located right in the middle of it all, within walking distance to epcot and just a shuttle ride or water taxi ride to the other parks. It was very nice, clean, quiet and had a store in the lobby with many things that were in the park stores, so you didnt have to buy soveniers in the parks and carry them around, just wait and get them there. We didnt try it, but they had a character breakfast in the lobby rest which seemed fun if you were interested in that. It is located right on the water near the taxi shuttle with a very nice view. We enjoyed our stay very much!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but is the price worth it?”
Reviews.Author: donnellyjen
Reviews.Content: Loved the furnishings of this deluxe resort. Theme was awesome. We liked the proximity to Epcot also. Stormalong Bay we were told via mail would be closed during our stay for refurbishments but it was operating and was fun. Your room location can defiantely make or break your stay here. Also be sure to request a LARGE BALCONY. I made the mistake on the online check-in to check off large or small not knowing the difference. A small balcony means you will have a door and a 3 inch square to stand on. Other than aesthetics I'm not sure what the hell the purpose of those balconies is for. So useless. Also for the price we would have liked a larger fridge and a microwave in the room. Also in hindsight travelling with 2 young kids we should have gotten a suite with a seperate room. Otherwise you'll all be in one large room and well my kids won't sleep if the light or tv is on. We stayed on the third floor closer to the small pool and Epcot. It was a good location for Epcot, laundry and small pool but a decent walk to the lobby and a big hike to the buses. Also the transportation stinks here. Buses to AK and DD include 4 other hotels so they are always packed. It took us 1 hour to get home from DD and 45 minutes from AK. The food court is also not that great. Very minimal offerings and selection. The French Quater has a better food court and is a Disney moderate hotel. Overall I would stay here again for the pools, proximity to EPCOT, and the overall theme and the rooms were comfortable. I would just be very particular in room request and if travelling during a busier time I might think about driving to some park and attractions rather than relying on Disney buses. We also liked wlaking to Hollywood Studios and the boat there. Beaches and Cream was great too as was room service. It's definately a popular hotel and busy so be prepared it can be quite noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome (but pricey) deluxe resort. Club level room review”
Reviews.Author: KatieCollette
Reviews.Content: This is my absolute favorite Disney resort stay that we have had so far! It started when we pulled up in our car at 10:00 AM (wayyyy before the 4:00 PM check in). I gave my name to the bellhop who was unloading our car and another man walked up to us and told us our room was already ready. They led us up to our room floor (it was club level) and had a personalized check in there. My only complaint is that I felt kind of rushed, they just gave us our papers and the bellhop took us straight to the room. While I know that having a fast checkin is good, I just felt like they wanted to be done with us and check us off their list, instead of giving us the personal check in that is expected for club level. Next, the bell hop took us all the way down two hallways to the very last room on the floor. We didn't mind the walk since you come to Disney World expecting to walk a lot, but I know others wouldn't feel the same way. We received one of only three king bed rooms in the room category we booked for, and they have to fit the kings into odd shaped rooms to make it fit, which is why we had a corner room all the way at the end of the resort. And, we didn't mind at all, because the room was HUGE! It was a big square shape that you could have easily fit another king bed in there and still had plenty of room. We also had two standing balcony's since we were a corner room. The bed was huge and comfy, which we also received a nice turn down service complete with chocolates every night. The bathroom was big and clean. Housekeeping was immaculate. This was our first time doing club level and we would do it again! The cast members went out of their way to make our stay magical, getting us whatever we wanted. One of the men even overhead us talking about needing a phone charger and not having one, and he walked over and handed us one to borrow! The food was plentiful, enough to eat a solid breakfast every morning. They had pastries, breads, hard boiled eggs, oatmeal, and fruit. Snacks during the day included chips, pretzels, candy, trail mix. They had appetizers and veggies at night, along with desserts. They helped us make and cancel a few dinner reservations and basically made our trip great! The pool was awesome, could always find some chairs in the shade. Sometimes the main hot tub was crowded, but there were a few more that were more hidden that you could relax in. Sand bottom was great! One tiny complaint we had was that the main lobby is always crowded with people waiting to go into the restaurant that is there. Other than that, great hotel and we wouldn't hesitate to stay there again! But would only do club level!

Reviews.Title: “Best WDW Resort for Epcot Fans”
Reviews.Author: MalOVision
Reviews.Content: This resort is about as close as you can get to Epcot. It was a 5 minute walk from our room to the International Gateway entrance to the park. Our room was very large, and I really enjoyed the theming. The only issue I had: although our room was conveniently located in the main building, it did get a bit noisy at night. We did enjoy how close we were to the Friendship boat launch and Stormalong Bay, though. It's only a 15 minute boat ride to Disney's Hollywood Studios from the Beach Club. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who plans to spend the majority of their Disney vacation at Epcot and/or DHS.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent deluxe Disney hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: Rip09
Reviews.Content: Very impressed. Spotlessly clean and bright public areas, nice atmosphere in the hotel. All the staff were courteous, polite and professional from reception to concierge to bellhops to room maids to restaurant staff. The room was a bit cramped, but we were not there to spend time in the room. The Cape May restaurant has an excellent (but expensive) seafood buffet. the ice cream parlour is also good. Captains Grille restaurant is fine. Pools were crowded - one pool with the pirate ship slide closed for refurbishment while we were there - odd timing in the Easter holidays! In walking distance of Epcot; boat to Disney Hollywood studios stops nearby; resort buses stop just outside every 10-15m. We stayed five days and were sorry to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort!!”
Reviews.Author: Laura H
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Disney World. We stayed in the Caribbean Beach Resort the first go round. Though a very, very nice resort, we decided to try something new. We originally chose the Yacht Club but due to our room choice was put in the Beach Club Resort instead. At first we were disappointed, but after viewing pictures online we decided it was a better choice. And after staying there we know it was the best choice we could make. You just walk around and take in the breathtaking view of the waters, the lighthouse. and the boardwalk across the lake. And when you walk into the Lobby you are hit with the most wonderful smell. We finally asked and was told it was Green Aloe and Clover. I wanted to bottle it and bring it home! Another thing I want to mention is that everyday you leave to go to the parks or whatever you room is of course serviced by housekeeping. We had a wonderful housekeeper and everyday we would come back to a new surprise in our room. She used towels to leave animal shapes in our room. One day it was a monkey hanging from our lamp, then it was a huge lobster, then a rabbit, then two swans touching noses. A couple of days we had someone different. On those days our server would use my son's toys as our surprise. I had bought him a T-Rex from Animal Kingdom. We came back to find it guarding the door. It was so fun to see what they would think of next. It was a little adventure everyday. We had the best time and if we get to come to back Disney World again we will most definately be staying at the Beach Club Resort!

Reviews.Title: “First Stay At A Deluxe Resort! Last Stay At A Deluxe Resort”
Reviews.Author: JohnKIOhio
Reviews.Content: First of all, it was no more than average. We come to Disney every year. We usually stay at Port Orleans Riverside. We loved the walk to Epcot from The Beach Club Resort. It's not worth the extra $1300 we spent to stay here. They have no food court. That sucks with the kids. The rooms weren't as clean as Riverside. I would not come back here with kids. This would be a GREAT location for couples or adult meetings! I was torn between rating this a 3 or 4. I would give Riverside a 4 and this isn't as good. It's fancier and check in is a little easier. The staff kisses your rear end a little better too. The bus rides still take forever from here.

Reviews.Title: “Another Super Stay at the Beach Club”
Reviews.Author: Sunnyday85
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 days at the Beach Club (our 2nd time there) from 4/14 - 4/21. Once again - a fantastic time! When doing the online check-in, prior to leaving home, I requested a full balcony. Upon our arrival at the BC, we found the request was granted. However, the room's full balcony overlooked the roof, with no view. We initially decided this was ok. But, after a sleepless night adjacent to the service elevator, we immediately requested a new room the next morning. We were happily moved by 10 AM, to a larger room, with a great view! The front desk was very accommodating. We had also received a letter from the BC a few weeks prior to our trip, advising that some of Stormalong Bay would be closed for renovations the week were were there. To our surprise, the entire pool area was opened on our 2nd day. We traveled w/ our 3 and 12-year olds - again very impressed w/ the sand-covered pool bottom in the more shallow areas. This is GREAT for younger kids. Enjoyed a wonderful character breakfast (the 3rd) at Cape May...selection is fantastic and yummy! Also had the seafood buffet one evening - also very good. My only complaint is that even though we made reservations WAY ahead for both breakfast and dinner at the Cape May Cafe, particularly w/ breakfast, when we arrived even a few minutes ahead of our reservation time, we had to wait about 25 minutes for a table. What is the point in making a reservation if you have to wait? Only a small point, though. Close proximity to Epcot and Hollywood Studios is a big bonus for this resort as well. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Such a pretty, well located resort.”
Reviews.Author: frankieandsandy
Reviews.Content: As a family, I was really pleased that we decided on this resort. It is right next to Epcot - which has the best dining options in the whole of Disney World, especially for dinner. Our children range in age from 10 to 4, and they all enjoyed the character dining at Cape May Cafe on the resort, the marshmallow toasting on the beach and the boardwalk area in the evenings. We watched the Epcot fireworks from the resort one night and they were spectacular! The rooms were very well appointed for families and staff were so helpful with every request. My husband became ill during our stay and had to be taken to hospital by ambulance - the staff were absoultely fantastic and very attentive to our needs. I must especially thank resort manager Sol and Sandcastle club manager Donna for going out of their way to help out with our children during our time at the hospital. My kids have never stayed in a kid's club before and had such a great experience, I was truly, truly grateful. When something goes wrong, its good to know you have support around you, so thank you again to the staff at Beach Club. All of the other theme parks within Disney Wprld are easily accessible from Beach Club, via boat or bus and we had no problem getting around. One tip if you're travelling by bus: bring a sweater because the air conditioning is set to Arctic temperatures! Overall, I HIGHLY recommend Beach Club if you're visiting Disney World as a family. The ambience is lovely and it really is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Relieved to be back in Disney - Bliss”
Reviews.Author: DisneyloverUk
Reviews.Content: What can I say, had a fantastic time spent the first 4 nts in a non Disney hotel then arrived at Disneys Beach Club in September for 12nts. Arrived about 12pm & was given our keys to a room on floor 3 a overlooking a garden opposite the beach area. Room felt larger than moderate rooms we've stayed in & Saratoga Springs Studio. Only had a tiny balcony however we were able to view Illuminations Reflections of Earth, EPCOT. Room was also very clean & remained that way throughout the stay. Lobby staff always seemed friendly & good with children. Just wish there was a bigger seating area for the food court, however hardly used it so can't complain. Bell services deserve a mention excellent service. My 8yr old adored Richard from the lobby, he was fantastic with her & such a nice man. Got to say lifeguards were fun, (best Disney lifeguards we've came across) great interaction with children & felt safe knowing they were there. Children's pool party was just what we needed to entertain a shy 8yr old, they certainly had the magic of building my daughters confidence, Raouf especially. This is by far one of the best children's clubs in Disney that we've came across IMO. What more can I say had a great holiday & was relieved to be in Disney as opposed to The non Disney resort we tried at the start of our 16nt trip. We've tried many Disney resorts & this is one of our fave's. Best pool by far. Convenient location & great restaurants on the doorstep. Hope we can make it this year :-I

Reviews.Title: “Great resort! Location, location, location!!!”
Reviews.Author: rg66
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 just returned from Disney and this was our first stay at Beach Club. It was wonderful! Perfect for my kids, ages 11, 13, & 17. We walked to Epcot everyday and saw something different. It was like our backyard, the location was amazing! We were at the pool everyday for a couple of hours, the quiet pool was so much nicer and our room was right near it. We also laid out on the beach which was nice change. Hollywood Studios was a relaxing 10min boat ride away. We actually walked through Epcot to use the monorail to get to MK and we also used the bus transportation which was excellent too. The rooms were clean and counter space and drawer space was abundant. You really could stay at this hotel and not need the parks b/c its a resort. So much to do, or not do. And b/c of shared things with Yacht Club, the choices are endless. I really cannot say a bad thing about it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Suncrew
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Beach Club Resort during March Break. Had a great time. The hotel was beautiful and the staff was very friendly. Our room was spacious and very clean and had a nice balcony that overlooked the quiet pool. We were within a five minute walk to the back entrance of EPCOT and a seven minute boat ride to Hollywood Studios. The hotel had a small quiet pool in one area and a larger sand bottom pool with a waterslide, lazy river and activities for the kids that were hosted by staff members. This hotel had a great resort feel to it which we enjoyed after a long day at the parks. We look forward to staying here again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Disney Resort hotels”
Reviews.Author: KoloheSanJose
Reviews.Content: We stayed March 27th through March 30th. We originally booked the standard room in January (2012) with the Disney (on line) deal of pay for 3 get 4th night free. We also did the on line check in before we arrived. On the day of our arrival (at about 1:30pm) we were greeted by name, and escorted to the 5th floor concierge level. They upgraded us at no cost because they were booked out of the standard rooms. What a wonderful surprise! saved us tons of money because of no extra cost for breakfast. We were truly thrilled. And our room overlooked the lake and plaza. The pool area is under construction, but we still enjoyed the amenities. The location of this resort is ideal for a WDW experience. You can walk to the back entrance of EPCOT, you can board the ferry boat to Hollywood Studios, and you can board the buses to the other parks easily. Staff is typical Disney. Pleasant, helpful, attentive of every need from the customer. I have considered trying out the Grand Fla, and the Poly, but in all the reviews in all the tour guides we read- Beach Club is the best of all. Reasonable pricing and excellent amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: WestIndian4ever
Reviews.Content: Visited this resort for a business conference and without my family unfortunately. As with other Disney resorts, you have complimentary shuttle to Disney parks and downtown Disney which works like clockwork. Rooms are fantastic and what you would expect from a resort in this class. I have visited Disney on several occasions and stayed at off site hotels, resorts and timeshares, but after staying here, I can say that it is the only way to go. No more off site stays for me again It is so much more convenient to stay on Disney's compound. The only thing I did not like was the choice of eating options at the hotel, while the restaurant was good, it was monotonous.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the pools!”
Reviews.Author: WootenLisa
Reviews.Content: This resort is within walking distance to EPCOT and Boardwalk. So convenient. Great pools. Good beach. Lots of kids!! Staff is so helpful and friendly!! Room was quiet and bed very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful stay”
Reviews.Author: Carmen M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our 2012 vacation. It was amazing! I loved it! The pool was so neat! It had a sand floor and the kiddie pool was so much fun they had it just like a beach! My daughter loved it so much and shes only 7 mos. she loved playing in the sand and pool! The rooms were nice I loved the decorations and paintings. We had a balcony as well which was nice to relax. You could sort of see epcots fireworks from the pool. All over good hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: rtanner8
Reviews.Content: Great pool, lovely rooms, and staff was great. Convenient to holllywood studios and epcot. Was a little surprised to find cigarette butts just outside our garden view room - Disney is usually immaculate. But I can't say anything worse than this. This was a great visit and we have loved the Grand Floridian and Poly too. r

Reviews.Title: “A Disney Dream!!!”
Reviews.Author: jentucci
Reviews.Content: This was our children's first trip to Disney. We chose the Beach Club and were THRILLED! The staff was friendly and accommodating. The pool and recreation areas were beautiful and lots of fun. It was a very convenient short walk to Epcot and an easy boat ride to Hollywood Studios! When we return for our next visit we will surely choose the Beach Club Again!

Reviews.Title: “Little run down but convinient”
Reviews.Author: smoke77
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent, rooms were small and a little rundown (doors to drawers broken and toilet that runs forever). However, the pool was awesome and the convenient location made up for the average nature of the hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “One of Disney's Best”
Reviews.Author: kgoeding
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in three years at the Beach Club. The rooms are clean, quiet (at least our section is quiet), and family friendly. There is easily enough room for a family of five. They have started doing some remodeling... starting with the fantastic pool area. Any time there is updating going on it is a nuiscence, but that is to be expected. It is a short walk to Epcot and if your room patio faces Epcot you can see some or most of the evening fire works display. The boat ride to Hollywood is about 5 -8 minutes and it runs every 15-20 minutes from the boat dock. The ride to Magic Kingdom is about 12-15 minutes. BCR is the first stop, so you are pretty much guaranteed a seat or a standing spot. At least that is our experience. The bus to Animal kingdom took a bit longer if I recall correctly. We were there seven days.. it turns into a blur after awhile. The steak house on property at the YCR is fanastic, the sit down buffet in the BCR was great with more choices that you can imagine. They have a character breakfast with Mickey, Minnie, Daisy, and Goofy. Donald may have been there, but I don't recall. The Market Street cafe/convenience shop at BCR had plenty of food options, and they carried plenty of supplies of little things we forgot. They also carry a lot of Disney gear. When you make your reservations for Disney book it out 180 days in advance and book all other options at that time. It gets very time intensive and confusing when you book thigs randomly. Know what dining plan you want (we laways do Delux and pretty much use everything up especially when it is hot and you buy a lot of waters and iced drinks. Know where you want to eat your sit downs especially the character dining as they fill up fast. Aim to have one early breakfast at MK so you can enter the park early and score some great photo ops without the crowds! If you are flying to Orlando use the Magical Express to get to and from airport and hotel. Just provide them with your flight info and they take care of the rest. Easy!! I have celiacs disease so eating out is difficult at best. But WDW made it SO easy. At sit downs the chef came out to help with menu options and changes that he could make, at quick service places the manager would come out and go over my choices make the necessary changes and then they would make the meal themselves and deliver to me and only me. They do this for all allergy issues. It was such a treat to have seven days of no meal worries!! The only negative that noticed was that the hallways carpets needed updating, but that issue is being addressed. Good luck and enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Disney Beach Club”
Reviews.Author: MAtravelbug
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Disney Beach Club resort in January for the Walt Disney World Marathon Weekend. Although it is one of the older luxury resorts in WDW you'd never know it. The room was large, very light and we had a balcony overlooking the lagoon. It is walking distance to Epcot with its myriad of dining options for those with park tickets. Although the park was fairly crowded for january, it was because of all the marathon runners, we still managed to get on every ride and attraction without much of a wait. Service was impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort! Great pools!”
Reviews.Author: Familywilltravel5
Reviews.Content: Our family enjoyed our stay here. The view from our room was so beautiful. Our teenagers spent hours in the pools and slide. Nice to be able to walk to Epcot. Boat to Hollywood studios is easier than walking. Getting off at the dolphin swan hotel stop could save time on returning from Hollywood studios. We had no issues with buses getting to other parks. We tend to head to parks early though. The only negative was that we didn't care for the single person balcony. Why so tiny? (this was the reason for no 5 star)Must eat at Beaches and Cream! Great service and food! You can watch the Epcot fireworks from the bridge between Boardwalk and Beach Club.

Reviews.Title: “Disney's Beach Club Resort Is Tops!”
Reviews.Author: Samuel V
Reviews.Content: It starts at the airport with the Disney 'hospitality' from the Magic Express Transportation Team and continues throughout your stay at the Hotel. Everyone is most helpful and courteous. The Beach Club Resort topped all of my expectations in every way. The minute you step off the bus you are greeted by the Hotel crew - who are there to take care of your every wish. The 'beach club' theme permeates the hotel and transports you back to an East Coast Beach Resort of the 1940's. The white powder beach - just a stones throw from the hotel - gives you time for relaxation and sunning, IF you can drag yourself away from all you need to do, in order to see all of the DisneyWorld Experience! The beach connects two other Disney Vacation Club Resorts to a giant man-made lake - and the landscaping is beautiful. All are accessible via a large canal boat which runs non-stop day and night - taking you to your hotel, Epcot and the Boardwalk. Epcot is a 5-minute walk and busses run contantly to the other Disney attractions. The room was large, with a small refrigerator (handy to keep snacks in) - snacks you can purchase at the small store just off the lobby at reasonable prices, as well as breakfast, drinks, pastries, and a endless refillable coffee mug. Location is always key - especially after a long day of parkhopping - and Disney has planned ahead for this. The Beach Club is the perfect place to stay on your DisneyWorld vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent place, but you are paying for location”
Reviews.Author: dtaylor197
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time we've stayed here and we stay here for the location. Extremely convenient to Epcot and Hollywood Studios. It has a lot of pool areas, and the kids loved it. Some of the pools were extremely crowded though...for the price the service is not fantastic. Most of the people we dealt with were quite good, but checkin was problematic (we had 3 rooms, I had pre-checked in online, but then had to checkin again, and we had to checkin separately for all 3 rooms, and then they screwed up the rooms we needed adjoining - which wouldn't be a pain if not for the way the tickets/key cards work). Additionally one room had my sister-in-law and her 2 kids, and her husband was joining for the weekend. I tried to call the hotel beforehand to arrange - but you can't! No way to call the hotel directly. Then when he got there they were very helpful and gave him a keycard, but when we tried to go to the pool, they said he couldn't come in because he wasn't a guest. The only 2 reasons to stay here are proximity to Epcot and the abundance of pools. Everything else is average (or worse).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nicely appointed, cool pool!”
Reviews.Author: EastTexasGMan
Reviews.Content: We have been to the Orlando/Disney area many times over the years, but this was our first experience staying at a Disney resort. I think we picked a near perfect location as this resort is located within walking distance of Epcot (literally, a 4 minute walk around the sidewalk) and is a short 8 minute ferry ride to Hollywood Studios. Of course, bus transportation picks you up at the front door and takes you to MK and AK, also in a matter of minutes. So, for location, you simply can't beat it. Service: Unmatched. Every employee that we encountered was eager to assist in any way possible to make our stay better. You will not find better service. Resort: As with everything Disney, beautiful everything. It really is an eye-catching place and the beach, landscaping, lobby, rooms, market, etc. were all spotless. Located right on the lake and a 5 minute ferry ride to the Boardwalk. The swimming pool is a work of art, complete with hot tubs and water slides. Just being here makes you feel good. Dining: Several options, all are super busy so reservations are strongly recommended! We ate at the Captain's Grille. Food was OK, service was marginal and none of us felt like we got the appropriate bang-for-the-buck. My daughter ordered the snow crab legs for $29. She's had better at Red Lobster. My fish filet was about the size of the filet-o-fish at McD's, but costs 12x more. We didn't try the other 'nice' restaurant or the seafood buffet. We did go to "Beaches-n-Cream", a retro styled soda shop/ice cream bar. You can get sandwiches here too. Our brownie sundae was spectacular and it was enough for several to share. Rooms: The rooms are very nicely appointed, very Cape Cod'ish in decor, tastefully and appropriately "disneyed" here and there. Clean linens, clean room, nice view of the courtyard. No complaints at all. Overall, you pay for the location and the service. The room really isn't that much nicer than other 'moderate' hotels (Hampton Inn, H.I. Express, Hyatt Place, etc.), so it really is the location that commands the premium price. But when you spend 15+ hours walking around a Disney park...location means A LOT! Nice Job, Disney!

Reviews.Title: “Deluxe Club Room in the 2500s is close to Epcot”
Reviews.Author: pabirds
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here before, but this time, we lucked into a deluxe room on the second floor in the 2500s section of the hotel, which had three advantages: 1) a semi-private pool adjacent to a laundry room, 2) an elevator away from the lobby which was hardly ever in use, 3) located at the Epcot end of the hotel with a special entrance onto the path to Epcot. Lots of people book the Beach Club versus the Yacht Club, because of the two, it's closest to the Epcot entrance (a real advantage when you're lugging your family out of the park after a long day). But if you ask for a room with a number from 2500 to 2599, you'll get the added bonus of being even closer. We were in the 2550 - 2560 range which was prime real estate. The negative is that you have a little longer walk to the main pool, which is definitely worth using at least once, but we're not talking a major inconvenience here, only minor. The Deluxe Room was a little pricier, but was worth it for a family of 5. 'Still only one bathroom, but plenty of room to spread-out. There was a relatively spacious balcony, too, with four chairs and 2 small tables overlooking the small "quiet" pool. We also had access to one of the hotel "clubs" with this room, which adds convenience, but only saves you money if you really work at it. Breakfasts are free (hard-boiled eggs, fruit, bagels, croissants, danish, cereal, hot oatmeal). But midday snacks consist of soda and cookies, basically, and while you can make a meal out of the hors'dourves and veggies they put out in the evening, you have to plan for it because they're only out from 5pm - 7pm. After that, almost everything goes away (including the beer and wine). Then, some very tasty desserts and cordials like Kalua are available until 10pm. You can borrow Disney DVDs for the room for free, too.

Reviews.Title: “Ho Hum, Ho Hum!”
Reviews.Author: lauryn57
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel in late February and have been trying to wrap my arms around this review. Here's the good: The staff is extremely helpful and friendly. The location is great if you want to be near Epcot and the Swan and Dolphin Resort. Here's the bad: Hotel needs to be updated, internet service in the rooms is TERRIBLE, you have to used the internet in the lobby or outside in the rocking chairs, cost of food is through the roof and not a good choice of restaurants (there are restaurants, but they have specific schedules for service). So with that being said, if you don't plan to stay in the room much or use the internet, then everything should be just great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good access to theme parks, good facility for kids”
Reviews.Author: MarinaDelRey335
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at several resorts in WDW including Grand Floridian Resorts, but this Beach Club Resorts and/or Yacht Club Resorts seem to be the best for access to all theme parks. This time we could not make a reservation for a nice lake view room due to a last minute reservation but a pool view was also very comfortable. The Beach Club has all necessary facility for kids up to low teens including self-serving soft drink bar. There are several choices of pools, sports activity fields, and even gaming. The main restaurant "Cape May Cafe" offers breakfast and dinner buffet with Disney's Character Dining. The only problem is you need to make a reservation more than a week ahead of your dining day otherwise no good reservation time will be available. This is a common problem for all Disney's Character Dining place. Considering the quality of facility, equipment, and hospitality of the staffs, the cost performance is questionable. However the benefit on location will trade off the minor issues.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Disney Resort”
Reviews.Author: hydster007
Reviews.Content: We LOVE the Beach Club. Pool is just amazing- slides & sand bottom. Great location. Walk or boat ride to Epcot, Boardwalk, & Hollywood Studios. Bus rides can be long & crowded due to multiple stops @ other hotels. Clam bake dinner is awesome- try the oreo bon bons. Can be a long walk to your room but then again it is a large hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms...Great location...need better needs”
Reviews.Author: Impoolside
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay! Our room had plenty of space and double vanity sinks make for easy to get ready to begin our day. The location could not of been better. It's less than a 10 minute walk to the back entrance to Epcot and all the countries. You can enjoy a large pool with a lot of kids or you can enjoy a pool that tends to be mostly adults. The worse thing at this hotel is that the beds ad beyond hard! And after a long day of walking all over the place at the parks you would love to come back to a comfortable bed to recoup before the next day begins. But neither my husband or I could get good rest due to the beds being so uncomfortable. And will love a firm mattress. It's one are that Disney skimped and it shows.

Reviews.Title: “Great location though not too "magical"”
Reviews.Author: Matthew C
Reviews.Content: This was my first time ever staying at Disney World, and I thought it was lots of fun. This hotel though, was not. Disney's theme is to be "magica,l" and this hotel definitely was not. In all the website pictures they (obviously) made the lobby look huge and grand, along with all the other Disney hotels. But when I stepped inside the real lobby, I felt very lame. That night we went down to the Animal Kingdom Lodge for a dinner reservation and the lobby was AMAZING. Aside from that, everything else, the service, location, etc. was great. We could walk to one park, take a boat to another, and buses to the last two. The pool is nice, has a good water slide and the bottom of the pool was sandy like the ocean. That was a nice change. The staff was very welcoming to us and every day after the parks our room was nice and clean. What I am trying to say is that it is a good hotel but the price, and the fact that it is Disney World made me expect a bit more. Though the truth is, you probably won't be spending too much time in the hotels, because there are four massive theme parks five minutes away. If you just want the parks, really nothing else then it's fine. But if you really want the full experience, try a different Disney hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I think I am done with Disney.”
Reviews.Author: Joseph S
Reviews.Content: I go to Disneyworld four to five times a year. I love the feeling that the parks give me. I like walking forever and getting out and about over a beach resort where I just sit and sit and sit. But I am tired of paying five star rates at Disney resorts and getting two star service. Twice in our last visit they completely forgot to clean our suite (which was $780 a night average). When we complained there was no real concern. It is so so busy at Disney that treating the customer with respect has gone out the window. Disney is so powerful they don't care about us at all. Sad day in mudville. I love the brand but now hate the hotels. This goes double for the Grand Floridian which is so passe and old that it is embarrassing that I have paid so much, so many times to stay there. So it goes. If you really need proximity to parks stay at the Disney resorts but get ready for five star costs $500 plus a night and 2 star service. Next time I will be at the Waldorf and dreaming of when the Four Seasons opens in Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Stay at the Beach Club”
Reviews.Author: TravelMel1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Beach Club for our 25th Anniversary celebration. As part of our celebration we planned a Vow Renewal service at the Wedding Pavilion. My son (21) and my parents (83 and 75) came along with us. We booked 3 rooms, one for my husband and I for 8 nights, and one each for my parents and my son for 5 nights each. My father is in a wheelchair so we needed a handicap accessible room for him along with a few medical needs to make his stay more comfortable. I had done the online checkin (which I highly recommend) and our rooms were ready when we arrived. However, even though I had confirmed several times with reservations about the special needs for my father, the first room they assigned him was not handicapped accessible and they were not aware of the extra medical necessities. The front desk staff was very apologetic and got them reassigned right away and the medical items were delivered within minutes of they arriving in the room. We had a problem with our first room also but it was remedied by a very helpful cast member who went above and beyond to make sure that our stay was magical. Once the check in process was complete...the rest of our stay was wonderful. The hotel is beautiful, the staff was very friendly and helpful, the pool is amazing, Beaches and Cream is a wonderful place, the store on site is wonderful and has everything that you should need during your stay. It's very convenient to stop and get refills in your refillable mugs on the way to the room. It is a large resort and some of the rooms are quite a hike from the elevator. If you need to be close you should try to request a room nearer the elevator. There are differences with the balconies also. My son and parents had small balconies with their rooms. Only one person could stand on the balcony. My husband and I had a full balcony with two chairs and a table. The decor was very well themed. The beds were very comfortable and the room was spacious for a Disney room (all disney rooms are a bit smaller than your normal hotel rooms at the various rate levels). The staff was so wonderful the day of our anniversary vow renewal. They made us feel so special and sent up a complimentary white chocolate mickey mouse and chocolate covered strawberries to congratulate us. Housekeeping was great. Our room was always made up in a timely manner and we had great towel origami's most days. The location of this hotel is wonderful. Everything is so convenient. Being able to go throughout the back entrance of Epcot is so simple. The boat to Hollywood Studios is right there and you can even go in the back entrance of Epcot and walk to the front of the park where you can pick up the monorail to the Magic Kingdom. Even though we had a few issues on checking in, I would highly recommend this hotel. Everything was remedied very quickly and they know how to make the magic happen!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Disney Villas”
Reviews.Author: MaryAnne D
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about the Disney Beach Club. Location is awesome-you can walk to the Boardwalk, Epcot and Disney Hollywood. You could also take a boat to Disney Hollywood. Shuttle service to other parks was very quick. The Stormalong Bay is great for little kids, and has a fun water slide. The lifeguards play games and build sandcastles with the kids Each night there is a campfire and marshmallow roasting, and they show a Disney movie on the beach which the kids loved. The Cape May character breakfast was delicious. I found the service at the hotel to be fast, reliable and helpful. For example, we had one extra sit down meal left on our meal plan and they were very quick to help us figure out the best way to use it. We had a 2 bedroom villa which was great with our 3 1/2 and 2 year old. Balcony overlooked the private pool. Rooms were clean and decorated in a 'beachy' fashion.My only complaint would be that the villas seem to be located so far from Stormalong Bay. This was my first trip to Disney and I absolutely loved it. One big role in that was the Disney Beach Club-really amazing place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wowsa! Great location, beautiful hotel in every way!”
Reviews.Author: MiTraveler33
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here. You know the service will be excellent when you are greeted at least twice on your way in the doors. This hotel has a wonderful, bright energy. We stayed in a room with two queen beds with a large balcony that overlooked the waterfront. It was wonderfully quiet and peaceful. The decor was fresh and clean. The room was more generously sized than a similar room at the Grand Floridian, one of Disney's 5-star hotels. We had some warm and cool weather during our 5-day stay, so we were able to use the pool. It was lovely and there was always some activity going on for the kids. The walk to Epcot was five minutes. We loved being able to go back and forth at will. The bus to Magic Kingdom was fast and reliable. It was much easier than driving and parking ourselves. There's also a business center there so you can ship things back home very reasonably. The food is very reasonable. We had dinner one night and the character breakfast buffet another time. Both were very tasty. There's also a marketplace for quick meals of salads, sandwiches and pizza that was open late when we returned from the parks. They truly thought of everything. The beds were wonderfully comfortable. We would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “best location and pool in disney-but....”
Reviews.Author: JRA610
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite’s deluxe resorts at Disney. The location is great you can walk into the back entrance at Epcot (which is nice for just going to dinner there) also Hollywood studios are a short boat ride or 15 minute walk. The boardwalk is also a fun place to be near. The pool is fantastic, though they are overly strict on who can enter, for instance my in-laws were staying at a differenct Disney resort while we were there, and had come over to watch the kids swim and have a few drinks with us, and under no circumstance would they let my children's grandparents (2- 65 year old adults) in the pool area *which was not overly crowded), in addition they had absolutely no intention of swimming, as they were dressed in light jackets and shorts. This made it very difficult for us because the kids were torn from wanting to enjoy the pool or spending time with their grandparents who they see 3 times a year. It was very disappointing considering my in-laws are season pass holders and have visited Disney (staying on property) more than 65 more times, and make frequent trips per year. The staff would make absolutely no exception, and at one point they would not let my husband in the pool area, because he did not have the room key, even I walked over and told the cast member this way my husband (who's the room was registered too and paid for it). The resort is very nice though; rooms are OK, not as nice as the Contemporary. But the location is great, unless you have very little kids and plan on spending the majority of time at Magic Kingdom (you have to bus over). My kid are 12 and 8, and have gone to Disney every year, so we usually only spend 1 to 2 days at magic kingdom, and schedule dinners at other parks/resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at Disney's Beach Club”
Reviews.Author: JudygReading_PA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (both newly retired) decided to take a 'soul breather' and go to Disney for a long weekend to experience good old Disney joy and delight! It was our first visit without kids or grandkids, and we had a blast. We worked with Lynda Hower from DreamMakers Vacation, and she easily set us up for our first visit to the Beach Club, since we wanted to walk to Epcot and Hollywood Studios. We also treated ourselves to Club Level for the first time - what a treat! Easy breakfast before we left for the parks, kind helpful concierge people to take care of all our questions easily, delicious appetizers and drinks early evening, and yummy desserts and drinks later eveing. We ate our big meals around noon, mostly at Epcot or the Boardwalk area, and could just have an appetizer/drinks for dinner, and we were full and very happy. We found the hotel room very clean, updated and comfortable. Room was smaller than the Polynesian, but was great for the 2 of us, and I really liked that, unlike Poly, there were 2 sinks outside the bathroom area so 2 people could get ready at same time. Lobby was bright and cheerful. Weather was a little too cold to use pool area, but on our last day it finally got sunny and we ate lunch and swam at the pool which was fabulous! Can't wait to bring the kids back to swim in Storm Along Bay, I think it is called. And the convenience of this resort, with a 5 minute walk to Epcot, 20 minute walk or boat ride to Hollywood Studios was so convenient. Buses came quickly for Animal KIngdom and the Magic Kingdom. We just had a very easy, relaxing and delightful time.

Reviews.Title: “Our Princess' First Time!”
Reviews.Author: neicbomb
Reviews.Content: We were in Disney for 8 days. Our hotel experience did not start off that well. It took a lot longer than noted to get our luggage from Magical Express. First morning we had no water and front desk gave a room key to another room that didn't exist to take showers. This gave us a very late start on our first day. I had to call Housekeeping everyday for extra coffee and condiments. They offered free wireless but it didn't work . We stayed there for the conveniece of being able to walk as well as buses. Other than that, I think they are overpriced! We went in December and I was kind of disappointed that they didn't have more decor! Oh and our balcony with a view...was a view of the other building and the front parking lot and the balcony was about a foot wide.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Experience Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Clive1954
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while at the IBM Lotusphere conference. The hotel is very clean and well mangaged but you can't avoid the 'Disney' experience which is fine if that's your thing but it's not mine. I really can't fault the hotel in terms of comfort, cleanliness and service and a great location if you are into theme parks. It was also good as a conference hotel. You are rather insulated from the real Orlando so the choice is yours.

Reviews.Title: “One of Disney's best!”
Reviews.Author: Jeff38094
Reviews.Content: Although a bit expensive, a very beautiful , comfortable, and relaxing resort. It has the best pool on Disney property (shared with the Yacht club). There are many food choices here and at the Boardwalk across the lake: I enjoyed ESPN Club, Big River Grille, and Cape May Cafe. The area is very fun at night. epcot is a five minute walk, the Studios are a 10 minute boat ride. If cost is not important or you can splurge, you won't be disappointed with this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we hoped for and more”
Reviews.Author: SimnCaite
Reviews.Content: The hotel was better than we hoped for! We were there to celebrate our wedding anniversary, so were disappointed to be given a room with two beds. We spoke with the hotel staff about the dearth of king beds and were amazed at their generosity - we were upgraded to the most amazing room on the top floor, king bed, overlooking the water! The hotel staff epitomized everything great about Disney! Our greatest disappointment was not with the hotel but with the parks. We had been told that the parks typically had lower occupancy during December, and that was not our experience. What was so appreciated about the Beach Club was that we could escape the frenetic parks environment and just be surrounded by calm at the Beach Club. Amazingly, we were usually the only people in the pool! As for walking, we averaged 12 miles per day. Although it isn't advertised, we found well-lit walking paths that connected us with other resorts and parks. Overall, superb!

Reviews.Title: “Favourite hotel, when we can book it.”
Reviews.Author: Stephen J
Reviews.Content: So often find that this hotel is not available for short durations. We travel from the UK, and tend to move around hotels, near the attraction we are visiting. (4 days Hard Rock Hotel, 4 Days Disney, 4 Days Cruise ) I have found it hard to get this hotel for any less than a week on quite a few occasions. Combine with a disney cruise, but do the cruise last. Otherwise you will feel the hotel is lacking something, which it is not. Great pool, fabulous staff. (Thank-you all) - Superb location. Occasional problems with rooms quickly resolved. Small shop suffering from the usual petty Disney over pricing... Very Disney, very family. Great Quality.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: klbh77
Reviews.Content: Our number one favorite place to stay for a vacation. My son plays in the pool/beach for hours and hours. There is a really cool shipwreck waterslide. Rooms are immaculate and in excellent condition. Love the beach cottage decor and theme throughout the resort. It is pretty expensive so we don't get to stay there often, but it is a real treat.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Time at the Beach Club”
Reviews.Author: NorthCarolinaRoxy
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in resorts all over the Kingdom. Although we loved the beach club, we still prefer Boardwalk & the Grand Floridian. The positives: With older kids, it's great being walking/boat distance from 2 parks - Epcot & Hollywood Studios. The resort was decorated beautifully for Christmas & had visits from characters in the lobby. The room was the typical deluxe size, clean & bright. The pool is very big with a sand bottom & fun slide (the kids still think the slide at Polynesian is better.) The negatives: The main problem is that the resort is huge & there were a zillion people everywhere. The lobby was always crowded as well as the pool. We took a tour of the yacht club & if we went back we would try there over the beach club due to a smaller size (which is why we like the Boardwalk). Also, it's nice on the other side of the water (where the Boardwalk resort is) to be able to walk out to restaurants, shops & buskers. If you get a great price I wouldn't not stay here but if everything is relative our vote is for the Boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “A Bit Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: nlitli
Reviews.Content: Was looking forward to a stay at the Beach Club since our previously wonderful stay many years ago. Hotel is beautiful, room was located for what seem like one mile from elevator, spacious corner room, a bit outdated, not enough lighting, as a matter of fact, only one lamp on one of the nightstands, called Housekeeping and within minutes a lamp was brought, except that there was no electrical outlet by the second nightstand, so the lamp was set on the dresser. The wonderful bell hop who brought the luggage tried his best and moved the floor lamp to another section of the room for more lighting access. But those are minor issues that did not deter from a wonderful stay just a bit disappointed for a deluxe hotel. Check-in, concierge and supervisory personnel are outstanding. Had an enjoyable meal at the Beaches & Cream Restaurant, excellent service by a young man server (name?). Another great dinner and service was at the Yatchsman SteakHouse. Overall we had a great time and will definitely try the Beach Club Resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: Syed I
Reviews.Content: the room was nice and clean but the internet service is horrible. It gets disconnected every 10 minutes. I even tried calling the help desk (5-6) but they blamed my new Laptop's wireless. Other than that, it was a pleasant stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Disney need to do better”
Reviews.Author: markrr71
Reviews.Content: January 18th, loads of painting and building work going on. Very noisy by pool, drilling, sanding, generators going from 10am until dusk. Parts of the pool closed. Wrong room given on arrival (walked in on a half naked women). WiFi in resort is the worst I have ever experienced, keeps dropping out, and is completely useless for business use. In 6 years I have been coming, this is the worst year ever! Come on Disney!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not magical”
Reviews.Author: kyrambler
Reviews.Content: This is a fine hotel...great pool, clean rooms, good location, blah blah blah. If it was anyplace other than Disney, I'd call it a great family resort. But for an on-property Disney resort, well, it isn't very magical. Which isn't really it's fault -- the theme is basically "resort hotel" -- of course it's not going to be as magical as the Animal Kingdom or the Wilderness Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “As always a vacation treat”
Reviews.Author: Cindywou
Reviews.Content: We love the Beach Club resort. It is beautiful by any standards, and offers vacationers a tastful elegent resort experience. We appreciate the little things such as staff say "welcome home" on arrival, and the beautiful array of flowers that greet all who enter this resort, along with the wonderful smell that I note each time I enter the main lobby. The location is the best if you are visiting Disney parks.EPCOT and Hollywood studios,are within walking distance (or a boat ride) and I love that I can walk through EPCOT to catch the monrail to Magic Kingdom. (I am not a fan of the loaded buses after a long day at the parks). We often sit on the little expanse of beach, just outside the main door, this is beautiful and relaxing, night or day. Boardwalk entertainment is amusing and entertaining, and there are some incredible restaraunts in each of the EPCOT area resorts, all are within walking distance. My daughter in-law loves minature golf. We also walked to a Disney version of this behind the Swan. Most enjoyable. The main pool, what can I say, it is like a water park. My husband and I also enjoy the quiet pool for a relaxing afternoon in the sun. Looking for a Disney trip that is relaxing, peaceful, elegant, and restoring, go to the Beach Club you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location”
Reviews.Author: Chris J
Reviews.Content: Not necessarily the cheapest hotel but the service and location make it an excellent choice Easy location for relaxed entry to Disney studios and Epcot.

Reviews.Title: “Another excellent stay at the Beach Club”
Reviews.Author: rjkzagat1
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Beach Club and it was great all over again. Never disappointing and continually a blast. It's location and appointments never disappoint. Stay here. Our family looks to change but can't find it's equal. Perfect for kids and/or adults.

Reviews.Title: “Location can't be beat! Needs a few updates, but almost perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Mouseturtle
Reviews.Content: This was my 6th time at Disney, and my 1st time at the Beach Club. I am a die-hard fan of the Grand Floridian, but have always wanted to try another Deluxe hotel. I came down for just 2 days for the Disney 5K during marathon weekend, and wanted to be close to Epcot. This hotel absolutely CAN'T be beat for the location. My 2 favorite parks, Epcot & Hollywood Studios, are within walking distance! HS is a bit of a hike, but it's a nice refreshing walk along the water, and since Disney is about indulgence, the extra exercise is nice. Being able to catch the boats is nice as well - it's just very beautiful. Epcot's "International Gateway" by the countries is just around the corner! I booked Club Level, and was not too impressed with their offerings, or the "Stone Harbor Club" room which is in need of some updates. A few cookies, a jar of gummy fish, a jar of white chocolate covered pretzels and a jar of trail mix does not club level make - HOWEVER, I had the deluxe dining plan so it didn't really matter. If I was counting on a "meal" here I'd be disappointed (but please note I never saw breakfast, and the Mickey sprinkle cookies were the best cookies everrrrr) The chips & red pepper ranch dip were also good. Basically, it's a place to "nibble" in between meals. it just seems so small, and dark, that it's not a place eyou want to "hang out" really. The room was clean, and served our purpose, and I don't really have major complaints, but it didn't "wow" me either. It just needs to be "refreshed" - since there furnishings are white they are showing age. My biggest complaint, really, was the in- room safe - which was definitely an afterthought - it was built into the wall and so shallow, it would not fit much at all, and certainly not a laptop (glad I didn't bring it) - the fact that we had to use a hard key was also annoying. I prefer the "real" safes with electronic locks. This, however, is a very minor complaint (do I sound spoiled?) and not enough to make me dislike the hotel. The big standout here was the SERVICE. With the exception of our arrival experience (they did not have our folder ready when we arrived after 3 pm, and the girl who greeted us said we "surprised her" - huh? With an advance reservation?) the concierge staff were AWESOME at club level - especially Vilma. Dave at the concierge in the lobby was great and had a nice sense of humor, and the bell staff is amazing. This was my one big improvement over the Grand Floridian, where the cast just doesn't seem as "happy" at the beach club. I much prefer the ambiance at the Grand, but the service and the location at the Beach Club simply cannot be beat. And don't get me started on Beaches & Cream...(-:

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location...”
Reviews.Author: l0ves_t0_plan
Reviews.Content: As a couple traveling to Disney, we couldn't be happier with the location of this hotel. There are so many restaurants and parks within walking distance. Our room was clean as well as quiet. We also had a large balcony where we ate breakfast every morning. The gift shop has a nice collection of food and trinkets. In my opinion, there are three minor downsides: bus service can be slow, our bags took forever to get to our room after giving them to the bellhop (at least 20 minutes), and finally the lobby is always loud and crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Disney's Beach Club Resort”
Reviews.Author: GG1429
Reviews.Content: Location, Location, Location! Disney's BC Resort continues to provide good service with a location that is without peer in Walt Disney World. We've been to every WDW Resort, most several times, and the Beach Club remains among our favorites. The only negative is the often crowded and lengthy bus service to the MK and/or AK. (Epcot is a short walk and the Studios a quick boat ride) Overall, still a great place to stay in Walt Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Akeogh
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days at the end of December 2011. A very quaint place, but do not be put off by the old-fashioned look as the hotel is in fact very modern and fresh. Very large room (standard room), with a small balcony at the back (or rather side of the complex). The back of the hotel backs to the impressive waterfront and if you are staying more than a few days you may think those rooms worth the extra. Service was excellent, although be warned - you must book dining in advance or you will not eat here! Food good if a little expensive. Pool area impressive. All in all a very relaxing place to stay. The hotel is about 5 minutes walk from Epcot along the waterfront (or you can go via boat!), and there is another resort (Boardwalk) just over the water. The Yacht club is next door. A bonus for those with children is the character breakfast with Disney characters joining you at the table - be sure to remember the camera. Perks also include extra hours at the Disney Theme Parks, travel to which can be found just outside of the hotel. Do use the reception area - the staff are incredibly knowledgeable. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Disney Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: weather72
Reviews.Content: This hotel really is the best in Disney. I have been going here for years and I have never been disappointed. Here are some great things this hotel has.... The Pool... The pool is definitely what makes this hotel unique. It is a huge pool (shared with the Yacht Club). The pool is sand bottomed and has a large water slide in the theme of a pirate ship. There are also 2 other pools at the beach club (that I know of) that are for those who enjoy a bit more peace and quiet. The Location.... The location is perfect. It is walking distance to EPCOT, literally a 5 minute walk, and about a 20 minute walk to Disney Hollywood Studios (or you can just take the water taxi that will get you there in 10 minutes or so). Last Summer I was lucky enough to have a room where I could see the fireworks at EPCOT ,and even one of the other parks, all from my balcony. My balcony also had a view of the pool, beach, and boardwalk. If you can't see the EPCOT fireworks from your room and you dont want to deal with the massive crowds at the park, then you can just go by the lighthouse and see the fireworks there. There are lots of great places to eat. You can stay at the hotel and go to the buffet at Cape May, or you can go to Beaches and Cream for some fries and shakes by the pool. The Steak place (cant remember the name) is also an option at the Yacht Club. Just a 5 minute walk away you can go to the restaurants at the Swan and Dolphin, or the many restaurants at the Boardwalk area. Also by the boardwalk are tons of games (like what you would expect at a Boardwalk somewhere in the Mid Atlantic States). And also just a short walk are many EPCOT restaurants which means a lot because there are tons of great restaurants to chose from (France, Italy, Japan, and others too!). The Rooms... The rooms are large, clean, and everything you would expect from Disney. There is a balcony from every room and the views have been nice in every room I have stayed in. Joined rooms are easy to find if you have a large family or vacationing with a lot of people and the Villas are another great option with 2 bathrooms, a kitchen, a living room, and tons of space for everyone. The Staff... Just like everywhere in Disney, the Staff is helpful, friendly, and always have a smile on their faces. Its a small detail that really does make your vacation even better. So there really are things to do for all ages. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Mutti8488
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at numerous Disney World hotels and the Yacht Club/Beach Club has become our favorite. It is within walking distance of both Epcot and Disney Hollywood Studios (although this is a bit farther). Also, the Boardwalk area is home to many restaurants, including ESPN. You could easily spend a few days here without ever using Disney transportation. Beaches & Cream is a small dining/ice cream shop located at the Beach Club that is delicious. The rooms are large and many have a daybed in addition to the two full or queen sized beds. One thing to be aware of is that all rooms do not have a full balcony, some have what they call a "standing balconey" which is just that - no room for a chair. Be sure to request a full balconey if this is important to you.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, even more amazing pool”
Reviews.Author: yankeetravels27
Reviews.Content: First the location is fantastic. It is walking distance to Epcot, which means you can hit up a new 'country' every night for dinner. The Boardwalk resort is also in walking distance which offers up several restaurants including ESPN to help mix things up. Hollywood Studios can be walked to as well, but it is a long walk, so I suggest the ferry instead. If you have kids there is an endless of supply of activities starting with the pool. Even if you don't have kids the pool is amazing for fun and relaxation. I wouldn't even call it a pool, it is more like a waterpark. You can rent bikes, rent a boat, go for a jog around the path, miniature golf is in walking distance. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A great time had by all”
Reviews.Author: rmsanch
Reviews.Content: We have been to this hotel before. We have our timeshare here. We stayed in a studio in the Villas. It was a nice room with a queen size bed with a pull out sofa for our 19 year old son. Most of the time pull outs are not comfortable but he was. When you pull it out the bedding is in a pocket built into the bottom of the bed. Only Disney! There is a microwave and small frig and lots of plates glasses and utinsils. For three adults it was very roomy. We bought the meal plan and let me tell you we don't travel to Disney World without buying it. It's a great value and it's nice to have your food paid for and then there is no need to skimp! I did have an issue with the concierge and the front desk. Did you know you cannot reach the concierge by phone. You have to walk down to the lobby and wait in line. This is the reason that I only rated the hotel very good. It was quite a hassle and the person i spoke to in the evening led me in the wrong direction and wasn't helpful at all. I did appreciate the service they have where a runner can run to the store for you to grab a couple of items, except my runner bought the wrong item and I wasn't able to take my medication. So I suggest that you don't entrust them with anything important. I started out going to the desk to ask for a car rental and then they told me about this service, I would have been better off renting the car. Overall though a great time was had by all and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Disney vacation”
Reviews.Author: deeter123
Reviews.Content: Great location, 1 minute walk to epcot! Pool is great, with a large water slide. We stayed there over Christmas and were very happy with the room. If your using the meal plan there is quick serve place in the hotel, the yacht club next door has to use the beach club or pool bar for quick serve. I highly recommend the ice cream shop, try the ice cream sandwich! The pool requires a room key for each person to get in, it is license as a water park due to size. So they are more strict with who gets in the pool. I will say the life guards were more vigilant than any pool I have ever been at. They also have movies on the beach usually at night with a bonfire.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: wooddale35124
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Beach Club Resort the first part of November along with our daughter and her family. This was also the first time we had stayed on property at a Disney resort. They are a first class operation. We stayed on the concierge floor and everything we asked for was provided very quickly and was first class. All of the employees were very friendly and one gentleman in particular was very helpful in giving us directions and helping us find the best locations to see and do things at the different parks. The pool was fantastic as well. If you are going to Disney World I do recommend you purchase a food plan, it will save you modney in the long run

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: JennyQS
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a 3 day conference and can't wait to come back with my family. The facility was clean, well organized, and the staff were friendly. The pool is the best part - I could sit poolside for days here and never get bored. Although the resort was full during my stay, it never felt crowded in the hotel. When my kids get a little older we plan to take them to Disney and we'll definitely be staying here at the Beach Club Resort. They are going to love the pool and I will love how convenient it is getting around the rest of Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: FromNJ
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week at The Beach Club. It was our first time staying there and it was all and more than I had hoped for. The resort is beautiful. It was beautifully decorated for Christmas. It is clean and very well kept. There was plenty of room for a family of 5 (3 kids ages 14, 12, 12), and for children that age, it was a perfect location. Online check-in is a must. We pulled in and someone greeted us immediately, asked our name, then brought our folder and keys within minutes. We stayed in room 1583...it was a perfect location...close to lobby, marketplace, pool, laundry and walkway to Epcot. The Cape May Cafe has a great character breakfast buffet and a nice seafood dinner buffet, but the counter service is limited. Next time I will head over to the bakery at the Boardwalk which has a better variety for breakfast. Another nice thing about the location is being able to walk to 2 parks (Epcot and Hollywood Studios) and the Boardwalk. We took the buses to MK, AK and Downtown Disney and did not wait long. We made dinner reservations in a few of the countries which was also very convenient. Christmas week is extremely busy, but if you take advantage of fast pass and magical hours, you can get on all of the rides and attractions you want to. With older children, we stayed out late and slept in which really helped in avoiding the massive crowds. Overall, no complaints. Everything about the Beach Club was fantastic and we will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and amenities”
Reviews.Author: j_nine13
Reviews.Content: I am a Disney annual passholder and have stayed at many Disney resorts...however this is my first review of them! I would not normally stay at a Deluxe resort due to the regular cost - even with a Passholder discount its extreme. I got the opportunity to stay at The Beach Club while my sister was attending a seminar there. The hotel is great. The lobby is beautiful and the elevators there are surprisingly fast. The pool is basically the best at Disney - water slides, hot tubs and sand in the bottom of the pool are just some of the features! They offer as many towels as you could possibly need and they some so you don't need to bring a beach towel or take any from the room. Some of the Disney resorts are over the top in the theme but the Beach Club does it tastefully even throwing in some subtle Little Mermaid characters and hidden Mickeys in the carpet. The rooms are decent size, we had plenty of room for three women with a lot of stuff! The bathroom had double sinks which helped with the space there. The housekeeping staff was very nice and attentive to any extras that we needed. The only complaint about the room was that the 'balcony' we had only fit two people - and only if they were standing side by side. This was disappointing after seeing some of the other ones with chairs and tables on them. The best thing about the Beach Club is the location. It is the closest park to Epcot, you could walk there in two minutes. You can also walk (15-20 minutes) or take a boat to Hollywood Studios. You also had access to the restaurants at 4 other hotels, all within walking distance: Yacht Club, Boardwalk, Swan & Dolphin not to mention all the great things at the Boardwalk - ESPN Zone, shops, a piano bar, etc. Couple of complaints, one minor one slightly major. The minor one is the stops when you are riding a bus to the parks. You stop at EVERY resort in the area - 5 stops including your own hotel so the bus rides can take a long time. Some moderate and value resorts have less stops! With the amount of money you pay to stay at this hotel you should get the benefit of fewer stops. The other complaint that I have was with my luggage. I had been staying at the All Star Sports Resort leading up to staying at the Beach Club and Disney transferred my luggage as its common to switch hotels mid-trip.
