However, they lost my luggage and didn't find it for about 8 hours. I kept checking at the desk and I was told that it wasn't there but a van from All Star had been by. Then I was told it wasn't there and they didn't know where it was, then next it was on a van on its way and back again to not knowing where it was. When the hotel manager (not someone from the bell service) they finally figured it out. It got delivered to the Caribbean Beach Resort despite the fact that it was tagged appropriately. So the van driver as well as the Caribbean Beach people were clearly not paying one bit of attention. The driver for not looking at what he was dropping off and the CB for letting a bag sit there for about 6 hours without it being claimed. The manager was very helpful keeping me updated and offered up any toiletries that I might need but what I really wanted was my jacket as the weather had turned cool. They ended up giving me a credit of $25 on my credit card to make up for it. So, it was an inconvenience but Disney did their best to make it right as they always do.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort!”
Reviews.Author: yellowjacket22
Reviews.Content: My children and I are annual passholders and frequent visitors to WDW. Previously though we had never stayed at one of the higher end resorts. I booked a reservation for the Port Orleans Riverside for Christmas and a couple of weeks ago received an email offer to upgrade to the Beach Club Resort for only an additional $30 a day. I jumped at the offer. I assumed since I'd gotten such a good deal (less than half the rack rate) we would end up in a room with a parking lot view, but was very pleasantly surprised to get a room with a full balcony and a great view of the water with close access to EPCOT. Contrary to some comments I'd read on here about the rooms being dated, our room was very nice and I noticed no problems at all. It was large and in good repair. As others have noted, the access to EPCOT and Hollywood Studios is well worth staying here. EPCOT in particular with the side entrance was a nice perk. When we entered the park there was absolutely no line for the bag check or the turnstile. We had great luck with the weather also and were able to enjoy the swimming pool and the bonfire. The easy access to the other resorts in the area as well as the boardwalk was a great. We took advantage of some down time and walked around the Boardwalk one night and enjoyed several street performers who were all very good and entertaining. I am a runner and loved the trail to Hollywood Studios and the Boardwalk...great open, uncrowded, no vehicular traffic areas to run. The resort is huge and was a bit of a maze finding our way to our room, but there is good signage and we had not problems at all with it. The maids we had were very friendly and accommodating. If you haven't been by the lobby during Christmas to see the carousel you definitely should drop by; it's second only to the Grand Floridian for Christmas decorations. We actually spent half a day going around to most of the Disney resorts checking out the decorations which was worth the effort. I have absolutely nothing but good things to say about our experience with the Beach Club Resort and would recommend it to anyone...especially if you can get the rate we got!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, really felt like I was at an old fashiones seashore!”
Reviews.Author: UNC_Indy
Reviews.Content: Loved this resort. stayed here with part of the trip a couple trip and part on business. it was well suited to both. the resort itself is relaxing and refreshing, the service top notch and the theming impeccable. the room was very well appointed and comfortable. my only critiques are that the free wifi is so slow it is unuseable except very late at night and the distance from your room to the elevator can be very long and you will feel like it is a maze. Our porter tipped me off to a staircase shortcut that cut the travel time in half and that helped. I loved walking to EPCOT and the launch to the studios!

Reviews.Title: “Disney Beach Club A+”
Reviews.Author: Bette E
Reviews.Content: I have been to disney 11 times plus one disney cruise and I have found that the Beach Club where I stayed December 19-22, 2011 was a WOW! We were fortunate to have 80+ degree days during our stay and made use of the hotel's beach, pool and outdoor entertainment. You could see the Disney Boardwalk from our balcony and walk to either the Boardwalk or Epcot in 5 minutes or use the waterway to go to the Hollywood Studios park. There were four adults and two children ages 5 and 8 we went for a quick trip to celebrate my daughters 40th birthday and wanted to stay in a deluxe resort. Can't say enough good things about the hotel and staff. We were also able to check our bags for our return flight right at the hotel. This hotel was recommended by my cousin she is a frequent visitor to disney as well. I would love to go back and stay there again. You can see the fireworks at Epcot from the beach or the balcony in your room! Oh yes and I forgot one of the most important things the beds were fantastic (important to me since I have back problems) - we had connecting rooms and our room for two people had eight towels, wash cloths which were nice and fluffy you don't get that in the cheaper rooms also a daybed / couch if you had extra people.

Reviews.Title: “Great Ambiance with lots to do and see”
Reviews.Author: Lackeykidd
Reviews.Content: Great pool and beach area. Rooms are very comfortable. Being collocated with the Boardwalk resort adds to the choices of things to do and places to eat that are within walking distance. Great place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with excellent pool. Food options in hotel could be better.”
Reviews.Author: Sapphire024
Reviews.Content: We returned to The Beach Club in early December this year after a very enjoyable holiday in 2010. The location is very convenient right next door to Epcot and minutes from Hollywood Studios. The Disney transport network makes getting to all other Disney parks a breeze as well. We had 3 adults and 3 children in our party and the inter connecting garden view rooms were spacious and comfortable. Resort is just starting to show it's age and could use some attention but not significant enough to detract from the overall experience. Disney deluxe dining plan was great with many excellent restaurant options throughout Disney World. Best was Flying Fish Cafe at the Boardwalk. Beach Club food was not really worth trying! Woul definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families”
Reviews.Author: johnsons5
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Disney with our children (3 boys ages 9, 7 and 4). The resort was perfect. I had done my research on most of the disney resorts and was debating about a family suite at All-Star Music or the Beach Club and I am so glad that we splurged and went with a deluxe resort with more on-site ammenities. We had a garden view room on the 3rd floor, the room size was perfect for us (not too big not too small). I was concerned about previous reviews saying the walls were thin (I'm a light sleeper) but we didn't even know we had neighbours. The only noise we did hear was from the hallway if someone was noisy walking by but once you put the ceiling fan on you didn't notice it. The location is very central to all the parks and walking distance to Epcot and boat ride to Hollywood Studios. The best part was the movies on the beach in the evenings. We all looked forward to ending the day just relaxing in our lounge chairs watching a movie and the boys playing in the sand with the free bucket and shovel we got with our kids meal at the pool. The only bad thing I can say is that if you didn't purchase the meal plan it would be a bit pricey to eat at the resort. But we were lucky enough to go when they were offering free meal plans! PS If you go with boys you have to go the Typhoon Lagoon water park - it was the best!

Reviews.Title: “a very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: dadizzles
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the beach club for the first half of our honeymoon.it is a great hotel by disney standards.it is a perfect location being walking distance to epcot and hollywood studios.it is a beautiful resort hotel and we enjoyed our stay.they finally have free wifi (testing it may not last) which they should have at these prices.the bed was cozy and the room had the normal disney limited tv channel selections.our room also had a very small one person balcony(nice view over looking the boardwalk) that you wouldn't be able to fit a chair on.im not sure what the point is of a 1 person balcony in a room for a couple (king bed).bring your own toilet paper for it is cardboard! like the normal disney rule you will get much more bang for your buck off site but it is one of the best on site resorts and we would stay here again.we are suckers lol.......the table service food was decent not great(looking at you yachtsman steakhouse) and the quick service food is still pretty bad even at the resorts.

Reviews.Title: “A bit shabby”
Reviews.Author: JetRTW
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying on-site with Disney and although it's location to EPCOT was great we found that the Beach Club fell short in the basics like cleanliness and and helpful service. The bed for the 5th person is ideally for those 10 years and under but was fine for our 5 year old. It would be a stretch to say we had a bad time but that was mainly because we spent all day in the parks...maybe we were unlucky but I can't help but feel there are better options out there for the money. I have written a bit about it in our blog along with some photos for those interested: http://jet-rtw.blogspot.com/2011/12/beach-club-hotel-disney.html

Reviews.Title: “Best Location to Epcot”
Reviews.Author: jandjfox
Reviews.Content: This was our 1st trip to Walt Disney World and I'm so glad we stayed at this hotel. We are a family of 4 with two small children, ages 8 and 6. My dad also joined us for 4 days so we were in a room with a daybed that accomodated us just fine. Don't get me wrong, I wish the room was bigger but we were comfortable. The beds were the most comfy beds ever ! The #1 best part about this hotel is the proximity to Epcot. We would spend an entire day at another park and stroll over to Epcot just to watch the fireworks show! We did this 3 times ! I was very content with the shuttle and ferry system - never waited more than 15 minutes and we went everywhere !! We did the character breakfast at Cape May and was pleasantly surprised with the food selection that incl lox and bagels. Of course the Mickey waffles were incredible ! Ate at the pool restaurant a few times and the burgers are amazing too ! Btw, the refillable mug for $14 is a must ! You can get all the soda, lemonade, coffee and hot chocolate you want. We will definately stay here if/when we come back to visit WDW.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: Catzip
Reviews.Content: We spent 1 week in Sept. 2011 and had an absolute fabulous time. The food is a little pricey on site but this is Disney and plenty of people had mentionned the same thing about Disney so we weren't caught of guard. The convenience store on site was also very pricey so if you're able to purchase water and fruit out of Disney World do so. The sand pool is a definate winner with the kids, especially since they give you a bucket and shovel upon purchasing a kids meal at the pool grill. Walking distance from the Epcot and having a nice Boardwalk, there was plenty to do on site. It also has 2 water slides , from a nice adult and older kid slide to the young kid slide. The white sand beach that's close to the pool area plays Disney movies every night, however unfortunately you can't swim in it. One can also see the fireworks everynight from the Boardwalk and also if you're room is facing the Epcot. We traveled with a 2 and 4 year old and this was the perfect Disney Resort for them. Don't miss the breakfast buffet with Goofy and friends on site, just make sure to reserve prior to going. Oh..one last thing that's in my opinion a real negative, they really blast the AC in the lobbies (which is felt even more if you go into the villa section), so coming back from the pool make sure to wrap up because the extreme hot from outside to the extreme cold made it unpleasant.

Reviews.Title: “closest to Epcot, great pool area, suitable for anyone!”
Reviews.Author: NewfoundlandDorie
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed in Disney's Beach Club (BC) many times over the years. THe BC is huge, stretching from a few steps from the International doorway into Epcot (between England and France in the World showcase area) to an area called Stormalong Bay, which is a sandy bottom pool that meanders through slow eddies, waterfalls, under bridges and around a slow moving river like area. Hot tubs and a unique water slide and great sandy, shallow pool kiddie area are included in a space so popular that Disney had to close off the pool to anyone not staying at the Yacht or Beach Club. The Beach Club rooms are large and comfortable. Most have 2 queen beds and some have a daybed that a small child can manage to sleep upon. Beds are comfortable and reasonably firm. No feathers in the bedding, whichis important for allergy sufferers. First floor rooms have a small patio area with 2 chairs and a table, but are not very private. Second, third and fourth floor rooms have balconies, but some balconies are very small and are standing room only - no space for tables or chairs. The garden view rooms on the end near Epcot are convenient to enter Epcot, but are a long walk to the lobby, bus stop to the Magic Kingdom/ Animal Kingdom and boat transporation to Disney Studies. Overall the most convenient rooms are those closest to the lobby and Stormalong BAy. The hotel is comfortable and beautiful with a relaxed, cozy atmosphere that offers a welcome respite from the crowds inside the theme parks. Wifi is supposedly available in the rooms, but I was unable to connect to it despite many tries. My room was very close to Epcot and far from the lobby, so that may be the problem. I am not sure, because I didn't take the time to pursue the issue. The air conditioning worked perfectly and quietly. The bathroom has double sinks outside the toilet and bathtub area. Every room has a mini fridge that you can request them to stock, or that you can fill yourself from groceries available at a small store near the lobby or from the Screen Door at the Boardwalk. There are a number of restaurants at the BC including the Cape May Cafe (buffet) and Beaches and Cream (a 50's style soda and burger place complete with juke box). In addition there are restaurants within walking distance at the yacht club (steakhouse), at the Beardwalk (seafood at The Flying Fish) and at the Swan and Dolphin (Blue, Fresh, etc) as well as numerous places to dine in World Showcase. Nightlife and sidewalk entertainment are a short walk away at the Boardwalk. THis is a great hotel for almost anyone, with facilites for all ages. It is my favorite Epcot area resort, especially for anyone from teenage years and older. The only time that I would recommend a Magic Kingdom (MK) area resort more highly would be if you have small children and expect to spend most of your time in the MK. Then, the Polynesian, or Grand Floridian or Contemporary are great choices. This place is romantic for couples or newlyweds, fabulous for teens, and fun for families that enjoy swimming and water activities. A wonderful resort, filled with the best of Disney magic!

Reviews.Title: “Don't even need to go into the parks!”
Reviews.Author: Jcreidler
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from The Beach Club. Besides everything Disney you come to expect when you stay on Disney property, the hotel offers enough entertainment, you don't even need the parks. We went down witht the expectation to go into the parks everyday, but the weather was so nice, we a little time at the pool almost every day. They have a pool party everyday with tons of activities for everyone including volleyball, tie dying, sand castle building, etc, etc. With the Boardwalk just down the path, we had plenty to keep us entertained at night with the street performers, music and lights. Just a few hundred feet was the back Entrance to Epcot, so we could walk in just for dinner and fireworks if we needed an additional dose of Disney Magic. We came home completely relaxed like we had been on a real vacation, not a typical storm through Disney adventure.

Reviews.Title: “Tired rooms, good service”
Reviews.Author: carolmdcruz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Beach Club for Thanksgiving. A year ago we stayed at the Yacht Club which is right next door. I think that the Yacht Club rooms were more updated. Our room had a chipped sink, a cabinet door that was falling off the hinges, and a shower curtain that didn't quite contain the shower water. However, the beds were comfortable, and the service personnel were all very pleasant and accommodating. Be advised that getting anywhere from the Beach or Yacht clubs requires a bus ride that can easily add 45 minutes to getting to and from the Magic Kingdom or Animal Kingdom.

Reviews.Title: “average quality room- not enough room for family of 5.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a Virgin Holidays traveler
Reviews.Content: room for 5booked at Beach Club. Way too small for 5people.small beds compared to places weve stayed before in Orlando. Only 1double wardrobe and a couple of small drawers, certainly not enough storage for 5 for 2weeks. Bathroom was tiny, the door almost hits the toilet when you open it. The shower was poor, more of a dribble than a shower, even when the flow is adjusted. Balcony- couldnt get a chair on it it was that small, enough for 1person to stand on..and found chewing gum stuck under the desk when I pulled the small table out!...I informed reception of my disappointment with the room, but the man was just not interested. Three days running I went to reception as the whole thing was spoiling my holiday, but each time, they were not interested, found this quite unbelievable as normally American people cannot do enough for you.We had paid a fortune to stay in this "luxury" hotel and although the foyer, corridors and restaurants were beautifully decorated, and had fresh flowers, the rooms were disappointing. Finally, we got moved to a different room which had a chest of drawers..whoo hoo and a balcony that we could actually sit on...We were also slightly disappointed with Stormalong Bay and its 8ft lazy river...really not safe for children and adults who arent strong swimmers... and Hurrican Hannahs Grille....awful.!...Cape May Cafe food was excellent as was Beaches and Cream!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, needs updating”
Reviews.Author: Museick
Reviews.Content: We were "upgraded" to a club level room on the 5th floor after paying for a room with a king-sized bed and a water view when we got there and they were out of rooms. We thought this might be a great thing however it turns out that the other room probably would have been better for us. The club level foods consisted of crackers and cheese and peanut butter and jelly sandwiches. They did offer beer and wine between 5 to 7pm but it was a waste to get back from the parks during that time and we are not much on drinking anyway. Also, we had already paid for disney dining so it was extra food that we didn't need. Our room was right next to the club dining room and very noisy. Beds were not too comfortable. I would not recommend this room location. Great hotel location though! We loved the short walk to Epcot and the boat ride to Hollywood Studios! I would say there's not too much of a difference between this Deluxe and a moderate like Coronado Springs except the transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort”
Reviews.Author: jayne b
Reviews.Content: We went to the beach club for 2 weeks on 26/10/2011, it was a lovely resort ,our room was 3716 and we got free internet so that was a bonus, the room could of do with a deep clean around the edges and the furniture was getting a bit dated but you are only in your room to sleep and it was comfortable enough.The house keeping came every day and gave us fresh supplies and were very nice, The eating places were really good at both the hotels and you save a fortune if you are on the disney dinning plan , Brian at Beaches and Cream was really nice, made you feel really welcome, all the staff and cast mambers were nice friendly and helpful apart from our last day at the market place where we were served by a young girl who kept raising her eyebrows and talking about us to her work mates when we didnt want our made up roll heated, very annoying after having such a lovely 2 weeks there, its not our fault she doesnt like her job!!! Very close to Epcot and water taxis to Hollywood Studios, great service on the boats and buses, disney just make everything so easy, I think we were only at the pool 4 times in our visit, the lazy river was too deep for me and my family 8 ft in places not too good if your not a strong swimmer but lots of life gaurds, there is a lovely kids section with sand so that went down well with my kids, they made friends at the pool every time they where there.We loved the movies on the beach each night , Only managed to put kids into kids club once and they loved it and wanted to go back but we ran out of time.We love disney and we would recommend it for a holiday but you could stay at one of their standard hotels and save some money, we have stayed at the animal kingdom 2 years ago and we enjoyed that as well, if you are going to be out all day at the parks stay somewhere cheaper but if you like staying closer to Epcot i would stay here .

Reviews.Title: “Will Someone Pick Up the Popsicle Stick”
Reviews.Author: errantmd
Reviews.Content: We went to WDW for the Food and Wine Festival and decided to stay at the Beach Club Resort because it is walking distance to Epcot. We have been to WDW over a dozen times but have never stayed at a deluxe hotel so we were pumped about staying at the Beach Club. Unfortunately it did not live up to expectations. Almost as soon as we walking into the room, we spotted problems. There was a Popsicle stick on the floor, toothpaste stains on the bathroom faucet and a large black mascara smudge on the hair drier handle. So I called the front desk and told then the problems. The person on the other end was very apologetic and assured me the problems would be taken care of. So we dashed off to the festival assuming Disney would fix the problem in their usual efficient way. Wrong. When we came back to the room, it was obvious someone had tidied up. But the Popsicle stick, toothpaste stains and mascara smudge were still there. So I cleaned up the stains and the smudge but left the stick to see if it would be picked up during the daily room cleaning. But it was not and it is probably still there. Granted it is under the table but it is very visible to anyone standing in the room. Don't get me wrong. The Beach Club resort is a great place. It is definitely upscale from the moderate hotels. The sand bottom pool is great and the slide is incredible. But if you do not clean my room, you are not going to get a good review. Sorry Mickey.

Reviews.Title: “Walk to Epcot and take a boat to Hollywood Studios”
Reviews.Author: Roseann_F
Reviews.Content: This was a nice place to stay. We could walk to Epcot and take a boat to Hollywood Studios, so if you are not a big fan of the busses, this is a good site to stay. We did take the bus to Magic Kingdom, and it was not a long wait coming or going. We elected to drive our car over to Animal Kingdom and pay the parking. We did not eat at any of the facilities at Beach Club, but we did eat at the Yachtman's Steakhouse and Captain's Grille at the adjoining Yacht Club. The meals at each were excellent, but would particularly call out the Yachtman's Steakhouse for the best filet mignon dinner I have had in years. My only disappointment with the Beach Club was the amount of noise in the hallways early in the morning. If you are an early riser, then this would not be an issue for you, but we tend to sleep in. People who got up early were not very considerate about being quiet while walking through the halls, and 4 out of the 6 mornings there, I was awakened before 6AM.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Disney property”
Reviews.Author: AM380
Reviews.Content: Just back from 5 days at the Disney Beach Club Resort. We were there for a a 3 day business conference and then added 2 more days for ourselves. This property is beautiful in appearance. Every detail is evident. We did an on-line check-in a few days before arriving, so when we got there we went to the on-line area. It was a long line but a gentleman came up to us, asked our name and in 30 seconds he was back with a folder with all we needed and we were off to find our room. The place is large, so there is a lot of walking to get anywhere. The room was very clean and comfortable. A double sink bathroom and a wonderful shower is stocked with more than enough thick bath towels. Beds have pillowtop mattresses and are very comfortable. The large pool area has a sand bottom and a large slide from ship wreck. Very attentive life guards are every where. You must show your room key card and get a wrist band to use this area. There is a smaller pool area (at the other side of the Beach Club) if you want a quieter place to relax. It is no more than a 5 minute leisurely walk to Epcot back gate. Also 5 more minutes brings you to Boardwalk across the lagoon. Go there in the evening for dinner or snacks. Jelly Roll and the Dance Hall have great entertainment. There are also very good street entertainers throughout the evening outside on the Boardwalk. We ate dinner at the Yachtsman's Steakhouse situated between the Yacht and Beach Club. They have aged beef priced at about $45 for a cut of beef and a potato choice. Any sides or salads are extra. If you staying at any Disney property do make any dinner reservations well in advance of your arrival date. It was difficult to get any reservations for the times and restaurants we wanted. This includes all restaurants in Epcot, or other resorts. The Beach Club has a Market Place to get snacks, quick breakfasts etc. for reasonable prices. The rack rate is pricy. If we did not have our conference and the abilty to stay longer at conference rates we would have not stayed there as rooms over $400 a night are not in our budget.

Reviews.Title: “Beach Club has something for everyone”
Reviews.Author: Katyjoy32
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 4 nights at the Disney Beach Club and was not disappointed. Overall, the stay was an extremely positive one. Resort employees are friendly, greating you from the moment you walk into the hotel and exceeded my expectations for the level of service provided. The Disney gift shop at the hotel is a great place to purchase souveniers for anyone - in addition to, a great place to pick up snacks or a quick lunch. The pool area is absolutely wonderful! A great mix of places for action or relaxation - with plenty of chairs! Convenient location within walking distance of Epcot & Boardwalk and accessible via water taxi. Only disappointing features was my room was extremely far away from elevators which wasn't very convenient and some hallways had a musty/water smell that wasn't pleasant. Although, I only found that smell in very select areas. An overall wonderful stay that I would recommend to any family or business traveler!

Reviews.Title: “Best location for Epcot”
Reviews.Author: ElGrandT
Reviews.Content: This is a cute and clean hotel just outside Epcot (5 minutes from my room door to the park entrance). The pool is maybe the best hotel pool (or any pool) I even seen, with sand bottom, slider and even a lazy river. And the scent of the lobby... However, it is overpriced. The "concierges" are not really helpful, and service is very inconsistent. You are paying mostly for the Disney "feel", and some perks like extended hours in the parks and transportation to/from airport. Still, the option to go have dinner in Epcot if you feel like, just a few steps away, makes this hotel the best option for a WDW vacation.

Reviews.Title: “It's Disney”
Reviews.Author: PaulNJ1103
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Beach Club for what must be 30th time. It's a standard hotel with a great pool area and close to EPCOT and the Boardwalk. Staff is Disney nice, rooms are clean, safe and serve the purpose. Some areas show wear but with the crowds there all the time it's hard not to.

Reviews.Title: “beach club”
Reviews.Author: juicyisthebest
Reviews.Content: we stayed here about a half a year ago. the hotel wad lovely. a bit over price. we booked a suite and when we go there it was miles away from the main hotel. we had to walk 15 mins each morning to get our breakfast.this was very disapointing seen as we paid alot of money for the room. EVERYTHING IN DISNEY IS SOOOOO EXPENSIVE. so be ware. othere then that the park and all was amazing. the price you pay for a suite is not worth it. so just go for a delux room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation at The Beach Club”
Reviews.Author: angelauno
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 7 night stay at The Beach Club. We are a family of 4 and we had room 4557. This is one of the Deluxe Club level rooms. We did have to go up to the 5th floor for concierge services, but that was no problem. I chose this room because it is one of the few with an extra large balcony. It also had a daybed which was perfect for one of my kids. This daybed would be too small for an adult though, so be aware of that. Check in was a breeze at the concierge desk. They also were able to grant my room request at this time and make some reservations for me. The staff truly was fantastic. We used the concierge service for breakfast only and it was convenient for that. The beds were fantastic for Disney standards and we had no problems being comfortable in them. Service was also top notch at this hotel. The best thing about the Beach Club was the pool. It is outstanding. The worst thing about the Beach Club was the bus system. At times we had to wait 30 minutes to get a bus! Walking to ESPN zone and the boardwalk was a plus for my sons who are into all things sports related. Overall this is a great resort. I am not sure if it is worth it to stay on Disney property though since the bus system leaves much to be desired. Next time we will probably stay off property and rent a car.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: seatheworldBoston
Reviews.Content: Best thing is the location. The resort itself is starting to need some refurbs which Disney, of course, is doing. So just check before you stay to see what the status of that is. But all in all, I love it here and have minimal complaints (ie: the food market area needs to be more spacious). Otherwise, a perfect place to stay for a disney trip. The pool is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel for a Family even if it is a family of 5 (kids ages 9-17)”
Reviews.Author: NorthernBirdOntario
Reviews.Content: It is hard to find hotels that will fit 5, comfortably and this one is one that will work as long as you are not in the room 7 by 24. There is connecting rooms but the cost of two rooms makes the snug fit worth it. Check in was a painless- We used the transportation from the airport, and so when we checked our bags in at home we didn't have to deal with them until they showed up in the room. Even though our flight down was a connecting flight, and was canceled, the next flight was so close (15 minutes) we ran to get it. Our bags didn't make that connection as well as we did. But some how they made it to our room 45 minutes after we did! This hotel is a gem, and I almost don't want to say that, as it is so hard to get in to it now! SOME OF THE GEM PARTS -Walking distance to the back of Epcot- way nice, smaller crowds going in and out. -Walking or boat to Hollywood Studios- -These two things mean you can go to 3 parks without closing your stroller. When we had a stroller I loved that part -The pool, it has a sand bottom! HOW COOL IS THAT! -There is a beach, that they show movies on -The boardwalk- you can rent a bike build for 6 and drive around the lake, and see Beach and Yacht Club, The Dolphin, and Swan, and the Boardwalk hotels -The service is top notch -They maintain this place VERY well- one night we walked back to our room and some one had made a hole in the wall, by morning we couldn't find the hole! -Character buffet breakfast SOME OF THE NOT SO GEM PARTS - The price, it is a $$$$$ star hotel - No large food court- if you are on a meal plan there isn't as much of a snack service as there is at the moderate or budget hotels AS FOR THE WHOLE OF DISNEY I have to tip my hat to them and there care for families, we have allergies that make travel hard and Disney not only understands these things, they make sure you have fun as well. our food allergies, ready for this....Wheat, tree nut, shell fish, sea food, mango, milk, orange, pork. In case you can't tell we love Disney World, as a park, as hotels, and their caring in knowing families need a break

Reviews.Title: “One of the better Disney options, close to the action but pricey”
Reviews.Author: amonynous
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Beach Club; family of four with two kids, 9 & 10. Overall this is one of the better choices for an on-site Disneyworld hotel, but there are a few drawbacks to bear in mind when deciding whether this is the right choice for you. Arriving ---------- The Beach Club is easy to find. We drove from Sanford International (SFB) using the 417 toll road. It's an easy drive of about an hour on an uncongested two/three lane highway, and cash tolls were less than $10. You can also take the 417 from Orlando International (MCO) which is about a 15 minute drive. Leave at either exit 6 signposted to Disneyworld, or exit 3 for a slightly easier route. Follow signs for Epcot Resorts and you'll be there in a few minutes. When first arriving, security at the hotel car park check their list of guests and then give you a paper parking permit to display in your vehicle. Once you have your room key you can use this to operate the entry barrier. You can self-park, or as we did opt for valet parking at $12 a day. It’s a three minute walk from the hotel entrance to self-parking, but if it is either wet (torrential showers are common), hot and humid, or you have tired kids after a late evening out, valet parking is a lifesaver. Check in was pleasant, quick and efficient. One omission was that we weren't given directions to the room; there is plenty of room number signage in the corridors but none from the lobby. There are lots of helpful hotel staff ("cast members" in Disney speak) around to ask for help though, so no problem finding our way. The layout of the hotel is very linear. It makes for the great-looking exterior views you see on the photos, which are just as good in real life, but if your room is at the far end of the hotel it is a long walk from the lobby area. If you have a lot of luggage you might want to use the bell service to have it moved to/from your room, or request a nearer room if walking is a problem. The main bank of four elevators is adjacent to the lobby. They were speedy enough when we stayed on an upper floor last year, but there are only a couple of single elevators at the far end of the hotel which appear to be much slower. Not a problem for us this time as we were given a ground floor room but regularly saw people waiting for them. The Location ----------------- The Beach Club (and Yacht Club, Boardwalk, Swan and Dolphin hotels) is in pretty much the best location for quick and easy access to the Disney theme parks. The Beach Club is right next door to the back entrance to Epcot (International Gateway) and you can find yourself between Britain and France in the Epcot World Showcase section within a couple of minutes of leaving the Beach Club. You can take a free boat from the dock between the Yacht and Beach Club to the Hollywood Studios theme park. These run (at least) every 20 minutes from before park opening until an hour after park closing, and more frequently at busy times. You can be in Hollywood Studios within 15 mins of leaving the hotel and it's a fun and relaxing way to get there, or if you prefer you can walk around the Boardwalk and then alongside the waterway, which would take about 25 mins. The location is also ideal for the free bus service to the other theme parks (Magic Kingdom, Animal Kingdom and the two water parks). Bus services run on a similar schedule to the boats, and we never had to wait more than 10 or 15 minutes for a bus, which will get you to and from the parks in a further 10 or 15 minutes. Tip: It is definitely worth taking the bus rather than your car to the Magic Kingdom in particular; the bus drops you off right outside the gates in an average of 20 minutes from leaving the hotel lobby. If you drive, it will take more like 45 mins to an hour, as you have to park, take the car park shuttle and then take either the ferry or the monorail to get to the park entrance. Plan your return to avoid just after the parade, fireworks or park closing otherwise you could end up queuing for a bus back. You can easily walk to the Boardwalk area or to the other hotels around the lake in a few minutes, giving you lots of extra eating and drinking options, and the Boardwalk has entertainers wandering around plus a couple of adult-only establishments for drinks and evening entertainment. The Room -------------- There are various grades and views of room available, including a concierge level with various amenities. We booked, and were given, a standard room on the ground floor at the back of the hotel with a view of a fairly dense patch of woodland/trees. Last year we also booked a standard room but were given an upper floor room with a view over the lake and the boardwalk which would have been a higher grade of room than we booked. If the view matters to you, or other details like a full balcony or similar make sure you book the relevant grade of room (at a significant extra cost). If you book the standard room, you might get lucky and get an upgraded room, but equally you could end up with one that overlooks a roof or the car park. These aren't terrible rooms, but the water views are great at night as you can see the Boardwalk all light up across the lake. The upside of our room location (1556) was that it was on the ground floor so no elevators, and directly opposite the exit to one of the small "quiet" pools, making it quick and easy to have a quick swim or a dip in the hot tub (on the one day it rained a bit). You can also exit through the quiet pool area and come out even closer to the entrance to Epcot. There were a few potential downsides to the room location. Firstly it is a bit of a hike to the lobby and the main pool area; not a problem for us but worth knowing. Secondly our particular room was right next to the ice machine room, a junction between three corridors, one of the few elevators at that end of the hotel and the aforementioned exit to the quiet pool. We were worried that it would prove very noisy in such a high traffic location, but in reality noise from outside the room wasn't an issue (it was worse last year on an upper floor in what should have been a quieter location). There were a couple of actual issues with the location however. Firstly the patio faced a small walkway which was also used as a service road by golf buggy type vehicles pulling loads of towel/linen carts. The entrance to bring these in and out of the hotel was literally right next to our patio area outside the double doors. Again, noise wasn't actually an issue, but the regular comings and goings of staff outside meant that we had to keep closing the curtains (rather than just the net drapes) whenever we were getting changes or whatever, and what could have been a secluded/private area was not. Secondly the woodland area was clearly a breeding ground for mosquitoes, I guess there were ponds or patches of standing water in there. These were a general nuisance at the this time of the year, but oddly not so much in the height of summer I found. I only got bitten once at the front of the hotel by the main pool, and that was early evening so perhaps to be expected. On the other hand, I only ventured out on to the small patio outside our room on two occasions, once early evening and managed to get bitten five times in about a minute, and once in the middle of the afternoon, again for less than a minute and was bitten twice. The combination of the woods and the shade behind the hotel seems to have made this a hot spot for mosquitoes, so if like me you seem to be the one who always gets bitten, beware. The room itself was a standard Beach Club type room; - Two comfortable double beds. - Wash area with two basins (handy for families). - Bathroom with lavatory, bath and shower over. - Large plasma TV with the usual selection of US TV channels, plus some kid-friendly Disney channels. - Writing/Computer desk with chargeable wired internet access if you wanted it. - Mini-fridge for storing your drinks and snacks. - Plenty of closet and drawer space - far more than we needed. - Coat hooks on the wall plus a pull-out drying line over the bath, handy for wet swimsuits. - Iron/Ironing Board. - Tea/coffee making facilities. - Hairdryer (worked for 10 seconds, then stopped, didn't bother to report as was only trying to dry my shoes out after an afternoon of watery rides!) - Very small key-operated safe in the closet. This is not the usual keypad type that can hold a fair amount of stuff, laptop, etc. You can just about get your documents, money and passports in it, and maybe a phone/iPod or two. Not really up to scratch in this day and age. The main difference from last year's water-view room was that the room was a bit shorter and didn't have the sofa/sofa bed. Nonetheless, the room was fine for sleeping and so on, but not somewhere you could spend a lot of time during the day or evening. We were packing a lot in to our week so sleeping was about all we used the room for, but if you were there for a fortnight and wanted a quiet evening in, it might be a bit limited on space. Housekeeping ------------------ The room was clean and tidy and in good repair and there were no faults or problems to report or deal with. (The basins in our room last year were cracked and in need of replacement, a problem noted by other reviewers). The housekeeping staff was efficient - they usually turned up about 9:00am, and if we weren't out at that time they would come back mid-afternoon instead. The only (minor) disappointment was the lack of towel animals - last year we got a different animal/Disney character made by artfully folding towels and leaving them on the bed, which the kids loved. We got one on the day we checked in, but nothing thereafter (boo). Not sure if this is because we were in one of the most basic rooms or just bad luck (and I did remember to tip!) Amenities ------------ Apart from the location, which is one of the main draws of the Beach Club, the hotel has some really great amenities: - The swimming pool is the best at any WDW property, period. It is almost a mini-water park in itself with three different pool areas and for us is the main draw of the Beach Club. It also serves the adjacent Yacht club and the Beach Club Villas: - A standard swimming pool area, broken in to several sections by curves and bridges. - A mini-lazy river - quite deep so not one for very small kids unsupervised. - A sand-bottomed pool which is large, fairly shallow and loved by kids of all ages. - A fairly big water slide themed as a pirate ship. You actually have to go out to the beach area, climb up the stairs and then ride it over the walkway around the lake and in to the beach club pool. - The whole pool is surrounded by sun loungers, and table/chair/umbrella sets. There was plenty of space in October, but last August finding somewhere to sit was a trial after mid-morning. Too many people putting towels and other items on loungers and then disappearing for four or five hours at a time, despite the signs asking them not to. - The whole thing is nicely themed in a New England/Cape Code style with bridges, a windmill in the middle of the area plus added tropical palm trees and rocky waterfalls. The two shouldn't work together as a concept, but somehow it does. - The pool was open 10:00am-10:00pm (later in summer), illuminated well after dark and extremely well lifeguarded for such a large area. There are also organised activities and games mid-afternoon through early evening. Towels are provided at all the pool entry points. - Entry to the pool area is by room key card only (one per guest including kids), which gets you a wrist band to save you carrying the key around all the time. This is fairly strictly enforced, and with good reason as the pool is so great and it would be easy for non-guests to overcrowd it otherwise as the pool is right next to the lake and only separated by low fences. - There are several other "small" pools dotted around the property with adjoining hot tubs, (small by comparison only to the main pool, but perfectly adequate for the handful of people using them each day). These are open longer hours (up to midnight) and have free towels and loungers available, but no life guards on duty. Other amenities: - Disney have just introduced free Wi-Fi access in guest rooms and other areas of the Beach Club (and I understand a number of hotels). Initially this is for a trial period, but I believe it is planned to be offered indefinitely if it works ok. It was fine for us on a laptop and two different smartphones - slightly annoying that one had to log in through the T&Cs page a bit more often than I would like, but otherwise fast and good signal throughout the hotel. - There is a small gym, a token operated arcade games room, a small laundry if you need it. - Concierge service, package delivery if you buy stuff in the Disney Parks, a chargeable kids club in the evening if you want to go out for a meal. - The lobby is fantastic, very much in keeping with the nautical theme of the hotel. Unlike other Disney hotels it does not have over the top theming, so look elsewhere if that is what you want, but it does a great job of transporting you to New England whilst actually being an elegant, airy and fantastically well-designed space. There are plenty of sofas and chairs to sit in, plus a small TV area for kids if you are waiting around for transport or whatever. - The hotel also has a "solarium" decorated in a similar style opposite the Marketplace, a good spot to sit and eat breakfast or lunch. - Boat rentals (chargeable) down at the dock area. - Camp fire and evening kids movies on the lakeside beach outside the hotel. Eating & Drinking ---------------------- - There is a beach bar serving soft and alcoholic drinks and light food and snacks open during pool hours.. - Also there 'Beaches and Cream' soda shop; small but perfectly formed. It serves burgers and fries and the like, (including the nicest veggie burgers in Disney), plus ice cream desserts galore. Some are even brave enough to try the 'Kitchen Sink', which is the ice cream equivalent of 'a pint of top shelf' for those who know what that is! - The Beach Club Marketplace sells everything you might want from souvenirs through food and drink to medicines. It also serves pastries and hot breakfast items in the morning, with delicious flatbread pizzas and other hot items for lunch and in to the evening. It can get quite busy at times, but service moves along quickly. - The Cape May Cafe does an expensive (but good) breakfast buffet with character appearances (Goofy, Donald and Minnie in beach attire). In the evening it offers a seafood buffet, not something we would eat as veggies but always seemed packed. The only downside was the stink of fish emanating from it during the evenings (even non-veggies comment on it), but it was fairly localised and easy to avoid. - There is also a small indoor bar area for drinks and light snacks in the evening. - There are probably over a dozen other eating options within a 10 minute walk at the Boardwalk and the other hotels around the lake, so you are bound to find something suitable. - If not, you can be in Epcot World Showcase in five minutes and there are about a gazillion different table and fast food-options in there. - Plus when we stayed the Epcot food and wine festival was on, so we ate snack-sized portions of delicacies everywhere from France to Mexico via every country in between, plus German beers (as good as the stuff in Bavaria), and Margaritas (not so good). Really glad it wasn't too far to walk back after all that! Issues -------- - Mosquitoes - mentioned above. - Hairdryer - mentioned above. - Apart from that, the only other thing was that the hotel was undergoing external renovations when we stayed - largely sanding, filling and painting. To be fair, we were aware of this before we visited, and the management also informed people by way of a note in the room. When we stayed they were mostly working on the outside of the solarium, which meant a few take-out meals were afflicted by the sound of power tools and the strong smell of paint. Work was limited to between 9 and 5, but I could imagine it being very annoying if one had been out late the night before and all that kicked off outside my window. Being realistic, the whole hotel consists of vast areas of beautifully painted woodwork which looks absolutely pristine despite the age of the building. I can only imagine what it would look like in the Florida climate if Disney weren't willing to invest large sums of money in keeping it up to scratch. It didn't cause us a major problem, but worth checking when this all finished before you go if it would bother you overly. Overall Impression ----------------------- We really like this hotel, and were keen to go back after our first trip. It is pretty expensive by any standards though. If judging it purely on the price vs. the quality and size of the room I'd rate it two and a half to three out of five at best, because it is four star accommodation at greater than five star prices. What pushes it up in my view is: - The exterior of the hotel and the location on the lake are fantastic. If you took away all the 'Disney' elements, this would still be one of the most fantastic hotels to look at or out of. - The wide range of family friendly amenities, in the hotel, near the hotel and easily accessible across the whole of WDW, and especially the fabulous pool. - Unbeatable service from the hotel staff. They really do their best to make you feel welcome and to help. Sure, it is pretty clear they are drilled in the 'Disney' way of providing customer service, but it results in people who actually seem to care about what their customers want and who make sure everyone is having the best time they possibly can. - The convenience of staying on a Disney property; free transport across the whole empire, the ability to charge everything to your room key and just get one credit card transaction at the end (saving on fees), extra hours in the theme parks just for Disney guests and the chance to get free Disney dining plans if you go at the right time. Would we go back to the Beach Club again? Absolutely. That said, I'd like to try some of the other Disney hotels to see what they are like, but I hesitate as I worry they would not live up to the great experiences we have had at the Beach Club.

Reviews.Title: “What a great Resort!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nulyte
Reviews.Content: My mother planned a family vacation for our entire family and wanted to stay on property where we have never stayed before. Well she did it right! This resort is superb, from the decorations, rooms, to the sand bottom pool, this hotel is great! It is a short walk to EPCOT and Hollywood Studios. The rooms were spacious enough for our family of five, 2 adults and 3 kids and my brother's family of 2 adults and 2 kids. Check-in was a breeze! The only downside is the limited quick service restaurant on site. My husband and I have already decided that we will be returning in June of next year since we already have our resort booked for January. We have stayed in the Value, Moderate and Deluxe resorts but the Beach Club will remain a favorite!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for kids and adults that love Epcot!”
Reviews.Author: mayabeatrice
Reviews.Content: Over the years, my DH and our 2 daughters, (both under 8), have visited the Grand Floridian, Port Orleans Riverside and Disney's Beach Club Resort. Our favorite is definitely the Beach Club Resort. We enjoy traveling to WDW the week right after Thanksgiving. We take advantage of the great hotel rates, fewer crowds and of course the outstanding Holiday decor. Our room was lovely and comfortable, but the biggest bonus was the hotel's close proximity to Epcot, which is our favorite park. We literally walked out of our room to find a welcoming view of the sandy beach and then on to a very short walk to what seemed like our own private entrance to Epcot. Absolutely no problems with this hotel. It's a super place if you have small children and love Epcot. The princess breakfast at Norway is quaint, lots of princesses, a must see! Also, don't miss the Candlelight ceremony with dinner package. Even the biggest Scrooge will convert to the glory of Christmas! Cape May has a super character breakfast with the more "original" Disney characters, Minnie, Mickey, Donald, Daisy, Goofey... You can not beat the pools here. Plan an extra day to take in just the hotel! The only neg was my husband and I found it difficult to get a great latte or a great cup of coffee in the hotel. We're from Seattle, though, so we are spoiled! Again, we were near Epcot so my husband would wake up early and take a stroll over to Italy and pick up coffee for both of us! Yum! Can't wait for our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Too bad for older folk”
Reviews.Author: paskey36
Reviews.Content: I have visited Disney properties many times and was pretty much always impressed. Now, as they fill in the free and open space to accommodate more families, they have taken away the very things that kept bringing us back, the peacefulness at the Beach Club did afford.With the Timeshare addition, they have ruined this property in my opinion for couples and older visitors. Too much hustle and bustle and way too many children. I know it is a family resort but this hotel offered older folk a great and easy way to visit Epcot but now that is gone. Just the opinion of an old Disney junkie.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Bill D
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights with wife and 3 kids in June and could have been more pleased with the resort. Check-in was easy and quick. The re was enough room for the 5 of us and we loved the fact that we could walk to Epcot within 5 minutes. Several food options with Cape May and Beaches and Cream. Though, I wish there were another or bigger option for quick services on site but a short walk to the Boardwalk was an easy solution. The Pool is second to none. The kids really enjoyed the water slide and sand bottom pool. Wish we would hve planned a day for the pool. At night, they offer a movie on the beach and you can see the fireworks from IllumiNations fireworks from the beach. Transportation: The water taxi to Hollywood is less than 10 minutes and the buses to Magic and Animal Kingdoms tho crowded were also less than 10 minutes with various stops. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay and are planning our next visit next year.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deluxe Resort on Property!”
Reviews.Author: WDWLuvr
Reviews.Content: The Beach Club Resort is the best deluxe resort on the Walt Disney Resort Property. Modeled after summers on Cape Cod, this cozy resort is a must see! The pool says it all. This luxurious pool area features a waterside, lazy river, sandy bottom pool complete with sinking sand, a kids water area and two jacuzzis tucked up in the rocks! Not to mention there are other quiet pools and jacuzzis all over this property! Take a break from swimming with a burger and/or Ice Cream at Beaches and Cream! Try the Kitchen Sink, I dare you! Cape May buffet is great as a character breakfast and features a New England Clam Bake buffet for dinner! Rooms are very spacious, beds are so comfortable, and the view is extrordinary! Other amenities include a sandy beach for your relaxation, nighttime movies by the camp fire with s'mores, and a grand lake view. Beach club Resort shares a lake front with the Yacht Club, Boardwalk, and the Swan and Dolphin. A walking path allows easy access to the other resorts as well as Hollywood Studios and EPCOT. Water transportation is also available between all mentioned destinations.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: dtgmichigan
Reviews.Content: Great location, generally excellent service and nicely-maintained common areas. Check-in was easy, lobby and pool areas are beautiful/clean. Rooms, on the other hand, are showing their age. Grout in the tub showed not-insignificant mildew/mold. Shower head needed to be replaced/upgraded. Bathroom sinks had chips in several places (not the vanities, but the bowls themselves). Surprised that the TVs weren't high def. However, my biggest single complaint is how incredibly thin the walls were. I'm 49 years old, and I've stayed in some pretty cheap hotels and motels over the years, but I have never in my life stayed somewhere where you can so clearly hear the party next door. From "Tyson" having a meltdown in the room around 11:00 p.m. our first night there, to the new residents checking in around midnight the next night, we heard *everything* that was being said, even things that sounded like they were being uttered in conversational tones. I have no idea if this is a problem with just room 2579, where we stayed, or in the entire resort. I scanned a few other reviews just now to see if it was mentioned elsewhere, and it was, but not to the extent that we experienced it. I know everyone says/thinks this, but I don't think we're particularly finicky or hard-to-please travelers, but this was ridiculous. Particularly for the cost of the room within the Disney resort hotels. We ate a dinner and a breakfast at the Cape May restaurant and both were good. A bit overpriced, but the quality was fine. Service is a bit unctuous for my taste, as the servers seem to all be bucking for the 20% tip (even for a buffet), but not horrible. I would definitely opt for the Polynesian (where we stayed last time) over this property.

Reviews.Title: “perfect everything”
Reviews.Author: maesea
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned a last minute quick get away, but this time decided to stay at the beach Club and also concierge level We figured we would splurge and now that we have done this, it will be hard not do it this way all the time We got out of our car and soon as we walked up they asked our name, we gave it and we were swept away onto an elevator right up to the concierge level where we sat at a desk right away, asked if we would like a drink. We got upgraded and our room was spectacular, what a view. Breakfast was included and the variety they put out if great, we would come back in the afternoon and had a cold beer and change for the pool....which may I add, the BEST pool ever. Never mind the size and all the little pools attached, it has a sandy bottom.The night time nibbles were out of this world also. We would ask for 2 bottle of water,and we got two large bottle of Evian water.We like to have a glass or two of wine at the end of the night, we would ask for 2 glasses and we got them, ask for 2 more and we got them. They staff way out of this world couldn't do enough for you.I loved this location too, so close to EPCOT that after Illuminations you just walk over the bridge and your home.The rooms are good size and are bright and clean. The beds were very comfortable and the room smelled nice. I guess what I am trying to say is, we did this all last minute and I thought it was our best Disney vacation ever and I have to say, it was the Beach Club and their staff. We have always been Wilderness lodge people, but the Beach house just won us over. I don't have a bad thing to say about this hotel or staff. The one thing we did wrong was not give ourselves enough pool time,it will be a must next time.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: bob18413
Reviews.Content: Stay started off poorly. After walking Epcot all day , decided to make the 1/4 mile walk from room to pool. There were 3 of us , took one room key . Upon arrival at pool , we all couldn't go in because everyone needs key to be allowed in pool. We weren't advised of that "rule", and had to walk all the way back to the room and return . The pool guard seemed to enjoy her power . I tried to contact a manager but ended up playing phone tag, very frustrating . The hotel signage is confusing and is difficult navigate thru the property . People we spoke with in passing also were wandering lost . I guess I expected more from Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Just Magical”
Reviews.Author: Patricia M
Reviews.Content: My just retired parents and I stayed at the Beach Club for 6 nights (10/2 - 10/8/11) while I attended a conference for the first three days. My folks have never really been big disney fans as they remember the long lines and the only ok service that we experienced back in the 70's. To say that they were impressed with this resort and the parks would be an understatement. The entire staff went out of their way for us and every request was met with a "It's my pleasure or we hope you have a magical day!" The resort was very clean and the attention to every detail is evident through out. I loved being able to walk along the super clean white sandy beach while talking with my husband by phone each evening. My husband and I are planning a trip and I just can't imagine staying anywhere else. Mom and Dad are now singing Disney praises to anyone who will listen. If you'd like to go off property for a day you can easily rent a car over at the Dolphin Hotel which is just across the lake. Epcot is very close and a real nice walk or you can take their water taxi to both Epcot and Hollywood Studios. The laundry is clean and the service at Beaches & Cream was fabulous! The buses to all other parks are accessed by a short walk out the main entrance. The gift shop is wonderful and its nice that they're open until 11pm for late night snacks and sandwiches that are made to order. We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: cbuschick
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Disney Beach Club September 9 - 14, 2011. My husband, our almost 3 year old princess and I had a dream vacation at the Beach Club! Location: So close to Epcot, literally a five minute walk. The buses to the Magic Kingdom, Animal Kingdom were convenient. We took the boat ride to Hollywood Studios and it was a quick trip. We loved the hotels proximity to the Boardwalk. We grabbed take out from the ESPN Zone late one night and took it back to the hotel - great meal. The Magical Express worked like a dream. We had to stop at a few other resorts on the way to and from the airport, but worth it to me not to worry about transportation arrangements or driving. Hotel: Very clean room. The hotel smelled great - really fresh & clean scent. The beds and pillows were super comfortable. The walls are a bit thin, but we only heard our neighbors once or twice - no big deal. The shower was good, nice bath products. Plenty of room for our family of 3 with 2 queen beds. Pool: AMAZING. If we get the chance to stay here again, we will definitely allow a full day for the pool. We had fun swimming after long days at the parks, but would have enjoyed more time there. The pool party was fun - games for kids were entertaining. My daughter loved playing in the sand. We brought a float for our daughter from home and they allowed us to bring it in the pool. We also enjoyed the quiet pool, which we had all to ourselves one night! Food: The market in the hotel was good for a quick breakfast. We used our snack credits to buy muffins/pastries for breakfast. We also bought a half gallon of milk for the room at a reasonable price. We enjoyed the Character Breakfast at Cape May - nice buffet. We also had great meals at Epcot and the Polynesian (Ohana). The Beach Club exceeded my expectations. I read many, many hotel reviews before booking the Beach Club and I know we made the right decision. I want to plan a return trip for next year! :)

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable Epcot access, less than stellar check in experience”
Reviews.Author: IMBELLE
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at all of the Deluxe Disney Resorts save the Boardwalk and the Yacht and Beach Club. As my solo trip to the Food and Wine Festival would require multiple trips into Epcot, the Beach Club was the practical choice this time around. People rave about this hotel so I was eager to try it out. Unfortunately my check in experience was less than magical. I had 3 questions that I had intended to ask at the concierge desk but as no one was in line behind me I just decided to ask Pete, the Cast Member who was checking me in. Big mistake. First I asked if I needed to sign a release to use the 24 hour fitness center. Pete said no but did not offer to give me the 24 hour card that I later found out that I needed to get from the check in desk. My second question regarded the beachside movies that were playing at the other resorts. I have inquired about this in the past and it seemed a simple matter for Cast Members to pull up the information. However, Pete apparently was not aware of where to find this information online and thought I wanted him to call all 24 resorts and ask what movies they were playing. He started by getting on the phone to All Stars and working his way down the list. When I realized what he was doing I tried to stop him and reinerate that I only wanted to know the movies playing at the resorts with beaches (Polynesian, Contemporary, Grand Floridian, and Boardwalk) and that I was pretty sure there was a place where it could be found online in their system. He ignored what I was saying, called Animal Kingdom Lodge, and asked his coworker to start calling the Coronado (neither of which have beaches). Obviously Pete was determined to punish me by making me stand there while he called all 24 resorts. I was stunned. I said "Look, you've proved your point, I'm sorry I asked" and I began to walk away without daring to ask my third question (1st bus arrival time on Extra Magic Hours morning..guess I should have started with the simplest question first). Pete widened his eyes, spread his arms and said "I'm only trying to help" in a phoney, overly solicitous manner, like I was too stupid to recognize sarcasm. Wow, Fortunately, when I went to Guest Services at Downtown Disney, a charming Cast Member named Laurent not only pulled up the movie schedules for the requested resorts in seconds but gave me printouts for the whole week's schedule unasked. The Beach Club has many positives, the greatest of these being walking access to Epcot and Disney's Hollywood Studio. The 24 hour fitness center and the path around Cresent Lake are great for early risers' workouts or jogs. The sand bottom in the pool is a nice, beachy touch. The biggest negative (well, besides Pete) is the shared bus system. When I returned from Downtown Disney I believe the stops were Downtown Disney Marketplace, Pleasure Island, Typhoon Lagoon, the Swan, the Dolphin, the Boardwalk, the Yacht Club, and the Beach Club. While I understand the logistics of why Disney does this, it makes for long travel times, inconvenient waits, and often very crowded buses for their guests. There were a few minor things that did not affect me but might be of note to others. Construction is going on at the Beach Club so currently guests shouldn't count on being able to take any afternoon naps. My standard room had a balcony that was only big enough to step out on, no room for a chair. A rather odd design; if you're going to have a balcony on a room, why not extend it out far enough to be useable? So I would say if a view or a seat on your balcony is important to you, invest in a more upscale room and ask specifically what you are getting. The two sinks, tub, and toilet were all enclosed in the bathroom. It seems like it would be more useful for the facilities to be separated so more than one person could get ready at the same time. Also the bathroom door almost grazes the toilet when you close the door which can be awkward. My room had an adjoining door to the room next to mine so while this could account for a larger noise factor, other than one noisy entrance at 2am, my neigbors were mercifully quiet. In summary I can see the appeal of the resort to familes with kids due to the large pool area but frankly I never lost the feeling that I was in a hotel. I would be inclined to recommend the Wilderness Lodge or the Animal Kingdom Lodge for character over the Beach Club. Even though these two are expansive, there are areas tucked away like overlooks with rocking chairs or alcoves with fireplaces and comfy couches that give them a homey feel. These resorts generally also share a bus with only one other resort. One last piece of advice, if you are checking in and Pete is the next available Cast Member, let the person behind you go first! And for Pete's sake don't ask any questions!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Mo3Virginia
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a wonderful 1 week trip to Orlando, FL and stayed at the Beach Club Resort. We couldn't have been happier staying at this resort. Pluses? 1. Walking distance to back gates of Epcot (10 minutes at most). This is a great plus to get into parks and enjoy the great cuisine using your quick service/table service dining credits. 2. Great pool (stays open until 10 pm) and quiet pool with hot tub (stays open 24 hours a day!). 3. Walking distance to Boardwalk - where there are lots of good restaurants 4. Boat service to Hollywood Studios The hotel was so convenient to so many things and I can't say enough about the staff there - all very friendly. Especially Josie - who really did a wonderful job setting up my family in three wonderful rooms that overlooked both the pool and lake. My kids enjoyed the Sandcastle Club one night while the adults went out. The only downside to the hotel was limited quick service dining options (only three options for breakfast; three options for lunch) but at least we were able to go to Epcot easily to get more options.

Reviews.Title: “Disney magic again!”
Reviews.Author: disneymum_1
Reviews.Content: Our family spent 8 nights at the Beach Club in December 2011. We really enjoyed our stay there. The location is superb. We walked to Epcot in the morning and then went back to the hotel for a quick swim and dinner and then popped back into the park later that night for fireworks. We rented a car and it took only minutes for us to reach the other 3 parks. The hotel was beautifully maintained, staff were very friendly and our room was a real treat at the end of a long day. The pool, which is more like a private water park, was great and the kids were happy to spend an entire afternoon. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to friends and family. We will definitely be booking another trip soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and room”
Reviews.Author: mln304
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Beach Club & I hope not the last. Upon arriving by the Magical Express, we were greeted outside by someone who walked us into the lobby and got us our room key and resort brochures/maps without us ever having to go to the check-in desk - I did the web check-in so they already had our credit card and other info. We arrived at 2pm and our room was ready. Our room - 2507 - was in the best location for us. Although it is far from the lobby, it is closest to Epcot - just out a side door and a 3-5 min walk and you're there. The room was clean and a nice size for us (2 adults). We had a problem with the AC in our room one day & after a call to engineering in the morning, it was fixed when we returned from the park in the afternoon. Every cast member that we encountered on this trip was friendly and helpful. We spent several afternoons at the pool, Stormalong Bay. Towels are available to use at the pool and plenty of chairs. The pool has a slide, small lazy river & a sand bottom. There are also games going on all afternoon for the kids. There is a second quiet pool away from the lobby, but there is more to see at the main pool. There is a Marketplace which serves as a quick service for breakfast & lunch/dinner (limited menu but good) and also as the hotel gift shop. The Marketplace & Hurricane Hanna's at the pool are the only quick service locations for both the Beach & Yacht Clubs - they could probably use another at this resort. We used the bus transportation to Animal Kingdom & Magic Kingdom with no trouble. We also walked through Epcot & took monorail to MK. We took the boat to Hollywood Studios - you could also walk but it was too hot. During afternoon rains, the hotel had towels for the guests to dry off in the lobby. This is, by far, my favorite resort at Disney for the great location and the excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Supreme Service at This Resort”
Reviews.Author: travelinggirl25610
Reviews.Content: The Beach Club is fabulous. It is family friendly and has so much to do for the kids. Huge pool with faux sand and slide. The life guards organize games for teens and young ones. Every evening the hotel hosts a family evening, " camping", movies under the stars etc. It has a store an ice cream parlor and two restaurants. A nice gym, spa and so much more. A short walk or boat ride to either Epcot or Hollywood Studios. Great room service. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Back to the Beach (resort)”
Reviews.Author: MTDigs
Reviews.Content: For the past 10 years, my wife & I generally spend at least 1 week each year at a Walt Disney World Resort and generally stay at the Boardwalk Resort or the beach Club Resort. This year we decided to go back to the Beach Club Resort after skipping over it for almost 4 years in favor of the Boardwalk. We were VERY Glad we came Back to the Beach. The staff is even more friendly than we remembered and the palce has been given a fresh coat of paint. The gift shop has been expanded & they're showing 'Movies on the Beach' nightly - Disney movies, of course. The quiet pool is TRULY a quiet pool since most of th kids prefer "Storm Along Bay" at the other side of the hotel. Plenty of clean towels, a hot tub and the water is kept clean with a Citrus Based tile cleaner so it's never slippery. Hint: Now that the Beach serves room service (they hadn't in the past) they'll even serve it Pool Side! Best of all, The beach Club Resort is the closest hotel to EPCOT especailly if you decide to stroll.

Reviews.Title: “Love this resort!”
Reviews.Author: traceyleep
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our annual May Disney trip with our 2 year old grandson, his mother and Aunt. We booked 2 rooms, and on check-in requested they be adjoining, and we got them. We did have to wait for one of the rooms, however we were there at noon, and they texted us within 40 minutes and the other room was ready. Bell services, very efficient. Brought up all of our things, gave us tips about the layout of the hotel, and even went and filled our ice buckets. We had a King room, with a daybed, and a large sink storgae area with 4 cup coffee maker. Plenty of room for storage. Beds were super comfortable, heavy cotton duvet covers and lots of big pillows. Baths were well equipped, lots of big fluffy towels, and toiletries were the H2o you can purchase in gif shops. We loved the lotion, and the room attendant gave us extras. We also got towel animals each day, which made the toddler in our group so happy. The adjoining room was a 2 queen bed room, also with lots of storage, and room to fit a crib. The rooms had small balconies and nice views, great spot to people watch and enjoy a glass of wine, or cup of coffee. We loved the huge pool area, it has a sand bottom, which the toddler didn't like so much but it was interesting and fun. Lots of people there must have room key to get a bracelet for each day you use the pool. This can be strictly enforced, as even our 2 year old had to have a room key one of the times we used the pool. It depends who is on duty I guess. Even though there were lots of people it is so spacious & spread out you don't feel crowded. Pool bar, awesome. Try the tropical Mojito, and relax. Quiet pools on the other side of hotel, also large & spacious, hot tub big enough to meet a few people and not feel uncomfortable. Plenty of tables & umbrellas, and chairs etc...We love how you are literally within walking distance of Epcot, so you can walk over & watch the Illuminations fireworks each night. We also walked to boardwalk, for dinner one night, and for bakery goodies to carry back to the room. Cape May restaurant on site has a fabulous seafood buffett, worth the money, and save room for those tiny desserts, they are heavenly, well worth the calories. So far this is our favorite resort, and we have stayed at Polynesian, Port Orleans Riverside, Carribean Beach, Old Key West, and Wilderness Lodge. The closeness to Epcot just tips it for some reason. We look forward to trying other resorts but will always come back to this one!

Reviews.Title: “Beware Club Level”
Reviews.Author: Funforthesun
Reviews.Content: CLUB LEVEL: Standard Rooms Club Level = Roof top view, ridiculous. Food skimpy and kept on comming in sporadically. Kids did not like most of the foods offerred except for the breakfast foods. Wines offerred are cheap $6.00 bottles,Can get OK wine for$11.00 a bottle. Area for obtaining food very small. Some staff were helpful others looked over worked and were robotic. One staff memeber shouted at some lady that she could only have two glasses of wine in front of her. Walls in room paper thin, heard kids in next room crying at 7am and construction at 8 am; horrible when comming back from park at 3am. Pros:Nice grounds, terriffic pools and slide, good location Club level at the Hard Rock in Orlando: Rooms =high ceilings , modern, nice views, good food kids liked, better wine, staff friendly and looked like they were interested in being there. Seperate quick lines at park all day when staying at Universal hotels.

Reviews.Title: “disney for the 15th time”
Reviews.Author: giants86
Reviews.Content: The beach club was magnificent. We loved the location. Brisk walk over to board walk. A boat trip to hollywood studios. A stroll over to Epcot. We found going to Magic Kingdom a new experience as we could walk thru epcot and take the monorail. We dont usually spend a lot of our time at the pool because of the great parks . This time was opposite. The sand bottom pool & acres of it is relaxing and fun. Our kids are of different age groups and loved trying everything. Our youngest 4 loved the 2 foot area with the buckets and pails for building sandcastles with dad. i might add that this was his (my husbands) favourite section as well. not a big swimmer.
