My other 2 children loved the pirate slide, waterfalls (also with dad.) jumping in the 8ft deep waters as i floated around the lazy river watching them. the daily games and activities everyday were a big hit especially the volleyball net with my teenage son.. We unfortunately couldnt' visit one day because of bad weather one day but were able to enjoy a smaller pool which was like d just as much. The Cape May restaurant was our first stop when we arrived. We got the magical express just in time as we almost missed a wonderful breakfast buffet and pics with characters. On another evening we chose to visit hurricane hannas not over the top excitement but good enough for hotdogs poolside. Another evening we chose to enjoy cape may again. My husband went especially for the crab legs and was not disappointed. My son was excited to see Portuguese octopus stew. one of his faves at home by his grandmother. i loved the kids section for my girls. can't get enough chicken nuggets and fries,. the carved beef was lovely. Good service as well. The room with day bed nice and spacious for a family five. not always easy to find especially as the kids get older. It was always nice to always have 5 of everything (ie. towels) that doesn't always happen either. Linda made our room lovely to return too. one small note would have requested a blanket for day bed but always got back late and didn't think of it till later when we did unfortunately it never came.If that little small detail is all too complain about i probably shouldn't even have mentioned It was a most memorable trip. We never tire of disney and hope to be back again soon. thanks beach club for being part of our trip.Melo family

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Rooms”
Reviews.Author: PBCGuy
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at many of Disney's resorts, but we found the Beach Club the nicest location so far. It's not just for the magnificent view when you step out of the lobby, either. Epcot and the Boardwalk area are an easy walk. And Hollywood Studios is just a short boat-ride away. I've been in a couple of old New England seaside resorts. The Beach Club does a great job recreating the look and feel. Our room was comfortable, immaculate and spacious - by far the largest room we've had at Disney. We found the best eating was next door, at the bar beside the Yacht Club's steak house. They had very good food and a fair selection of beers. Our one complaint was the parking. If you don't use the valet service, be prepared to walk. Guest parking is over by the villas, so you have to haul your bags a fair distance to get back to check-in. The Beach Club is pricey. But if you're looking for a quieter resort where you can feel a little pampered, it's a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!!”
Reviews.Author: tab-reho
Reviews.Content: It was a perfect location .. great to get from park to park so easy... it is a must do but the prices were high all the way around..

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice resort - Great Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: deakoripp
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that the Beach Club is a very good Disney resort. We actually preferred it to The Grand Floridian! Beach Club has the most amazing pool we've ever seen. Too bad we were too busy to use it every day. We also loved the proximity to Epcot. This made the evening dinners so easy, and we were able to choose some fabulous restaurants in Epcot like Teppan Edo and San Angel Inn. Hollywood Studios was also a short boat ride away, which we found convenient. The bus service to Beach Club is pretty poor, however. We shared buses with the Swan, The Dolphin, and The Boardwalk resorts - this meant lots of standing, and we went at a fairly uncrowded time of year (end of August)! It also seemed as if our bus line was often the longest and no buses came, where 2 or 3 buses would have come for other (lesser) resorts! This was irritating, as we felt that we paid top dollar for our resort and we should have better bus service. The Cape May Cafe in the Beach Club was our least favorite meal of the week, unfortunately. Also, the Club Level food was not that good, and not varied at all. Still, we did like the convenience of breakfast on the Club Level (and a few beers helped on a couple of evenings!). The room was fairly clean. We found some crusts of bread under the dust ruffle of a bed....kind of yucky, but overall it was O.K. The room was good size for 5 of us, and the daybed was perfect for our youngest. The lobby is very pretty - great for some family photos! Overall, Beach Club is a lovely resort. The pool is the best we've seen, and the location for Epcot and Hollywood Studios is great. The price was very high, but I guess that's Disney! We would stay here again if we go back to Disney, but we did prefer the Universal Resorts for the money. Hard Rock was awesome and half the price. Their Club Level service was also superior. Disney resorts could learn a thing or two!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at the Beach Club”
Reviews.Author: wdwfan10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Disney Beach Club Resort for three days in September 2011. This was my first time staying in a WDW Deluxe hotel, so I was really expecting a lot. Most of my expectations were met. Our trip was planned for us to spend the majority of our time in Epcot, so that is the main reason we chose the Beach Club. It is a five minute walk to the back entrance of Epcot--the International Gateway, which is located between the France and UK pavilions. For this reason, we also requested a room as close to the Epcoot end of the resort as possible, and that request was granted. The Beach Club and Yacht Club resorts are basically combined, they share an amazing pool-one of the best on Disney property, for sure. It has a lazy river, shipwreck slide, and a sandy bottom! The Beach Club is also a short walk to the Boardwalk resort and entertainment area, which has several restaurants and a couple of nightspots. You can also walk or catch a boat into Hollywood Studios, and the Swan and Dolphin Hotels. Lots of options closeby. The only thing I was disappointed in were a few maintanence issues with our room. One of the closet doors was completely off when we got there, but was fixed the next day. Also, in the bathroom, the door actually rubbed against the toilet everytime it was opened. The shower sprayed water all over the floor, and when I tried to adjust it, I discovered a half-dollar sized hole where the pipe went into the wall. The rest of the room was lovely, with plenty of room.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Best place we ever stayed in Disney!”
Reviews.Author: zmcgee
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, great location! It was so nice to be able to walk to Epcot for meals and the quick boat ride to Hollywood Studios! The pool area could have been a vacation by itself for the kids!

Reviews.Title: “Second time here, had fun, maintenance and staff knowledge needs work”
Reviews.Author: David T
Reviews.Content: We booked our room for 4 with a specific request for 2 queens and a day bed as our "child" is 171/2 and her adult brother is 22. When we arrived, the staff was courteous but had a very difficult time finding a place for us and stated that with 1 child listed and 3 adults they thought the two queens would work out. Not a good response especially since the adult 6ft 2 other child was standing there. They did find a room for us but it was not ready until 5 p.m and we arrived well before noon. The room we were given was not in the gardens section but rather in the woods section -not an issue except that the maintenance and environment were not up to disney standards. There was power washing and scrapping with a "tree picker" apparatus --every week day--and while this family is used to construction noise -the resulting dirt, caulk, etc was not cleaned off of our balcony everyday. Inside the room, the towel rack kept falling down and the cleaning service on the 4th day just put it on top of the dresser. (I would have assumed the first day that the cleaning staff would have notified the maintenance staff that there was a repair to be made). One sink had faucets that were not on correctly and therefore did not operate well. There was a hole in the shower directly under the on/off knob. Our door to the hallway did not close upon exiting the room unless one of us stood on the inside of the room and pulled back the latch while another of us inserted the room key. And while They paid for the lost item, I was not impressed when a pair of earrings I had put in a glass with a note underneath stating not to empty, were missing but the note was still there. The final irritation is that the instructions printed and provided to us regarding luggage for our express check out did not follow the guidance given by our travel agent: we followed her guidance but when wetried to confirm with the bell boy staff, we received multiple and conflicting guidance from several people standing at the same desk at the same time. Suggest that even if the " the instructions change all the time" as I was told, that instructions are divided into those using express and luggage check out and airport check in at the resort and those who are not. Go green and just print on two sides ot the same piece of paper. Maintenance and staff knowledge definitely a pause for concern. But the great pool and restaurants and walking distance to EPCOT outshadowed the not so good about the room. Big issue is that your Beaches and Cream inside seating area is TOO SMALL to accomodate the number of folks who want to sit down and it is confusing when you walk up. Suggest that you take some of the area of the gameroom and use it for beaches and cream seating. Walk up pool side grill ---great; pool and lifeguards --fantastic; captain's grill --great; cape may restaurant --great for characters and buffet; yachtmans steakhouse--go back to good steak dinners and stop with the phoo phoo dressings and sides. Bathrooms on main floor/lobby area need cleaning more often. Gift shop should be the gift shop and you need to move the grill and restaurant part out of there. IT takes forever just to get a slice of pizza because there is not enough room for more than 2 people. Gift shop still nice! and like the availability of snacks. Expand beaches and cream and get rid of the hot grill in the gift shop.

Reviews.Title: “1st time WDW visit.”
Reviews.Author: Keynah
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Nice pools. There could be more child friendly food choices for the kids & the boardwalk should have more things to do. The night movies for the kids was cool, also free. The best part of staying at a Disney resort is the many FREE transportation systems. we had the Disney express service, which was free with our package. A cab from the airport to the hotel is $60-70.

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation”
Reviews.Author: marccsw
Reviews.Content: easy access to epcot and boardwalk areas, fun pool with sandy bottom floor, clean with good service. Needs some updating, mini-fridge in our room was noisy... There was work being done on the exterior of the building right outside our window which was somewhat annoying. Doesn't Disney know to move people away from work areas? It was disappointing they didn't move or upgrade us.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Hotel. Loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyMari
Reviews.Content: We just came back from WDW and stayed at this hotel which we were glad we did. The location could not be better. A short walk from Epcot and just across from the Boardwalk restaurants and stores. The pool was huge and beautiful with a pirate ship and a slide which goes into one of the pools. The water is very warm in the pool. There is a waterfall at one end of the pool, and an area where you can get lifejackets for children, tubes to float around on in another pool, and other pool items. The pool was refreshing on a warm day. There are activities at the pool daily which such as different contests and games. The staff are from different countries and are very friendly and helpful wherever you go. The marketplace in the hotel is the quick service area for breakfast, lunch, and a quick dinner which you can use for your dining plan if you are on one. In the morning it is very crowded as guests run to get refills of coffee for their breakfasts before setting out for the parks. The marketplace is also a gift shop which sells drug items, clothes, and souvenirs you may need to pick up. The hotel's landscape was very nice and the hotel inside was very clean. The lobby is spacious and resembles a Capecod seaside resort with comfortable chairs and a laid back atmosphere. The hotel has a buffet at breakfast and a seafood buffet dinner which appeared to be very popular and crowded. Our room had two queen size beds with a balcony with a view of the front of the hotel which was very nice. The room contained a day bed which another person was able to sleep on. It held five of us. There were double sinks and one bathroom. Our maid supplied us with enough towels and cleaned our room nicely and changed our linens when requested. The Yacht club is connected to this hotel and you can quickly move from one hotel to the next by connecting walkways outside. You can eat at the other hotel's restaurants which are very good as well. We ate at the Captains Grille twice for dinner and enjoyed our meals very much. The hotel does cater to children and my children loved the artist of the day contests and the stickers and coloring books given to them at the front desk. The staff go out of their way to make children feel welcome. There are probably more children at the hotel than adults. The Disney bus service to the parks can be picked up in front of the hotel and run every 20 minutes. This was really nice as you do not have to do the driving and the buses are very cool and air-conditioned. The only complaint was that there were not enough washing machines working at the hotel when we had to do laundry. For such a large hotel this can be an inconvenience when alot of people need to wash their clothes. Other than that, this was a terrific hotel and added greatly to our traveling experience. We will miss our stay here. My children said they would love to live here!!

Reviews.Title: “Would go back in a heartbeat ! Just a few quibbles!”
Reviews.Author: flyingfox21
Reviews.Content: Like anywhere this hotel has its pluses and minuses !! Mostly good though. Having stayed at the Disney Port Orleans last year, we really wanted to go back again this year but wanted to try a Deluxe hotel, as opposed to one of their moderate hotels. We got the Free Dining Plan as we went in August ( please read tipping note below though !). The balcony was not very big at all (if this concerns you then check !) as I had expected something that my husband and I could sit out on when the children needed to catch up on their sleep ! ( Like I had seen in the brochure). You could only stand 1 person on it, and the door automatically shut !! I did ring down to be told that their were no more rooms available that night, but they may be able to move us tomorrow ( after a nine hour flight plus other travelling time I really didn't fancy unpacking to change rooms again !). The bell hop arrived and as we mentioned our upset with the balcony he said the room being in a corner was bigger than most standard rooms, and if we moved to another room tomorrow if would be much smaller. As I am disabled and had a wheelchair to accommodate we decided to stay with the room we had for the sake of space !! and less hassle !! Need to mention though - the bed was v.comfortable, we has 2 queen sized beds in our room. Flat screen TV good. Coffee making facilities - horrid ! - we went downstairs in the lift to the Marketplace and got coffees in our refillable cups instead. Note - there is a decent sized fridge though, and a very small safe in the wall in your room ! ( I mean Small ) ! Coat hangars ( yes, they brought more in 15 mins) but when will they realise a family room needs more than 10 or so hangars !! ( I had the same issue last year). Negatives to this hotel ; 1. Disney have changed their policy this year , and where as before in Deluxe hotel you got FREE wi-fi in the room, NOW you have to pay !! Having gone last year and asked about the Wi-Fi policy and not been told of the change we were expecting if to be free in a Deluxe hotel !! The only time we really NEEDED this was when trying to check info. on the launch of Juno we wanted to go and see at Cape Canaeveral. I now this change of policy upset quite a few people staying at the hotel though ! My husband was rather expecting to be able to use his Smart Phone in the hotel and I wasn't willing to pay the price ! 2. Whilst the lobby area and pools/gardens etc are immaculate, I did feel that it had been a LONG time since our bedroom had been cleaned properly, very dusty carpets under the desk, down the sides of the bedside cabinets etc, edges of carpets. 3. Would benefit from more tables to use to eat a counter service breakfast at in the morning, as the few available outside and in the solarium soon got taken, meaning you had to to back to your room or eat on the go if busy, There is a hotel restaurant for breakfast, but as it is a character breakfast in the Cape May Cafe which is great but we couldn't afford that every day !! 4. There was repainting and sanding going on externally whilst we were there that we didn't know of in advance, it didn't affect us though...but we did over hear some people it had. The sanding at 9am was a bit noisy mind !! Positives ;- 1. An excellent hotel along with the Yacht Club ( next door) for position. A 5 minute walk to Epcot, and very quick to get in at these turnstyles at the top end of the park ! very quiet entrance. Made it very easy to eat out in some gorgeous restaurants in Epcot in an evening if not wanting to spend all day in the parks, and then come out and watch the Epcot fireworks at 9pm (every night). Nice walk to Epcot too ! Could also walk to the Boardwalk in 5-10 mins ( across the water from the hotel), where magicians would pop up and entertain people on the boardwalk, as well as other venues being situated here. A nice walk ( or bike ride) after dinner if dining in the hotel too ! 2. Pool area. brilliant if you have children. Not noisy, just lively in a nice way. Lots of lifeguards. Plenty of seats. the different areas of the pool, lazy river etc were lovely. This bit in the brochure is to be believed ! 3. Dining in the hotel if you like seafood ( buffet) is lovely ! Kids loved it too !! The Steak Restaurant in the Yacht Club - what can I say, the steak was divine !! Gets very busy, so book ! We tried to go to the Beaches and Cream Ice Cream parlour but the wait to get in ( they have a waiting list at busy times !) was just too long so we just got ice cream to go ! and ate it at a table around the pool area ! When a cloud blows over everyone has the same idea !! Kids were a bit gutted, but it's not that big inside !! 4. Films on the beach (what a cute idea)! Deckchairs were set out on the beach area every night and a different Disney film played on a huge inflatable screen ! Really nice, although I watched from the pathway as I was in a wheelchair ! (not too good on sand !). 5. Boat ride to Hollywood Studios was great ! and quite quick. Made for a quick escape after the ''Fantasmic'' performance ( do the Dinner Package! well worth it)....back in no time ! This hotel is a sure fire winner for location and its super pool complex keeping both the children and the adults happy. We did have a rental car as we flew from the UK into Sanford airport so needed transport and intended on doing the odd Mall trip, the Juno launch at Cape Canaeveral and Sea World and Discovery Cove on this visit, so was worth hiring a car. When in Disney though we just let them do the driving and used their transportation system ! Its' a BIG place!! much more relaxing and easier to let them take you round their parks for free and buses and boats were pretty frequent and queues never got too big. Just leave plenty of time if you have say a character breakfast at Tusker House to get to in Animal Kingdom ( it's a fair trip !), but well worth it ! The Yacht Club ( next door to the Beach Club ) is more expensive to book from the UK , ? why ?? Do they all have bigger usable balconies at the Yacht Club ? Other than that we weren't sure why the difference ! Staff - all very friendly and helpful. ONE MOAN though - the TIPPING system. A 'suggested' tip of 15% or 18% on a food bill in Disney is NOT CHEAP! We got the Meal Plan for Free going in August, but some restaurants are 'double your entitlements', so called Signature restaurants ! Yes, the food was v. nice, but BE PREPARED FOR THE TIP THEY EXPECT !! Only parties of 6 or more HAVE THE TIP ENFORCED, but the face of the waiters ( some, but not all) says it all when you leave a reasonable tip ! Be prepared for this !! If not careful you could have a bill of 100s of $ at the end of a 2 week stay due to to tipping expected !! I think they are used to American's staying a few nights ( not 2 weeks) !! and leaving bigger tips. PS. Discovery Cove is amazing, but be aware it is open 'whatever the weather' ! We had a fab dolphin encounter, but an hour later the sky went dark and stayed like that for the rest of the day ! (from 10am onwards!) top tip. get there early ! to reduce impact of any mid/ late afternoon storms on your dolphin swim. Overlall, we had an amazing time and the customer service is second to none. We always feel so safe in Disney and can just relax ! We would go back again - would check out the Yacht Club too....a bigger balcony would have been nice ! From asking around the pool other people got their rooms changed for other ones when checking in too....there seem to be a variety or rooms !

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel but needs more "life"”
Reviews.Author: dwfco
Reviews.Content: We spent two weeks here in August. The hotel looks lovely, has a great swimming pool complex and has very easy access to Epcot. We found all the staff very happy to help with any questions we had and from the hotel point of view it was great, apart fom the five minute walk to the furthest part of the hotel to reach our room. We were dissapointed at the lack of WiFi in the room and the fact that you had to pay $9.95 for access each day. Our main problem with the hotel was the lack of facilities. If you got back from the parks after 9 you can't get anything to eat, apart from the shop,until 11. We found this very frustrating and with the bar closing at 11:30 you couldn't get a late drink. I admit there is room service but in a "5 Star" hotel I would expect facilities to be available as and when guests want them. We did have a good time, but please extend the opening hours and provide free WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “Construction noise and activity spoiled what might have been a nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: djstep
Reviews.Content: Unbeknownst to us, this hotel is undergoing an exterior paint job with scaffolding, cranes, and loud industrial grinders going nonstop from 9AM to 5PM. We were unable to use our "garden view" balcony the entire week as it was covered in drop clothes and paint dust when not actively being scraped, sanded and caulked. Why this was scheduled during the hight of the summer season is certainly a mystery. There were also maintenance issues in the room as well...peeling wallpaper in the bathroom, a loose sink faucet, a rusted through shower faucet coverplate, and a lamp that did not work...certainly not up to expectations of a deluxe Disney resort. The best thing about this hotel was the location..a short walk to Epcot and a short boat ride to hollywood studios. Also the pool and restaurant Cape May Cafe were great. If you are staying at this resort anytime soon I suggest you switch reservations to the Yacht Club next door, or better yet the Swan and Dolphin down the walk and save yourself some money.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very nice....value is a question?”
Reviews.Author: Irishcreamer
Reviews.Content: Context - Average family - One kid - We are well traveled but first time to Disney. Booked the whole vacation tru Mouse Savers travel agent....cant say enough about these guys. They were great, flexible and free! Took a lot of stress out of the process. The Beach club is great. Clean, large, friendly staff, fantastic grounds and setting and excellent location. Short walk to Epcot and Boardwalk. Boat ride or short bus to DHS. Bus ride is a little longer to Downtown Disney and Magic Kingdom...but you can get mono rail from Epcot. Rooms are nice and large, comfy beds, good room service. Resturants and on site facilities are great. Day care, arcade, average spa and gym, ice cream parlor and several nice places to eat. Pool is excellent...in fact they have 3 pools. Not too crowded, great water slides and very kid friendly. Lots of 3 foot and four foot play area. Life guards are also excellent. I took a star away for value. We stayed at a the club level..it was great, snacks, beer, softdrinks desserts and a papmered feeling but not worth the extra $150 a night. Our rate was about $550 per night....hard to say if it was worth it...but as they say if you have to ask... Tips - Pool is open at 10:00am so get there early and get a good spot in shade! They have laundry on site so you can get a couple of wash loads in to help reduce packing. Overall - If you have the $$$ use the club. You cant beat the location. Raglan Road in DT is awesome...Cirque show is great..California Grill is a great date location..The on site Daycare is great....our 6 year old loved it. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nicandalli
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. It is right on the lake at Disney's boardwalk, which makes a very attractive setting. Its also only 5 mins walk to the world showcase at Epcot which is really convenient and makes a change from needing to use the Disney buses. The hotel is immaculate as you'd expect for Disney. Ask for a pool / lake view. The pool area with beach / lazy river is lovely for the kids - very warm and safe. We stayed here after a week at the Animal Kingdom Lodge and I was surprised that this was so good (probably a bit better than the AKL). Only tiny gripe is that the drinks and meals were a bit expensive but we knew that before we went. Make sure you book the Character Breakfast at the Cape May Cafe (at the Beach Club Resort) - its great fun and the food is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: IraBfromCSG
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, the service was great. The hotel staffs extra people in the lobby to answer questions, check people in on remote devices, etc. Disney never fails to provide the best customer service. Rooms are sufficient with great maid service (lots of towels, tissues refilled, plenty of shampoo and soap, etc.). The Hotel has Cape May Restaurant - Great character breakfast with Minnie and Goofy available for pictures. The hotel is within walking distance of Epcot (even closer than taking the boat), MGM by boat, and the Boardwalk restaurants and shopping. Very fun beach fire smores event nightly. Busses run frequently to all of the parks. Food prices are a bit expensive, but that's standard Disney expectation.

Reviews.Title: “Construction Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: lifeisaj0urney
Reviews.Content: We wanted a "deluxe" hotel, we paid for a "deluxe" hotel, instead it was a nightmare! Active construction outside our room, actually sanding the balcony, we requested another room and were told no they were sold out, yet other people by the pool said they had no previous reservations and checked right in last minute. We offered to pay for a room upgrade, and were told they were sold out again. Bad service, bad policy, we would have stayed on another property. BTW, the workers started yelling outside our window at 0730hrs, awful experience. INQUIRE ABOUT this before you book.

Reviews.Title: “Not very impressed!”
Reviews.Author: Bridget522
Reviews.Content: Let me start by first saying I seriously LOVE disney and visit at least twice a year. This was our first visit to the beach club and although nothing bad happened, I just wasnt that impressed. I got a good rate for our garden view room, but I would never pay $350-$400 a night here. Yes the location is great, but you can stay at the swan & dolphin for cheaper in the same location. Some might think my complaints are petty, but again at a resort charging high prices I expect these things. Room: Housekeeping was not good........2nd day had to call and request more shampoo (that should have been replenished) 3rd night needed to call for more towels, 4th day our room was never made up mainly b/c housekeeping never came before 1:00 and we decided to take a 2 hour nap. Also, they were doing renovations right outside our room during the day which would have been a problem if I had a baby trying to nap. The one day I had ponchos out on the balcony to dry and returned home to sand dust ALL over them. It would have been nice if they told us they would be sanding and not to put things out on the balcony. Pool: It was cool, the kids loved the sand at the bottom & the waterslide was great. However, the area is so big that to get from one area of the pool to the other you almost have to get out and walk over bridges, etc. Also, the walk from the pool to the waterslide is far enough to where I would have never let my 4 & 6 year old go by themselves. Just not convenient for those with small kids. The lazy river was 7-8ft deep basically forcing you into renting a tube. Overall up keep: At Hurricane Hanna's there really needs to be a worker cleaning and wiping off tables. The benches near the buses had dead little bugs on them, again things you shouldnt see at a $350-$400 a night resort. Marketplace: Food was fine however, there was no place to sit down and eat it. The only place was outside and in the middle of August most people don't want to sit outside.

Reviews.Title: “The Usual Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Intrepid1
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have stayed at the Yacht/Beach more times than at any other on-property hotel at Disney. We have become used to excellent customer service and our recent five-night stay was no exception. We were in a standard double room on the 3rd floor (garden view). Housekeeping continues to be good although the carpet was not vacuumed every day but the sheets were changed. Plenty of towels, etc., but that coffee in those packs in the room tastes TERRIBLE IMO..don't bother. Overall, building maintenance remains good (they were painting the exterior while we were there). The pool is, I think, the very BEST pool at ANY Disney property, bar none. Lots of pool activities every day for the kids such as bingo, hula hoop contests, make your own ice cream, etc. The Hurricane Hannah grill gets VERY busy around lunchtime and I thought the service was a little slower than usual...probably because they could have used a couple more staff members. We dined throughout the park in various venues (we did not use the dining plan) and overall were pleased with food quality especially in the sit-down restaurants such as the Cape May Cafe (the buffet nighttime meal); the California Grill at the Contemporary (try the flatbread appetizers..great) and, of course, there is no place better than Beaches and Cream at the Beach Club for ice cream. My only suggestion is to make dinner reservations well in advance if you can because this time around a lot of the places were filled way ahead of time (Canadian steakhouse at EPCOT we are STILL trying to get into!). Overall a good stay. It is what it is. If you don;t like kids running around then avoid the place at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite what was expected from Disney”
Reviews.Author: ajps1020
Reviews.Content: Pros - Nice size room for a family of four...considering how little time was spent in the room. TIP to Disney: Hang a curtain in front of the sink area to offer a little privacy for guests to change. Stormalong Beach pool was very large and offered different types of activities without interfering with each other. Received immediate servicef from Maintenance in regards to a roller being broken on the patio door and from Housekeeping in regards to a less-than-spotless bathtub upon arrival. Dining plan is a great value...especially when offered as a promotion. Cons No free wi-fi (for the price we're paying, to charge for it is outrageous). TIP: Walk over to the Boardwalk area - I was able to find free wi-fi for my Touch near the ESPN end of the strip. Resort closed Stormalong twice during the week because of impending storms (one never came). But they not only closed the pool but the entire lounging area as well. So even though it was not raining, and I was comfortable finishing lunch and reading a book, I had to leave. TIP to Disney: We're adults; if a thunderstorm comes, we know to get up and move . On the other hand, the resort did not close down or ask guests at the smaller pool on the Beach Club side to leave (are those people less valuable???) Reported a running toilet issue that was never repaired. Walkway from resort to smaller pool is a smoking area, so you have to pass through this to get to the pool. And the area, for the Disney brand, was not spotless. Overall, a decent stay but not quite up to the standards I expected from Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: KR0703
Reviews.Content: We are regular visitors to Disney in Orlando, but this was our first time at the Beach Club resort. It is one of the Deluxe Disney properties, and can be a little pricey. We always stay at a Disney hotel, but the Moderate properties (Carribean Beach, French Quarter, Riverside) are a usually a better fit. This was the first time in a few years that we were going for something longer than a quick weekend, so we tried the Beach Club. We were able to get some Florida resident pricing, which made it more affordable. It was great! The location is wonderful because of the proximity to EPCOT and the Boardwalk area. The property is great, (clean, interesting, convenient), and the service was outstanding. The pool area is unique and layed out in a way that didn't seem crowded or hectic. I would definitely recommend the Beach Club, if you can get a deal that makes the high price more affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: dexter9999
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Beach Club before on business trips, but this was the first time with my family. Before we got there I kept telling them how great the resort would be. A list of small issues involving different people caused us to regret staying there. Each issue by itself would not have been a big deal, but it was the cumulative effect that caused the disappointment with our stay. 1. Even though all luggage has unique numbers on it, the bellman brought us someone else's luggage with the same last name when we checked it. 2. The standard room with pool/water view and balcony we reserved had a balcony the size of a pizza box. The water view (of the lake) is mostly blocked by tree's. This was room 4667. 3. After requesting a new room, a very helpful front desk gentleman arranged for us to move to a new room the next day. We were told that we could pack our bags in the morning, leave them in the room, notify the bellman to pickup the bags and store them and when we returned from the park we would then check-in to our new room. When I asked the bellman to pickup the bags, they politely said I would need to go wait in the room. A manager overrode this and we left for the park. When we returned at 4:00, and if it wasn't for this event, I would not be writing this review, I went to the front desk to pickup our new room keys. I informed the person at the front desk that I was supposed to have a room change and need to pickup my new keys. His first question was "did you speak to anyone about this?", as if I was doing this on m own. I told him that I had and that it was supposed to be all arranged. After about 5 minutes on the phone with someone, he pulls out a map of the resort and starts to tell me that the room is fine and has a water view. I reminded him that there was no need to discuss this and that all of my bags had already been packed up to prepare for the move to the new room. More time goes by and I asked him what the issue was. All I got was a dirty look. He then started giving me an attitude and finally created the new room keys and just handed them to me. No mention of where the room was. When we got to the room, the cleaning staff was in it. 4. On the way to the new room, a very nice bellman got our bags out of storage and we were telling him we had spent too much time at the front desk and were running late for a 5:30 dinner at Cinderella's Castle. He said they could arrange for a car service for us instead of the buses that we were using to get to the parks. I thought this was great as I didn't want my daughters to miss their dinner. What he didn't tell me or maybe know, was that cabs drop you off pretty far away from the entrance to the Magic Kingdom. So far in fact, that you have to take a monorail from that point to get to the park. The buses would have easily been faster and at no cost. 5. After the room change, my wife realized she left a purse in the room and asked if it had been turned in to Lost and Found. She was told no purse was turned in. I met someone at the room and looked for the purse and could not find it. My wife had given a detailed description of the purse she was looking for. A few hours later we received a message stating they would look for the purse, but need a description of it. The next day we received the purse back. It had been in the Lost and Found the whole time. First we were told they looked in the wrong room for the purse, which was not true since I was there with them looking for it, and then they said it had been in the lost and found the whole time. The Beach Club is a nice resort and as I've stated I've stayed there before, but this trip didn't show what they are capable of. For nearly $500/night I expect a little more. The attitude of the man at the front desk was the thing that really disappointed me with this stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: aster143
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Disney World and our first stay at a deluxe resort (thanks to a special offer!) We chose the Beach Club for its proximity to Epcot and great pool. We had a wonderful stay! Arrival: We arrived by Magical Express to a busy lobby. We had done the online check-in, and the line moved quickly. Our room wasn't ready yet (11:00 am), so we went to check out the pool. They check for room keys at every entrance to the pool. The cast member at the pool entrance was very helpful and told us where we could change. We swam and had lunch before finding out at 2 that our room was ready. The Pool: Yes, it's as great as everyone says. We like water parks and have been to many hotel pools. But the atmosphere at this one was wonderful. There were lots of people, but we never felt crowded; parents were with their kids and everyone was there to relax. The pool area is a bit like a maze, with lots of pathways and bridges. At first I thought that this was a downside, as there was no one place where I could sit and watch the 2 boys in the different pool areas. But this turned out to be a plus--why would I want to sit down anyway, when I could be swimming in the pool? The sandy bottom is amazing and felt wonderful after long walks in the parks. With so many different areas and passages, everyone could spread out. We bought 2 noodles for $4 on our first day and used them throughout the week, then passed them on to another family when we left. My younger son (6) appreciated the free lifejacket that we borrowed all week. The room There were 5 of us in the room (my mom stayed with us). The room was quite large and worked out fine. My older son pronounced the daybed very comfortable, and we always had plenty of towels and bath supplies. I was disappointed at first to have only the Juliet balcony, but it was so hot our week that I don't know how much sitting on a balcony I would have done. There were 4 large drawers and 4 smaller ones, a good-sized closet, and a space to store a suitcase. The double vanity was big and had room underneath to store items. Someone could change in the vanity area without being in view of the rest of the room, another plus. Housekeeping was fine. Our non-preferred room had a courtyard view and was just three doors down from the elevator, which helped to minimize our walking. And the elevators were fast and easy. The public parts of the hotel Wow, wow, wow! On our last stay at Caribbean Beach I felt a little--lost, because our room was so far from anything. We were far from lost here. The lobby was always busy, and yet there were always places to sit. I had worried that it would feel fussy, but everyone was relaxed. I will say that the Marketplace is on the small side, in keeping with the rest of the reviews. And the ice machine for the free mug refills was having a rough week. (Like I said, it was hot!) But the staff there were always nice and explained the dining plan details. Even though it was crowded, there were never lines. The beach area is lovely. We went out to watch a movie there one night. At first it seemed silly, to go and watch a movie at Disney World...but our youngest son was so keyed up after fun in the parks that the movie was a nice way for him to wind down. Again, it was relaxed and friendly, with staff playing tag with kids further down the beach. We realized the true value of the Beach Club on a rainy night. All of the lifeguards and activities staff came indoors, and several set up shop in the Solarium. They had board games, coloring pages, and showed a movie indoors. It would have been a miserable evening to spend in a hotel room...the fun staff really brightened it up. There were many thunderstorms during our stay, and the pool closed, but the staff was prompt with reopening as soon as possible. Location This was the reason why we went with the Beach Club. We could walk to Epcot. We could have walked to Hollywood Studios, but no one else wanted to try it, so we took the boat instead. Boat transportation stopped at other resorts but was fairly even and dependable. Buses to Magic Kingdom and Animal Kingdom arrived quickly at our resort--we never waited very long. The ride back from AK was a little crowded, as that bus served all of the Epcot area resorts, but we managed. At least the air conditioning was cold. To sum up, the Beach Club was the perfect spot for our family. It was a magical home for our week at Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing short of Perfect”
Reviews.Author: wkrupa7586
Reviews.Content: This was a family vacation that turned out to be eight perfect days touring Disney while staying at the Beach Club. The hotel was great, the buffet there was worth visiting more than once. The room cleaning was less than what I normally expect as we had to call more than once to have them clean something they missed, but other than that little issue, it was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “We had lots of fun nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: hooponu
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August we had a great time. It was hotttttttt but we went to the parks in the morning and then went swimming in the afternoon and at supper and headed off to a park again for fireworks or parades ect. Good thing about staying is you are a couple of hundred yards from Epcot and the nightly fireworks. It is a must see you can walk there with no problem at all. The pool was packed but the kids had fun they have a long waterslide and a little one for the young ones. The bid slide is not built for a grown man as you will see if you use it you will feel every seam on the way down. The kids loved it. We used the boat taxi almost everyday to go to Hollywood Studios if you want to do the Toy Story ride you need to get there early we did four three days and had a half hour wait. I would get and in line and the wife got a fast pass while I waited and then we went the first time and would come back in an hour or so after we got done and go again. It was our favorite ride. The food plan is confusing til you catch on to what you get. Get as much as you can for Breakfast and what drinks you don't use you can take to park and or put in the fridge in your room. ie the kids breakfast you can get frosted flakes milk and a drink we would get a water or oj and take with us. Not all places to use your meal plan have the plan identified on their menu so ask. That is what we did do not assume you can't eat there we found most of the places we could eat there. We flew in at night I would not recommend this as the kids were wiped for two days after. We got to our room about 1 am. We got in earlier but were about the last drop off from the people on the bus. It you don't get the food plan lunchs dinners and ect will run 50- 80 bucks. We did the morning breakfast with the Characters in the motel the kids loved it . However it cost like 150.00 bucks for a family of five seperate from the food plan. Must sees I would say are the parades, fireworks, Toy Story, The Loin King was a great show we sat in the front row and it was awesome the kids got taken out and were involved in the show. All in all had a great time on the way it took us an hour to get security at the Orlando airport. Disney got us there like 2 hours before now I know why. One more thing check out the soda shop it is pretty neat and the ice cream is great. Can use as a snack on the food plan.

Reviews.Title: “What's Not to Love?”
Reviews.Author: Summerluv0417
Reviews.Content: This trip included my husband and myself, my 16 year old son and his friend. I had used online check-in with the request for a garden room. When we got there about 10 a.m., the room was not ready, which was okay. However 1:00 came around and the room still wasn't ready. It just happened that one of the guest services managers was roaming the lobby talking with guests and took things in hand. Bottom line is that we were upgraded to a Club level room. While I don't think dollar for dollar the extra amenities were worth it, it was lovely having breakfast, as well as snacks and drinks, throughout the day and I would recommend the club level if you can afford it. The room was large, but not exceptional and everything from the wallpaper to the prints on the walls to the carpeting in the hallways is nautically themed. If you don't appreciate nautical, don't stay there. The lobby and exterior grounds are both beautiful! The staff, from housekeeping to concierge, was wonderful and as accommodating as possible. I had a few issues with my internet connection, so they credited that money back to us. Hubbie complained about the lack of FOX News on the TV. Apparently they hear that a lot. The pool area is great and so pretty. The kids enjoyed it a lot, as well as the arcade. There's also a quiet pool if you want to just swim laps. The location is excellent, especially if you don't expect to spend most of your time at the Magic Kingdom park. Epcot is an easy walk. Hollywood Studios takes a good 20 minutes to walk, but the boats are available. There are all sorts of shops and eateries along the boardwalk, as well as in the Yacht Club, Boardwalk and Swan and Dolphin hotels to explore. All in all it's a beautiful place with a wonderful staff. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Mickeys and Magic, Too"”
Reviews.Author: fairville
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Beach Club Resort. The experience was delightful from beginning to end. Like all Disney resorts, this one has a theme -- a turn of the century beach resort. The decor was lovely, and didn't seem overdone. Taking a boat to either Epcot or Hollywood studios was a real plus. The walk to Epcot was also short and pleasant. For families, the pool is a huge positive factor. It offers many areas, including a sandy bottom one with a real sandpile in the center and a great water slide. The staff was gracious and accomodating. Kudos to the rec staff, who helped make rainy evenings fun for families. The lifeguards actually came in and colored with little ones. Family members will enjoy finding the hidden mickeys in paintings, rugs, and wallpaper as they move throughout the spacious, warm and inviting public areas. I would go back every year if I could!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: maggieb12123
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel quite a few times, and we love it! The sand bottom pool is terrific, and we loved that there was just about a ten minute walk to Epcot. It was great having a few restaurants in the hotel, although we hardly ever ate there. This is a great hotel, and I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “The Beach Club Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: tink1229
Reviews.Content: Disney's Beach Club Resort is a hidden gem in Walt Disney World! I must say, when I booked this resort for our family of five for a week, I was not sure if I was going to like it. I live in the northeast, so staying at a beach club resembling Cape May or Martha's Vineyard was a vacation spot my family would enjoy on weekends, not something I would pay $$$$ and drive 18 hours to reach! I wondered how this resort would compare with the magic disney offers at their other resorts. Well... It was not love at first sight but a very subtle to an exploding, wishes fireworks, kind of love... When we arrived the gateman asked our name and was very kind when he said welcome home:) When we pulled in front to unload our luggage and check in, Samantha greeted us by using our family name and walked me inside to the front desk, I held back tears, (This trip we had a garden view room however I have stayed concierge level at other WDW resorts and we were never greeted like this.) It went down hill from there yet I can not blame the cast members at the BC but the misinformation I was given from the call center when the reservation was made. To make a long story short, we added a day to the beginning of our trip, so this gave us two separate reservations which in turn we had to switch rooms on our second day. Forgive me, but I can not remember her name but she works at the front desk and has dark skin with dark medium length hair and she was AWESOME!!!!!!! She searched and searched the rooms at BC, made calls but the resort was at full capacity and could not get us into a room we didn't have to move. She said to see her in the morning, she arrives at 8:00a.m. and I will not be disappointed. That night I called over to the Polynesian to check availability and was all set to leave BC for the remainder of our trip in the morning. We couldn't unpack anyway and I was reluctant about this resort from the beginning. Morning came and I said, lets give BC one more try today... it was the best decision I made all trip. Dark haired girl gave us the most fabulous room, ground level just a few steps away from Epcot AND it was ready by noon! Thank you, thank you, thank you dark haired girl! Our room was fabulous, spotless and whatever we requested from housekeeping we were given. Throughout our stay our teenage boys enjoyed the fitness club and the pool area and Cape May Cafe (best mac and cheese in the world) for dinner, beaches and cream for milkshakes and sundays and the pool area restaurant for burgers and hotdogs. Everything from food quality to service was exceptional! The restrooms by the pool area are spotless and the waitstaff is great when you don't want to get up from your lounge chair. Everyday we had a different question for concierge and everyday we had someone different who answered our questions so pleasantly without making us feel we were a bother... (you know the song, "Be Our Guest" ?? this must be their motto/philosophy.) I can not put into words how grateful I am for the service we received when we stayed at the Beach Club. From the cast members to the spotless rooms to the most amazing pool day at a resort I ever had in WDW Thank You! Me and my husband are the average american family who both work two jobs to be able to afford a vacation and now they have spoiled us so much I don't think I can ever stay anywhere else. This resort is amazing! I was so wrong in thinking this resort could not offer the magic compared to other WDW resorts. Its not a WOW in your face kind of magic but its found in the cast members, the smell in the lobby and the character of this resort whom I think actually has a soul!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my trip”
Reviews.Author: jamton34
Reviews.Content: My wife and I won a company incentive trip to Disney for 3 days and 4 nights. Being young and without kids this was not my cup of tea but the wife was happy, happy wife equals happy wife!!! We flew in late Thursday night and rented a car instead of taking the Magical Express. After a 20 minute drive to our hotel we quickly checked in and inquired about food since it was 10:30 at night and we still had not eaten dinner. Room service was open but all of other options closed at 11pm and we did not want to be rushed. Since this place is very big, expect to have a nice walk to your room. The room was 2 queen beds with a sofa and 2 sinks. The rooms itself was very nice and had all of the items we wanted in a room. I have 2 complaints, they did not have plastic cups in the room and the balcony was very dirty with debris. Plastic cups came in handy while walking the resort later at night with a beverage in hand.... Another issue, although it did not effect us, was that housekeeping started promptly around 8am every morning. We were up and about to leave each day but I am sure some people do not want to be bothered that early. Now back to room service. The price was that of any room service, outrageuous, but also took about 45 minutes to get to our room. I wonder why it took so long at 11pm at night. The hotel has a nice market with all of the items you may need on your trip, food, coffee, clothing, eye solution, you name it, they had it. I would also reccomend the $15 plastic mug. While on property you can fill it up with soft drinks or coffee whenever you choose. We went to 4 parks but i will not bore you with those details, All in all, this was a very nice resort and I would reccomend it to family, singles, etc. We would stay here again the next time we visit Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded to Club Level.....WOW!!”
Reviews.Author: Lori S
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a couple of time before, in addition to many other Disney Resort hotels, but I have never been upgraded to Club Level. I learned this upon check-in, and was taken to this floor for my check-in. The check-in process was very slow, and the staff did not seem to be very experienced, but that was my only fault in this experience. You might expect this area to employ the most talented team of professionals, and I did not find this to be the case. They were friendly, however, and that's always a good thing. The food was substantial enough for you not to have to buy your meals on property or in the park. Food and beverages were being served most of the time throughout the day, and that was a welcome surprise. The room was lovely, with all the usual amenities, and I even had a small balcony overlooking the pool. I was only there for two nights during the EPCOT Flower and Garden festival, mainly to see the presentation of one of the HGTV design professionals, and this was an amazing event! I am hoping that HGTV and WDW continue this relationship for many years to come. I will definitely book this Club Level type room when I come to visit again, and it truly made these two nights something extra special. I will also plan on staying a few extra nights next time as well!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!! Always made us feel like we were at home!!!”
Reviews.Author: karina_dlg
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. We had stayed at the Grand Floridian Hotel before. I thought that there was not another hotel that could top the Grand Floridian, but I was wrong!! From the moment we arrived we were treated with friendly faces. It was wonderful to always run into anyone (cast member or guest) and to have them greet you with a "good morning", afternoon or evening! We enjoyed buying our meals at the Market Place and taking them to our rooms where we would dine outside on the balcony which had a beautiful view of the Swan and Dolphin hotel!! We had a mini refrigerator with special drawers to put food in them too. We would stock up on some snacks to have in the room especially late at night when the Market Place closed. The rooms were nice and clean and very spacious! The pool is wonderful! We had a great time swimming! We felt safe with all the life guards around us. The breakfast with the characters were a definite high light. Our boys loved having that one-to-one time with Goofy, Minnie and Donald!! What I especially enjoyed was that every time we stepped into the lobby after coming back from a park or somewhere else, we were always welcomed with a 'WELCOME HOME"!! It truly was like coming home!! Best part is that we would walk to EPCOT and ride the boat to Hollywood Studios!! Bottom line: I LOVE THIS HOTEL!! I DIDN'T WANT TO LEAVE IT!!! I will definitely book my other Disney vacation at The Beach Club!!

Reviews.Title: “High quality hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: ThePenzers
Reviews.Content: After reading what seemed like a million Trip Advisor reviews before booking our family holiday to Disney we finally decided on Disneys Beach Club - we were not dissapointed! The Beach Club is perfect for those who wants to stop with the Disney Area. Highlights for me : Very clean rooms Tremendous Pool area Beautiful Location Walking distance to Epcot Would I go back there? Absolutley!!

Reviews.Title: “Close in and improving”
Reviews.Author: DHK44
Reviews.Content: The Beach Club (and the Beach Club Villas) have the advantage of adjoining EPCOT, and are only a boat ride away from Hollywood Studios, and a bus ride away from everything else. The Villas have better in-room eating facilities, with a microwave, sink and refrigerator. WDW has added a mini food emporium to the Beach Club area, with enough provisions to provide for all meals if one wants to avoid the WDW restaurants. The rooms are reasonably-sized but the major advantage is the closeness to major WDW attractions. There is also a large on-site swimming area. While hotels farther afield may have some advantages, if your goal is WDW and not staying at an upscale (or downscale) hotel, this is the place. A hint: if you do intend to eat at any of the EPCOT restaurants, make reservations EARLY (via the internet).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Disney Deluxe Resort, but not my favourite”
Reviews.Author: 2Euro-Travellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in March 2011 and liked it, but I do not think that we will choose the Beach Club for one of our next trips to Walt Disney World. The rooms are very large and sleep up to 5 people. What I liked most was the location as the hotel is situated between Epcot and Disney's Hollywood Studios, which means that you can easily enjoy the huge sand bottom pool in the afternoon and hop back to the parks afterwards (I always bothers me at Walt Disney World, that you cannot walk from your hotel to the parks). It takes 5 minutes to walk to Epcot and 15 to Disney's Hollywood Studios. The Beach Club and the Yacht Club share the same pool area but have two different lobbies. As you also got a convention centre, a Disney Vacation Club area, I found this hotel complex too big and too crowded for a Delux Resort and prefer the Boardwalk. + beautiful rooms with iPhone charger, in walking distance to Epcot and Disney's Hollywood Studios, a great und huge sand bottom pool, great restaurant - no free wireless internet access (10,-$ for wired 24 hours access), views from Standard rooms are not stunning, small lobby and this hotel seems to be crowded all the time

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsLB
Reviews.Content: We loved the Beach club, perhaps not as much as Yacht club but still a great hotel. We booked a standard view and was very lucky to get an upgrade to water view. The theming of the hotel is of course Beach and the room decor reflects this. Beds were super comfortable. The pool is perhaps the best Disney pool, lifeguards are situated all around and keep an eye on things. Water is warm and there is a sand bottom. Staff all are great especially Tina who welcomes you back home!

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: FloridaFreak17
Reviews.Content: My family is made up of a bunch of Disney freaks! We found that we were never able to make the best of our experience until we began staying at the Beach Club. Not only is the hotel lobby beautiful, but when you walk out to the back, you see the entire Boardwalk, the best pool in all of Disney World, and maybe even the Epcot Globe. The Beach Club offers an amazing Character breakfast with Mickey, Minnie, Goofy, and Donald all dressed in their beach gear. The pool which is shared with the Yacht Club is also amazing with Sand Bottoms, a pirate ship themed water slide, and my personal favorite part, the Whirl Pool. Although you need to take a bus to the Magic Kingdom or Animal Kingdom, Epcot is in walking distance and Hollywood Studios is a short boat ride away. A boat can also take you to Epcot. With great food, location, and transportation, whenever we go to Disney World we will always stay at the Beach Club!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Beach Club!!”
Reviews.Author: scarlett81
Reviews.Content: We came here with our 3 yr old daughter. We booked a standard club level room. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a junior suite at no cost! We love how each room has a wonderful outdoor area-in our case it was a small patio as we were ground floor. It is very worth going club level. Some debate this but we love it. When we go to Disney we're not looking to be at the parks from 8 am till 11 pm each night. We want some downtime too. Taking some quiet time in the lounge with the added amenities is worth it. The late night dessert is the BEST part!! The staff is wonderful. I had a small issue with housekeeping, as turn down service/twice daily housekeeping is included, however they rarely came to our room for the pm service. I assume its bc we would often come back to our room in the late afternoon, but I figured by the 2nd or 3rd day they'd get a handle on this and just come back after we'd left. That was annoying, but if thats the only flaw I can find its fine. I would pay extra for a lagoon view room here. We loved sitting outside on our porch while our daughter slept. We had a pool/garden view which was fine. However, I'd pay the bit extra for a water view. The restaurants here are great too. We still dream about Beaches and Cream, the 50s style soda shoppe restaurant at the Yacht Club next door. And the Cape May cafe's character breakfast was great too. Very fresh, and much less crowded than the big hotel character breakfasts. The greatest thing about this hotel has got to be the location though. We could hear Illuminations, Epcots fireworks show each night from our patio. If we walked over to the Boardwalk side of the lagoon, we could see it. That was such a cool feature of that area. We loved going to the pool during the day here, and walking into the back of Epcots world showcase from our hotel! The pool at this hotel is phenomenal. You have a huge sandbottom area, and a regular pool too with tons of water slides. There are just too many amenities of the hotel to list them all. Basically its down to location. If you want that true Disney feel, but don't want to be in the busy hustle and bustle of a monorail hotel-you can't beat the Beach Club.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, LOCATION!!!”
Reviews.Author: MarltonMom
Reviews.Content: Our 3 person family stayed here for 10 days in June. Our room was large and clean with a full balcony. Disney has recently reclassified the room rates by view. We had paid 9 dollars per day extra for a garden view but it was not worth it as this view consisted of scraggly tree tops 5 feet from the balcony that obscured all views. It was really unfortunate that Disney charged extra for this ugly "view". Many of the trees around the property in the front and sides of the hotel could have used some major sprucing up as they were long past their prime and detracted from the beauty and enjoyment of the property. Housekeeping was excellent! We had many requests which were honored promptly and completely. A good tip is to call housekeeping and let them know when you will be out of the room and request that it be made up during your absence. The hotel restaurant staff was helpful and they often went above and beyond their duty to assist you. The life guards at the pool were especially attentive and the recreation staff did a great job with the games at the pool. Basically with the exception of the front desk staff and Bell services, every staff member here was professional and went all out to assist you. We had trouble with the front desk staff when the staff member processing our check in was reluctant to assist us in the way that we needed. All he really needed to do was locate some packages that had been delivered for us and he basically blew us off with out offering to find some one who could assist us. Bell Services was an absolute mess coordinating deliveries that needed to be gathered and sent to our room. We had to explain over and over again what needed to be done as an employee would show up with only 1 package at a time. After promising to return with the rest of the items, a new staff member would appear with 1 thing and we would have to explain all over again. This was very chaotic and contributed greatly to our check in stress. The Hotel facilities were well maintained and transportation was prompt. We never experienced overcrowding on the buses. The down side to transportation at this hotel was the Friendship boats that transport guests to Hollywood Studios. They were unbearably hot and were in need of much better ventilation.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location and pool!”
Reviews.Author: Nclark75
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice and wouldn't want to stay anywhere else! The staff is super friendly and accommodating, rooms are clean and well appointed, and the pool is the best on the property. You can take a walk to Epcot and Hollywood Studios or take a water taxi. The marketplace has quick meal items, and souvenirs also. Also, the Boardwalk entertainment district is right across the water! At night they play Disney movies on a giant screen outside the resort on the beach which is a great entertainment option if you get tired of the parks. Can't say enough good things about the Beach Club resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great for adults and kids!”
Reviews.Author: DKlammer
Reviews.Content: The pool and waterslide were awesome! The location was great - only a 3 minute walk to Epcot! Rooms were nice and spacious - the daybed was an added convenience with 2 kids. The only shortcoming was the limited laundry facilities, everything else was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort - pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: JTMAtlanta
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at a Disney resort and it was a nice experience. The nice thing about staying at a Disney property is there is enough to do there so you don't have to go to the parks..just depends on what you prefer and how much you want to spend. The customer service at the resort from our arrival was outstanding. When you walk in, you are hit with a very nice fragrance. The captain greets you everyday and is a nice, funny man. The sister property is the Yacht club but the Beach resort is much better, in my opinion. The yacht club was dark and uninviting. This location is great for kids (we did not have any with us) but it was fun to watch them running around. PROS Staff is pleasant and helpful. The grounds were impeccable. Rooms are a nice size, good pools, private beach area, onsite dining (expensive - but that's Disney), LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION - close to Downtown Disney and connected to Disney Boardwalk. We could see the fireworks every night! No mosquito bites! CONS The resort could use an upgrade of the furniture in several areas. We noticed stains in the lobby, common areas, and the sofa in our room. We also had hair on our blanket upon arrival. I am VERY particular about cleanliness when I travel so it might not be an issue for some...... The dining area in the gift shop smelled like something was burning every day... not very appetizing. There was outside construction near our room, so that was a bit annoying..but obviously unavoidable and necessary. The other room someone in our group had was suppose to be a garden view but it was woods.. LOL - We have a lovely view of the pool . We came with a group so we did not pay full price. I personally would not pay full price but would return if it was a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay at DisneyWorld”
Reviews.Author: PEMPAM18
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel with a staff that is very friendly and welcoming. You are greeted each time you enter, someone is always available to answer questions, and they will help you with anything you need. The rooms are good size and comfortable. Large flat screen TV, only negative would be limited channels. Pool is huge with a lazy river, slide, and the beach. They do games and activities to keep the kids entertained. So close to EPCOT, short walk...go early, come back for a swim, and heard back for the evening. Close to Boardwalk and lots of restaurants. Fun place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “you'll have a ball at the beach club”
Reviews.Author: Grangers
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 2 weeks at the Beach Club, a standard room with a full balcony.It's a beautiful resort with a marvellous smell at the entrance..The staff at the front desk are helpful and friendly and Mousekeeping stafff are also accommodating and very pleasant. The rooms are comfortable as are the beds. Don't worry about the daybeds - they are long enough for an adult and very comfortable.There is a very relaxed atmosphere about the resort. The pools are great - it took me a couple of days to get used to the sand bottom. Pool staff are very nice and helpful when giving out wristbands and towels and always ask about your day. Hurricane Hannas burgers are lovely, as is the icecream in Beaches and Cream - we did go for the kitchen sink which is nice but messy. The refillable mugs are a must -so handy The Marketplace is handy for breakfast or lunch items.Sometimes Mousekeeping could have given the bathroom a better wash or the floor a bit of a hoover but they were reliable with towels, changing beds and supplies Great location - boats and buses very regular and Epcot a few minutes walk away. Would love to stay again so that is my greatest compliment..If you are going soon, Don't worry about a thing - you will have a wonderful time..

Reviews.Title: “Disney is the undisputed Champion of the World”
Reviews.Author: umassjsp
Reviews.Content: We just did 4 nights at Beach Club Villas coming down from Massachusetts. Everything from the pool, transportation, bell services, staff and atmosphere was perfect. I like sitting in the Breezeway room and my kids loved pool slide. Easy access to ESPN Zone and Epcot. I am glad there is no WiFi....don't have time to use it anyways and it is more relaxing to be off the grid!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Disney Resort”
Reviews.Author: Jilianld
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my family to Disney's Beach Club Resort from July 11th to the 16th. We are an adult family (I am 29 and my brother is 24) who still love going to Disney. We arrived at the hotel around noon and were checked right in to our room. We had requested one of the Villas because we had stayed at Saratoga Springs Villas on our last trip. The hotel is doing some painting and power washing of the exterior so they had some walkways blocked off. We had a tough time navigating through the closures to get to our room. Once we got there we were disappointed with the room itself. It did not live up to the standard that we expected from a Villa property. After going to Epcot for the day; which is only a 5 minute walk from the hotel, we went to the front desk to see if we could switch rooms. Without hesitation, they changed our room to one in the main building right off of the lobby. The front desk was extremely pleasant and helpful with this situation. The room they gave us was fantastic; 2 queen beds, a day bed, vanity with counter space, big closet, patio with a garden view (water view if you looked to the right). We were very pleased with the level of service in this matter and with the rest of the staff in general. Everyone you encounter is friendly; from the housekeepers to the captain greeting you at the door. This resort is beautiful and we can't wait to go back again. The pool area is huge and the sand bottom pool is definitely a must see. The walk to Epcot and the Boardwalk Resort is very easy and convenient. After staying at Saratoga and most recently the Polynesian, the Beach Club ranks right up there with them.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: sbhil
Reviews.Content: My family and I just spent a week at the Beach Club ( July 6 - 13 ) and had an amazing time. If you love Epcot like we do, you can't beat this resort's location. It's about a 5 minute walk into the back entrance which is the world showcase. We had a standard garden room ( no view to talk about ) which was very clean and comfortable. This resort by far has the best pool in Disney. It is broken up into tiny lagoons, a lazy river, and a beach area with sand for the kids to play. There is also a great slide which my son loved as did most of the kids. The staff was very friendly and helpful. This was our 4th trip to Disney and I would definitely stay at the Beach Club again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but there were some "unmagical" moments!”
Reviews.Author: bybybelly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Disney Beach Club resort for 4 nights, July 3-July 7, 2011. The lobby of the hotel was grand and met every expectation I had. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. But we did have to change rooms because our original room had an undeniable mold/mildew smell. It took your breath away! At first I thought it would go away but it got worse. Plus, the bathtub was clogged so when we took a shower, standing water quickly rose to our calves! Also, they were painting the exterior of the building so our balcony was covered in paint chips and basically un-usable. We have small children and I did not want them to accidently eat paint chips!!! Overall, it was an OK place to stay. The kids loved pool. We did have a delicious breakfast and dinner at the Cape May restaurant inside the hotel but it was not cheap, over $100 for a breakfast for 4 and over $200 for a dinner for 5! We might stay again but will consider other options first!

Reviews.Title: “Not the magical experience that we hoped for”
Reviews.Author: katiedid123
Reviews.Content: We were so excited to take our children to Disney for the first time. We spent five nights at their Beach Club resort and were very disappointed. First, the bathroom had peeling paint and mold stains along the grout. The hotel was doing some exterior renovation work right outside our balcony. There was no indication that renovation work was being done before we went on our trip. We would have chosen another resort ha we known about this. It was loud outside our window which meant we kept the balcony door closed. Instead of looking outside at the garden an lake, we saw construction equipment and heavy machinery. One afternoon we returned to our room to find a worker on our balcony painting. Nobody asked I'd it wa on for him to he there nor dis we have any warning that he was there. No "wet paint" sign was left on the balcony and we were forced to close our curtains while in our room because he was there. When we called the manager to tell her about our concerns, we were told that there was nothing they could do about it. The pool area was crowded and dirty. The staff did not pick up towels and garbage from people who had left. It was difficult to even find a beach chair and the staff indicated that they couldn't assist in this regard. Needless to say, this was far from the magical superior Disney service that we were expecting.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely be back. One of Disney's best.”
Reviews.Author: busyUSmom
Reviews.Content: We love staying at the BC resort when we are going to Disney World. As far as deluxe resorts at Disney go I think this one is the best. We stayed concierge level and the staff were super friendly, always greeted us, delivered special treats to our room on two occasions (once chocolate covered strawberries and a chocolate Mickey and on another time balloons). The rooms were very clean and the location can't be beat. I wouldn't consider the rooms 5 star but more like average hotel rooms (Westin, Marriot) with a 5 star lobby, pool, and location. We did not eat here though other than a few snacks from the lounge so I can't comment on the restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: STWGFAMILY6
Reviews.Content: it's was such a wonderful experience . the pool was the best ever. i love being on the back of epcot. would come here everytime. can't wait to come back. beds were awesome. LOVE THIS PLACE. GO TO THE CREWS CUP LOUNGE AT YACHT CLUB NEXT STORE AWESOME SERVICE AND GREAT DRINKS AND FOOD.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced hotel stay; No WIFI included in the room price”
Reviews.Author: S117Eta
Reviews.Content: The workers and room were nice, although some things we found very problematic. The room is a typical hotel sized room (at least where we were). Very cramped for 4 people. Workers were out in the early morning with gas trimmers. Restaurants and store prices were way overpriced, but not shocked by the 2x-3x the normal price. The biggest complaint I have is there were no complimentary WIFI offered. You have to pay extra per day to connect to the internet. Come on Disney, this is 2011. All of us need the internet, and we shouldn't have to pay extra to have that, on top of the high price we pay to stay there. PLEASE PROVIDE FREE WIFI IN ROOMS!!! The pools were nice, and the bus transports to the parks were nice as well. Overall, I won't be back. I'll stay somewhere else and save my money, and where they offer WIFI.

Reviews.Title: “Pefect for our first trip to Disney”
Reviews.Author: chelmichell
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at the Beach Club and I must say I couldn't have chosen a more perfect place for a first time visit for my kids. The hotel is so bright and fresh and cheery. Wonderful fragrance each time you enter the lobby. We did online check in the night before we arrived, and even though we arrived early at 11:00 am, our room was ready and we went right up. We were lucky to get a room on the 4th floor of the main building, so it was a quick elevator ride down to the Marketplace to refill our mugs and get snacks. The room was super clean with a beautiful garden view and balcony. Luggage arrived via Magical Express about an hour and a half after we checked in. Beds were fairly comfortable, but the pillows were just ok, I'd probably bring my own next time.
