The only minor complaint I would have about the room is that the showerhead wasn't that great, but was certainly adequate. The greeters were very friendly and one gentleman even got out the pin trading books from behind the concierge desk to help my son find a specific pin he was looking for to complete his Orange Bird series. The location of the hotel is great. Short walk into Epcot. We ended up spending the most time in Epcot because it was so close and the kids liked it best. Longer walk over to Hollywood Studios, approx 25 minutes with two young kids ages 4 and 7. Only tried that walk the first time we went to Hollywood, the second time we took the boat because the walk was just too long for the kids. Buses to the other parks were pretty good. Most times we were lucky and there was a bus just pulling up as we walked up to the bus stop. Only had a couple of times that we had maybe a 15 minute wait. Never had to wait long at all to get buses back to the hotel from the parks either. We did the character breakfast at Cape May one day. It was probably our least favorite of all the character breakfasts we had over the week (which were 6 in total!). Not bad, food was just average and service was painfully slow. The only times we saw our waitress were when we were first seated and when she brought our check. It took her close to 20 minutes to even come back with our card. We had to flag down another waitress to find out what the deal was. Final verdict, you can see the characters that Cape May offers elsewhere and have better food. Beaches and Cream ice cream was good, only did the counter service window here. Tried to get a table for lunch one day without reservations, and it was at least a 30 minute wait outside in the heat (even though I was sick and close to fainting, the hostess would not allow us to wait inside in the doorway) so we decided to skip it. The Marketplace has some good turkey sandwiches available for a quick bite. Pool area is really cool and was a deciding factor for my kids in choosing this hotel. Sadly, we only had time on one afternoon to actually swim. It was crowded, but there were still plenty of open loungers. They play pool games with the kids for prizes and have silly dances and volleyball. Lots of fun for everyone. We had a great time at the Beach Club and wouldn't hesitate to book it for a return trip!

Reviews.Title: “Love love love the Beach Club”
Reviews.Author: AJR2000
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to the Beach Club and we loved it. The location is fantastic (can walk to EPCOT and Hollywood Studios), and the pool is fabulous (sand bottom!). My only complaint is there aren't many quick service dining options for such a large hotel, and the one quick service option didn't open until 7am. The hotel is well kept up and is very clean. The workout room is also very nice. I would highly recommend a stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: coachpc
Reviews.Content: Beautiful place, but it is just a normal hotel with lots of extras. Rooms were nice, amenities were above normal. My only complaint is that we were stuck with a handicap room and they said nothing else was avaliable. The pool area was awesome and the kids just wanted to stay there instead of go to the parks. It is a very short walk to Epcot and the Boardwalk which was a plus. You can walk to Hollywood Studios but it is not short. The bus service was no problem and worked great. Overall we had a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great location”
Reviews.Author: Jimwill77
Reviews.Content: This was my third trip to the beach club, I have also stayed at DCB and POFC, DCR, and this is by far my favorite due to the staff, pool room size and location. I have read a lot of reviews where people aren't complaining about the lack of counter service and snack options at the hotel... with the location being between Epcot, Hollywood Studios and the Boardwalk, my point is there is a ton of options, I always feel that there is always a lot of options within a 5 minute walk... DBC rooms have ample space and you will feel like you are not right on top of each other, rooms are brightly clolored and themed, mousekeeping is great, and if you need something just ask. The pool is second to none, with a section that has its own current (lazy river style) a large section with a sand bottom and another quiet pool as well... The dining options are great, Cape May Cafe has an excellent character breakfast or a new england clam bake for dinner. Hurricanes serves good burgers and nice cold drinks, Beaches and cream has some long lines if you stop by at noon or after 6pm but the burgers and ice cream will help you forget your wait. A quick walk to the Yacht Club will give you more dining options as well... all above average. On top of all this, its really all about location location location, I have never had to wait more than 10-15 minutes for a bus to DMK or DAK, a quick 5 minute walk to Epcots world showcase from the beach club is about the same walk to the Yacktsman steakhouse... boats for hollywood studios come about every 10-15 minutes if not quicker with a couple quick stops for about a 15 minute trip. The market place is pretty small considering all of the surrounding option you have by staying here, but they do have some sandwiches and breakfast options, as well as soft drinks and water, if you are looking to not use your quick service dining plan options on these things... there are several grocery options that deliver to the beach club and other disney resorts... and if you find the right ones they also deliver beer and wine, very good cost savings compared to paying resort prices. All in all i'd say that this is my favorite resort in Disney

Reviews.Title: “Beach Club is one of the best Disney hotels to stay out.”
Reviews.Author: rjkzagat1
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay at Disney. Stay at the Beach Club resort. It's location is perfect right next to Epcot and Disney Boardwalk. You can walk right into the back of Epcot and other attractions like MGM Studios are a boat ride away. The front desk is so helpful. The pool and water slide are outrageous. The ice cream parlor is convenient as well as the gym and salon.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay here. No big complaints and great location.”
Reviews.Author: theslant
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at this resort. This was our first WDW vacation, and we would definitely stay at this resort again. The lobby and grounds of the hotel are very nice and really meet the deluxe standards. Our king-bed room was nice enough (4573), far from the main elevators but a very close walk to smaller elevator on the side of the building nearest epcot. We had a view of the garden area and also the beach and boardwalk in the distance. The room was clean enough--I felt comfortable walking barefoot on the carpet which is saying a lot. There did seem to be a difference in housekeepers during our stay, and it showed as our room started to get more and more clean mid-week. There is a nice little fridge and mini coffee maker which we used daily. We ordered groceries from an outside company to be delivered before we arrived, and we were very glad we did. We ate breakfast in our room almost every day and saved a lot of money and enjoyed the convenience. The bus service to MK and AK was easy, prompt and covenient. Water taxi service to HS was nice, as we found the walk to be quite a distance, especially in the heat. Walking to HS is much shorter if staying on the opposite side of Crescent Lake, such as at Boardwalk or Swan and Dolphin. However, walk to Epcot from Beach Club was literally 5 minutes, if that. It was so nice being that near to Epcot's World Showcase. We almost felt like we were staying right at Epcot. Most of the staff were very nice and helpful, from the Bell staff to the front desk staff to people working at the pool and in the restaurants. The staff in the Marketplace were another story, especially those at the food counter who were extremely rude and even told us they had run out of food one night when we attempted to order around 10:30 pm (sign clearly reads that they serve food until 11 pm). Other than that, we found the employees were all up to the Disney standard. The pool area is very nice and there is a lot to do in the pool complex. There are also smaller pools which are much quieter. The pool just outside our wing almost never had anyone in it. There was laundry room just off of the pool also, so one day we were able to do laundry and swim while we waited for it! The location of this hotel is the very best thing about it. Aside from having access to all the dining of the Yacht and Beach Club Resorts, you have access to the Boardwalk area, swan and Dolphin and can walk right into Epcot for lunch or dinner. The Boardwalk area is really neat with shops, stands and benches to relax on. On the Beach Club side of the lake, there are movies on the beach every night. There are also surrey bikes as well as small boats available to rent. Really the only complaint we have, besides the rudeness of the staff at the Marketplace, is that housekeeping was a little loud just outside our room. It seems 4573 is just across from a housekeeping headquarters or storage room, as well as a very loud a.c. unit, so it was almost never quiet in our room during the day. Each morning around 7 am, housekeeping began slamming doors and hollering right outside our door. This wasn't a major problem for us, because we were up early every day anyway, but don't stay in this room or on this hall if you expect to sleep in or nap in your room. I'm sure there are quieter areas, and we never complained to anyone, or I'm sure we would have been moved to a different room or housekeeping would have tried to be quieter. We will definitely stay here again. It was so worth paying the extra for a deluxe resort to stay here, particularly in this location and for the level of service and amenities we received. A word of caution: Beware the non-Disney pizza delivery companies who put fliers under your door! They are rude and likely criminals! They harrassed us in our room after we attempted to place an order, then cancelled after the woman who was taking the order rudely hung up the telephone on us. They repeatedly called our phone and even arrived to the hotel and tried to get the front desk staff to allow them to come up to our room. Thankfully, the front desk staff was very courteous and sent them away. We were actually scared of them, because of the very rude and threatening tone of one of their employees over the telephone. I spent a day looking over my shoulder every time we were in our hallway, because they did know our room number. I have heard other bad things about them as well, including that the food is disgusting. Just order room service pizza from the hotel. The couple dollars more will be worth it and save you a lot of grief.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: kim001007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Beach Club resort from May27-June2. Our entire stay was fabulous. Our room was located on the 4th floor over looking Crescent Lake. From our patio, we could bunnies, squirrels, and chipmunks scrurrying about in the gardens every morning. Our room was perfect with no broken appliances, the cleanliness was superb. I'm not sure what TV another vacationer was referencing in another review, but we loved our TV and watched Fox News Channel on several occasions. The pools are magnificent! Our daughters are older. One is a former lifeguard at another theme park in another state. Our daughter complimented how attentive the lifeguards were to small children and how clean Stormalong Bay was. We were on the Disney Dining Plan and had used all of our table credits. We had reservations at the Yachtsman Steakhouse at the the sister resort "Yacht Club." We paid for Yachtsman Steakhouse and we're so glad we did! It was worth every cent. Our waiter was extremely informative and helpful. The Marketplace had everything we needed. The Ham and Cheese Croissants are delicious. They're large enough to share between two adults. The Beach Club is not cheap, but there is nothing about it I would change.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! Perfect for kids!”
Reviews.Author: SneakersOToole
Reviews.Content: Disney is just first rate all the way. There is nothing bad you can say about this resort. It was so fun and completely amazing. There's so much to do in Orlando, but I found myself not wanting to leave this hotel. I could stay for two weeks just enjoying the amenities. And kids will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: drsue2
Reviews.Content: We just got back from disney and stayed at the Beach Club. It was wonderful. The hotel is beautiful and clean. The staff was very helpful. Pools are great for the kids. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but expecting a bit more from a Disney deluxe hotel”
Reviews.Author: ultrasonic1
Reviews.Content: The beach club is architecturally stunning, the location is great, and the pool area is nice. However, almost every fixture on every faucet in the room was loose, there were two strips of wood missing about 8" long each on the bottom of the bathroom door, the inside knob of the door that went out to the balcony had it's cover plate hanging, and the room a/c kept the room tolerable but not relaxing. Also, it could be unique to our room but the beds were horribly squeaky so anytime the kids would move around it would stir me a bit. This is the first time i've stayed in a Disney deluxe where I was really disappointed with my visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: caleighsma
Reviews.Content: We stayed club level for 3 nights. Loved every minute of it. Ryan in the club lounge is terrific! Very helpful and pleasant. We are military and got the room at 40% off. It was about $350 a night with the discount. So def not cheap! But you are paying for location and the stormalong bay pool complex. Pool use is exclusive for people staying at the beach and yacht club resorts and the staff will check your room key. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Our Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: LSUmagnolia
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 (2 adults + 2 20yr olds) felt we had outgrown Wilderness Lodge and decided to try the Beach Club. First- the staff is WONDERFUL-very helpful. We loved the location-could easily walk to Epcot and Boardwalk and short boat ride to Hollywood Studios. We ate once at the Cape May Buffet and grabbed quick bites at the Marketplace on most mornings as we headed out for the day. We had one pool day. Pool is great for families with smaller kids (there is also a quiet pool but no wait service) lifeguards on duty, it is very crowded so be patient w/the wait service. The pool deck is VERY HOT-really hard to believe that Disney would not have installed cool decking around all pools. Had one incident of "unscheduled maintenance"- everyone out of the pool and it took an hour before we could go back in...after being told '20 minutes' in the beginning but a clean pool is desirable so it is what it is. Our connecting rooms were on the 4th floor-housekeeping very good, good a/c. Drawbacks: very firm pillows. Very firm. Not enough outlets. Wish Marketplace would stay open until midnight. TV mounted on wall-sucky service-NO FOX NEWS-no pay-per-view Disney movies either (huge drawback for young families w/earlier bedtimes). We would stay again at the Beach Club. Dining options in Epcot and Hollywood Studios more appealing with young adults. Personally I think internet service should be provided at no cost but we paid $10 a day (x 2). We used the taxi service that was recommended twice. Rode bus from MK back to hotel once. Walked a lot to Epcot and took boat to Hollywood Studios and back several times.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay at the Beach Club”
Reviews.Author: barryvo
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a five night stay over Memorial Day Weekend. The Beach Club and Disney World exceeded all of our expectations. We were impressed with the service and the location of the facility. The Magical Express was as advertised both ways and was very efficient. The WDW transportation worked flawlessly and quickly erased my doubts. We had an early morning character breakfast at the Polynesian and were directed to catch the 7:00 am bus to the Magic Kingdom and that the driver would take us directly to the resort for breakfast. The staff at the Market Place store where very friendly and accommodating. They would always greet you right away and offer to refill our refillable mugs for us. They also gave us pointers on how to get the most value from our snacks. The manager Brad went out of his way to get us into Ohana for dinner which was completely booked. No request when unfilled. The pool alone was super great and a lot of fun. Disney isn’t cheap but they give you what you pay for and more. It was great being able to walk to EPCOT and Hollywood Studios. We ended up getting a room right by the elevator which was convenient without being loud. I would recommend the Beach Club to anyone looking for a good time and a convenient location. The Yacht Club (connected to the Beach Club) is also nice but does not have the vibe and energy. You cannot go wrong with either location. My bottom line is the Beach Club is great place for couples or families, just save your pennies to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Not the same”
Reviews.Author: mgbeer
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Disney World May 17-221, for a 4 night stay and 2 of the nights we stayed at the Beach Club Villas. We received a handicap room at check in, which we did not know until we walked the LONG walk over to the villas only to find out, this type of room will not work with a 5 year old child. The bathroom had a walk in shower and no tub. I called the front desk to switch rooms and was told I would have to come all the way back to the front desk to get new keys to switch over rooms. They should have noticed the room assignment at check in, and not assigned it to a family with a young child in this type of room. Never did they say they were sorry for the mess up and for making us walk back and forth carrying all our luggage. They never even offered to move our luggage for us. I expect a lot more from a Disney Resort! All the other Disney properties we have stayed on have always been much more helpful. We have stayed at the Beach Club 4 times now, and I recall in the past, the Customer Service being much better. What happened over here!!!!!!!!!!! Next unpleasant encounter was at the Market Place. The women working both the store and the food services in the store are terrible. They were rude and very unpleasant. I was shocked by their behaviour. One lady working at the check out was complaining about the other lady working behind the food service counter. I was shocked. We had just arrived at the resort, just starting our vacation, and this is what our family had to listed to. This happened each time we shopped at the Market Place. After the second visit in the store, we decided we'd stop getting any food from the Market Place. The Pool at Beach Club is very pretty, but not worth spending the money to stay there just for that. My daughter actually cut her foot up pretty bad in the sandy beach area. Seems they don't keep up on replacing the sand to a required amount. No one offered to help us out, but told us to go ALL the way to the front desk for help!!!!!!!!! WHAT? Luckily, we moved over to Sarratoga Springs for 2 nights, which was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “It met all my expectations”
Reviews.Author: Pittpantherfan
Reviews.Content: Stayed May 1 - 8, 2011.Let me preface this review by saying that I am obsessed with details, do alot of planning and I am picky about cleanliness and customer service (but not unrealistically so). I planned this trip for about 9 months and labored over which hotel we would stay at for our first on-property Disney visit. I had been to Disney 5 other times but have stayed off site.Our choices were a bit narrowed because we are a family of 5 and there are not as many options for families of 5 as their are for smaller parties. We choose the Beach Club for it's seaside decor and proximity to EPCOT. We have 3 kids 10, 7, 4. We debated about this location or a Magic Kingdom hotel because of the kids. After being there, we decided that we made the right choice because of all the dining options in EPCOT. It was a brief walk to EPCOT. It was also a short boat ride to DHS. The Boardwalk was either in walking or boat distance. This was also a nice area to spend some time. We did stay Club Level so my review is based on this experience. We found check in a breeze - did not do online but we were able to check in upstairs on the club level. We would stay club level again. Our room was spacious for 5 with a large day bed that was the size of a single bed. We had a dormer balcony that had ample room for two chairs. The beds were sooooo comfortable - the sheets, the mattress made settling in after a long park day very comforting. Ample clothes storage. We had no noise from the hall or the adjacent rooms. The room was very clean! Mousekeeping was great, towel animals daily -remember to tip them for their efforts. The resort had a happy atmosphere and all of the CMs were very friendly and helpful. The resort was clean and welcoming. It has a wonderful smell as you walk through the entry doors. The pool was outstanding. We just wish we would have spend more time there. It has a great water slide that the kids loved.The lifeguards were very nice and they even got in the pool with kids at the end of the shift. The kids thought that was really cool. We only ate at Hurricane Hannah's. Great burgers -I hear they are the same as Beaches and Cream. We unfortunately did not try Beaches and Cream. We had breakfast and things in the club lounge, which were all great. The Marketplace did have numerous options even though it is not truly a quick service place. Our 2 boys, 10 and 4, did the Albatross pirate cruise that leaves from the boat dock. They had a blast - something I would recommend. It's tought balancing park time and resort time. I left wishing we would have spent more time at the resort.For our first on property stay, it was great and I can't image staying anywhere else and I am looking forward to returning again. The resort came up just as researched and met all of my expectations and then some. It was a magical stay!

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever Hands Down.”
Reviews.Author: christy31
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the yacht club side last year and decided to stay on the beach club side this year. Both are great but enjoyed the beach club side even more. My husband and I were completely shocked when upgraded to Conciege Level. We were so happy that we could not get the smile off our faces honestly. It was fantastic! We were treated like movie stars from the time we walked through the door. The Beach Club is an first class place to stay for sure. Beautiful surroundings inside and out. Pool is always amazing like a big waterpark with nice slide. It had a wonderful fresh and clean smell wherever we went which means they are keeping everything clean like they should. Room we stayed in was bright and beautiful. Maid service was great always came back to a clean room. Whenever we walked inside hotel was always greeted with nice smiles. The hotels in that area are the best for us because we love going to Epcot Park and is an easy walk or boatride to Epcot. Just cannot say enough about this place and honestly there are alot of choices on where to stay when at Disney World but if you are going to stay deluxe can say with confidence to stay here. You will be glad you did!!

Reviews.Title: “Boy has this gone downhill!”
Reviews.Author: clarkmouse
Reviews.Content: STayed here 6 years ago and loved it. Returned 2011 with my 13yrs old and my 6yr old. The hotel is not of the same standard: service not quite as attentive, food dreadfull and very expensive for quality offered. The facilities are still as good, the Beach Club has probablhy the best Disney hotel pool anywhere in the world. Just felt things had changed and the Hotel was no longer the 5* Disney we expected. Wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not our Favorite WDW Resort”
Reviews.Author: JoJosontheroad
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice, our room (a two bedroom suite) was spacious and comfortable. The housekeeping and bell service staff were very good and on top of it. In my POV Disney has several very nice hotels, but I would not compare them to a 5 star hotel such as a Fairmont or Four Seasons. This hotel has all that Disney has to offer.... easy access to the parks, that whole Disney theme thing going on, beautifully maintained grounds and buildings and lots of family friendly activities. My family was not as in love with the pool as many others are (too many bridges and pathways to cross to get a drink or a snack from the bar, hard to keep track of your kids), but we spent several nice afternoons there. The kids and my husband thought the beds were extremely comfortable. Very convenient to Epcot and Hollywood studios. Food choices were plenty if you considered the Boardwalk area and had a multipark pass so you could sample food from the Epcot food vendors. We did like this hotel, but it felt crowded and cramped (our favorite WDW resort is the Grand Floridian, the grounds around the Grand Floridian made things feel more wide open and less crammed with people).

Reviews.Title: “So much for good customer service.”
Reviews.Author: BobcatGirl04
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Beach Club for two nights during a conference. After hearing for years about the fabulous customer service Disney is known for, I was expecting to be wowed during my stay. However, I was far from wowed. Upon check-in, I was told that there were no clean rooms ready. However, a group checking in next to me was immediately given access to their three rooms. When I questioned this, the woman behind the counter (who had very bad English) couldn't give me an answer as to why the other guests could access their rooms and I could not. The woman told me I would need to speak with her supervisor. The supervisor told me that if I didn't mind having a room with a garden view rather than a lake view, I could access my room right away. I said that was fine, and was given a room on the first floor, right off the lobby area. When I opened the door to my room, the door stood open for a solid 20 seconds before automatically closing on its own - a handicapped room. Every time I opened the door to leave the room, I had to stand there for 20 seconds and make sure that it did in fact close before I left. My shower was made for roll-in wheelchairs and water leaked everywhere each time I used it. Coincidentally, there were a group of workers with ladders and such performing maintenance on the building right outside of my patio. Everytime I went out on the patio, they all gave me dirty looks as if I was not supposed to be outside near where they working. My patio door had an issue with the lock. I could NOT get the lock to work. I called the front desk twice about this issue, and was told maintenance would come to fix the lock for me. They never came. I actually ended up shoving a chair under the handle while I slept at night because I felt very unsafe (being that I was on ground level and any could just walk right in to my room, including the mass of workers right outside). I could not help but think that the front desk had intentionally given me a bad room because they were not happy that I didn't want to wait for a room to be prepared when checking in. I was not overly impressed by the pool. Filled with screaming children throwing balls and water toys around. And the sand bottom actually seemed dirty. There were a few waiters walking by who were apparently there to serve drinks to guests laying poolside. However, they never made the initiative to approach anyone. People would have to try repeatedly to flag them down in order to get a drink. The few good things about the resort were the pretty view of the boardwalk; the well-equipped fitness center; and the convenience store located right off the lobby. I would never stay here again and would certainly not recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Adult Couples”
Reviews.Author: JCBraz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I (early 30’s) stayed at Beach Club in early May to celebrate our first anniversary. At first, we were considering booking at Wilderness Lodge or Animal Kingdom, but at the suggestion of our super travel agent, Lynda Hower at Dream Makers Vacation Services, we decided on Beach Club. We were certainly that glad that we did. For a couple in their early 30’s with no kids, Beach Club’s atmosphere is perfect: Very soft colors, beachy, with a hint of sophistication. Many have raved about the pool. I have to agree. Not only does it capture the mellow theme that people like myself enjoy, but they don’t play non-stop kid music, instead focusing on an array of tropically themed music for adults. The area around Hurricane Hannah’s made us feel that we were somewhere other than Disney, which wasn’t a bad thing after long days dodging motor scooters and rampaging kids in the parks. The water slide could have been in a water park. The only downside to the slide was having to cross the pathway over to the slide entrance. This could be a problem if a motor scooter is nearby. The view at night is great, especially with the Boardwalk all lit up. Again, another adult like bonus to the resort. Also, since we enjoy our cocktails, the short walk to Epcot is fantastic. You are literally five minutes away, two minutes if you zoom by on a motor scooter, which seem to plague Disney now. Being able to walk over to the Rose & Crown to enjoy a pint is great. It also helps to walk off the unwanted calories from drinking. The walk to Hollywood Studios is a little longer, and something that should be considered in the summer time heat. Buy the resort mugs. It is worth it in the end. The Ale and Compass at the attached Yacht Club (honestly, it feels like the same hotel) is a cool place with nice décor for time out of the sun. The gym is perfect for a vacation. Although they don’t have the heavier weights, there is enough to get the job done before venturing out for the day. All in all, we had a great time in a resort with enough of a mature feel to balance out the otherwise kid-focused Disney hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Oh my god<3”
Reviews.Author: Meghan122
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stay here everytime we come to Disney! Its fabulous! Everytime you drive into the parking lot, they greet you and say "Welcome Home!". Its in between MGM Studios and Epcot. The service is amazing, whenever you walk out onto your balcony you smell the green grass and pretty flowers below you. You always have a good view whether its the parking lot, or Tower of Terror. The room are very big and beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Disney hotels just don't get better than this - perfection!”
Reviews.Author: Pixie1104
Reviews.Content: We had been planning our 3 year old daughter's first trip to Disneyworld since before she was born so where we stayed was a major part of the planning. We used Tripadvisor as well as other resources to research the best Disney Hotel for us and fnally decided on the Beach Club because of it's consistently good reviews and it's proximity to Epcot (our favourite park). It's fair to say therefore that our expectations were high but from the moment we turned into the driveway we were thrilled with this hotel and it exceeded our expectations in every way. The Beach Club has a wonderful ambience that is hard to describe but it striked the perfect balance of casual and elegant. From the moment you go through the gate it's a beautiful place to be. The staff, without exception, were friendly, happy, courteous and always on hand to help and anticipate your evey need. We were greeted by name at the front entrance when we pulled up, whisked to the check in and given lots of information in prepraration for our holiday. Our 3 year old daughter was given her own activity pack to keep her amused whilst we checked in and was always treated like an important person in her own right. I would say that the Beach Club is especially excellent for families with children but wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to anyone at all looking for a first class service and hotel in Disneyworld. The lobby of this place is just beautiful - we visited many other Disney hotels for meals whilst there and no others even came close except perhaps for the Yacht Club next door but even that doesn't have the same fun, friendly feel as the Beach Club. The Grand Floridian had wow factor but lacked the atmosphere and ambience of the Beach Club. The room (a standard) was much larger than I expected - certainly larger than other Disney hotel rooms. The beds had duvets as well as blanket and sheets so you could choose your preference - in our case duvets. They were very comfortable with two pillows each instead of the usual one and nice touches like dimmable lamps and plenty of bedside storage. The bathroom, which we were expecting to be very small from the reviews was actually perfectly lovely with a huge vanity area which more than made up for the compact bath and toilet area. The room decor itself is just lovely, light and airy with a pleasing colour scheme and plenty of storage (there was a separate 4 drawer dresser in addition to the wardrobe and a multi-drawered unit that the TV sits on). It really felt like care had been taken to make the room as comfortable as possible. Mousekeeping were superb and always managed to do their thing whilst we were out, no matter what time of day we happened to leave or come back - it's like some kind of magic! Whenever we passed them in the hallway we were always greeted with a smile and a friendly hello. The Cape May Cafe was fantastic - Minnie, Donald and Goofy were there the morning we had breakfast there. We were worried we wouldn't be able to eat there as we hadn't been able to book a reservation for there online before we went but, to our amazement, we rolled up there at 8.30am on our first morning and were seated within 2 minutes! Be prepared to pay a lot for character dining, it IS expensive but in our opinion it's well worth it as it's always a magical experience. Make sure you buy an autograph book and chunky pen before you go - they sell them in the hotel shop. We probably did a total of around 7 character meals whilst there and Cape May was one of the best. We also ate at the Beaches & Cream Ice Cream Parlour which was lovely - they do burgers and the like there too so it's perfect for a quick snack or lunch. Speaking of the hotel shop, that was fab too, lots of Disney gifts and souveniers obviously but also a great range of hot & cold food, beverages, groceries etc... You could easily have a very nice breakfast from there and take it back to your room to eat. We bought a small carton of Mickey Milk for my daughter there every other day and they always had what we needed. The Beach Club's location really can't be beaten. It really is just a 5 minute walk from the World Showcase entrance of Epcot, it was superb to be able to leave the hotel and a short - very pleasant - walk later be at Epcot, right between England and France. Very handy for early starts, evening meals or just a nice stroll! It's also a few minutes walk from the Boardwalk which is just the other side of the beach and lake outside the back of the hotel. Of an evening the view of the Boardwalk all lit up on the other side of the lake is really lovely. It's also a great route for those runners out there (it's 1 mile around the lake and back but can be extended by diverting around the Swan or Dolphin hotels). Every evening they show a Disney movie on the beach, chairs are lined up or you can take a beach towel and it's a wonderful atmosphere. They also have marshmallows and singalong on the beach every evening too. Stormalong Bay, the Beach & Yacht Club's pool is something else - simply amazing! How do you combine a beach with a pool? Go to the Beach Club and see for yourself! Our little girl LOVED it, she could play in the sand and paddle her feet in the gently sloping pool or play in the shallow small pools that were dotted around. There were always heaps of buckets and spades lying around for the kids to play with so no need to take your own. The area is exclusively for the guests of the Beach & Yacht Clubs so you need to show a valid room key each for admission but then you're given a wristband and as many towels as you need and can come and go as you please. There are loads of loungers and one morning we arrived and the ladies sweeping the sand (yes they sweep the sand!) actually arranged our loungers for us so they were in the shade and asked us if we needed anything, it really was above and beyond great service! We had a rental car for our entire holiday so used the car park daily but there were never any problems finding a space and once you have your keycard you just use that to open the barriers and enter the car park each time. When we booked our holiday we decided we would split our 10 day stay into a week at the Beach Club and 3 days at The Animal Kingdom Lodge. When we checked out of the Beach Club at the end of our first week I was VERY sad to leave it and, in hindsight it was a mistake. I will review the AKL seperately but suffice to say it PALED it comparison to the Beach Club for a whole list of reasons (and that was even in a Savannah View room at Animal Kingdom Lodge) and I would never stay there again. Next time we come to Disneyworld we will definitely choose the Beach Club, nowhere else even comes close! I think I fell a little bit in love with it and I will always remember our first stay in this most perfect of Disney Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent ... Great pool and location”
Reviews.Author: Challenger300
Reviews.Content: First time in the hotel ... Loved it ... Great pool and place for the family. Will definitely be back !!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Beach Club”
Reviews.Author: CapeCodTraveler3
Reviews.Content: Just returned yesterday from a week long stay at Disneys Beach Club (5/7-5/14/11). Loved this hotel - most especially the location. Great to be able to walk to Epcot (made lots of dinner reservations there - it worked out well) and short boat ride to Hollywood Studios. Need to take a bus to Magic Kingdom and Animal Kingdom. To get to Fort Wilderness (if going to the Hoop Dee Doo Revue - highly recommend) - you need to take a bus to Magic Kingdom - then catch a boat from there to the campground. Allow plenty of time for this trip - for the 7:15 show the front desk recommended leaving at 5:30 - and you need the time! (We left later and did arrive a little late!) Bus ride to MK is about 20 minutes, to Animal Kingdom about 15 minutes - not bad and buses come every 15 minutes or so. 5 minute walk to Epcot, 10 minute boat ride to HS. We booked a water view room - not impressed with the view. If garden view available - just get that! Most balconies are just big enough for 2 people to stand on - very small. As mentioned by others, there is outside painting currently going on at the hotel. Cranes around the property, paint scraped off the trim, etc - but it didnt bother us. If we want the hotel to stay beautiful they do need to do maintenance sometimes!!!! The overall condition of the hotel is very nice and the grounds are meticuosly landscaped. But hotel does show signs of age (rusty vent in shower, some 'scraped' walls, things like that) - not perfect. Views over to the Boardwalk are great - beautiful setting. We had dinner at the Animal Kingdom Lodge one night and found the entire hotel to be dark and somewhat depressing. Complete opposite of the Beach Club - it is really beauiful. Only ate in the Marketplace at the hotel (didnt use the other restaurants). Sandwiches and breakfast pastries are Yummy! Great store - offer lots of souveniers, grocery items (for your room), refillable drink mugs (definately worth the $), etc. Pool is best we saw at Disney. Fantastic, large 2 foot deep sandy "beach" area for the little ones - our 4 year old daughter loved it. The pirate pool slide is a great ride - even for the grown ups. Our 10 and 7 year olds loved that! Entire pool has a sand bottom - so cool! Plenty of chairs and tables - never had an issue finding a nice spot. Hurricane Hannahs offers beer and drinks and a refill station for those mugs! Waitresses at the pool were great too. Can get a burger or hot dog by the pool. Staff leads games each day (although somewhat cheesy - name that tune, hoola hoop, etc - typical). Lazy river doesnt do much - no current really to push you along, weak. But a nice swim around the pool nonetheless. Food: We had the food plan that included 1 snack , 1 quick serve, and 1 sit dowm meal per day/per person. This is plenty of food. The snack choices are great! (breakfast pastry, candybars, yogurt parfaits, ice cream, fruit, popcorn, soda, water - all included). The quick serve ("cafeteria style") restaurants in the parks worked perfectly for lunch each day. Only quick serve we had that we didnt like was in Mexico at Epcot. Dinners - we ate at the Hoop Dee Doo Revue (fun and great food), Via Napoli in Italy (great brick oven pizza - highly recommend), Kona Cafe at the Polynesian (get the teriyaki sirloin - very good), 50's Prime Time Cafe (lots of fun - great waitress), Teppan Edo in Japan (best meal we had!), and Boma at Animal Kingdom Lodge (not very good - do NOT recommend). Also had a Character Breakfast Buffet at Crystal Palace (this was OK - although not impressed. Have had MUCH better breakfast buffets - food was cold, not huge variety) - but kids enjoyed the Winnie the Pooh characters. Shows: DO NOT MISS FANTASMIC!! Saw it our 1st night - was the best show we saw entire trip. Go early - it is a mob scene. We liked Nemo better than Lion King at Animal Kingdom. Beauty and Beast was great at HS and 'Lights, Motors, Action' much better than 'Indiana Jones' (we found Indiana Jones to be boring). Go to the parks early and hit the BIG rides 1st (Rock and Roller Coaster, Expedition Everest, Kilimanjaro Safari, Soarin, Test Track, Space Mountain, Tower of Terror, etc - we barely waited in line). Did need a fast pass for Toy Story Mania - cute ride/game. Kids liked it! Electric Light Parade was fantastic - got a front row seat and the floats and characters come so close! 'Wishes' Fireworks - on Main St. behind castle - spectacular(look for Tinkerbell) ! Not as impressed with Illuminations - not many lasers anymore - mostly fireworks (Wishes is better!) If your kids want pictures with Characters check the times guide when you get to each park for times/locations and go early. The lines can be very long and they will close them off if there are alot of people. We were the last people in line before they closed the Tinkerbell line- and we had to wait 1 and 1/2 hours for pictures with Tink. (Our daughter was thrilled - but waiting in 90 degree weather, not much fun). Pictures with the Princesses in MK was great - indoors in AC, and you got pics with Belle, Princess Aurora, and Cinderella all in one line! We had a fantasticly exhausting vacation. Get ready to walk (alot), sweat, and fight the crowds - but SOOOO much fun! We crammed in as much as we could in one week and are so glad we did. Didnt leave wishing we had seen anything else (although we probably could have stayed another week and still not seen everything). Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Pool! Lots of fun, great setting!”
Reviews.Author: DisneyCrazed
Reviews.Content: This pool is a blast! Great slide that runs from a pirate ship across the sidewalk from the hotel over to the pool. There is a sand bottom pool with a sand area for kids to play in and plenty of linking pool sections to float around in an inflatable ring. The ice cream shop (Beaches and Cream) is great and in the evening you can get an ice cream and walk over to the beach area on the lake and catch an outdoor movie while you eat it! This resort has the shortest walking distance to Epcot, which is very nice. The view over the lake is really terrific and you can also walk to Dolphin/Yacht Club/Boardwalk restaurants and stroll the Boardwalk for a lot of great fun. The rooms were pretty good, although it was a heavy spring break week so I'll mention I had to vacuum when I got there as we found some popcorn and doritos on the floor but I give them a pass because the turn over must have been tremendous that week. Of course the staff was friendly, helpful and fun, as is always the case with Disney's style. Overall a great place and always worth being on site at Disney!

Reviews.Title: “First Disney visit, the Beach Club rooms and services top notch.”
Reviews.Author: jasonoNiagaraFalls
Reviews.Content: We arrived by car and greeted at front door to help us from vehichle. Our luggage was taken, and we were personally taken to the fifth floor (club level) and checked in by one of our two conciergs. We only paid for a reg. room w/ a garden view, Disney upgraded us to club level. Club level (5th floor) had a room with food and booze from 6am to 10pm all included. The room, two queen beds, fridge, private sitting balcony and granite bath vanity, clean and comfortable. Several pools, sand bottom lagoon style with food and drink service there. The Beach Club for us was an excelent choice for a first time Disney visit.

Reviews.Title: “Walking Distance to Epcot”
Reviews.Author: D_Nicole85
Reviews.Content: My friends and I went to Disney last year for their Food & Wine festival. There were 5 of us, and we booked a one bedroom suite.. come to find out when we got there, they had sold out of their suites and downgraded us to a room with one double bed and one sofa beed. Needless to say we were all cramped and didn't have enough room to fit all of us and our luggage comfortably. We were also pretty far from the pool, but we didn't plan on swimming anyway so that wasn't much of an issue. The room did have a little kitchen section with microwave, fridge, sink, dishes/utensils, and everything necessary to stock up for late night snacks (which we did). This also came in handy for heating up our leftovers. The buses to the parks were within a comfortable walking distance, and were very convenient. The walk to the water taxis was also nice, and it was nice to have the option of doing either. Our main reason for being there was for the Epcot Food & Wine festival, and the hotel was a 5 minute walk to the park. You ended up in the back of the park, but it was great to not have to wait on a line for buses after the concerts and be able to walk back to the hotel without crazy crowds. Overall, it was a decent hotel, but we plan on staying at a different hotel this year that will give us a room with more space rather than downgrading us!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel - Awful Concierge!”
Reviews.Author: flyawaygrl
Reviews.Content: We really want to give this hotel a better rating. It's an absolutely beautiful resort but the "service" we received from the front desk staff and especially the concierge was so poor that we just can't give it any better than an average rating. THE PROS: Gorgeous property located within a 5 minute walk to Epcot and a quick boat ride to Hollywood Studios. The bus service to MK, AK and DD is your typical overcrowded, slow ride, but just deal with it. You're on vacation! The grounds are beautifully landscaped and the 3 acre pool is breathtaking. Could have spent an entire day at the pool alone! The beach along the lake is well kept and it was great to just sit and "people watch" at night or stroll over to the Boardwalk which is also just a 5 minute walk. Plenty of activities close by for everyone. Disney movies were shown on the beach each night - great resort for families with children or for adult couples. Something to please everybody. The attached Yacht Club is also beautiful and we ate breakfast at the Captain's Grill most mornings. Nice break from the happy chaos over at the Cape May Cafe if you're looking for a quiet meal. BTW - The Cape May is a lot of fun and the characters do a great job of keeping the kids entertained! Hurricane Hannah's Grill (located at the pool) is a nice spot for a snack, lunch or adult beverage - try the Pina Co-LAVA - yummy! You can also bring your resort mug there for unlimited soft drink refills. The hotel is just stunning and is worth the extra $$ just for the pool and great location alone! THE CONS: Booked this vacation over 6 months ago and there was never any mention about the renovations going on with the exterior of the hotel. There were a multitude of giant lift-trucks parked all over the grounds, pick-up trucks parked in walkways, giant pressure-washing trailers parked on the lawns, scaffolding and so many workers in orange vests and hard hats milling around that it was difficult to get a decent picture of the hotel. I have to say they were all very friendly, though! It appears they are repainting, re-siding and renovating the trim/molding. We're all for maintaining a property but we would've appreciated the option of choosing different dates to avoid this mess. Constant sounds of jack-jammering, scraping, hammering and pressure washing made for a much less relaxing vacation than what we expected and paid for. Didn't bother complaining about it to the front desk, though, as they seemed to be seriously irritated enough just being there. Which brings up the just average rating for this hotel. Check-In at the Beach Club was not a pleasant experience. There was no "Welcome Home" greeting upon entering the hotel. Instead, we were "greeted" by an expressionless woman who asked "You are?" When we gave our last name, she simply pointed to a long line and asked us to wait in it. After about 15 minutes, we were checked in by a very bored looking woman and sent on our way. The room was just a very bland, standard room with no real style to speak of. Very small closet with only 6 hangers and 2 tiny drawers to store our clothing. The room also had a seriously funky smell that never really disipated - can't even describe the smell. Oh well, we weren't spending that much time in the room so what the heck, right? We dealt with the broken lamp, the lack of storage space, the broken sink and bathtub faucets, the funky smell...you get the picture. Not what you would expect for almost $400 per night. We had a pleasant 5 days though up until the night before check-out. Due to a family situation at home, we wanted to check for an earlier flight home the next day. I stopped at the concierge desk to see if there was a PC on site that I could use. The concierge, a really grumpy man, looked up at me over his glasses and asked if it was for business or personal use. ??? As I tried to explain that it was to check on a flight change, he interrupted me and told me I could use a computer in the convention/conference center next door but not until tomorrow morning at 7am. I was so miffed by his rude attitude that I didn't even think to ask him to check the airline schedule for me. If he was a true professional, he would have offered his assistance without being asked. To top it off, he didn't bothering mentioning there's a charge for internet access at the conference center and a $1.00 per page charge if you want to print anything. I chose to call the airline myself and change the flights and then have the morning-shift concierge print our boarding passes. We didn't use the baggage service upon check out due to the change in flight plans. No offers for assistance though as we wheeled our large suitcases out. The poor service at check in (and especially the concierge) and the unexpected construction noise was enough to leave a bad taste in our mouths but the resort itself is so beautiful that we can't say we wouldn't recommend it to our friends and family. We would just tell them not to be too surprised by the poor service at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Beach Club. Will be back!”
Reviews.Author: alwaysplanningatrip
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at The Polynesian, Contemporary and Wilderness Lodge. Beach Club is our new favorite. We were upgraded to the Concierge level at check-in which was a great plus. Having the cont. breakfast and snacks/drinks later in the day worked out perfectly. All of the rooms are the basically the same. Now that our kids are older, it was ok to stay at an Epcot resort rather than be close to the MK.We enjoy going to Epcot for dinner and loved being able to walk there and back. Bus transportation to the other parks was fine. We enjoyed the pool area and I'm sure the younger kids enjoy it even more. Would love to stay here again the next time we go to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: quattrorings
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to WDW so we decided to stay at the beach club because of its excellent water complex and proximity to the boardwalk and Epcot. The room was tastefully furnished with excellent beds. The staff were always very welcoming and nothing was ever too much trouble. Yes I know it is the Disney way but some hotels in Europe could learn real lessons from the Disney approach. The only letdown was the on site Cape May cafe - which was a bit lacklustre - however the restaurants in the adjoining Yacht club are excellent. For a real treat try Beaches & Cream - the onsite soda bar - which is great for Kids.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Amazing Disney Style!”
Reviews.Author: Sunnyday85
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 7-night stay at the Beach Club with our 2 children - ages 11 & 2. I based my booking of this resort on recommendations from Disney Vacation Club members, as well as Trip Advisor Reviews. Went with very high expectations and they were exceeded! From the moment our bags were checked in at our originating airport, Disney's impeccable service began. We did not see our bags again until they were delivered promptly to our room, shortly after check-in at the resort. (The same baggage service was offered at departure - no bag handling until we returned to our home airport - our Boarding Passes were even printed at the resort prior to departure - no waiting in line at the airport in Orlando.) I'm not sure where to begin my compliments - the room was very good-sized and appointed nicely - very comfy beds and terrific housekeeping service. Our room overlooked Crescent Lake and the Boardwalk area, which was a great view to awake to every morning. The Resort location was fantastic - both the entrance to Epcot and the Boardwalk were a short walk. The transportation provided by Disney, to each park was super convenient - we used it very frequently. On longer park days, we went back to the resort for our 2-year old's nap and cooled off in the pools. Which brings me to that topic...absolutely amazing pool area for the entire family. The sand-bottom pool areas were really neat. We also used the smaller pool in a different area of the resort for late-evening swims (the water was nice and warm...if you prefer that). The arcade was one of the best I've seen at a resort...huge! We ate at the Cape May Cafe for breakfast a couple of times - great buffet and those yummy Mickey Mouse waffles. Also frequented Beaches & Cream and the resort Marketplace. We did not choose to use the dining plan - the Marketplace was fantastic for a quick bite to eat in between park visits and also for those quick, late dinners - they had a great variety - pizzas, hot/cold sandwiches, refrigerated and freezer items (also had microwaves for use by guests). Can't wait to return...would highly recommed this beautiful resort.

Reviews.Title: “Club Level is an excellent option...”
Reviews.Author: JRCinMS
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Orlando with our 18-year-old daughter to visit his family and spend a few days at the theme parks. We loved the option of staying on the club level at this hotel and feel it more than made up for the increased cost of the fifth floor. We were greeted as we pulled in by name and personally escorted up to the club floor.We here offered drinks as we sat down to go through the check in process with one of the two concierges dedicated to the club level. They arranged our park passes and made dining suggestions and reservations. But best of all for our family, the little dining area is open almost 24/7. In the morning it was more than an adequate breakfast and throughout the day they move different food and drinks into the area. Between 5 and 7 they put in appetizers and beer and wine are available. The first night there the appetizers were more than fine for our dinner...and were tasty. We spent most of our time in the parks, but the pool area is beautiful and I used the very nice gym several times as well. This hotel is within walking distance to EPCOT but the rest of the parks are reached via the Disney buses that pull up in front of the hotel. Also, right across the lake is the Disney Boardwalk area with more choices of restaurants. Since we are hockey fans and were there during the playoffs, we spent some time at the ESPN restaurant/bar.

Reviews.Title: “Has GREAT potential, but...”
Reviews.Author: twilkins80
Reviews.Content: The hotel, of course, is beautiful. The grounds are typical Disney, gorgeous flowers and trees everywhere. The pool feels tropical... my husband and I thought the sand bottom and the "miniature beaches" were a really cool ideas for the kids. We saw lots of kids building sand castles while running back and forth to the water. The "beach" and walkway have a 1920-ish feel with the boardwalk in the distance and the ambiance music softly playing. The hotel also had a few really cool things, movies at night on the lawn, a bonfire roasting marshmallows, and really great access to Epcot and H.S! The walk to Epcot was only about 5 minutes. The service overall was very helpful. The front desk, concierge and all the servers during our two catered company meals were all helpful, cheerful and made me feel like they actually enjoyed working there and helping us. The food for both of the meals was excellent! Those are the perks. ... Every day that we were there they were doing serious renovating. They had big tractors and cranes working all over the grounds. There was a constant jack hammering sound, a loud sander, and workers all over painting. It really kinda ruins the ambiance of sitting on the back deck with an ocean view while a big tractor beeps and raises it's crane in front of you... or when you are trying to relax in your room with your door open and all you can hear is a jack hammer. I would've been seriously irritated if I saved all year to go on a "relaxing" Disney vacation just to deal with the construction sites and sounds. If we ever do save and decide to go back I will make sure there is no renovating going on. I would also request a room on the end farthest away from the main pool. There are a lot of pool activities, which is cool if you are doing the activities, not cool if you are hanging out in your room. Loud music, loud voices on a megaphone, and loud kids, once again, take away from a "relaxing" trip. I didn't mind too much, because when you go to Disney you don't really hang out in your room all day, but as a Mom and being around kid craziness all day, my idea of a calmer trip is one that doesn't sound like there is a school playground right outside your window. I also considered the Yacht Club instead of the Beach Club next trip.. it was further away from the pool. Also, the last day my hubby and me wanted to go to Sea World. But being a Disney resort, they only do transportation to Disney parks. The concierge was very helpful about helping us find the most economical way to get to Sea World, (take the bus to Downtown Disney, then grab a taxi from there to Sea World.) Taxi fare is something to plan for if you aren't driving and plan on seeing other sites. There really are so many positives, but the noise and renovation were a big downer. If you go when the renovation is over, it would be GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “Rude Concierge”
Reviews.Author: NewEnglandFoodietoo
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here many times over the years. The rooms have been recently refurbished (rugs, linens, beds and flat-screen television). Room size is adequate, but bathrooms are tiny, unlike newer hotels (we had a major plumbing problem that took a couple of frantic calls to resolve). Very convenient for visiting EPCOT. Food was very good at restaurants and the pool area is the largest and most unique. This was the first time that I have complained directly to any management about Disney cast members (never had reason to before) - an older male concierge was extremely rude and he gave off a very snooty, condescending tone to me when I asked for assistance with dining (which is his job). Declined the free icecream offer for my trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Best Trip to Disney World”
Reviews.Author: familynj6
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Disney Beach Club Resort. You can't beat the location or the pool. Can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: lovedisney51
Reviews.Content: My family of three absolutely loved the Beach Club Resort! I was a little nervous at check in as we had reserved a club level room and the greeter didn't find our name on the list right away. He escorted us to the main check in desk and shortly after realized he should have brought us directly up to the 5th floor for check in. He was very apologetic and gave us a great tour of the floor and our room. The club level seemed a bit estravegant and I had a bit of buyers remorse after booking our reservation. I was very glad in the end that I didn't change anything. Every morning we were in the lounge for a deliscious breakfast before hitting the parks. There were a variety of pastries, bagels, cereals, beverages and hard boiled eggs. The lounge was staffed by at least 3-4 cast members that bussed tables efficiently and kept the food stocked. The lounge wasn't very large and there were mornings when families struggled to find a place to sit, but the cast members did provide trays to bring food back to the rooms. In the afternoon there were snacks such as, pretzels, sweedish fish, nuts and cookies available. My favorate time was between 5 and 7 when we would come back from the parks for a break to find a varity of hot and cold snacks and beverages available. The offerings ranged from cheese and crackers and olives to scewered teriaki chicken and scallops wrapped in bacon. Sodas were available all day, but in the afternoon there was also beer and wine. Late in the evening tasty deserts waited for us as we returned from the park. We found that we only needed one meal outside of the food made available in the club level lounge. The cast members went out of there way to make sure we had what we needed and honored special requests.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome home... what more can you say????”
Reviews.Author: MOUSEAHOLIC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Beach Club during spring break 03/12-03/16/11. The hotel is gorgeous and the staff is so friendly and attentive. When you check in and every time you walk through the front door you are greeted with a smiling "welcome home" from the staff. There are places that showed a little wear in the hotel, but it appeared that repairs were being made. The room was very large for a family of four, but I was very disappointed with the trundle bed. It was too hard for either one of my children to sleep on and I had planned to have them sleep seperately, which is why I requested a room with a trundle bed. But the queen size beds were plenty comfy for us to all double up and sleep. My children are ages 12 and 9 so the pool was a huge hit with them. It was amazing and is huge with a pirate ship tube slide, a lazy river, waterfalls and a beach in the middle of the kiddie pool area! A waitress even walks around and brings your meals/drinks to you poolside. It's heavenly. We walked everywhere that we could and you are so close to Epcot's international gateway and the Boardwalk and Fantasia golf course that it is a very pleasant stroll to any of these locations. There are lots of restaraunts at the hotel and within walking distance and lots of entertainment available right outside the hotel. They have nightly campfires on the beach and outdoor movies every night beside the beach. There are daily games played in the pool and lots of other activities at the hotel for children. You can truly enjoy yourself at the hotel without ever tackling an amusement park if that is your choice. We got a really great room deal during Disney's 40% off room promotion early in the year and the rates were very reasonable for the level of comfort this hotel offers. Don't hesitate to stay here if you are considering it.

Reviews.Title: “Water view units NOISEY from the ferry boats horn every few minutes”
Reviews.Author: Iselective
Reviews.Content: We didn't sleep through any of our nights in the villas. The incessant horn blowing eminating from the launch every few minutes until 1 hr after the park closes. That is 1am! Request for a room change, but none available. Overheard another guest w/same complaint. Tiny, tiny spiders in the bathroom, found one on my suitecase upon arriving home! The rest of the suite was clean. Beds hard, not comfortable. Never had an uncomfortable bed in a hotel before. Not enough towels here for # of people in the room. Location to Epcot and Animal Kingdom good w/launch. EPcot disappointing. Restaurants and trinkets. The rides were sold out on fast pass and 95 min waits at noon! Very crowded w/long lines. At Epcot, eat at Tutto Italia. Hard to get a reservation. Feels like Italy with the columns and murals on the walls. Upscale interior for Disney. Prices fair, portions large. AMAZING food and waiters. Flavors you'll never taste. Order the mixed green salad, the dressing is unbelievable! Pasta is so tasty. Didn't like the snapper. We all also thought concierge was distant and didn't help with restaurant selections. We called the 800 cust service to assist. Front desk were pleasant enough. Not warm or fuzzy. Andy was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Beach Club - The Truth”
Reviews.Author: PWPres
Reviews.Content: Back with another review of yet another Disney resort. Check out my reviews AKL/Poly/Saratoga Springs/Pop Century. Ok folks this is the truth from a normal person like yourself and not some lady complaining Mickey Mouse hugged the kid at the next table but not her kid..lol. Beach Club was clean and elegant and the staff were friendly(not overly friendly but perfectly proffesional and nice). The resort is a quiet place at a lot of times and this is saying something because spring break was pretty crowded this year. The location is unbeatable as you can walk to EPCOT and the Boardwalk. Storm-a-long Bay pool as better than advertised , kids and i had a blast and never felt cramped. The room was spacious compared to other Disney resorts and it was spotless. The beds were extremely comfortable(you melt away in those BC beds)..Now i will tell you about some snags we had. Got there at 9 am and the resort gave us a choice of taking a room that was ready or waiting for a better location. We went to the ready room and it was a mile away from the lobby and the view was a rooftop. We decided that we would grin and bear it and take the room. We were all tired and the view wasn't that important to us. The resort knew we had 5 people but the room had no pull out chair for a 5th sleeper. They sent a roll away up for us. Another head scratcher was that housekeeping only left 4 towels a day for a room with 5 people??? We notified the desk and the mousekeeper about this the first day but still got the same thing. We called for a DVD player that was supposed to be in the room at 8 am..................they brought it up at (get this) 11 pm??. So the truth is the Beach Club service may need a little attention. The bell desk guys were great though and the pool staff were the best. This is a beautiful resort and it is very well lit. We enjoyed our stay here and would recommend it to you......... P.S. don't miss Beaches and Cream but remember that if you use the dining plan it counts as a table service(something we surprisingly didn't know).

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but the employees need an Attitude Adjustment”
Reviews.Author: Sherpa_Guy
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, the rooms were fine, the food was ok.. the location was good, and the pool was great! BUT, the people working at the resort, (and many in Disney World) were not very happy people. I found most of the front desk staff, and especially the concierge desk almost at the point of being rude. It did not make me feel welcome there at all. One of the guys at the Conceirge desk (Dave?) was very rude to us - I thought maybe he was having a bad day, but I found most of the staff in Front Desk and Concierge not very accomodating... The cleaning staff were all very nice and pleasant, and the pool staff were great... but the rest, I'd like to forget. Otherwise, we had a nice trip!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, Gorgeous,Worth it”
Reviews.Author: gg67ful
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Beach Club Resort was an unforgettable one! Service was friendly and wait was only about five to ten minutes for transportation. I would really recommend this resort is you want to visit epcot.Its only a view steps away. I really thought my teenagers would be bored staying at the hotel but the amenities the pool kept my kids busy and happy. We will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: fourbirds_11
Reviews.Content: Great family spot for any Disney dream vacation. Best pool in Disney (plan for extra pool time), 5 minute walk to Epcot, 15 minute walk to Hollywood Studios, quick shuttles to Magic Kingdom, Animal Kingdom and waterparks. Room was large and clean. Marketplace has excellent quick service food items, the is an amazing 1950's like ice cream and burger shop and Cape May Cafe has an excellent seafood buffet. The pool area is incredible with life guards every 20 feet watching the pool like hawks and a ton of fun for the kids. Service was friendly and attentive. Price is on higher end but well worth the extra dollars. Love this place and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Disney at its Best!”
Reviews.Author: Euro_101
Reviews.Content: Second time staying at this resort - just as suberb as the first - and we came with high expectations! All were met. Rooms are great - very clean. The resort has a charm to it - very quaint and lovely. It is literally a 5-10 minute walk to Epcot's back door (aka International Gateway), depending on where your room is. It is about a 20min walk to Hollywood Studios or a 15 to 20 min boat ride. Very conveinent to both parks. The buses to/from the MK and AK are also great. We never had any problems taking Disney's transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Convenient,Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Verbelly
Reviews.Content: We spent our last three nights here after a nine night stay at the Pop Century which is noisy, full of lines, and still very friendly! It was a "vacation from our vacation" and allowed us to go home refreshed and rested from our "theme park mania". The perfect spot to sleep-in, sit in the sun, and take leisurely walks through the Boardwalk and Epcot. The Marketplace needs expanding! Mornings there are crazy and detract from the overall peaceful nature of this resort. Cast members were wonderfully helpful throughout our stay. We have been to WDW close to thirty times and offer this as our best advice: Stay in a value resort when you are "living" in the theme parks ten or twelve hours a day. Stay at the Beach Club when you are able to enjoy the resort itself for more than a quick dip in the pool.

Reviews.Title: “This resort made me feel like a new person with all the perks & total relaxation”
Reviews.Author: Bea12312
Reviews.Content: Could not do enough to make our club level adventure a great one. The atmosphere and the attention we received made the tension I had upon arrival vanish away. Would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a getaway of your choice. Could be a adventureous one to total relaxation with all the atmosphere of the holidays included.

Reviews.Title: “Great Atmosphere, Amazing Location!”
Reviews.Author: aburke
Reviews.Content: LOVE the Beach Club! This is one of Disney's best -- great theming, amazing location, and just the right atmosphere for a stay at Disney. You feel like you're on vacation the minute you walk through the door! DON'T MISS: Stormalong Bay; quick strolls to Epcot, Boardwalk; super comfy beds; Beaches N Cream; people watching in the lobby; great decor; Cape May Buffet; evening movies on the beach; fun-for-all-ages arcade; Disney magic throughout! COULD BE BETTER: Marketplace (quick service dining/shop) -- could offer more options, should be open 24/7; some noise bleed from other rooms (a problem at most Disney hotels)

Reviews.Title: “Too dated for our taste”
Reviews.Author: soonertourist
Reviews.Content: Two in our party are young teens (13 years old) and they loved the pool area. Unfortunately, our first 2 days in Orlando were in the 30s and 40s! They really enjoyed the arcade, the ice cream parlor, and the proximity to the parks. We arrived in the afternoon, and the 13 year olds were out the door figuring out the transportation system for themselves (both boat and bus) within 20 minutes! My husband, best friend, and myself, enjoyed the hotel's location. The service at Disney is amazing! The mattresses were much more comfortable than those at Hard Rock Resort by Universal Studios. We even had a view of Epcot's fireworks display at 9:30 pm every night. However, the hotel room is just a hotel room. We paid $349/night, and I've stayed in much nicer places for that amount. The upholstery and linens are very beachy and heavy. Our main complaint was that the seafood restaurant downstairs smelled AWFUL! They serve breakfast in the same space, but the seafood restaurant was so malodorous that there is no way I would eat ANY meal in that space. Also, I may be a steak snob, but their steakhouse was just okay. I would recommend this hotel to travelers who are visiting in warmer weather, and who wish to stay close to Epcot's entrance and the Boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect five days.”
Reviews.Author: lblackman
Reviews.Content: We had the good fortune of staying on the Club level at the Beach Resort. It was fantastic!! The concierge met us at the front door, and took us up to the fifth floor. We sat down for a leisurely check in, and then helped ourselves to wonderful snacks. Our room had a problem with water on the balcony, so they moved us immediately. Every time we returned to our floor, we were greeted with smiles, and questions. It was better than coming home!! We found treats in our room every day including towel animals, a welcome poster, and candy. Whenever we needed help or assistance, the concierge staff was fantastic. (We had already established all dining reservations). Due to the cost, we will not be able to return for several years, but it was worth it!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel with outstanding location”
Reviews.Author: kkmengland
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Beach Club during the Mickey marathon weekend because it’s walking distance to Epcot and Hollywood Studios. Overall, my experience staying at this hotel was good, but I can’t give it more than 4 stars due to the inefficiency of the front desk staff. Pros: The room was very clean, the beds were extremely comfortable, the room was quiet, the staff was friendly, and it was easy to check our luggage when our room wasn’t ready at check-in. Also, the grounds, pool, and lobby are gorgeous! Cons: The room décor is a bit tired; rust stain on the vanity and peeling wallpaper and no room safe which surprised me since this hotel is a deluxe. Also, check in was a disaster even though I checked in online! There were a ton of employees around to talk to, but only 2 working the front desk and it took 30 minutes to find out that our rooms weren’t ready. Then, when we can back later that evening, our keys didn’t even work and this time the front desk only had 1 person working and another 30 minute line. The keys were fixed, but 2 days later they stopped working again so I got to experience the inefficient front desk a 3rd time. Despite the cons, I would stay at the Beach Club again simply for the location and the comfort of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “THIS IS A GREAT DISNEY RESORT!”
Reviews.Author: ThePerryParty
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a girls week away...and had a wonderful time! The rooms were very clean, the staff very friendly, our beds very comfy, and our location very quiet! I have stayed at SEVERAL Disney resorts...this one and Animal Kingdom Lodge are my favorites! I would definitely recommend this resort to anyone...with or without kids!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and wonderful service, but the rooms were very disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: GRWTravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is charming and has a beautiful lobby, front area, and beach area on the lake. It is extremely close to the Epcot gate (5 minutes walking), which we enjoyed and took advantage of. My only real problem with this hotel is that it is overpriced for the condition of the rooms, and the rooms do not designate this as anywhere near a "RESORT" hotel. We could EASILY hear loud conversations coming from 1) the adjacent room to ours, 2) the hallway, and 3) the outside courtyard and balconies. I personally was awakened about 6-7 times in the 4 nights we stayed there late at night or very early in the morning. The walls and doors are extremely thin, and the furniture is extremely average in the rooms for the price we paid. Also, there was consistenly a humid, "musty" feeling and smell to our room, and we had to prop the door open every time we came back in order to get some fresh air into the room. The bathroom was so small that we had to close the door first in order to move around the toilet to the shower. We enjoyed our stay, but we would never pay that much money again to stay here (we got a great "winter" deal, and I still felt like we paid too much). The hotel: wonderful. The rooms: very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “My FAVORITE Disney Hotel”
Reviews.Author: klytia
Reviews.Content: The Beach Club (and adjoining Yacht Club) is my absolute favorite hotel on Disney property. Here's why: Location: you can get to any of the parks so easily from this resort! It's within walking distance to EPCOT, via the world showcase gateway. You can take a boat to Hollywood Studios and of course there are busses to any of the other parks. Resort: The rooms are lovely, the beach theme throughout the hotel is perfectly whimsicle but the BEST part is...the pool. The resort pool, shared by the Yacht Club is definitely one of the biggest at Disney outside their water parks. A half sunked ship, from the top of which is a pretty long water slide into the pool, a lazy river, whirlpool, "quicksand"...who needs the park when you have a pool like this?! Food: THe food here is pretty tasty and there's a very yummy steakhouse next door at the Yacht Club. But the best restaurants are in EPCOT so make your reservations there and enjoy an easy, short walk back to your room afterwards.

Reviews.Title: “The Beach Club Saved Us”
Reviews.Author: Tink3
