Reviews.Content: Disney Beach Club was Plan B when we had our Puerto Rico trip cancelled due to snow in Philly. We could not get out anywhere in the Caribbean so the next best thing was Disney Beach Club Resort. We have been to Disney around 7 times…. 5 of which we stayed in the Disney area at the Contemporary three times, Polynesian once, Port Orleans once and this time the Disney Beach Club. We were very pleased and surprised being last minute to book at how nice and accommodating the Beach Club was and we actually liked the location better then the Contemporary and Polynesian. The Beach Club was fast to check us in and set us up with our passes and off to the room where our bellman Mike informed us of all the short cuts and must knows about the Beach Club. The staff was very accommodating, our room was always clean with new towels every day and the beds were comfortable. I actually loved the size of the room and the separate vanity area to get ready in the morning. It had a little refrigerator and nice drawer space so we were very happy. We had a ground floor room so it was so easy just going out the door to a path that led right to Epcot and the Boardwalk area so it was a convenient location for us. I can’t believe how easy it was to walk right into Epcot which was nice on New Year’s Eve. I also found the pool area to be the best in the Disney area. They have a quiet pool for the Beach Club with hot tub and then a huge share pool that both the Yacht Club and Beach Club share which is awesome. It has huge slides and a ship wreck boat and lots of nice little areas and coves. You can have lunch right by it and drinks as well. The Beach Club also had their own little beach area with lots of lounge chairs to give you that beach feeling. We did all the parks which I found to be very crowded, but what do you expect on a holiday week, right? In the Magic Kingdom we only had the opportunity to do 4 rides in 6 hours and on our Hollywood Studios Day we actually only did 2 rides in 5 hours. It was fine for us since we have been to Disney numerous times but I would be upset if it was my first time. We were able to do what we wanted to do and then just take our time and enjoy the parks. On New Year’s Day we ventured over to Universal and found that park to be less crowded which was a strategy of mine thinking everyone had a late night the night before. We were able to walk right into the Harry Potter Village and do the rides all within 10 minutes. We heard that days before they had to have crowd control just to get into Harry Potter and special tickets were given out telling you a time in which you can enter. We lucked out on this. We were a bit upset about how this park is run. They do not seem to have as many employees as Disney to help guide you. My kids did the Hulk ride at Island of Adventure and when they were getting into their cart to ride they were told they had to put their backpack on the side. There were other backpacks sitting there. When they got off the ride the backpack was gone. They asked for the attendant to call security and the reply was “There is nothing security can do for you.” We went to a nearby concession stand and told them and they were quick to call security for us. It took approximately 30 minutes for a security officer to show up and he did not seem that concerned just took us to lost and found to report it. So…..my son’s girlfriend lost her ID, Disney Card, checkbook, bank card, both their cell phones and a camera and we spent the rest of the day checking lost and found and reporting things stolen. This ruined our day and not much concern at all from the park which I know would never have happened at a Disney Park. So, we decided to do the one ride at the Universal side of the park the boys wanted to do. The new rollercoaster that plays music as you ride. After a 2 1/12 hour wait for the ride (you cannot fast pass it) the ride broke down and my guys never got to ride it. No special pass tickets for those who waited that long…nothing. So back to the resort for us. When we arrived at the Beach Club and reported what happened they were very concerned. They took my son and girlfriend in a back room and showed them how to fill out a report for the police which will get her on the plane to come home. They got her a new safe key within no time and at no charge (it said if you lose your safe key there is a 30.00 charge) and cancelled and replaced her Disney Card to enter parks which was also a charge card within the Disney area. I can’t say enough how wonderful they were at the Disney Beach Club Resort. I would highly recommend the Disney Beach Club to anyone. I do want to add that we did the Disney Magical Express on this trip which I really liked. The best part was when leaving we checked our bags at the resort and never saw them again until we got home. We were able to get our boarding passes and leave our bags right at the resort and when we got to the airport we headed right through security. This was a wonderful experience and I would recommend taking it but did know that when arriving at Disney to bring your bags on the bus with you because it could take up to 3 hours to arrive in your room. If you don’t care because you are going right to the park then go for it but if you arrive later that day and want to unpack and relax until dinner…..don’t do it.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful week”
Reviews.Author: Cruella10861
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at The Beach Club, although I have stayed at other Epcot resorts. I cannot fault the staff or service. This was our delayed honeymoon, and did not disappoint.Friends had orderd flowers for our room, which were delivered just 2 minutes after our arrival, and I had arranged for the Disney florist to put a Christmas tree in our room. This was delivered and collected to be forwarded to us at home at exactly the agreed time. Yes, it is extravagant but I feel it was well worth the money and will be a permanent reminder of the trip. We did feel that we were the only people in Walt Disneyworld who were not on the dining plan! However, we wanted to retain some flexibility and it was easy to eat at The Yacht Club for breakfast or dinner. The reservations we had made - California Grill, Candlelight Processional and Character Breakfasts went without a hitch. However, I do recommend that if you MUST eat at a partcular venue you book as soon as you make your hotel reservation.It was difficult to get same day bookings or walk ins. The parks were busier than in previous years at this time of year (my favourite for visiting) but still not overcrowded. Mickey's Very Merry Christmas Party was again well organised. Housekeeping at the hotel was second to none. Our maid left us a new animal (made from towels every day). A nice touch. We chatted with the lady (Jacqueline) and she was a delight. Service at Cape May Cafe was also superb. My husband was unable to find asparagus on the buffet and, within 2 minutes of mentioning this to our server,tere was a plate of steaming hot asparagus, just for him.She also took photographs of us with the characters without being asked. Unfortunately I cannot be certain if her name, but I think it may have been Susan. All in all a perfect trip. Thank you. Just a footnote, not about Disney. It is well worth taking a trip to ICE at the Gaylord Palms for half a day.

Reviews.Title: “No coffee”
Reviews.Author: faduck
Reviews.Content: After staying at Beach Club resort for 10 days I would not stay there again. We ran out of hot water in showers, had very noisy neighbors, because as it turns out the double doors between us was the issue. Not insulated! Had attitude from the girl at the pool house about what time we could get a life jacket and tube rental had no check in and out privileges if you wanted for example to go in for lunch. To top it off, I need my java for start-up and the only place to get it was as best hit and miss. I don't do room coffee. Anywho it's supposed to be magical and the park was. Just not the resort, sorry to say.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not "all that"”
Reviews.Author: brlmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 8 d, 7n from 12/1-12/8 for a family vacation. I will start by saying that for $340 a night and Disney, my expectations were high. It was a great trip, and a good stay, but there are definate pros and cons. First off, Beach Club is lovely in appearance. Everything was decorated for Christmas and couldn't have been prettier. The gingerbread carousel in the lobby is something to see! Magical express was flawless-no issues there. Our bags arrived just over an hour after we checked in. We did online check in, which was a very good thing. The front desk experience was so-so, with the clerk having a VERY strong accent (hubs couldn't understand what he was saying at all). Service was fine, but certainly not stellar. We got lucky in that our room was ready when we checked in at 1100, so we went right there. Bell services was very helpful and quick to respond. The room was spacious for our familiy of 5 (especially liked the day bed), the beds were comfy, and the sink area was nice. The toilet/shower area was TINY, though and the water pressure in the showers was ridiculously poor. Be advised, the walls are paper thin and sound pours under the doors from anyone passing by at any hour. Mousekeeping was OK, but a little hit or miss. I really would have expected better with a hotel this expensive. One small complaint I have is the overwhelming odor of stinky seafood from the Cape May buffett that permeates the floors above. It seems to stay in the hallways, but its kind of gross. The pool area was awesome, but it was too cold for us to experience it this trip. Location was fantastic. Being that close to Epcot was great, as it is one of our favorite parks. If you have the Dining plan, it expands your eating options vastly, as the food in all the other parks is terrible and counter service is essentially non-existant within the hotel. The Marketplace is an OK option for a quick snack or small breakfest, but got a little old after a few days. It is also busy busy in the am. We did eat over at Yacht Club at the Yachtsman Steakhouse (me and hubby-no kids), which I would highly recommend. Quite expensive, though. Knowing that this is Disney and highway robbery is par for the course, the Beach Club is a good place to stay, but not a good value AT ALL. If this hotel were anywhere else, there is NO WAY anyone would spend $340/night to stay there. I had very high expectations for customer service, but it was merely average. All that said, we would probably stay here again for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Pool, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: chaplo
Reviews.Content: We visited this Disney property just after Thanksgiving, and enjoyed our stay very much. The pool was awesome, dining options were good (for disney) and the accomodations were nice. We were on the first floor facing the lake, near the small (quiet) pool, which while quiet, but did have a musty smell. Walked to Epcot - very doable even with 6 and 8 year olds, however walking back from Disney MGM Studios was LONG and not appropriate for two little ones (we walked because there was a long line for the boat, a mistake). Have stayed at Animal Kingdom Lodge, Wilderness Lodge, and Beach Club is on the same level of quality and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Beach Club, best Disney has to offer”
Reviews.Author: sweetfan99
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from the Beach Club, Nov 13-20th, and were traveling with two children ages 5 and 2.5. We had a 2 bedroom villa. We love staying here because we get the hopper pass and go to Epcot nearly every night for dinner and/or fireworks, and from the villa building it's about a 200 yard walk. We also walked to Hollywood studios twice. I have read complaints about the buses; this I don't get. We went to the MK twice, and waited about 3 minutes each time for a direct 10 minute bus ride to the front gate. What more could you want? The only "slow" trip was the bus to the Animal Kingdom, which we waited 15 minutes for and then it made one stop at a water park. The pool is great, the rooms are nice and the service is always good. My only complaint is that the time went too quickly. Our kids had a blast. We took a ton of pictures, and we always keep notes on everything we do (restaurants, what days we went to what park and how the crowds were, etc...), so please don't hesitate to contact me if you are interested in more info. We have stayed at this hotel several times, and like it the best of the places we've stayed (Grand Floridian, Polynesian).

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Spot for a Grown-Up Disney Trip!”
Reviews.Author: elbodans
Reviews.Content: This was, hands down, the best hotel I've ever had the opportunity to experience. We travel a lot, and I'm not very picky (I also really liked our one night at the super-cheap Hampton Inn Lake Buena Vista). The place was beautiful, and had everything anyone could possibly want--a beautiful lobby, great sitting areas (some quiet and blissfuly child-free), a giant pool complex, a smaller pool and jacuzzi deemed 'quiet' where no children ventured (which is GREAT in a place like Disney) and what must be the best location of all of the resorts. I've never really wanted to go to Disney--I was afraid of lots of screaming children--but this place made me want to return. There is a man in the lobby who, from what I could tell, is employed solely to tell people to 'have a magical day'. How great is that? As was mentioned in several reviews, the bus service to the parks is annoying--I had to wait almost 45 minutes for a bus from the magic kingdom, and it does stop multiple times--but I imagine this is true for all resorts. In the future, I'd rent a car. But as annoying as the shuttles are, you only need them for two of the four parks--you can walk to Hollywood Stuidos, and Epcot is LITERALLY right next door. We had a first floor room with a patio, and could walk directly out of our room onto a path that led to Epcot that was maybe 200 yards away--it literally took 3 minutes to walk there. I hope that some day I can return. An important note: I stayed at the Beach Club this past week for a convention. Because of this, I got the convention rate, which is less than the normal rate--and half of THAT was paid for by my husband's work (as he was also going to the convention)--we paid for 'my half'. This is why my 'value' rating was low--because it really is QUITE expensive. my 'hope' that we can return is based upon price--we may not ever be able to. But if you can afford it, DEFINITELY book this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location with a couple of flaws”
Reviews.Author: chuck2222
Reviews.Content: We rented a two-bedroom suite for parents, grand-parents and a three-year-old. Excellent location to Epcot. You will spend the better part of an hour to reach the Magic Kingdom or Animal Kingdom. Pretty beach and extensive swimming pools. We found the service to be friendly and accommodating. Check-in was smooth. Plenty of staff to answer questions and give directions. The furnishings were a step downscale from a Ritz or Four Seasons. The hotel offered the opportunity to check-in our suitcases at the airport and they went straight to our room. We liked this feature. My two complaints are: 1.) No in-room WiFi and a $10 daily charge for Internet access, and 2.) weak line-up of cable TV channels -- no Fox News, Animal Planet, History, but every other channel promotes a Disney revenue stream. Given the high price of the hotel, the lengthy time to reach the Magic Kingdom and these two flaws, I will take a look at some off-campus hotels for my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & awesome travel agent”
Reviews.Author: travling4work
Reviews.Content: I recently decided to go to Walt Disney World for the food & wine festival, however I waited until very late to make this decision, so finding a room was a little difficult. I contact Travel on a Dream agency asking for a good rate at a hotel near Epcot. She was able to secure a waterfront view room for the last weekend of F&W. A few days later Disney announced an A/P discount and she was able to get my rate reduced before I even knew about the new discount. Our room was not available when we arrived, however, we were given our keys and received a text with our room number around 3:00. Our room was not too far from the elevators and overlooked the beach. We could see the lighthouse from our room, it was very pretty. We could walk to Epcot, which made it so easy to attend the festival. We also made use of the boat transportation to Hollywood Studio's, it was pretty quick but we did have to wait for a second boat due to the crowds heading over to see the Osborn Family Lights, spectacular as always. I would say one other thing about our TA, as noted, I waited until late to make these bookings. I decided the week before that we wanted to attend the 3D dessert party and our TA was able to get us reservations at the last minute.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the bucks”
Reviews.Author: ncitalian4
Reviews.Content: This is a very pretty and clean resort. Great location also, but the bus rides are tremendously long to everywhere. so many stops. and most of the time the busses were very crowded. The front desk staff was "okay" but nothing we did in advance to help expedite our check in helped. It was as if we did nothing in advance. Check in takes way too long. The pool is disgusting in the warm months. It's heated YEAR ROUND. the temp in the pool was hotter than bath water in june and we couldn't bear to be in it. it was yucky. not refreshing at all. the games they have for the kids poolside are great tho. The gentleman leading them when we were there had a very thick accent and all the children had trouble understanding his directions. the food was "okay" but way overpriced. esp Cape May. What a rip off. the food was "fine" nothign special, but the price was way high. Not worth the bucks. the gift shop was very frustrating b/c more than 1/2 of the food products are not priced. and the employees running the registers don't know the prices either. they have to scan the item. very frustrating for them also. the location of this was the best and it's quicker to walk to the boardwalk than to take the boats. The rooms are nice, but there is no where to change clothes in privacy. the "potty closet" barely has room to stand, much less change clothes. We would never stay here again. I would try a less expensive resort b/c if you have small children you are in your room very very little. I also was not impressed with the "Salon" on this property. They didn't answer the phone and didn't return phone calls. The workers were all but rude. Not friendly like you would expect from a high priced Resort Salon. Spend the money elsewhere. And please don't misunderstand. We had a great trip, fun time and the hotel is very nice. Maybe for a couple w/ no kids it would be more worthy. The best part of this property was the Steakhouse (they cure their own meat and you can see their curing room). Food, service and atmosphere was the total package there. I would eat there even if not staying in that resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool and terrible service”
Reviews.Author: pjflickinger
Reviews.Content: The pool was fantastic. Unfortunately, the service from front desk was terrible. I kept having issue after issue and the front desk was interested in doing little more than giving excuses. They did not give apologies or go beyond in any way. I think this hotel is very poorly managed. I emailed WDW (at the high level) and got a pretty generic response. The kids happy, but the dad was not.

Reviews.Title: “Best Pool for children and adults”
Reviews.Author: mgbeer
Reviews.Content: My family just stayed at the Disney Beach Club and have the best stay ever. The pool is by far the best pool you will ever find at any hotel. The sand bottom pool for younger children is full of family activities all day long. The cast members keep the children entertained throughout the day! The Rooms are beautiful and clean and bright and cheery! We will only stay at the Beach Club when traveling to Disney!

Reviews.Title: “This is my favorite of all the Disney Hotels.”
Reviews.Author: PhiladelphiaMicromom
Reviews.Content: We went for our anniversary and they upgraded us to the concierge level. The Beach Club is a beautiful hotel. The swimming pool is the best. The room and service was great. Disney knows how to make a special occasion truly special. It is an easy walk to Epcot. We enjoyed just staying at the hotel because it was so nice.

Reviews.Title: “All around lovely resort...”
Reviews.Author: rockmama12052
Reviews.Content: My husband was attending an annual business conference being held at Disney, so my son (9 yrs) and I flew down for a four night stay. Looking back on it now, I wish we'd spent more time enjoying the resort and not spent every day in a park. The pools were just outstanding. They have two "quiet" pools (one at end of Beach Club's property--another at end of Yacht Club's) that are open 24 hrs and have hot tubs. The large recreation pool was open from 10am-10pm and had plenty of lifeguards on duty. One of the main features was a huge pirate ship that contained a water slide that emptied across the beach path and into the pool. Very cool! The property set up is very convenient...with the Yacht and Beach Clubs basically sharing all the amenities, you get twice the restaurant choices, etc. There is an arcade/ice cream shop in the middle that we enjoyed at night. If you like they have show family movies on the "beach" every night and you can see the fireworks from Epcot. We received a first floor suite with separate bedroom and sitting area and a small, oustide sitting area/patio Rooms were extremely clean, bedding and mattresses VERY comfy--received turn down service with chocolates every night. I initially was concerned with us being on the first floor about noise, but we had no issues at all. We visit Disney every year anywhere from once to three times. I have not stayed in every resort as of yet, but many of them. My long running favorite is still Animal Kingdom Lodge, but this resort ran a VERY close 2nd.! The location very convenient, especially if you are visiting Epcot (5 min walk to rear gate). We did hotel buffet at night (Cape May Cafe) which was the seafood dinner. I found it to be just average...however, be aware that this seemed to be consistent throughout Disney. The quality has suffered from what I've come to experience in past years, and I'm not sure how much of it is due to just plain ole cutting back--or because Disney is giving away their dining plan free to everyone that books resort packages! But food aside...I would definitely not hesitate to stay at either the Beach or Yacht Club resorts. They have many more things to do than I've touched on here...just be sure to build in some "down" time from the parks so you can utilize what we were missing!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort! Wouldn't stay anywhere else!!! A+++++++++++++”
Reviews.Author: TimmyB23
Reviews.Content: Here’s the deal, A LOT of reviewers for this resort seem to nitpick or are high maintenance, or both! ;-) You’ll see comments about how far away their room was from the elevator/front lobby; folks, it’s Disney World, you are going to do A LOT of walking (p.s. The rooms aren't that far from the lobby/elevator)! You’ll see comments about how cramped the bathroom was; how much time are you spending in a bathroom to notice that there is ½-inch clearance between the door and the toilet as you close the door? I may take the time to mention something like that IF the door DIDN’T close. Geesh people!! If your household income isn’t in the seven figures, this resort is AWESOME, stop reading and go book your trip! We are a family of three; two adults (in our early 40’s) and a seven year old. We stayed at the Beach Club Resort Oct 11 – 18; standard room (room # 3583). We overlooked a courtyard with a sand volleyball court. Check-in: We took advantage of the online check in, and arrived at 9:30am on the 11th. The entire check-in process at the hotel took approximately one minute; and much to my surprise, we were told that our room was ready. Room #3583: Nice room, décor was beach themed (big surprise, huh?). Two queen sized beds and a day bed. Small fridge, flat screen TV, plenty of storage for clothes, two sinks and a small balcony that 2 people can stand on and overlook the courtyard. The beds were incredibly comfortable, as were the sheets (no idea of thread count) and the comforter. I cannot speak to the “noise” from the hallway that other people have mentioned, as we travel with a sound therapy machine (we use “waterfall”), so we don’t hear anything. Stormalong Bay (pool): Awesome. Incredible. Outstanding. Unbelievable. Stunning. Not to build it up too much, but it is pretty cool! Sand bottom + waterslide + lazy river + three Jacuzzis = 3 acres of fun! No matter the ages of the people in your party, if they like pools, they will like this one! We never had a problem finding a place to sit. PLENTY of lounge chairs and clean dry towels. Bus Transportation: Just a short walk from the main entrance of the hotel is where the buses stop for transportation to the parks (the water parks included). Our expectations were met for our journies to the Magic Kingdom and Animal Kingdom; a short wait and we were on a short ride to our destination. We were on a vacation, so we weren’t looking at our watches timing every aspect of the bus experience; but our experience was acceptable. I suppose you could drive your own car; but we didn’t want to rent a car and pay $12 a night to park at the resort and then drive to the parks, pay to park, find parking, and then walk to the entrance. The buses never made a stop after picking us up at the Beach Club resort, and they dropped us off near the entrance of the parks. Slick as snot! Access to Epcot/Hollywood Studios: The Resort is a mere 5-minute walk from the resort to the International Gateway Entrance at Epcot, and an easy 15-minute walk to Hollywood Studios along a nicely maintained walkway. We walked to Hollywood Studios 6-8 times; and we either arrived before the boat that we would have taken, or shortly thereafter. I’d definitely suggest walking back to the resort from Hollywood Studios if there is a line for the boat. Beach: Every night at 8pm the resort inflates a big movie screen and plays a DVD for families. Our son loved watching movies at the beach while playing in the sand. I grabbed some fish and chips from Epcot and we all had a great time. I believe on Saturday nights(but it may be every night) they have a campfire prior to the movie and make smores! Food: There are a few places to eat on site. We had two meals at Cape May’s (a buffet style restaurant near the main lobby of the hotel) and 3 or 4 meals at Hurricane Hannah’s (counter service near the pool). No complaints for either location. Good food, fast service and seated immediately. If you make the short walk across to the Boardwalk; there are other restaurants there (we only ate at the ESPN Zone on the Boardwalk). Concierge: Simply awesome! They can assist in securing reservations (or even canceling them if you cannot use an ADR) and have answers to any questions that you may have! It’s an outstanding resort, look for special deals and then plan your trip! Three days into our trip my wife said “I am never staying offsite again, this place is incredible!” If you don’t already know; by staying at a Disney resort, you are eligible to access different parks on different days using Disney’s “Extra Magic Hours”.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely themed, EPCOT-close resort”
Reviews.Author: pillowsofwanderlust
Reviews.Content: I came to Orlando to attend a convention, and chose to split our stay between this Disney property and a Universal Studios hotel (Portofino Bay--see separate review) so as to more easily access the theme parks in my free time. The Beach and Yacht Club hotels, designed by Robert Stern, are separate, but joined by a corridor of restaurants and other shared facilities such as the main pool. They are 2 of the 5 hotels within walking distance to the International Gateway entrance to EPCOT (which is NOT the main entrance). The other EPCOT hotels are the Boardwalk Inn and Villas and the Swan (where I've stayed) and Dolphin, both whimsically designed by Michael Graves, and both affiliated with but not owned by Disney. The Disney Hollywood Studios park is accessible by boat or a not unpleasant 15 minute walk. The Beach and Yacht Clubs are considered Deluxe Disney resorts, as opposed to Moderate or Value resorts. These categories relate to extensiveness of decor and landscaping, sit-down restaurants vs. food courts, amenities, recreation, room size, price, and proximity to theme parks. The oyster gray-coloured Yacht Club, where I've stayed before, has a more sedate vibe than the light blue-coloured Beach Club, which seems more informal and family-oriented, in part because there is a light green -coloured Beach Club Villas building adjacent, on a patch of land where there used to be tennis courts. Part of the gift shop in the Beach Club has been converted into a mini-market/quick meal service restaurant, while the Yacht Club shop remains strictly a gift shop. The Yacht Club has a Club Level and a convention center. Each hotel has a small quiet pool, as does the villas, but they all share the large main pool complex, called Stormalong Bay, one of the most elaborately themed pools of any Disney resort. They use a wristband policy during busy times. There is also a beach and marina along the lake , where movies are shown at night, and campfire singalongs are held. We had rented a car, so the gate attendant asked for our name and gave us a parking pass. Self-parking is free, as is parking at any theme park with the pass. The parking attendant informed the entry host of our arrival, because they welcomed us by name and escorted us to the front desk. The room we were given met our basic needs but was not ideal. It was a ground floor room, so somewhat dark. The patio looked out onto a pathway people took to EPCOT, so privacy was lacking. It was near the beginning of a long corridor of rooms, so hallway noise was very audible through the door. Due to the building's configuration, our room was 3-4 feet shorter that most, so we did not have the sofa/daybed other rooms had. Thus, the only chair in the room was the desk chair. The desk does have a table on wheels beneath it that can serve as a dining/play table. Cute Mickey desk lamp. The sliding shelves and mini-fridge that once held the minibar are now barren, the better to fill with your own goods. The split bath had a roomy double sink area and a tiny shower-toilet room (apparently Disney is infamous for this)--the door comes to within less than an inch of the unoccupied toilet seat when closing. This being a very popular resort constantly filled with excited rambunctious children, conventioneers and foreign tourists, the room furnishings showed much wear and tear. The size of your balcony at the Beach Club varies with floor level; the Yacht Club balconies seem to be of more uniform size. The Y & B Clubs have 3 sit-down restaurants (one is a clambake), a classic soda fountain, and a quick-serve place by the pool. There are 2-3 lounges, and also the dining options at the Boardwalk, Swan and Dolphin. Food Network Iron Chef Cat Cora has a newish restaurant at the Boardwalk. We frequented the soda shop twice, but frankly did a lot of eating at EPCOT, where the annual Food and Wine Festival was being held. Many countries have little food pavilions set up around the World Showcase, offering a selection of small tastes, plus wines and alcohol. Delicious--and withing walking distance. Overall a nice hotel, with lots to keep families occupied even if you don't go to a park. But easy access to 2 parks is the biggest draw, because this is rather rare--I can only think of the Contemporary Resort being within walking distance to the Magic Kingdom, although the Grand Floridian (where I have also stayed) and Polynesian have easy monorail access. Any of the EPCOT resorts are worth considering for this fact alone.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever”
Reviews.Author: bkohler
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 6 night stay at Disney's Beach Club Resort. If you have young children, shell out and stay here. The sand bottom pool is enormous and so much fun for the kids. It's huge and winds all through the pool area. Huge water slide for the kids was awesome as well. The white sandy beach is perfect for sandcastles or just chilling out and getting a tan. Every night there is a campfire for the kids and huge movie screen showing a different Disney movie. The kids loved it. Staff was overly friendly and the concierge service was a huge help for making last minute reservations. Stay here if you can. NO complaints at all!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: nickynash
Reviews.Content: We were so lucky to be upgraded to club level. However, having said that, we've stayed before and not been upgraded so I can comment on everything. The hotel is beautiful, friendly, clean and just lovely. Walking distance to Epcot and Hollywood Studios. Or great transport system to all the Disney theme parks. Lovely "quiet" pool, but also a fantastic larger pool with a slide, whirlpool, jacuzzi, and sandy bottom! I love it here.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Family Location”
Reviews.Author: JSB9365
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic! Walking distance to Epcot, a boat ride away from Universal Studios (which kids always enjoy). The pool was awesome, not only in size but with added features, like the sand in the pool and beach like area, the waterslide was a hit and was open to all ages! Pool side food and beverages were good, with very friendly wait staff. The rooms were decent in size and clean. The only downfall was the buses to The Magic Kingdom and Animal Kingdom never seemed to be there and ran longer than the 20 minutes in between buses.

Reviews.Title: “Magical hotel: Great location and pool”
Reviews.Author: andersmj3
Reviews.Content: We have small children (age 2 and 5) and this hotel was perfect for our visit to Disney. The pool has a zero depth sandy entry with an area perfect for kids not able to swim yet. They could build sand castles and splash around on their own. Also, there is a character meal onsite. The rooms are nice with a cute seaside motif. We just loved it and plan to go again. It is a short walk to Epcot (< 5 minutes) or the Boardwalk and there is a boat that goes to Hollywood Studios. Buses take you to the Magic Kingdom and Animal Kingdom.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jordyn429
Reviews.Content: Our room was very spacious...but the best part was the pool. In a word...awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded to Beach Club, but impressions vary”
Reviews.Author: kjb1976
Reviews.Content: We were switched to this resort via phone call about 5 hours prior to our arrival to Florida. I'm guessing due to overbooking at POFQ. We originally booked French Quarter so were ultimately given an upgrade. However, we were unfamiliar with the BC layout, so it became more of a hassle than it was worth. Yes, the resort is gorgeous, the proximity to EPCOT is amazing and very convenient, the pool area rivals no other on WDW property, and if you have money to spend, you are at the right place. We did not like how the resort was so large and spread out. Originally or rooms were far apart from each other and to the main elevators. We got this switched with some hassle the next day, due to my mom needing to be on the second level with her knee issues. The biggest complain was that the quick service food was very limited. Other than rolls and cereal, there were only 3 options for b-fast and only flat bread pizza or a few sandwiches for dinner/lunch. This was very disappointing as we depend on quick service for our b-fasts and for last minute and late night meals. It is located in a small area that gets swamped early morning for b-fast and those filling up mugs. The pool area is nothing short of spectacular and if you stay at this resort, budget 2-3 afternoons to spend here if you have children. The concierge and bell services were extremely helpful and accommodating. The front desk and housekeeping had a lot of mis-communication which resulted in us waiting a while for clean rooms upon our room switch. Bottom line: if money is not an issue, I would recommend staying here. If you are on a budget, you will get more bang for your buck at a WDW value or moderate.

Reviews.Title: “If I were a kid it would have 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: FeedTheMouse
Reviews.Content: I say this because the pool is a child's greatest fantasy. Truly amazing. But as an adult, I wanted to go hit the spa at night and found them all teaming with people. Generally that's my gripe - too many kids (I know I know, it's Disney), but our last stay was at the Grand Floridian and our next will be as well. That said, proximity to Epcot was amazing. And we love the restaurants at the Dolphin - dinner at Shula's was fantastic, albeit very pricy ($225 with tip, 2 cocktails each, no dessert). Check out the little pub next to the Yachtsman Steakhouse - a welcome cozy nook with a great burger. The lobby was a little crowded and busy and the service was not what we had at the GF. The tv was faulty and never fully fixed and we wanted to watch the Notre Dame game. The pub bartender didn't know if they'd be showing it and seemed unconcerned about the request. Just note quite the level of coddling you get at the GF, a beautiful facility and amazing pool and great for families more than couples.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: jdfunky2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked our first anniversary at Coronado Springs Resort. Three days prior to our trip, Disney called and said they were upgrading us to the Beach Club. All I can say is WOW and thanks! It was awesome. When we stepped off the Magical Express bus, we were greeted by name and escorted to the front desk for a quick and very easy check-in. This resort is ideal. Our room had a private balcony with a view of the beach. We could walk out the back door and take a short path right into Epcot. The Food & Wine Festival was spectacular. For anyone visiting during this event, be sure to pick up your "free" event passport at any Disney Vacation Club kiosk. It lists all the countries participating in the festival, the food items available and a space for a passport stamp. It was lots of fun and a great way to taste food from around the world. We would definitely stay at this resort again. It's convenient, clean, friendly with many dining options. It's definitely a thumbs up for us!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: dewybeach
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort from 9/26 to 10/1/10 and we can't wait to return! I can only describe our stay as "magical". The resort is breath-taking, beautiful pools with sand bottom, nice pool-side bar & grill "Hurricane Hanna's", and the rest I'll give some details. First of all we upgraded our room to concierge, club level. For a family of 4 it was worth every penny! We had a beautiful, large room with 2 queen beds and a daybed. We had plenty of room to walk around and didn't get into each other's space, very nice! Our 4 year old made a lot of "Ooh and ah" comments throughout the resort, too cute! We stayed on the 2nd floor and our balcony faced a private pool that is open until midnight, but they will let you stay later if you don't make noise. It also has a jacuzzi along side of it. The other pools close @ 10pm. The concierge service on the 5th floor was amazing. The staff will do anything to please you. The appetizers were tasty, everything from cheese, fruit, crackers and usually 2 hot appetizers like egg rolls, bacon wrapped scallops, quesadillas, stuff like that. 3 different wines to choose from, about 4 different beers, sodas and Evian bottled water. We usually brought beer, wine and appetizers back to our room when we were too tired to hang out in the lounge. The lounge is nice but it can become crowded especially around 5ish and at breakfast. There's a nice little area for kids with their own TV. My son's luggage was lost on arrival (because it did not have a Disney luggage slip/ tag on it). It was retrieved after following up more than 2x with the front desk. That's the only complaint we have. MAKE SURE YOU HAVE ENOUGH DISNEY LUGGAGE STRAPS/TAGS!!!! If not, request more way before your trip. It will save you a headache Ü Other than that we had a blast. We didn't want to leave but it's something to look forward to next vacation! We will DEFINITELY return to the Beach Club Resort. Oh and by the way, if you like steaks, fish and a beautiful aquarium atmosphere, you must try the Coral Reef Restaurant for dinner at Epcot. Awesome and delicious! The restaurant at the resort, Cape May Buffet, has a great selection for dinner. All in all I cannot imagine why anyone would complain about this resort other then the enjoyment of complaining.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but a little disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: sassyzback
Reviews.Content: I had been looking forward to staying here, but now I'm not sure we'll stay again. The pros: convenient 3-minute walk to EPCOT, beautiful setting, good storage, comfortable beds. The cons: Housekeeping was sketchy (taking soap and not replacing, not replacing coffee or cups), the bathroom is too small with only a centimeter clearance between the door and the toilet, poor quick-service dining (the Marketplace is just not adequate), musty smell in the room, no real sitting area in the room, no free wifi. Stormalong Bay pool is pretty, but it closes earlier than other WDW pools, so if you're out late at the park forget it. The lazy river is also 8 ft deep in some places, so a nonswimmer like my mother could not enjoy it. We found ourselves using the quiet pool close to our room often, however, because it was open 24 hrs. I would recommend this hotel only if you get a good rate like we did, which was 40% off the rack rate. Even with that, I'm not sure we will stay here again. We actually missed the Contemporary!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DBeth
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for 3 nights while attending a conference. The location and pool were amazing. The rooms were very roomy and the beds were comfy. Can't wait to return with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “WOW, 5 Star All the Way!!!!”
Reviews.Author: EleanorNovaScotia
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Disney's Beach Club Resort after spending a week there. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived so they upgraded us to a full Crescent Lake View room. This room (1561) also wasn't ready, so they put a rush on it for us. It was about 4:30 p.m. by now and we were tired after our long trip from Nova Scotia. For the inconvenience they credited us a $50 bonus to our account to use as we pleased, which we accepted. We were too tired to agrue anyway. The room is the perfect location - about 10 steps from the quiet pool, which we seniors appreciated. Directly is front of our patio doors was the most beautiful view of Crescent Lake with the sandy beach, swings and lounger chairs. About three minutes through the quiet pool area is the path for Epcot entrance. Everything was so close to our room it made it easy for everything we wanted to do at the hotel. My sister and her husband had room 4585 which they too loved because they wanted a full balcony. About 3 minutes in the other direction, up the beach from Crescent Lake is the boat launch for transportation to Hollywood Studios and The Boardwalk. You can also take the scenic route by boat to Epcot too if you want. The first night we had reservations at Cape May for dinner. The seafood buffet was truly amazing. I thought my brother-in-law and husband would sprout fins they ate so much fish. My sister and I stuck with the more traditional stuff, great soups, salads and roast beef as well. We had the Disney meal plan and truly had more food than we could possibly eat, especially at the table service meals which includes the buffet meals too. My one and only complaint which, after so much luxury, seems petty - is the MARGARINE they use in ALL Disney restaurants. I am not a fussy eater, but it really tastes like the cheap stuff they used in the early 1950's after the war to save money. I was really surprised Disney would use this stuff because it seems like such a small portion of the otherwise luxurious meals they have. If this bothers you too, I suggest taking a small container of your own brand butter or margarine. As with all Disney staff, DBC staff are all pleasant and accommodating. The lazy river and Storm-along-bay are a dream come true for kids who love the water. The large water slides complete the picture for them. We can't wait to go again. We should have listened to our neice who said "once you go to Disney's Beach Club Resort you will be spoiled for all other hotels bar none". For us this is true.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Disney Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: GoPenguins
Reviews.Content: It just dawned on me that I had never written a review of the Beach Club, even though I have stayed there five times, including three times in less than the past two years. My wife and I have stayed at other hotels at Disney, but we have stayed the most at the Beach Club because it has a number of advantages: 1. The hotel is in the EPCOT resort area. This means that you can walk to EPCOT, and take a short boat ride to Hollywood Studios. It is also within walking distance of numerous restaurants at the Beach Club and Yacht Club, at EPCOT, and at other hotels in the EPCOT area. Morevoer, we like to eat a big breakfast, and there is a breakfast buffet at the Cape May Cafe in the Beach Club, and also at the restaurant in the Yacht Club (you will definitely need reservations for the Cape May Cafe breakfast, as it is a character breakfast). 2. If you drive like we do, the Beach Club is a relatively short distance away from Animal Kingdom, Downtown Disney, and the miniature golf and water park locations. 3. The rooms are genarally big by Disney World standards, and are always clean. Moreover, Disney seems to have maintenance going on at all times, so nothing ever looks worn out or dated. 4. I am a bad sleeper, and yet I can sleep well in certain areas of the Beach Club. All of the rooms have relatively good inside soundproofing, and the beds and sheets are very comfortable, which is a good start to getting sleep no matter where you are. However, unlike many of the Disny hotels, the Beach Club has a quiet side, which is the side facing the trees between the Beach Club and EPCOT. It is also quiet in the area between the Beach Club and the Beach Club villas. 5. It shares a fantastic pool complex, Stormalong Bay, with the Yacht Club. It also has a quiet pool that is near the entrance to EPCOT. One drawback for couples is that the Becah Club has very few king rooms (I think only around a dozen rooms in the whole place), but we have been able to get a king room on two of our five trips there. The other drawback of the Beach Club, and any other deluxe Disney hotel for that matter, is price. The rack rate for its rooms will generally be more than $400 per night, which is why my wife and I have generally only stayed there when Disney is running a big discount program. The past couple of years we have gotten 40% off, and I would only stay on Disney property in the future if we can get a significant discount.

Reviews.Title: “Good first trip choice with young children”
Reviews.Author: relentlessjen
Reviews.Content: 1st good trip with my husband, 3 boys (4, 8 and 9) Location is great because we were a very short walk to Epcot and the boardwalk. The pool was fantastic and fun. A little pricey but worth the expense. Try to go in Aug where free dining is offered to cut costs. We considered a moderate choice for next trip but decided on staying here or Boardwalk hotel because of the location. Nice hotel!!! Cape May rest. was ok . The only thing is I did not like the size of my room..thought it would be a bit more larger.

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway...even without the theme parks.”
Reviews.Author: johnnymike
Reviews.Content: I've seen a lot of reviews lately complaining about the condition of the Beach Club, and I have to say that really wasn't my personal experience. I love the Yacht and Beach Club Resorts for the atmosphere, amazing pools, Beaches and Cream, Yachtsman Steakhouse and location next to Epcot. This time around, however, we stayed at the Beach Club just to experience the resort itself with no trips to the theme park and we were NOT disappointed. Lobby The grounds and lobby are magnificent. The cast members were attentive (no wait!) and everything looked spot on. Highly recommend online check in. Our room was immediately available and, after a little help with a broken door handle, discovered that we had been upgraded to a lagoon view room for free! Rooms Lots of different room types here....ours has two queen-sized beds and a pullout. The rooms have been updated in great fabrics and a flat-panel TV. We had our own balcony overlooking the garden, beach, and lake beyond. Great view. Plenty of space, great bathroom, fantastic beds, not too much noise from the hallway. Pool This is where we camped for the weekend. Despite a few changes (no more quicksand) the pool is still amazing after almost 20 years. Waterslide was great, plenty of sand to make sandcastles, and spent two easy afternoons getting sunburned. Also ordered two piña colavas (have to try them!) which were expensive but yummy and part of the beach experience. Beaches and Cream A great little soda shop complete with hamburgers, malts and a jukebox you can request songs from. Since we were the "guests of the day"...first ones in at 11 am...they upgraded our sundae to epic proportions. Great food, great atmosphere, very beachy and casual. A great lunch spot. Beach Club Marketplace Great place for grab and go food. Also free refills on the Disney resort mugs. Visited there often. Transportation Even though theme parks weren't our objective this trip we did decide to take advantage of extra magic hours late one night at Magic Kingdom. The MK is a bus ride away though on this trip we had NO WAIT for a bus on the way there or back. Amazing, I know, but there it is. Hollywood Studios is only a boat ride away and Epcot is the real winner within walking distance of the International Gateway entrance. Overall The Yacht and Beach Clubs are still among my favorite resorts at Disney. Less pretentious than the Grand Floridian but all the style and luxury. Best points: pool, location to theme parks. Obvious downside: cost. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent as always”
Reviews.Author: claire0208
Reviews.Content: What can I say - this resort is fantasic - the walk inot Epcot and to DHS is priceless. Stormalong Bay could entertain the kids all holiday without going to the parks. Can't wait to return next summer!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly magical!”
Reviews.Author: margo58
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Beach Club resort for 5 nights and loved it! It is in walking distance to Epcot and the Disney transportation system takes you everywhere else. The rooms are very spacious and nicely decorated. Our view was of the lagoon and boardwalk. The pool is terrific. The sandy bottom feels great on your feet after a full day of walking in the parks! Pool is very clean and open late for fun relaxation after hours. The staff throughout the hotel is exceptional. Take advantage of the extended park hours that are offered for hotel guests. Also, the Disney dining plan makes eating out easy and economical.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure this hotel is worth the price tag”
Reviews.Author: hatster31
Reviews.Content: For a "discounted" rate of over $300 a night, I'm not sure Disney Beach Club Resort is worth it. Maybe if you have small children and need to spend a lot of time at the hotel pool or napping in between time parks, this might be justified. ROOM: The room itself is very mediocre, on par with most 3-star hotels. The bed is comfortable. The bathroom is old and small, and the toilet makes noises throughout the night. The door is so thin, and with kids walking around talking and making noises, you really cannot get a good night's sleep. LOCATION: This is the best part of this hotel. It is very conveniently located. It is about a 5 minute walk to Disney Boardwalk area, and a 5 to 10 minute walk to Epcot Center. There are also shuttles that take you to all the theme park. So, the location, especially if you are going to Epcot, cannot be beat. HOTEL: The hotel looks a little beat. After staying at Vegas 5-star hotels, this is not even a comparison. The hotel has a free shuttle service from the airport, which is another plus, but be prepared to wait a long while for the bus to fill up. The pool area is very nice, so if you plan to spend a ton of time at the pool, this might be worth it. Overall, okay stay. Sleep quality not good due to heavy noise level throughout the night and morning when excited kids walk through the hallway. I'm not sure I will return, especially given the price tag.

Reviews.Title: “Dream vacation”
Reviews.Author: kbouressa1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with 12 kids ages 1-9 and 10 adults, some of us in villas, some in hotel. we loved the beach club. check in took 5 minutes, bags delivered to room, room was spotless. kids loved the towel animals every day. stormalong bay was great, but we also used the quiet pools by our villa every night after returning from parks for late night swimming with kids or mid day for a break. easy walk to epcot and to boardwalk at night to see street entertainer. boat ride to hollywood easy. bus to magic kingdom convenient. we even walked through epcot (10 minutes from hotel to monorail) and took monorail to magic kindgdom. sand bottom pool a huge hit with the little kids-like being at the beach. will def return.

Reviews.Title: “Am I missing something?”
Reviews.Author: Mayamaniacs
Reviews.Content: We stayed in early August. We read the reviews in making this hotel one of our choices. The location of the hotel was great, but I do not see how anyone can rate the hotel above three stars. On two occasions, we had to wait over 40 minutes for a bus to Downtown Disney and Typhoon Lagoon. When we complained to the concierge, they dismissed our complaints. Frankly, we thought the concierges were helpful, but were somewhat aloof or arrogant. About what----Disney!!!! It made me want to puke. The bed were not much better than what you get at a Holiday Inn Express or a Fairfield Inn. There was no coffee shop type restaurant. Most every hotel that we have stayed at for a vacation has a restaurant that fills that function. As a result, for a short breakfast or a lunch, you had to go to the Marketplace. It has the worst coffee we ever tasted. Disney must cut the grounds used in half. The rolls were not even equal to the quality at a Panera Bread. We did not eat at the restaurants so we can not comment on those. Based on the upscale restaurants that we ate elsewhere, I would save the money. Finally, we have to comment about Stormalong Bay. We do not undersntand all the hype. A slide at a pool is not a major thing. The pool was really no better than at most major resorts. The towel service was appreciated, but nothing really stood out. Overall, we think the fact the resort was within the Disney complex allows it to survive. We would never stay at this hotel for its price at a different location. We think its association with Disney clouds people's vision. $10/day for internet service and televisionservice which only has Disney/ABC/ESPN channels is really unacceptable. Would we stay there again? Only if we got the deal we did since you get extra Disney hours, transportation, and transit from the airport. However, if you do not want to be bound to the bus, want a better pool, and better food choices, I would stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't get much better than the Beach Club!!!!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyandFun5
Reviews.Content: I could go on all day about how much we love the Beach Club! This was our second stay of 9 days and we enjoyed every second. We are a family of five and rooms were spacious and soooo comfortable. The soft, cozy, beds are amazing and there was a sofa that converted into a single bed for our 9 year old. The pool is unmatched in Disney and the poolside staff are the best on Disney property. Check in and concierge were more than happy to assist me with everything I needed and housekeeping was there at 2am when my daughter got sick, twice. You will not be disappointed with the Beach Club. You can easily walk to Epcot and the Boardwalk. We spend a lot of time at the hotel (because we go to Disney often and do not spend the entire day in the parks) and this is the perfect place to hang by the pool during the day, enjoy the family poolside activities with the kids, and then hit Beaches and cream for some wonderful treats. It has been hard to find another place that compares to the Beach Club. Disney has spoiled us!!! Be sure to roast some marshmallows on the beach at night, watch a movie on the beach with the family, and tie-dye Mickey shirts by the pool! LOVE LOVE LOVE the Beach Club! We will not stay any other place in Disney again, the Beach Club is the best by FAR! (((Just a little side note: My only complaint is lack of free internet. I understand why they do it but for the cost of the room, it should be included. I was taking some online classes and had to have internet access during my stay. I only used it for a couple of hours our entire stay but had to pay $10. for each day I logged on.)))))

Reviews.Title: “Perfection ... again!!”
Reviews.Author: dffcpa
Reviews.Content: My family accompanied me on a business conference that was held at the Swan Hotel; however, as we have stayed many times at Disney's Beach Club Resort, we opted to stay at the Beach Club for the "home" feel it offers us. As stated, we have stayed at the Beach Club numerous times over the years, and have yet to have a bad experience. Walking in the front door is like returning home to us, although we still fondly miss Art the doorman! The addition of the Beach Club Villas (DVC) has resulting in the gift shop evolution into a gift shop/food pantry/food bar; however, the resulting increased traffic flow in that area is offset by the availability of an added dining option. We used the online check-in process and it went spotlessly smooth and very quick; we were on our way to the room within just moments of walking in the front door of the hotel. This is the second time we used the online check-in process and it has worked as advertised for us. The hotel staff perform ideally in my opinion ... they are available when needed, do whatever is asked of them, will return a smile with a smile or hello, but do not overwhelm you. Housekeeping does a consistently good job. I realize this is not an inexpensive hotel and, as such, pampering is traditionally expected; however, one look around the theming, the grounds, facilities, transportation/benefits and location will explain the hotel pricing. The clambake at Cape May Cafe is our favorite meal when at Disney, and we enjoyed it twice on our recent trip; both meals were excellent; the staff is very enjoyable and friendly, and one never feels rushed. Also, Beaches and Cream Soda Shop is a fun place to have a great quick lunch/dinner; the offerings are limited; however, everything on the menu is made to order and very good. The No Way Jose Sundae remains my number one treat in the World!! (Disney, please place this back on the take-out menu for those times I NEED my No Way Jose fix addressed quickly???). That takes us to location; it remains my opinion the Beach Club Resort is the most ideally located of all of the Disney resorts. The hotel is only a few minutes walk from Epcot Center, Boardwalk and the boat transportation to Hollywood Studios. The walk to Hollywood Studios is actually similar in time to the boat ride, and a very nice, peaceful walk along the water. Finally, one cannot forget to mention Stormalong Bay, the wonderful water recreation area of the hotel and, in my opinion, the best Disney Resort pool area. It can be crowded and loud, but is always a fun place with numerous daily planned activities. Hurricane Hanna's is located in this area for food and drink. The staff members do a great job with their enthusiasm. There are also quiet pools available if one seeks some peaceful pool time. Overall, the Beach Club Resort is simply a very enjoyable, safe and comfortable place to spend your time at Disneyworld, and it has retained its' seaside charm over the years.

Reviews.Title: “Big on Location and Amenities - low on overall Disney Wow factor.”
Reviews.Author: Page21Austin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Beach Club last October 2009 (and yes, I'm tardy in posting this review), but I wanted to get this out since the International Food and Wine Festival will be rolling around again in October and that was the primary reason that we chose to stay at BC - location. You will read it again and again here in the reviews....BC is the absolute closest to EPCOT - 5 minute walk. It's true. And the shortest wait to get through the gates any time during the day. If EPCOT is your destination, and you can afford a Deluxe Resort, then definitely consider Beach Club. We used the Online Check-In - I can't give it a thumbs up unfortunately and I'm really trying to be fair. I would have been better off standing in the standard check in line - now that line was moving! It was one of those situations where the customer at the counter had what seemed like thousands of problems, questions, issues, and things that should have been taken care of at the Concierge Desk, not at the OnLine Check In. The Disney Cast Member was trying to help, but due to a language barrier/issue, the situation kept going on and on, and instead of calling or asking for help from a Manager, she just let it continue. My issue was that she never acknowledged me or redirected me to the other lines. Not the best start to a 10 day vacation. I actually have to agree with some of the other reviews here in that, I didn't find the overall staff to be at the typical Disney level of superior. I was a little disappointed. I can't quite put my finger on it, but there was a general malaise and at times I felt like I was bothering them when I just asking for even the smallest thing at the front desk. It's nothing to keep me from coming back to a Disney property.....we are booked for this December 2010 at the Polynesian actually! We've also stayed at BoardWalk, and we actually liked the atmosphere at BoardWalk better. Besides the fantastic pool at BC (Stormalong Bay), my opinion is that BC is not huge on overall Disney WOW appeal. My daughters (ages 11 and 8) were not overwhelmed by the theming of the hotel. It's lovely, but they didn't really get it. That's not a negative, but I think having stayed before at the Polynesian, the Animal Kingdom Lodge, the Wilderness Lodge, and even the Disneyland Hotel in California, they expected a heavier Disney theming in the hotel. BC is very subtle, and that appeals to many (especially after being bombarded by so much at the parks), but I just want to put it out there if you or your family is expecting something different. The room size is standard for a Deluxe Disney hotel. We had 3 kids and 2 adults on this trip. It was sufficient - of course, a suite would have been better, but we made do. Definitely eat at Beaches 'n Cream Soda Shop while you are there....or at least get an ice cream treat. I would say skip the Cape May Buffet and head over to the Yacht Club for their breakfast buffet instead. Unless you just absolutely must spend the bucks to see Characters again while you eat. We didn't think it was worth it. The Yacht Club's "Captains Grille" has a nice buffet breakfast for a better price (although no characters) but we didn't need reservations and it was much less stressful. Also, check out the bar at the Yacht Club, the Crew's Cup Lounge. We stopped in there several times in the afternoon and had snacks and beverages (our kids were allowed to join us). It was nice to sit, watch some ESPN, have some appetizers, and chill out. The movies on the beach at night are fun and were a cool surprise for the kids. It's a great way to unwind. If you're planning a trip for the International Food and Wine Festival this year...lucky you!! Enjoy and Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful visit to the The Beach Club Resort”
Reviews.Author: stew2730
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a five day stay at Disney's Beach Club Resort. Prior to our trip I did a lot of research in order to decide which Disney property would be best for us. I went on this trip with very high expectations and can honestly say that my expectations were exceeded. Some of the deifinite positives were the easy walk to the International Gateway at Epcot (this made it very stress-free to go over and see the Illumination Show at night), the pool complex was great and the housekeeping was flawless. As an added bonus we were upgraded to Concierge level and are now very sad that we can't go down to the hall for a snack....

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort for Toddlers & Teenagers”
Reviews.Author: MISCMOMOF3
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful place to stay. It is a short walk to Epcot. It is very convenient to many other attractions and shopping. The room overlooked the pool that is off to itself and it was very quiet. My 3 year old loved the large pool area. It was perfect for his age because it is a shallow and there was even a shady beach area to play. The teenagers loved the other pools that were in the same area. At the pool area you will find a place to buy hot dogs, hamburgers, drinks, etc... the kids meals come in a sand pail which the children love to use in the pool area. The hotel was very clean and the employees were very friendly. On some nights the would set up a huge outdoor television and play a movie for the guests to enjoy. I have stayed at many Disney Resorts in the past but must say this one is the BEST!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: judyqPennsylvania
Reviews.Content: One of the best assets of the Beach Club Resort is its location. Being able to walk to Epcot and the Boardwalk and having the boat to Hollywood Studios so close are great perks. The other beauty is the pool; its fantastic. The restaurants in the Yacht & Beach Club are wonderful also. We found the staff to be fine but surprisingly not as great as in the Wilderness Lodge where we stayed before. They just weren't so "people friendly." Also, double check your room reservation before you arrive! We checked in and found that they had us in a room with a king-size bed and one day bed for husband, wife and two grown boys! Way too cozy! They had to change our room and although I made the reservation many months before, stuck us in a room so far away from the elevators and the view wasn't even the parking lot but the top of any ugly roof. I was very upset at first and tried to get yet another room but none was available. I didn't want to let this ruin the whole vacation but I will be sure to ask about my room in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but you definitely pay to be on Disney property.”
Reviews.Author: crimsonxskies
Reviews.Content: Check-in Online check-in definitely stream-lined the process. It was very simple. Staff All of the cast members were very helpful and friendly, though we didn't have much interaction with them. Room Honestly, for being as expensive as it was, the room was a bit disappointing. It was very spacious and looked clean. However, the wallpaper was beginning to wear, as well as the carpets and the bathrooms were disappointingly small. The bed was very soft and provided a very comfortable place to relax after a day of activity. The walls were very thin, and both rooms beside us had very loud children. If you're a sensitive sleeper and wake up easily, you'll find it difficult to get a full night's rest in these room. You can hear people walking down the hallway even when they aren't being incredibly loud. The view from our balconey was wonderful. We overlooked the "quiet pool" and the boardwalk. It was stunning at night. Amenities There were numerous chairs available, but as others have said, it was difficult to find one because they had all been claimed by a towel. The main pool stays busy, and it can be a bit of a maze the first time you enter. The quiet pool was the best part about the hotel. Each time we were there, there were at most 10 people in the pool. At its deepest, it is just over 4ft, but it provides a relaxing atmosphere, and there is a spa located next to it which is very relaxing as well. The prices of items at the resort itself were surprisingly reasonable. (With the exception of food in the marketplace). Location If you are planning on going to Epcot during your stay, you can't beat the location. The back park entrance (by England in the World Showcase) was a two minute walk from our room. We went to the park early, returned to the pool at 3 and went to watch the fireworks at 8. Very convenient. From the boardwalk you can see a little bit of the fireworks, but you really can't see much. The Bowardwalk itself can provide a couple of hours of entertainment. There are quite a few restaurants and shops to browse. Food While we were there we ate at three places outside the parks. We ate the ESPN club, which was our best dining experience. We didn't have to wait for a table and our appetizer and alcohol came out very quickly. Our waitress was very friendly and the food was very good. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a casual dining atmosphere. We also ate at Big River Grille, which I do NOT recommend. We were really looking forward to the dinner, as we were celebrating a birthday and an engagement, but we were thoroughly disappointed with the evening. We stood in front of the host for a full minute before he ever acknowledged our presence, and when he finally did he was not friendly in the least. When we were finally given a buzzer, we watched as empty tables sat unbussed for at least 10 minutes. We saw one table that was ready to be seated, and was ready for 5 minutes before our buzzer went off. The service was terribly slow. As far as the actual food went, I ordered the chicken alfredo and it was incredibly bland. It definitely wasn't worth the money we paid for it. The other place we ate was the Beaches and Cream soda shop. The staff here was much more friendly and inviting and we didn't have to wait to be seated. However, the service was very slow. We ordered two sundaes and a side of french fries and we were in the shop for over an hour, we didn't sit around after we received the check either. So I can definitely see why the tables are always full, they aren't very concerned with turnover. The sundaes were delicious and you got a lot for your money. The only downside was the service speed, so I would certainly recommend it if you're craving ice cream. Summary Overall, I would only recommend if you plan on spending a lot of time there. If your plan is to go to the parks all day and only come back to the resort to sleep, then you're just wasting your money. There are more affordable resorts, which would be a better option.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: copelnad
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my recent stay at the Beach Club. The rooms were large and comfortable and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The pool is great, even travelling without children we enjoyed watching the pool games and using the facilities. A short walk takes you to all the attractions of Epcot, the Boardwalk and the other area hotels. We never waited more than 10 minutes for a bus to go anywhere or come back which was very helpful when trying to maximize a short trip. I'll definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “The worst I've ever been treated in my life!”
Reviews.Author: beechbebe
Reviews.Content: . There was no bigger Disney fan than I. Nine new families go because of our recommendations. I never had a single complaint about ANYONE who worked at WDW. In fact, I always believed that every cast member I ever dealt with always went well beyond any expectation I ever had. I have a son with Asperger’s Syndrome, and I credit WDW for encouraging a lot of wonderful social breakthroughs for him. Our newest “favorite” Disney hotel was the Beach Club Resort. It had casual elegance, an unbelievable pool, and unbeatable location. We had stayed at the BCR two other times without any negative incident. Our third visit to the BCR occurred this past May: May 11-18, 2010. Disney is advertising 2010 as the “Year of Celebrations”. What better place to go for our wedding anniversary and son’s birthday combined? And while every other place and cast member on Disney property rose to their usual above and beyond outstanding service, a few staff at the BCR ruined every single day of our stay, except one. Keep in mind, I don’t think I have ever lodged a complaint against anyone, at Disney or anywhere else. During our stay at the BCR this May, the staff at the hotel started our vacation by telling us in a very belligerent tone that our standard view room wasn’t ready, and check in was at 4 pm. Even though I was bewildered at the tone of voice and even though I knew check in was at 3 pm, I said, ok, just asking, no big deal. We dropped off our bags, and walked to Epcot. Hours later, while we were having a great time, I received a call telling me that our room wasn’t ready. In fact, the room that we had chosen from a list they had given us to choose from had been trashed by people who stayed there the night before. I asked about the state of the mattresses. The manager on the phone hesitated and didn’t answer. We were then offered another standard view room instead, and we were checked in a little after 3 pm. The next day, my husband discovered that the front desk had “lost” my husband’s credit card information! My husband’s attempt to find out where his cc information went, was met by VERY nasty, nonchalant, staff who tried to blame HIM. This made my husband angry enough to complain to a wonderful manager, who reimbursed my husband the amount he (the manager) deemed fair. My husband came back totally pixie dusted! My husband was so grateful for the manager’s kind regard, he took the money the manager credited our account, and put it right back into WDW, by using it to purchase me two Dooney Bourke handbags they sell in the WDW gift shops .Day three was great, no problem. Day 4, the day before our wedding anniversary, we came back from lunch to discover that my expensive designer bathing suit was missing from my room! So, while my family went to see Chubby Checker at Epcot, I spent the evening dealing with the BCR managers. I was reimbursed the depreciated value of my suit. From this point on, I was getting upset at the BCR, but was trying to be a lady. But, now my child was afraid to leave his camera equipment in the room: he was concerned with theft and “people looking through my stuff”. I was upset because half the reason we booked at the BCR to begin with, a DELUXE hotel that charges people $400 plus per night for that privilege, was to swim in their amazing 3 acre pool. To find ANY one piece swimsuit in a size 4 or 6 on Disneyworld property proved impossible. I am a 46 year old mother. I am not bikini material. If a middle aged man reads this, the equivalent would be like asking you to wear a speedo ot thong. I don’t know a single woman over 40 who finds a flattering suit without the help of a good designer and lots of time trying suits on .Consequently, by the third full day of our 8 day trip, I could no longer use the pool that we paid so much money to enjoy. After the disappearance of my suit was reported to management (my suit was NEVER found), housekeeping abruptly stopped giving us ANY service at all. We felt this neglect was retaliatory for the complaint about the missing suit to management. A male housekeeper met my husband in the hall the next day and snapped “YOU don’t want housekeeping!” very aggressively, the day after we reported the suit missing. For two days, we would call housekeeping and beg them to give us service, and report when we left the room, not to return for 6 or more hours, because we REALLY needed service. No one came. Finally, when we no longer even had toilet paper (not to mention towels, shampoo, or soap); I broke down. I asked a manager in the lobby if it was too much to expect for a Deluxe Disney resort to provide toilet paper. I burst into tears. We were all so stressed from one mishap after the other by BCR staff, we just wanted to go home. The manager kept telling my husband that he was too busy, with a hotel at 40% capacity, to be bothered with what he considered our small issues. He snidely accused my husband of wanting to “profit” from this situation (?!?) Immediately after dealing with that manager, we went to the Polynesian Resort for our dinner reservations. We were all three so angry, stressed, and upset at how badly we were treated, that I had to fight back tears, my husband just sat in the lobby, looking dangerously angry, and my poor son had a severe meltdown, and sat in the men’s room for two solid hours due to a series of extreme panic attacks.. A wonderful young man who worked at the front desk of the Poly helped me talk my son out of his anxiety attack and into a cab back to the BCR, where we slunk back to our room feeling horrible about being trapped there. To this day, I pray for that young man, and the waiter at Le Cellier, who was the only one to acknowledge our anniversary with two glasses of surprise champagne, the last day of our trip. No one at the BCR cared. In fact, when we told them it was our anniversary, they treated us like we wanted something. Uh, yeah, we wanted what we paid for: deluxe service. I believe everywhere on earth, that does include toilet paper! The same manager, who was rude and insulting, continued his taunting and coercion until we went home. I cried several time in the remaining two days, particularly after said manager insinuated that there never WAS a swim suit!! I burst into tears, and gave a minute description to the Yacht Club manager, who was a lovely person who tried to comfort me. I knew at that second, my beautiful suit would never be found( and I was right. I was told that a BCR manager was sent to supervise the sifting through of the laundry)! The nasty manager at the BCR made it a point to show up to crow triumphantly at our departing backs as the Magical Express drove us away. This manager did things like this from the second we asked him for help: he kept going out of his way to be in my husband’s face and taunt him into a silent, helpless fury. I had thought about this many times since: did it ever occur to this manager that his need to dominate and humiliate his male “guests” could result in another guest taking their futile rage on their little children with their fists?
