I have seen families at WDW who looked like they wouldn’t have needed half the anger this man supplied. I am fortunate that my husband was a man who understood that he was deliberately being baited. In my opinion, this was done because they knew we did nothing wrong, THEY did. They ruined our vacation, but wanted to shift the blame onto us. If my suit never showed up, they could claim I lied. If they could bait my husband into losing his temper, then they could say we somehow deserved the horrific treatment we were subjected to. When I told this manager that I intended to write a letter of complaint, he laughed and said, “Go Ahead!” in a way that told me that he knew he could act with impunity. He was right. I wrote no less than five letters to Guest Communications,the WDW President , and even the very top. The responses ranged from a verbal apology (WDW is very careful not to put anything in writing), to ridicule, and finally ignoring us. With the second letter, I asked to be reimbursed for the days at the hotel (minus the day and one half the first manager reimbursed), at the discounted price that we paid, $264.00 per night, and I listed. I also stated that, instead of money, I would be receptive to reimbursement in the form of another deluxe hotel stay for 5 days. I already knew that 40% capacity was considered a hardship: they had the rooms. Stupid me, I thought it would be a cheaper way for them, considering their mark up on their prices; and the fact that we usually spend tons of money on food, drinks, and other goodies. They would still turn a nice profit, and it would have shown us good faith. It would have been a way to show us that we wouldn’t be abused a second time around. I would never consider paying them another $5,000 and placing myself in their power unless they made some gesture. Had Disney shown good faith and remorse for destroying our anniversary, they would have been pleasantly surprised: it is the principle for me. No one in my family even wants to go back, and we don’t have the time anyway. Instead, the woman on the phone said they felt they did all they were interested in doing for our family, and insinuated she had my letters, so to shut up and just take it. I found that puzzling, as I have no problem with what I put in writing at all, including the suggestion to be reimbursed. I believe that it is the right thing for them to do. Although the person who was delegated the responsibility of our complaint promised to call us last week, she never did. Instead, I had to email. At that, she called, and said she believed the BCR, and they felt they reimbursed us enough with the suit and the first manager. I guess when that manager at the BCR encouraged me to write my complaints; he knew nothing would be done. WDW seemed bitterly angry that they already reimbursed us for the incidents occurring our first day and one half: the trashed room and late check in, lost cc information, nastiness, and and theft of my property (at what they considered it’s depreciated value) granted them license to be as nasty, bullying, and withholding amenities we had paid for, for the remaining six days we were forced to stay in their hotel . My family had to go use the pool bathroom because we weren’t even given toilet paper. At a deluxe hotel! We are being painted as mercenary because I had politely requested reimbursement for the discounted price we paid for the ruined hotel days only. That’s actually funny. The BCR destroyed our vacation and celebration, and WDW doesn’t care. They didn’t back us, the guests, at all. The fact that we had been loyal fans who spent over $60,000.00 at their resort, and brought 8-9 new families MEANT NOTHING TO THEM. The pixie dust bubble was popped right in front of my face. We had been to WDW 11 times before where nothing bad happened. Unfortunately, when things did go wrong, WDW did not feel accountable for promises they made to us regarding our time, effort, planning, money, and trust. In fact, Guest Communications went out of their way to make things a lot worse .The woman on the phone even had the nerve to tell me, smugly, that they would continue to take our money for future trips. When I said it for what it was, they just want our money, she said, “Yup”. Needless to say, I have informed my travel agents. They said, “YOU, of all people, have a problem with Disney??’, and after listening, told me Disney’s behavior toward me and mine was disgusting. Fortunately, when I called my credit card company to see if I could dispute the hotel stay only, they didn't even get past hearing about the trashed room before they also said, "disgusting!" like my travel agent. I used to be like all the other reviewers here: all it took was some incompetence and the worst manager I've ever seen just let things keep escalating until now I feel I have to warn everyone: especially those who are planning to due to my recommendation. The one time we had very disturbing, valid complaints, WDW showed their true colors.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Resort - Amazing Pool - You will not be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: esgordon
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fabulous 4 night stay at the Beach Club. It's hard for me to pick a favorite resort at WDW. We've stayed at the Contemporary twice, the Polynesian 1x and now the Beach Club 1x. They are all great resorts with different benefits to each. If you like to spend time in Epcot and Hollywood Studios, this location cannot be beaten. The rooms were spacious and comfortable, friendly castmembers and an amazing pool make this a great family vacation resort. This was our first Beach Club stay and we were NOT disappointed. The entire staff at the Beach Club are some of the nicest and most helpful CM's we've ever encountered. Check-in was a breeze. Of course we arrived on a Wednesday morning at 8:20 a.m. When we drove up, the gate guard had radioed ahead to let them know we were arriving so they greeted us by name. Someone escorted me directly to the on-line check in counter where we received a warm welcome and our packet of information. Our room wasn't quite ready, but we received our KTTW and were on our way to the MK bus in less than 10 minutes. The pool was phenomenal! The sand bottom pool was one of the major factors in choosing to stay at this resort. I did have to laugh when I overheard another adult guest say "There's sand in the pool. You'd think they'd clean that out." The pool is huge and winding and there is something for everyone. A very shallow beach (ranging from approx. 18 in. to 2 1/2 feet deep) pool area for young children; a lazy river, a child size water slide, a larger faster waterslide, two hot tubs, a whirlpool area and some deeper swimming areas. And that's just the theme pool. There's also a quiet pool on the other side of the property which is a traditional style pool and a separate jacuzzi. Pool Hint -- if you're driving, bring a noodle for the pool if you like them. You can't use your own tubes or child swim rings, but you can use a noodle. The tubes that are available to rent at the swim hut are $3/hr. or $10 day. The price was fine, but they don't have child size tubes and the ones they have are a bit too big for a small child. My 4 year old loves the lazy river, but she was too small for the tube. We rented one for her, but she kept falling through, and since she is a "big girl" she didn't want to share a tube with me. You can also purchase noodles in the gift shop for $5. It was a bit of a hike to the waterslide from the pool. Too far to let your small child go unattended as you have to leave the pool area completely and go across the public walkway. It was a fun slide though. I loved it and my 4 year old did too. Children need to be able to swim to go down the big slide. It dumps into about 4 - 4 1/2 feet of water at the bottom. There is a poolside counterservice restaurant with good lunchtime fare, burgers, salads, wraps, etc. The kids meals are served in a sand bucket w/shovel that the children can use at the beach area of the pool. We had a standard view room and I requested "courtyard view." We had room 3632 which was far enough away from the elevator that we didn't hear elevator noise but close enough that it was very convenient. We overlooked a nice little courtyard and had the European style walk out only balcony. The beds and pillows were very comfy and there was ample storage in the room. Double sinks and plenty of counterspace in the vanity area which was separated from the shower and toilet area was convenient when family was all trying to shower and get dressed. The Marketplace had very few counter service offerings, but had much more grocery store type offerings for the room if you needed that type of merchandise. The Marketplace was also the Beach Club's gift shop. It's on the small side for a WDW gift shop, but it had the basic gift shop offerings. We had no problems with transportation from the resort. It was a quick walk to the International Gateway entrance to Epcot (which is located between France and England in the World Showcase) and a short boat ride to Hollywood Studios. We had quick bus service to Magic Kingdom and Animal Kingdom. If we were returning from Magic Kingdom in the afternoon we took the monorail to Epcot and walked through the Future World to the International Gateway to get back to our hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel but expensive”
Reviews.Author: Redal66
Reviews.Content: There are several good points about this hotel, the location next to the boardwalk is fantastic and Epcot is only a 10 minute walk. On the down side you do pay for the privilage of being so close this hotel is very expensive and not particularly good value. The room itself is a little better than average, it has a nice bed and a good amount of space. The bathroom is a little unusual with the wash hand basin outside of the main bathroom. The staff in general are good and will try and help. The pool area is very nice and also the beach area is a nice touch. Some of the shop staff and pool staff can be a little curt. One other thing that is disappointing is that there is no internet access unless you go to the business centre and you have to pay for it. Most other hotels I have been to offer some access to check flights / email etc. Overall I would say that the area is a real bonus and the boardwalk area is lovely. If you are set on staying at Disney this is a nice option if you have money to burn but you will find much better value is International Drive or Kissimme.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: bluemoon62
Reviews.Content: They say little things sometimes make a big difference. The Disney Beach Club Resort was all that and then some. Great location, walking or boat rides to the parks, access to Boardwalk, restaurants, bakery, ice cream shop, shopping. Outstanding cleaning of room by housekeeping, the most comfortable beds ever. Swimming pools were loved by our three children. Our six year old daughter had a birthday during our stay and we ordered a cake from Costco to be shipped to the hotel. When we checked to see if it arrived on the day of delivery, it could not be found. Spoke to Lindsay from Tennessee late that night (front desk) and she was of tremendous help trying to locate it. We found it the next day in time for our birthday dinner with the help of Concierge. It turns out the cake was mixed in with a food shipment to the Conference Center. Can't say enough about all the hotel staff!

Reviews.Title: “Hustle and Bustle”
Reviews.Author: Tbro1971
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in May. The hotel is exactly what you'd expect for Disney: big, clean, busy and well run. When pulling up to check in, a cast member approached and welcomed us by name. We had arranged for online check-in and what a great idea that is! We were sent to a special line at the front desk, our room was ready and all of our materials were waiting. Very convenient! The hotel is very busy, especially the lobby area. Self-service refillable mug stations were convenient and the lifeguards were great at the huge pool. Everyone raves about the pool for good reason but there is a drawback: The pool is broken up into sections and you actually have to get out of the water in order to enter other sections which quite frankly is a pain. I'm sure there is a logical reason, but I'd rather be able to stay in the water, not have to climb out every time we wanted to explore another section. Other than that, the water was warm and the kids love the sandy bottomed area. Overall, the pros definitely outweigh the cons.

Reviews.Title: “It is worth it!”
Reviews.Author: WoodlandsSingapore
Reviews.Content: Yes, you pay a lot for the hotel, but you also get perks and top service, location, convenience and facilities. I think it is worth the money. Disney Express was good, processing was fast, driver friendly and helpful, journey easy with the intro video. We check-in online, so it is a breeze to get to our room. We felt like special guest, Amanda was very polite and apologetic when our first room didn't work out because of the sink. But it was taken care of speedily, and we have another room. The laundry rooms were 24 hrs. I never have to wait for others to do their laundry. Beaches and Cream was great and we didn't have to wait long. Anyway, they allow you to play in the next door Lafferty arcade room while carrying an electronic buzzer to wait for their call. The pool and slide is great as mentioned by many others. The walk to EPCOT takes about 5-10 mins. depending on which part of resort your room is. The boat to DHS and the return trip were frequent and took about 10-15 mins each way. The boardwalk is not far away, and it is romantic to dine by the lake. We also walked to the Swan hotel to be pick up for our Kennedy Space Centre tour with Gator tours. Buses to animal kingdom/ blizzard beach as well as to Magic Kingdom were easy to take from the front of the resort. Coming back from MK after Wishes at 10 p.m. was a concern to me before our trip, and I was planning to take the monorail to Contemporary Hotel to take a cab back. There were so many people at the monorail station. In the end, we tried the resort bus again, and it worked out well in the end. We reached the resort pretty fast too by this way. All in all, we will stay here in a heart beat, this place gave us a very comfortable and relaxing feel the moment we arrived. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Georgia047
Reviews.Content: We are true Disney fans - this was our 6th trip to Disney World celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary with family. I love the way Disney takes care of you the minute you step off the plane and get on one of their Magical Express buses. When we checked in we were greeted with a smile and were quickly processed. The styling of the Beach Club Resort is spot on - down to the Mickey's and Little Mermaid characters in the carpets in the hall. We had requested, back in the November of 2009, connecting rooms with our family and were not given this at check in (this happened another time at Port Orleans Riverside). They were very accommodating and found us two connecting rooms on the same floor (not really sure why were weren't given these to begin with), but we chose to stay in our rooms because of the top-notch view of the Boardwalk across from us. Another complaint we had was that our room had little to no storage. My sisters room had hooks and a great chest of drawers, and there were only two of them staying in that room. We had four people in our room but none of these amenities. The "cast member" I talked to at the front desk about possibly getting one put in our room was probably the rudest person I encountered in our whole 9 day trip. One other drawback, I think especially for families with small kids, is that they don't really have a food court or a large enough place to enjoy a counter service meal. They have a counter where you can get pizza's and sandwiches, in the marketplace, with a couple of tables, which were always full. Hurricane Hannah's at the pool had burgers and chicken, but stay away from the veggie wrap, it was NOT worth spending money on. However, you had to sit outside which, in the Florida heat, was not always appealing. Being so, so close to EPCOT and the world showcase (we took a left out of our room and in literally minutes were at the back gate - you couldn't even finish a drink in the time it took you to walk there) - we ate a lot there. The biggest draw for this resort has to be the pool (phenomenal!) and the great lifeguards (they do a dance at the "changing of the guards") and the "cruise directors" at the pool that always kept it fun and hopping for the kids. They had movies and s'mores on the beach, and the Boardwalk was a short walk around the lagoon. All in all, I would love to stay there again and would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a little something more than just rides and shows - it's an experience in and of itself.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, nice pool, a little dated”
Reviews.Author: VolpeTravels
Reviews.Content: Overall Very Nice. First let me start off with the good...the location is great, across from the Boardwalk, next to Epcot and a short boat ride to MGM. The service when we checked in was great. I have stayed at Wilderness lodge and Port Orleans, and the service at the Beach Club exceeded both. The Market/Cafe was nice- had muffins and yogurt for breakfast. I. The Pool is nice. And kids will love spending time in the pool. Nice Bar/Grill by the Pool. Beaches and Cream ice cream was great. Nice Beach front. So let me touch on the bad The hotel is huge so we had a very very very long walk from our room to the Pool- my Daughter thought the maze of hallways was like the movie The Shinning. The Room and decor is dated - the hallway wallpaper is peeling, and the bathrooms in the room are not of a high quality (the drapery was nice) The Cape May Cafe- which we ate at for Dinner and for a character breakfast was not good at all. actually both my Husband and Daughter got sick after having the dinner Buffet. Rooms were cleaned very late in the day- cleaned well but late in the day. The pool water was way too hot!!!! Cant believe they could not fill it with cooler water- I mean about 98 degree hot- not at all refreshing. Much more expensive than other Disney resorts So all that being said would I stay here again - maybe. although because it is a little less I would consider the Boardwalk across the lake. I really loved the location and my kids really loved the pool. But I would not eat at Cape May. And if you are on a tigher budget I would recommend Port Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great place too stay”
Reviews.Author: donaldsmith
Reviews.Content: the Beach club was a very nice place to stay, easy transportation to all the parks, and also downtown disney!! The staff was very friendly and nice, we were suprised to be up graded, a pleasant trip became even better. The pool was great it had a sand bottom, life guards seemed to be all over which was a plus, heated too! Cape May is a must with the kids, Beaches and cream, a 50's style soda/food shop... cool. All in all the experience was excellent... but as we all know if you stay on grounds and eat there too it can be pricey .... There are cheaper places to eat off grounds , McD's...etc,.... cross roads intersection... As for me and my family , we mixed it up....so every thing worked out well..... remember your on vaction...enjoy... and what better place than DISNEY WITH YOUR FAMILY!!

Reviews.Title: “First Family Vacation to Disney and LOVED IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: LAJ124
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Beach Club Resort May 28-June 3, 2010 and couldn't have been happier. The staff were very friendly and went out of their way for us. The pools were fantastic, fun and children oriented. The food all over Disney is good and we used the meal plan (GREAT THING FOR FIRST TIMERS!!). Shopping was great and the parks were so much fun. We can't wait to come back and visit. We walked right over to the Boardwalk and enjoyed that area alot (nice and quiet without crowds.) Great transportation by boat and shuttle and walking to Epcot takes less then 10 minutes from the Resort. LOTS OF FUN IN DISNEY!!!! I miss it already and I am planning our next trip to the Beach Club for next year. My family and I wouldn't stay anywhere else!!

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Hotel, especially for those travelling with young ones”
Reviews.Author: rgrs7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Beach Club between May 12-20 (8 nights) and were very impressed by the hotel. First off - for those of you who are budget conscious, the deluxe hotels are not for you. They are all expensive. We were lucky enough to get 40% off when we booked in February. That enabled us to stay. Our room which was normally $500 a night was $285. You pay for the location and the ammenedies. We have 2 small children aged 3 (almost 4) and 11 months old. We knew we had to stay at a resort that was close to all of the action, had a large room to accomodate our crib and have lots of stuff at the resort itself to do after the parks. There is no other hotel around Disney that offers as many great things. First off the rooms, very large and spaceous. We paid the extra to have a pool/water view. We were on the 2nd floor which meant we got a huge balcony. If you are on the 1st floor you get a patio, 2nd floor nice balcony. 3rd and 4th floors don't get much other than a little platform to stand out on. We had 2 queen size beds in our room. They were seperated by a wall, where we put our crib. It had 2 double sinks then a door to the bathroom. Lots of room for a couple kids to play around in, much different from the crampt confinds of the econo or even moderate resorts. We had a fridge and microwafe with is essencial for heating up baby food etc. I have heard some people say certain parts of the rooms or halls etc needed updating but I walked the whole hotel about 50 times and did not notice anything that looked worn or outdated. Some people will always be picky. Beds were very comfortable and we could not hear our neighbours beside or on top of us, contrary to other people's reviews. The heating / ac worked great, no complaints about the room. Housekeeping was good, nothing out of the ordinary there. The restaurants were great, but we were very happy to be on the Disney Dining plan. Any restaurant either at the hotel or at the parks for the 3 of us (2 adults, one child) was $40 for lunch and at least $85 for supper. The dining plan saved us huge. The character breakfast at Cape Mae's was great, but again - $82 for breakfast (if you had to pay for it) OUCH! Only complaint - the food quality at Beaches & Cream Ice Cream Parlour. Don't get me wrong, the ice cream was good, but their "famous" burgers were nothing special. The restaurant is extremely small. 2 booths and maybe 6 tables total, very small so if you go during a peak time you would wait forever to get seated. Cape Mae's buffet for b-fast and supper was good. Great mix of food. Also ate at the Captain's Grille - great steak and chicken. Did have a reservation for the Yachtsman Steakhouse, but we skipped it (too formal for a 1yr old) and had a character supper at Epcot instead. Pool - just like everyone else said - this was the selling point. No other resort in the world has a pool like the beach club. It is not all one large pool, rather a few pools all close together, seperated by a wall at best. They have a deeper tubing secion like a lazy river, other rapids areas where they have the jets turned up to take you round and round till your dizzy, areas with waterfalls and best of all for little kids - a 80x80ft or maybe bigger area that is only 2ft deep where they can play in the sand and run through the water. Everything is sand, its amazing. They keep the pool at I'd say 90 degrees, its bath water, which makes swimming at night amazing. There are lots of ducks and baby ducts that make the pool their home, so it feels as if you were swimming in a lake or ocean. There are also lifeguards every 20 feet or so which is very reassuring. The own downside when we were there, the main waterslide was closed, they were fixing it. They had movies on the beach every night for the kids and a campfire where you could roast marshmellows, very cool. Lots of souveneer stores between the Yacht Club and the Beach Club. We purchased cereal, oj, cinnimon buns at our store so we didn't have to pay for breakfast every day. One of the other great things is that you can pay $14 for a refillable mug which you can use at the resort for your whole trip, so unlimtied pop, lemonade, coffee, tea etc. That really came in handy. The resort is right on crescent lake, which means you can rent boats if that's your thing. We took a 21ft pontoon boat out for 90 minutes ($95) and had a blast. Took it around the lake, and down the 1.5mile straight to Hollywood Studios. Location - you are steps away from Epcot, less than a 5 minute walk, 5 minutes to the other side of the lake (Disney's Boardwalk). 10 minute boat ride to Hollywood Studios, 15 minute bus to Animal Kingtom. When it comes to the Magic Kingdom its 15 minutes by bus or maybe 20 or so by monorail. We far preferred walking into epcot and taking the monorail. It is such a pain to fold up double strollers and fight your way onto a bus. The monorail made it so much easier. We would definitley return to the Beach Club, as long as we booked at a "special" rate. For our situation having young kids the location and what they had to offer was far superior to other resorts. If anyone has any questions please give me a shout!!

Reviews.Title: “NORWALK VIRUS”
Reviews.Author: jen41717
Reviews.Content: FAMILIES BEWARE..NORWALK VIRUS. Well our first family vacation...Things got off to a pretty good start. We were looking forward to staying at the Disney Beach Club. Growing up my Mom had taken us almost every year to the Polynesian Resort, and a few years ago I had gone with an Aunt of mine to the Disney Beach Club. So I knew where I wanted to stay with my own young children when we planned our trip to see Mickey Mouse for their first time. Well we had a seven night stay, we took the magical express and I was slightly annoyed with that, but I thought if that's the worst thing that could happen than, I'll get over it. Boy was I wrong... can you say Norwalk/Norovirus, yeah both my husband and daughter got extremely sick, so from Tuesday - Friday vomiting, diarrhea, nausea, also my ten month old got a touch of it too. And then on Saturday we left at 7am, so most of the trip was ruined. The most troubling thing with the whole Norwalk virus is I found out from the cast coordinator and from the lifeguard at disney BC, that most of the cast members (staff) in rec, housekeeping and DINING services have/had been sick with the same virus. My family and I never left disney property, we had their meal plan, so we eat all of our meals there and my family difinitely picked up the NORWALK VIRUS from DISNEY BEACH CLUB. Hotel staff was calling the illness the flu, but this is not flu. Doctor came to check my daughter and doctor said people refer the illness as the stomach flu. The whole latter half of the week was a nightmare. And in retrospect, from beginning to end several different times through out...vomit was everywhere, at the parks, out at the hotel pool (staff calls it Mickey Poo), over at the Boardwalk (at the Big River restuarant) and of course in our hotel room. Oh when we checked in our bed comforter was dirty, and it looked like there was a period stain on it. Not sure if that's what it was or not. But that was gross. Another thing Disney food is horrible, especially Magic Kingdom. There are a few exceptions to finding some decent food like Animal Kingdom, some places in epcot, and we got really good food at the character buffets, but that is it. Good luck finding good/healthy food especially with small children. Disney prides themselves on celebration...I constantly told them this was my kids first visit. Never got the 1st visit pin. This is small potatoes compared to the virus though. Have a magical day...aghhh, yeah right!!!! One question, why would honeymooners ever want to take their honeymoon there? I can think of a million other places to vacation than listen to screaming children on my honeymoon. One other thing the Dept of Public Health has been notified...So if you get sick please report it. Dept Of Public Health has been told about the virus, they have also been told about the ducks swimming in the pools, which can you say e-coli (nasty). Also there was a county that was just over an hour away from Disney where they has to shut down the schools due to Norwalk virus.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and expensive”
Reviews.Author: mrsfawver
Reviews.Content: My family just stayed for the first time at the Beach Club- concierge level. This was our first Disney trip with our daughter (6 months old) and we had the most wonderful time! THE ROOMS- Well, just like most Disney rooms, this was nice but nothing special. I really wish that Disney would do some major updates that really would set their rooms apart from off-property competitors. I love staying on property, but unless you stay where a monorail runs, off property (Disney-affiliated) resorts are MUCH less expensive and still have bus transport and magic hours. This makes spending $350+ per night difficult to swallow. They did bring us a pack and play for free-- and this was a wonderful "extra". CONCIERGE- We loved the concierge lounge for breakfast and late night snacks/drinks. We really didn't have time to stop in any other time. Top quality everything! I asked for a bottle water and they brought me evian! WOW. We did not use the concierge services, because we have been to Disney so much--we planned ahead. However- we decided these little extras did not compensate for the extra $$ to stay there. STAFF- Everyone was great with the exception of one customer service man. We accidentally arrived 1 day earlier (booked w Expedia and made a mistake) and instead of "magically" helping us with a room, he was demeaning and somewhat chastising about my mistake. For heavens sake- we are on vacation (not to mention a 10+ hr drive with a baby)--please be pleasant and helpful! Other than that- the staff was amazing. We got to meet "Grandma America" a very sweet woman that worked on the concierge floor who was known to her grandchildren overseas as Grandma America. :) LOCATION- If you are going to Epcot, you cannot beat this location! It is located on the Boardwalk and is very convenient to several restaurants. You take the bus to Disney or Animal Kingdom. You can walk to Epcot and take a boat to Hollywood Studios. POOL- Awesome pool! We did not use it, but gosh it looked so nice and so fun! Everyone was having a blast. it was HUGE. I thought it was neat that it had a sand bottom. I can understand why everyone thinks this pool is the best. All in all- great hotel, but is too expensive. We could have stayed at the Ritz or the Waldorf for less! They both have a shuttle to Disney with magic hours. I think we may try an "off property" hotel or a resort with the monorail next time.

Reviews.Title: “really nice”
Reviews.Author: travelsmile12
Reviews.Content: Great choice if you plan to spend a lot of time in Epcot. We stayed here for the Food & Wine Festival and it is a three minute walk - at a leisurely pace!! Wonderful and helpful staff, as always with Disney (in our experience). This would be a great hotel for adults or families with children. The pool is the best I've encountered on Disney property. It's large, has a great slide, and a sandy bottom, which is really a neat touch. Aesthetically, it's a very pretty and relaxing hotel, too. Hollywood Studios (MGM) is a short boat ride away, as well. Beds were very comfy and room was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Beach Club has it all!”
Reviews.Author: boater239
Reviews.Content: We LOVED the Beach Club. We've stayed at other Disney resorts (Grand Floridian, Polynesian) and they don't compare! It's located on the Boardwalk next to the Yacht Club (equally nice) and across the lake from the Boardwalk Hotel and Swan/Dolphin hotels. The boardwalk wraps the entire lake (with ferry service across and to Epcot and MGM as well) and is wonderful to walk or rent the "car" bikes. On the boardwalk on the opposite side of the lake there's a bakery, candy store, carnival games, restaurants (no reservations required) and outdoor entertainment daily in the form of jugglers and comedians! In front of the hotel there is a beach (no swimming) where they show nightly family movies and roast marshmallows. The bridge on the Boardwalk is a wonderful place to watch the Epcot fireworks everynight! You can walk to Epcot and MGM as well. You need to take a bus to Animal Kingdom and the Magic Kingdom. The pool that is shared by the Yacht Club and Beach Club is fabulous! There's a lazy river, sandy area in the pool for the little ones, a lazy river and a big tube slide from the pirate ship. I wouldn't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “As Close as You Can Get to Staying Inside a Disney Park”
Reviews.Author: BandwagonPa
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Beach Club makes you feel as though you are staying inside Disney's EPCOT theme park. In just 5 minuets after the fireworks show at EPCOT, we were back in our room. The 5 pools are wonderful, as are the hot tubs. We loved taking a break each day and then walking into EPCOT for dinner each night. The rooms are super quiet, immaculately clean and very comfortable and spacious. We stayed before at Coronado Springs, the Animal Kingdom Lodge, and at the Wilderness Lodge. The main difference are 1. Direct and quick access to Disney Studios and Epcot. 2. Easy access to a nearly unlimited number of excellent restaurants, at the others you evening dining selection are rather limited. 3. Well laid out hotel makes the pool, Epcot, and the boat launch seem close to each room. 4. Excellent large pool facility.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST pool and fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: NewEnglandTraveler09
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the first week in May with our 7 month old son. Although we had a wonderful time at the parks, it was very hot during the day, and the pool was the highlight of the trip - the water slide was a blast! The food wasalso fantastic. Due to allergies with my son, I can not have any dairy, soy, eggs, or nuts. Each time we dined at a Disney restaurant, the chef would come out and discuss different menu options for me and prepare a custom meal based on my needs, it was great! The only downsides to this resort were (a) it was expensive (breakfast for three people cost us $80 at Cape May cafe, ouch), (b) you had to pay $10 for internet,which is ridiculous (as everyone else has commented) and, (c) the walls are kind of thin (we could hear the people in the room next door and the people at the tidal pool outside our room door). However, these things were so minor compared to the fun we had and we will definitely go back! I read some reviews before our trip commenting that the decor was outdated and that the carpets needed to be replaced, I did not find that to be the case while we were there - the rooms were great, the carpets were fun with the disney characters on them (our son loved looking at them), and the lobby was bright and welcoming. I found only one grumpy staff member at the dining/recreation counter, and I avoided her as a result. Next time, I will try to book earlier so that we can get into the villas, and I will request a room with a view of the fireworks at Epcot, there was no way we could get to see them with the baby, but we could hear them every night.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Pixie Dust Goes a Long Way”
Reviews.Author: JassoFam
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 8 day glorious trip on May 3. We arrived at 7:30 a.m. and our room was ready, which was great after traveling for 6 hours on a plane. The price was more than what we would normally pay for a hotel of this type, but it was well worth it! LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION....could not be beat. I called ahead and requested a room near the lobby and got it. From our room to the back entrance of EPCOT was a 5 minute walk, and it was about a 20 minute walk to Hollywood Studios (they also offer a ferry). The transportation otherwise was a bit of a hassle because they had moved the bus pickup area to a different side of the hotel and it was a bit of a walk with three little, tired children. Mousekeeping was great, service at Cape May was great, pool was SPECTACULAR...I LOVED THIS PLACE and would def. stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Resort: Comfortable Rooms plus Fantastic Pool area Equals an Almost Magical Stay”
Reviews.Author: TarheelTraveler
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a four night stay at the Beach Club Resort with our four year old son. It was such a fun, family time for us, and we were pleased with our stay at this property. This was his first time to Disney World, and it was well worth the splurge to stay at a Deluxe Resort. If you like luxury hotels and are used to staying in resorts like Four Seasons, Ritz-Carlton, Preferred Hotels of the World or other hotels known for their service and exceptional rooms then you need to book your stay at WDW Deluxe property with the mind-set that you are paying for as realtors like to say, " location, location, location". Being on WDW property with park transportation, having magical express service from the airport, and beautiful grounds and pool areas are the main amenities for this hotel. In my opinion, the rooms are slightly above average, and comfortable with lots of drawer space for families, but don't expect to see a lot of luxury room extras. Other luxury hotels with room charges similiar to the Beach Club Resort come with turndown service, chocolates on the pillows, frette linens, robes and slippers, and plush bathrooms with scales. I think for some of those amenities, you need to pay even more per night and stay on a club level. Overall, we found our room to be inviting with its decor, and the beds comfortable. It was also clean. There were some housekeeping issues that could have been easily resolved if we had pursued it, but we did not bother. We were missing a privacy door sign, and several lightbulbs were out in the room. The one over the vanity, and a light on one of the tables were burned out. We did have to call and get a new remote. Our TV remote was missing. The hotel pool was great. I found dining in the Captain's Grille (adjacent Yacht Club) to be just average. The Character dining at the hotel's Cape May was fun and a trip highlight. The location near Epcot and Hollywood Studios is excellent, however, we did not spend much time there. Instead, we were on a bus to Magic Kingdom a lot. That is to be expected with our son's age, and as a result, when we go back in about four years with him, and our daughter, who will then be four, we will probably stay at a monorail hotel or the Wilderness Lodge which has easier access to the Magic Kingdom. The buses are very efficient, but the Beach Club bus four other hotel stops (Yacht, Dolphin, Swan and the Boardwalk hotel). Also, there is no easy way to get back from the monorail hotels to our resort if the Magic Kingdom closes early and the other parks are also closed which happened to us one night. We ate at the Contemporary after the park closed at 7 pm, and at 9:30 pm, we realized we had no bus ride back unless we went all the way to Downtown Disney then change to another bus that would take us back to our resort. We were on a bus for about an hour and half. We got to bed at midnight!!! We should have taken a taxi, but again, we were paying for free transportation in our room rates. Overall, we were very satisfied with our stay and I would recommend the hotel.....especially for those with older children and for people who want to spend less time at Magic Kingdom.

Reviews.Title: “Beach Club Resort with Dream Makers Vacation - Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Kanith
Reviews.Content: I cannot praise Lynda Hower enough at Dream Makers vacation. This was our family's first trip to Disney. Lynda advised us on every step of the way. She helped us plan and have the best vacation. We stayed at the Beach Club Resort -- which was a beautiful resort with tons of things to do for our children. We were lucky enough to be able to check in upon our arrival around 12:00 noon, which was a pleasant surprise. The room was very clean and located near a pool. The resort had several pools throughout and one immense pool with a pirate ship, water slides, and poolside entertainment; the pool included plenty of shallow areas for youngsters and plenty of room for older children and adults. The resort had a great little market/gift shop which was convenient for grabbing milk, AM coffee, autograph books, and last minute gifts. We ate breakfast at Cape May, a restaurant at the resort. It was a character breakfast with Goofy, Minnie, and Donald. The food was delicious, and the service was fantastic as well. Everyone whom we encountered at the hotel was friendly and helpful and interested in making sure they were meeting our needs. When we checked in and out, we used the Magical Express Service for our luggage and had no worries about dragging luggage from hotel to airport and back. Our luggage was delivered to our room upon our arrival and shipped to the airport from the entrance of Beach Club at our departure. We loved the fact that we could walk out of our room at the Beach Club and walk into the entrance of Epcot in only five minutes. We also enjoyed walking across the bridge to visit the shops and restaurants located at the Boardwalk. Lynda helped us secure some great table service dining including character meals at Chef Mickey’s, Crystal Palace, and even a Princess dinner in Epcot. The food was great and our kids loved meeting the characters in person. Lynda also helped us by giving us some tips for saving money and for making sure we were able to make the most of our 6 days in Disney! I told my husband, considering it was our first trip to Disney, I felt like we were well informed and prepped, thanks to Lynda. When we return to Disney (and I know we will), we will definitely book our trip with Lynda and stay at the Beach Club. We hope to send some of our family and friends there to enjoy as well. If you are feeling overwhelmed by all of the options Disney vacations have to offer, go to "dreammakersvaca.com" and ask for Lynda, and she will set your mind at ease and hook you up with a great resort at the Beach Club and a vacation you will never forget!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location for visiting Epcot, rooms are ok”
Reviews.Author: MrTed
Reviews.Content: Five years ago I stayed at the Yacht Club, my first stay at a Disney resort, and was a little disappointed with what Disney considered "Deluxe". I went into this stay with lower expectations and while I enjoyed the Beach Club more than the Yacht Club, I still can't belive that these at the upper level of Disney resorts. The room itself was fine and almost exactly like the rooms at the Yacht Club in terms of size and layout. It was cleaner than the previous room and did not have a musty smell. Bedding was new and very comfortable. I also like the new Disney-branded toiletries provided. Our room lacked the "Privacy Please" sign for the door and recycling bags, even though there were cards in the room asking guests to put all recyclable items in the bags provided. We heard some odd noises at night, but I don't think these were coming from neighboring rooms, rather from outside. It finally dawned on me that the high room rates don't really reflect the quality of the rooms, but the level of service and, perhaps more importantly, the location. Service at the Beach Club was great. Check in and check out processes were fast and efficient. The concierge printed our boarding passes for us the day before our return. Room service breakfast was delivered at the requested times and by very friendly cast members. All of the cast members were friendly and welcoming. It was the location that sold me first on the Yacht Club and this time on the Beach Club. Epcot is my favorite park and since I knew we would be eating most of our meals at Epcot, I wanted to be close. Both the Yacht Club and Beach Club are within very easy walking distance of Epcot, or you can take the boat across the lagoon. These hotels also give you access to all of the restaurants along the Boardwalk. I would highly recommend the Beach Club for anyone who plans to spend most of their time at Epcot. If you're a first-timer, just don't expect something luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Glorified 2-star hotel with a nice but VERY crowded pool area”
Reviews.Author: simmyDet
Reviews.Content: The Beach Club Villas will run you princely $400 a night, yet the everything from the small size of your room, to the quality of the mattress, the restroom, the dirty carpet is 2-star. The location is great, if you love the Epcot and Animal Kingdom, but further away from the other parks. Having been to Disney a few times, I'd recommend having your own car to get the most out of your stay. It'll cut down on travel times considerably, offer you easy access to other resorts (Disney's resort to resort transportation is non-existent), and can be your defacto storage for an extra change of clothes, sunscreen, snacks when you park hop. The best thing about the Beach club is the vast expanse of sand-bottom pools and the water slide (best on the property). But the pool area tends to get extremely crowded with kids, so pretty much a disadvantage if you're going during peak season. Even in the off-season, the pool traffic in the afternoons can get very hectic. And the water slide is nice, but if you're already planning on visiting the water park, it's not really worth dishing out $400 a night for. The bathroom is very, very basic as well. It seems that Disney has spent ALL the money on making the outside of the property pretty. Any of the other moderate resorts are a better value than this place. Save your money and stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Zsciaeount
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Yacht Club/Beach Club complex, and I must say that the for the price, the quality of the amenities and the physical plant are not up to par. During this most recent stay, I stayed on the club level. Check in was perhaps the best part, with a friendly escort up to the Club level and concierge check-in. However, I did have to wait for about 15 minutes for the lone agent to become available. That, however, is pretty much where the positives ended. The Beach Club is unofficially promoted by the staff as the more "family friendly" building in the complex. However, I really didn't notice a higher percentage of families there compared to the Yacht Club. Instead, I think "family friendly" was just code for "inferior amenities and decor." The carpets are dingy and worn, and the hallways and rooms are extraordinarily spartan. Because the focus is on families, there are surprisingly few rooms with king-sized beds, which means that they were unable to accommodate my room request and I was stuck with two double beds. In the room, the disappointments continued. The high-speed internet is anything but, and chugs along at speeds well below 1 meg, which is disappointing, considering that it is not free. Even worse, there is no option for Wifi, which is absolutely inexcusable in 2010. Heck, it would have been inexcusable in 2007! This is especially problematic, as there is absolutely no option for wireless internet in the conference facilities. Absolutely unbelievable when you're talking $300+ a night. The walls are paper-thin, which makes getting a full night of sleep very difficult. This is made even worse by the fact that the climate controls in the room only appear to have two settings: hot and muggy or just 3 degrees above absolute zero. I found myself getting up multiple times to try and readjust the climate controls, but never found a reasonable setting. All in all, the Beach Club is an overpriced mess of a hotel that offers 1990's-style comfort with none of the value. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Disney does it again!”
Reviews.Author: flipflopchic214em
Reviews.Content: Im 12 years old and has been to Disney world three times, and this time Disney really outdid itself! The pool espically was incredible. I highly recommend this resort to any family. It's just a short walk to Epcot, it has a Character meal, and at night you can easily walk to the Boardwalk resort (stayed there too) for ice cream and night entertainment. Disney does it again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but some suggestions”
Reviews.Author: twinklechicago
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel! Nice pool but can believe it is shared with the Yacht Club! Chair couldnt be found if my life depended on it! For the price of this hotel they CHARGE for the internet-give me a break!! Traveling with friends, and requested adjoining rooms months in advanced. Checked in and had us 15 rooms away from friends, said they couldnt guarantee adjoining rooms. Went back to front desk and explained this wasnt acceptable and they would get us closer together. Ended up having adjoining rooms-did they lie to us in the first place? They had adjoining rooms but apparently did want to give them to us until we complained.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely rooms, the BEST pool”
Reviews.Author: PerthFamilyof5
Reviews.Content: We checked in here around 3pm, and on check- in I requested that as we had a split stay, that we could stay in the same room. They happily assisted and we were upgraded from a standard room to a lake view room. The room was near the lobby on the first floor, this was great as we could use the stairs from the lobby to get to and from our room. Also, we could easily use the free wireless internet that was available from the lounge area without being in the busy lobby. The room was great, we had two queens and a day bed, which was made up for us. The room had a good size flat screen TV, but not as many channels as most hotels (all the Disney ones though!). Unfortunately, it ws too cold to swim for much of our stay but we did manage to use the fabulous pool a couple of times. We used the store a few times, the breakfast cereal was $6 a box! Most other items seemed more reasonable. During the very cold days the poolside activities were moved indoors, we participated in bingo. The staff at the conceirge desk were for the most part helpful, although we did encounter one lady who was a bit difficult. We used the laundry only negative was the distance from our room. The only other negative was having to pay for the internet, nearly every other hotel we stayed at during our US trip provided free in-room internet. The bus service was great and we never seemed to wait too long for any transport. We loved the dining plan, having breakfast in our room, using counter service credits for lunch, and our table service credits for our sit down dinner. Worked out to be great value for us, although I highly recommend booking as far in advance as possible.

Reviews.Title: “First Time......Hope the Second Time is better.....@ the Beach Club Resort!!!”
Reviews.Author: Speedy34Mississauga
Reviews.Content: First time to Disney......& staying @ the Beach Club Resort.......the time I was there March 12-March 18th....fitness club steam room was not working & also the whirlpool was not working either....need new fitness equipment...tooo old......my check out took 1 hour...I guess new staff.........too pricey .........nice place........very clean.....room & grounds.....swimming pool is ...wow.....sand in it..........need to be more helpful to resolve issue.....never told the blizzard beach waterpark was closed........went to front desk & asked for refund....told me I needed to talk to my travel agent......not very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Second stay not so "magical"”
Reviews.Author: smallmom
Reviews.Content: Our room was over the reception area. Was awaken at 3:30AM by marathon walkers who were hooting and hollering- kept us awake till 5AM. Called the front desk and was told they couldn't do anything about the noise and we should see the day manager. The day manager told us it was out of his control since the Beach Club didn't sponsor the walk a thon. We never received an apology nor did anyone seem to care about us being disturbed. Also, we ate in the Cape May Cafe and our server talked baby talk to us. Didn't appreciate that since we are in our 50's! We were there several years ago and had a great time. However, after this last visit will never return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Pool Complex”
Reviews.Author: Domer90mom
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Beach Club Resort. On our last visit to Disney, we stayed at the Polynesian which was equally as fabulous, but I would have to give the nod to Beach Club especially if you're going to spend any significant time at Epcot at night as we did. The strengths of this hotel is it's location and it's pool complex. As stated in other reviews, it is the best pool of any of the Disney resorts. Even when it was only 65 degrees, we were able to enjoy it as it's heated to 82 deg. You are literally just steps away from the back entrance to Epcot and the Boardwalk entertainment area is a 10 min walk on the other side of the lake. At the end of Illuminations, it took us just 10 min to get back to our room. Bus service to and from Magic Kingdom and Animal Kingdom was very good and the boat to Disney Studios was efficient and a fun and unique way to travel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Best pool on Disney property.”
Reviews.Author: Orange74
Reviews.Content: The Beach Club Resort is one of the best Disney hotels in Orlando. We've stayed at several of the other "deluxe" Disney hotels and this is now one of our favorites. The location is very convenient to Epcot and the Studios. This along with close proximity to the Yacht Club Resort and the Boardwalk Resort give you numerous dining and entertainment options. Everything is within walking distance and other transportation options (buses and boats) are convenient, too. The hotel's signature offering is the pool complex that it shares with the Yacht Club. Our young children (ages 2 and 8) loved the slides, lazy river and especially the sand bottom pool. It does tend to get crowded, but it is a great way to relax after a day in the parks. One complaint: To match the cost and exceptional level of service, Disney really needs to upgrade the bed comfort and linen quality. Other hotels with similar pricing feature high thread-count linens, down comforters and pillows, etc. Disney's best hotels (including this one) continue to use scratchy sheets and foam pillows. I expect better when paying $400+ per night.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Nyetao
Reviews.Content: Was very disappointed in the trip, from start to finish. Stayed at the Disney Beach Resort, and the service and food was horrid. Restaurants (including room service) closed at 10 unless you want bar food. Line ups and long travel times between parks just added to the drain of our 'vacation'. Nothing in any of the parks was worth the wait. Stay home if this is your only travel option-our worst vacation EVER

Reviews.Title: “A little over priced, but very nice.”
Reviews.Author: CaptRags
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at the Disney Beach Club. The motel was well appointed and VERY convenient to Epcot......a 10 minute walk at the maximum. The room was well appointed, although small i size for the price. The staff was very efficicent, friendly and knowledgable. I was amazed at the attention to the customer by all associates we encountered....even in passing. It's only a 15 minute ride to The Magic Kingdom and a 10 minute boat ride to The Animal Kingdom. Very convenient, very pleasant......but slightly high in price for room and what it offers.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great vacation”
Reviews.Author: amw1000
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 5 year old daughter and 3 month old son and had a great relaxing vacation. The hotel is beautiful, the staff super friendly and helpful, the amenities excellent. They have thought of everything. The things we appreciated the most included the kids club (age 4-12 I think), the swimming pool (amazing), the on site laundry (very practical), the character breakfasts at the Cape May Cafe and the good food at the Steakhouse (in neighboring Yacht Club Resort). We thought that there could be more of a range of food in the hotel store (as its expensive to eat breakfast in the restaurant every day). The hotel store had cereal and yoghurt but it would be good if they had fresh bagels, muffins etc and cappucino/latte machine. We also thought the food in the Cape May breakfast could be a bit better. I think they had those fake scrambled eggs and the fresh melon fruit mix tasted not so fresh. We would love to stay here again - walking distance to Epcot and frequent buses to Magic Kingdom etc. However we paid $300 a night which we thought was reasonable for the large room and all the amenities but with the park tickets and the accomodation and then food it becomes a very expensive vacation. You have to pay for internet in your room when we expected that for a hotel that seems to hve thought of everything, could have that.

Reviews.Title: “You can easily make this Disney Resort its own Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: LoriABil
Reviews.Content: This is our second trip to WDW, and our first time staying at a Deluxe hotel. Disney really does go out of their way to make it feel like you are staying at a beach-side resort. The furnishings were nice, and the beds were very comfortable for hotel beds! Food: There is only one "table service" restaurant here: The Cape May Cafe. We did not do the character breakfast here, but we did do the Clambake on the night of our arrival, which was very good. There are two other Table service restaurants at The Yacht Club Resort, which is the Beach Club's sister resort. These are just a short walk on the veranda by the pool. The Yachtsman Steakhouse seemed more upscale (we did not eat here) and The Captain's Grille. The Captain's Grille was a great place, and our 6 year old even loved it, which is rare for a steak place! (Note: it's been our experience that when ordering a steak, especially at the resort restaurants, the steak is usually spot-on, so if you normally order medium-well to make sure it's medium, you will end up with a steak that is overcooked to your liking. My husband did not learn this until the 3rd time he ordered one!) There is also a pool-side snack bar, with fairly good sandwiches, and the breakfast at the snack bar in the gift shop is wonderful! I was surprised that such good crescent breakfast sandwiches and yogurt parfaits could come from a tiny corner of the gift shop! One downside, there is no "food court" type place like at the Moderate Resorts, but with Epcot's backdoor a 5-10 minute walk away, you literally have an entire world of cuisine to choose from step away! TIP: There is a general store with groceries on the boardwalk if you need essentials and snacks. Also, go during the International Food and Wine Festival and you can sample foods and wines from all over the world. Plus, you can spread this out over several nights! Recreation: The pool is amazing. We were able to use it in October, and there were always plenty of lounge chairs. My son loved the pirate-themed water slide and the river and the whirlpools! The one down side is that the pool complex was so big, you can not set up in one area and expect to be able to keep a close eye on your kids, especially if they are only fair swimmers. It gets fairly deep in some areas due to the soft sand bottom, but the crew tries to keep the sand raked and even. If you have kids that are not good swimmers, you need to be in the water with them! There is always something (water volleyball, karaoke, joke contests) going on at the pool! Every night, there is a movie at the beach. The beach is very clean and great for sand castles! There is an arcade, but the other stuff was so great, he never even asked to go in there! You can also take a walk to the Boardwalk, where there are great magicians, plate spinners, and any thing else you can imagine. TIP: You can see the fireworks at Epcot at night if you stand on the bridge that takes you to the Boardwalk. Transportation: Free to and from the airport on Disney's bus. Buses to and from Downtown Disney, Animal Kingdom, and Magic Kingdom. Boat service to and from Epcot and MGM Studios. Walking distance to Epcot. Also, you can walk to the Disney Dolphin or Swan, cross the street, and you are at Fantasia Mini-Golf course.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: VernonCT
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the BC - very nice hotel! We have stayed at other WDW properties before and thought that this was one of the best. THe pool area is great. Sadly it was too cold for us to use but it was beautiful. They have a beach area too which is great for the kids with the sand. The room itself was very nice, and clean, which is important. We were at the villas so they had a nice little room with the TV running kids cartoons that was really cute. The only problem I had with this place was the Disney travel - bascially we caught a bus to the Magic Kingdom in the AM and were at Epcot in the PM. INterestingly enough for a $500 aa night hotel they don't run busses back there. They said I had to go to MGM and then take a ferry over (?? ) to get back to the beach club. I was not pleased with small tired kids that this is the way things are done. SO we had to hitch a cab back to the hotel (not pleased about that either ) so I was surprised at one of their deluxe hotels that they dont' have transportation running from every park and it's just from MGM. Other than that the hotel is very nice. CLean and friendly staff as is the way of Disney

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: KarylO
Reviews.Content: Great hotel..lots of water activities, shuttle boat to MGM..close to Boardwalk Hotel for entertainment, back door of Epcot...awesome character breakfasts for the kids!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a convention”
Reviews.Author: ironranger
Reviews.Content: I was at the Beach Club for 5 days to attend a training session. The staff was great the room was outstanding. I had a basic room but the decor and bed coverings were 5 star! The food at the resort was expensive but very good. The fact that its located next to Epcot makes it real convienent.....Not to mention they are next to 'boardwalk' which has lots of restaurants and entertainment within walking distance. every couple of days they have a movie on the beach shown on a screen.......it was very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: picktails
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Beach Club. Although the price is outrageous, you can't beat the location, especially with older kids. Epcot is less than a 10 minute walk, and the boat to Hollywood studios is convenient. It takes a little while, though, with stops at the Boardwalk and Swan/Dolphin. Try to get a room close to the elevators for quick in/out; some of the rooms are FAR from the lobby. Plus we could get free wifi! Staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Shop has good breakfast offerings in the back - croissant sandwiches, yogurt parfaits, lots of cereals, juices, coffee. Very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but worth it.”
Reviews.Author: EvilAsh14
Reviews.Content: We decided to cough up the dough to stay at the Beach Club after being so impressed with the grounds and location when we visited Cape May Cafe during our last Disney trip. I was so happy we did. This is definitely a huge step up from the moderate resorts we typically book (Port Orleans, Coronado Springs). Our morning coffee and a great restaurant were right downstairs. A USA Today was left at our door each day. Location is perfect. We were steps outside Epcot's back entrance and a quick boat ride away from Hollywood studios. I personally despise Disney's bus system, so we usually opted to walk through Epcot and take the monorail to Magic Kingdom. It was rainy and cold when we visited, but there were plenty of restaurants and amenities at our resort and the neighboring Yacht Club, not to mention all the goings-on at Boardwalk right across the lake. Our room was very spacious and clean, with a large balcony overlooking Crescent Lake. No hint of the filth, disrepair or buggies that other reviewers have claimed. We were unable to take advantage of the pool (cold and rain and all), but it is spectacular. Only downsides: --No food court. The Marketplace was fine, but you get tired of the same four sandwich choices all the time. Beaches and Cream was cute but crowded, and had an EXTREMELY limited takeout menu. (They wouldn't make me a strawberry sundae to go because it was not on the takeout menu, but I could order all the hot fudge sundaes I wanted. Stupid. Should have more quick food options. --I already dislike Disney bus transportation in general. Luckily, we only needed to take the bus to Animal Kingdowm, but you do have to share the bus with neighboring resorts, which makes the trip even longer.

Reviews.Title: “Disney working its magic”
Reviews.Author: casey25
Reviews.Content: By far one of the best hotels there is at Disney. You can't really say one bad thing about the Beach club. They have great rooms, amazing service, the best pool and slide by far (it has a lazy river too!) You can even watch movies on a beach with roasted marshmellows. Go during the spring though, perfect weather plus not as many people as during some times of the year. You can't really go wrong if you're staying here.

Reviews.Title: “"Best WDW hotel..you can feel the magic"”
Reviews.Author: Laurenl98
Reviews.Content: I went to the Beach club resort on January 18 with my sister and 2 friends and came back 10 days later. I was in love with it. The best thing for me was the pool because i love to swim since i was a little baby (now i'm 22) and the pool was bigger then my whole backyard. The only thing i didn't like about it was that it was REALLY crowded in the afternoons and iv'e been at the parks during the afternoon because of that. The rooms were spectactular. I liked the villa's because the rooms were very big and you could fit 6 people in that whole 2 rooms (we only went with 4). The bathroom for the King bed was spectactulor and the shower had alot of hot water for me and my sister (i slept with my sister). The only thing i didn't like was the small balconies. My freind and sister smokes and they didn't like the fact that the balcony had two plastic miny chairs. The resturants where spectactulor and the breakfast was amazing. There eggs were delightful but they burned my tounge, lol. My favorite was Beaches and Cream where we got amazing shakes. We had no problem with the resturants 5/5. The staff was so nice and funny. We became friends with a woman named Paula. She is the most amazing woman you could ever meet and she helped us with ALL the problems :). The walk to Epcot and the Boardwalk is amazing and the boat to Hollywood Studios is fantastic (if you don't want to walk to epcot there is always the boat)! The beach infront of the pool is great for making san castles for the kids! (don't go into the water because the boats and fish are in there). This hotel is amazing! I totally recomend it! :) <3

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Disney Resort”
Reviews.Author: mrzip
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at Disney's Beach club resort for four days and four nights the end of January. The hotel is very attractive. The rooms are tastfully decorated and the beds were extremely comfortable. The vanity area outside the bathroom was set up well with two sinks and mirrors and shelves below for storage. But, the actual bathroom with shower and toilet just seemed very small and crowded. We stayed on the club floor in a garden/standard view room. Our room was a hike from the elevators but we had a decent view. Although we were a couple of floors above a roof the view beyond the roof was pretty good. We could see Spaceship Earth in Epcot so that was pretty nice. I was disappointed with the size of the club floor lounge. It was really small so I usually took my food back to the room to eat. The food was okay. The evening wine seemed inexpensive but again it was alright. I had a discount for this level so I was happy to try it but I don't think it was worth the extra money even for convenience. The ice cream shop, Beaches & Cream is really cute and they had great desserts. It's very small and they get crowded so its probably best to visit at an off time. We ate breakfast at Cape May Character breakfast and it wasn't very good. We ate here last year and it seemed better. We ate at another Disney character breakfast buffet and it was considerably better. There are other restaurants at this hotel but we didn't get an opportunity to try them. One thing that was annoying that if you came back to the hotel at 11:00 p.m. or later it was difficult to get something to drink such as water or pop. There were no machines and the gift store and club lounge was closed. I had to walk to the BC villas in order to get a bottle of water from the machine. I asked someone working there where the nearest vending machine was and this is where I had to go. From that point on, I knew to put drinks in our room refrigerator. As others have stated, the pool area is very nice and we enjoyed the ping pong tables set up outside the ;pool section. Location is very good for visiting Epcot (walking distance) and the boardwalk area. Overall, we had a really nice time and I would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, many Ameneties, AMAZING Pool, Perfect Location in the heart of Disney”
Reviews.Author: michelleiada
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Beach Club for 10 days in May. The location of this resort is, in my opinion, the best in all of Walt Disney World. Nothing like staying in the magic 24/7. A stroll away from the bustling Boardwalk, Swan and Dolphin, EPCOT, and Hollywood Studios. A boat is also offered for those who don't wish to walk. Lots to do and countless places to dine. The grounds are lovely and rooms, which were recently refurbished and look nothing like the pictures on the Disney World website, are lovely tool The pool, Stormalong Bay is amazing, sand bottom, and huge. The cast members were freindly and helpful. The only thing that could be improved upon is the bus service, a bit slow. We loved staying here and can't wait to get back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: laurenjoshtravel116
Reviews.Content: What a gorgeous hotel with relaxing atmosphere. Our only complaint was the extremely slow bus service to Walt Disney World. The bed was extremely comfortable and the staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: JDK5
Reviews.Content: Got a 40% off special for a January stay. Hotel and pools are gorgeous. Perhaps the biggest perk of this hotel is the proximity to Epcot, Hollywood Studious, and dining options. Epcot is a 5 minute walk, Hollywood is a short boat ride, and there are 4 or 5 dining options you can walk to, without having to enter a park. The room was very modern, bright and cheery. The staff was very helpful. Not sure how anyone can rate this place anything other than a 5. I guess the only bad thing I can say is that if you had to pay full price for this hotel, it is too much. Our 40% discount was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: samille
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Beach Club Resort. We got a special deal through Expedia and were able to stay on the Concierge floor for a lower rate than the regular floors. We decided that even if we had to pay more, it would be a wise decision to choose the concierge floor. There are four times a day when food is out out. There is a great breakfast with all the sweet rolls, breads, cereal, fresh fruit and boiled eggs. We never made the snack time, but the afternoon hors d'oeuvres were really wonderful. There was even a lobster salad, and bacon wrapped scallops, chicken, cheeses, crudities and dip. At night the desserts were very impressive. There is always a choice of beers, cordials, and soft drinks. The staff is very courteous and friendly. The only small irritation was the number of children that were sometimes in the lounge. One morning I counted 35 and it is a fairly small room. But it is Disney World, after all. The rooms are lovely and very well kept. The location is very close to Epcot. I would have liked a bus to the front of Epcot because if you are going to that part, you would have to walk through the World Showcase to get there. But there are buses to the other parks. Our son said that the water slide was really great and the pool is spectacular. When we return to WDW, we will certainly stay at the Beach Club. If there had been free internet connection (There is in the lobby.), it could not have been a better experience!

Reviews.Title: “4th Time and always love it!”
Reviews.Author: TAYBUG
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Beach Club in January we were there for the half marathon and we were so happy to get to our favorite hotel and move in for the week. It was our 4th time there and the first trip back since they renovated the hotel. The rooms were beautiful. Loved the new couch bed, that worked out great for my teenage daughter. We had 3 adults and two teenage girls, crazy yes. The room never felt two crowded, the lay out of the room and the size is really nice. When we got there they upgraded us to a view room looking out at the lake, such a nice surprise. The staff is always friendly and happy to see you. The cleaning at times was spotty but there are so many rooms at that hotel I cant be to picky. All in all a wonderful trip back to our favorite Disney hotel. I cant see why anyone would be dissapointed in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel with an even better location”
Reviews.Author: eavesm
Reviews.Content: For the price there are better rooms to be found in the orlnado area even huge condos are cheaper than the Beach Club however no where else is in as good a location as this. 5 minute walk to Epcot, 10 minute walk to Hollywood Studios and a 2 minute walk to the fantastic Boardwalk Dining and Entertainment area (the ESPN Club is amazing for sports fans but get there very early for big games). The room was great, my only complaint is there was no Wifi only a wired connection in the room (mine did not work and it took there tech guys 24 hours to come out and fix it), which charges at $9.99 per day. The resort is beautiful and very romantic the staff have a very warm and welcoming front.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Chinana
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Beach Club with our two grandchildren for 4 nights in December. Everything about our stay was enjoyable and pleasant. The weather only allowed us to enjoy the magnificent pool one day of our trip, but in warmer months it would be heaven. Staff was friendly and courteous, always helpful with any request. Pre-check in went smoothly and arrival and departure on the Magical Express was efficient and easy. Also recommend the Cape May Cafe seafood buffet at this hotel. It was the best of our trip by far. Lobby was decoated with a fantasic chocolate carousel for Christmas. Our room overlooked Epcot -a great view of the fireworks. Easy access to Epcot and Hollywood Studios and the Boardwalk. Nice sized room with small balcony. Only complaint was too few outlets in the bathroom/vanity area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: singsongs
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel. The parking lot had plenty of spaces and was easily accessible to the hotel. The staff were very nice. The rooms were large and clean. The children loved the pool and wonderful slide. The location is great. It is a 5 minute walk into the backgate of Epcot. It is also around the lake with the Boardwalk shops and restaurants. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location... good value... but not really first class”
Reviews.Author: beachclubguy
Reviews.Content: The beach club has one of the best locations in disney especially if you are a fan of epcot. The convenience of being able to walk to epcot is beyond valuable in terms of saving time and easing stress. The boat to Hollywood studios is also good and convenient although sometimes slow to get you there. There can also be a HUGE line when returning. The Magic Kingdom bus was on time and not a bad ride. Unfortunately, to the best of my knowledge the Trip to Animal Kingdom stinks from any hotel including The Beach Club. Remember that the buses also stop at the Yacht Club, and many times at the Swan and Dolphin. This adds time to your trips. The hotel's service is very good. From the bell staff to the concierge the service is Almost first class. When comparing service to a moderate hotel we have stayed at like the Coranado Springs...the difference is night and day and worth every penny additionally spent. My main complaint is the hotels Cleanliness. I found that in general our room was not cleaned as well as expected upon arrival. It seemed, especially in the bathroom, that the room had only been quickly wiped down. The carpets were not vacuumed well if at all, and i found cereal all over our day bed. The beds/sheets, however, were clean and comfortable. It is a let down that we still felt a lack of cleanliness in such an expensive hotel. There is also no free internet in the rooms. Overall the Beach Club is a safe, fun and good bet.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't enjoy your vacation at the Beach Club, you probably should stop going on vacation”
Reviews.Author: sweetfan99
Reviews.Content: I reviewed practically every spot in Disney before we settled on the beach club. We stayed ended up here b/c we wanted to take advantage of the "Buy 4 get 3 Free" deal, and were able to book a 1 bedroom villa at a really good price. I understand the common complaint about a counter service restaurant, I guess, but there are probably 15 places to eat within a 10 minute walk (including the Boardwalk), and there is counter service by the pool, so I wouldn't necessarily agree that this is a major issue. There is also plenty to eat in the gift shop/eatery. We have a 4 year old and 1.5 year old. We LOVED the hotel. It was exactly what we had hoped, and I cannot recommend it enough. We definitely benefited from going during a REALLY slow time; we took the bus to the Magic Kingdom, and were the only ones onboard. The pool is awesome, my 4 year old liked the slide better than anything else we did all week, parks included. The pool area is awesome. The villa was perfect, we needed something like that so we could put the baby to bed and still be able to watch TV or hang out without worrying about waking her. We ordered groceries from Gardengrocer.com and the service was great. Food was there 30 minutes after we arrived. Having a full kitchen was a great luxury, especially being able to have breakfast each day in the room before heading out to the parks.
