Proximity to Epcot is as close as can be, Hollywood Studios is about 5 minutes by boat. Magic Kingdom was easy. On the last day (11/21) we went to Animal Kingdom, also pretty easy by bus. Some thoughts......Stay away from the ESPN Zone (at Boardwalk) for a meal unless you like really bad food in an absurdly loud atmosphere, or you have to watch a game......Flying Fish was good (at Boardwalk), pricey but nice....Ate at the hotel buffet twice, did the Character Breakfast one morning and it was great, also did the Seafood Buffet and that was great also....if you have a "princess" in the group, book a meal in Norway at the castle. It's the only place in all of Disney where you can eat with almost all the princesses, but it books up fast, DON'T wait until you get there.....we ate at 1900 Park at the Grand Floridian and found the food to be poor, though my daughter liked the interaction with Cinderella..... We CANNOT WAIT to go back. If you are hesitating to book something, or are not sure if this is the place, trust me when I say that it's as good as it gets. The only downside, if it is a downside, is that you may share a bus to Magic Kingdom or Animal Kingdom. Otherwise, there are no negatives. We kept track of a lot of info, like where we ate, etc...so feel free to contact me if you have questions. I can't post everything!

Reviews.Title: “The only Disney Resort to choose”
Reviews.Author: WDW4LIFE
Reviews.Content: Coming from a Disney lover who has been there 12 times, and stayed in numerous places such as Contemporary, Wilderness Lodge, Boardwalk and Polynesian, Beach Club is hands down my favorite place. From the atmosphere and service to the room accommodations and dining, Beach Club has it all. The Cape May Cafe is one of the top buffet restaurants in all of Disney, offering a wide variety of fine foods to mac' n' cheese. There's something for everyone. Recently adding crab legs to the buffet only made it that much better too. Being just a short walk from the Boardwalk area, it opens up many doors for nightlife. Jelly Rolls and the ESPN Zone offer a place to go and have a drink at night, while watching your favorite hometown team. Mine was the Phillies and the server was able to put them on numerous tvs for my family and I. The pool, while it may be crowded during the summer season, still offers one of the best atmospheres a Disney resort pool has to offer. The unique sand floor is a neat feature that sets the Beach Club apart from other pools. The Beach Clubs proximity to EPCOT, just a short walk, and Hollywood Studios, a longer walk or a short boat ride, is so convenient. With the boats running till after the parks close, its advantageous to plan to get there accordingly and in a timely fashion so you don't miss them. Overall, if you're a Disney first timer, there's no better place to stay then Disney's Beach Club Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Trip!”
Reviews.Author: peekacho_2000
Reviews.Content: We (4 adults) stayed in a 2 bedroom Villa from 11/6-11/9, room 454. Yes, it was a hike from the lobby, but there was a shortcut to the bus stop across one of the interior courtyards, so that was very manageable. The resort is beautiful! I'm a DVC member and have stayed at 99% of the resorts. This was our 1st time at BC and we loved it. Top of my list now, next to BLT. The main pool was great, lots of fun. Although it was a bit too cold out to spend much time at the pool, we enjoyed it. Had breakfast at Cape May, delicious, good service, great character interaction. The main shop did not have as much of a food stuff or clothing selection as many of the other resorts, but it was sufficient for our needs. Loved, loved, loved it here and will be back again ASAP!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort!”
Reviews.Author: Shel28
Reviews.Content: Our room was very comfortable and housekeeping was great. The resort is beautiful and very nice to just stroll around. Storm-a-long Bay was outstanding. Everyone in our party from 4 years old to 38 years old found something to love there. The quiet pools were also nice for a late night dip after a hot afternoon in the park. The staff was super friendly and accommodating. We had a car so never used the buses. The walk to Epcot was great. Took the boat to the Studios and only word of caution there is to make sure you know the time of the last boat and be there early because they ended the service prior to the posted time the night we were there. They called a boat back for the crowd that had formed but the boat drivers were not pleased! Only negative to this resort is the lack of a counter service restaurant like Captain Cooks at the Polynesian or Contempo Cafe at the Contemporary. We are Polynesian lovers but we would definitely stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons of Beach Club”
Reviews.Author: mrvinotinto
Reviews.Content: We chose the Beach Club for our first trip to Disney. We travelled with our two children (ages 2, 4). Pros: - The hotel is walking distance from Epcot and a 15-minute ride away from Disney Studios. - We had a standard room and felt it was a good size, with two queen size beds, and a spacious entryway (large enough for a double stroller). The room has an empty mini-fridge, where you can store milk and snacks. - The beds were extremely comfortable - definitely high quality bedding and mattress. We all slept great. The crib provided was a full-size crb, not a pack n play (which is what is most often provided in many hotels). - The lobby smelled so nice. I want my house to smell like that! - The activities team at the pool in the afternoon were great at engaging the kids and getting them involved in games. My son did not want to leave to get ready for dinner, ever. - There's a shallow beach area at the pool (near the Yacht Club) that is perfect for small children. There were even buckets and shovels provided! - The pool slide was a huge hit with my 4-year old. - Housekeeping was great. They always prepared our room while we were not in it (we usually went back to the room for naps in the afternoon). OK - I really expected the pool to be much larger. We're used to vacationing in resorts in the Caribbean and Mexico, and we thought the pool, while not small, was certainly not huge in comparison to a real beach resort. It has different areas, and it's certainly fun, but there wasn't enough sitting during Columbus Day weekend for everyone. And all the chairs are next to each other. - The stairs to climb to the top of the slide were on the beach, not on the pool area. This makes for a dramatic slide, but logistically, you cannot be at the pool and watch your kids go to the slide and up the slide while you sit at the pool or pool area. Just an FYI, in case your children are young and you thought you could just lay at the pool and watch them from there. Not the case! Cons: - Only one: There isn't a good counter-service restaurant. There's a little stand at the Marketplace store, but they don't have any substantial food/seating.

Reviews.Title: “Beach Club - A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dunblane_andersons
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week long stay at the Disney Beach Club resort and highly recommend it. We arrived after a long flight to find out that we had be bumped up to the Concierge floor (room 5652). What a great surprise! Our whole stay at the Beach Club resort was excellent. We were pleasantly surprised by the food and drinks selection on offer in the lounge and were only disappointed that we weren't around enough to use it all the time. The housekeeping staff were great and very responsive to a problem with a teddy bear getting caught up in the laundry. The concierge staff were very helpful and friendly too offering help where needed. The location of the Beach Club is excellent. We were visiting during the Wine and Food festival so it was just a quick walk over to Epcot at night to enjoy the atmosphere and the fireworks. We found the boat trip to Hollywood to be very convenient and never had to wait long for buses to the other parks. We thoroughly enjoyed the pool area at the Club and the restaurants. The Cape May Cafe was great for breakfast and also for a delicious dinner. We would recommend the Beach Club to any of our friends and hope to return (even to non concierge level) sometime soon!

Reviews.Title: “King Room with Illuminations View”
Reviews.Author: Rach217
Reviews.Content: Well, we have just had the pleasure of spending 15 glorious nights in room 4592 at Disney's Beach Club resort. We asked for room 2598 (a king room with a woods view) which wasn't available but they provided us with 4592 instead which is also a king with a woods view but as it's higher up you can see the top of the Imagination Pavillion in Epcot from the balcony and more exciting watch the illuminations fireworks (partially through the trees) at 9pm every night. We bought the holiday direct from Disney in the UK on a flight inclusive package and it came with free Disney Dining Plan and also gave a discount on the room and flight too (Saving ~ £100 / $160 a night all in). I personally wouldn't PAY for the Disney Dining plan as it doesn't suit how we like to eat, but for free - it was a great buy! The room was very nice, hidden mickeys all over the place. Mousekeeping did a good job (encouraged by a small daily tip and little notes to say we liked the towel animals). The balcony was quite large - big enough for 2 to sit out on - but beware that about 50% of the balconies are far smaller and only enough for 1 to stand on. Get the Sehlinger guide to Disney World if you want details. The bathroom was a little dated (not been refurbished like the bedroom) but did the job. I found the cast members generally excellent - especially Art the greeter in his penultimate week on the job :-( the reception staff were very helpful and courteous, as were most of the staff at beach club marketplace, and all at beaches and cream (best burger and milkshake ever!) and Raquel the lovely lady who served us tangerine dreams by the pool :-) The one time we had an issue (with the shower), they dealt with it politely and immediately - and were very friendly to boot! We'd heard loads about the size of the pool and as such was surprised it wasn't bigger! Don't get me wrong, it is a big pool but not ridiculously large. I didn't try the slide but my hubby did and said it was okay - maybe more for the kids! One of the weiredest but nicest things at the Beach Club was the atmosphere when you walked into reception. It was so hot and sticky outside and reception was always gorgeous. Cool temperature and an indescribable aroma in the air that just made it feel...lovely! (I'm not being wet, honest, it's really something else!) We'd not stayed at a Disney Deluxe resort before and there is a marked difference between the experience and room quality here vs. the very nice Port Orleans Riverside (granted there is also a marked difference in price too!). We would definately go back. We were so close to Epcot - it was nearer than the Swan and Dolphin, less than 5 minutes from our room. Wish list time, if they could make improvements... I'd like the Epcot resort 'Friendship' boats to depart from the boat docks near Canada and Mexico in world showcase (that would be COOL) and secondly if they could provide a card reader in the hotel TV so you could view your own and maybe your photopass snaps at leisure, I think that would be wonderful. The resort isn't perfect, nothing is, but we had a very nice time and on many an occasion looked around and said 'Wow, we're actually here'...how many places do you feel like that?

Reviews.Title: “More than we could have wished for”
Reviews.Author: lreast
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on here, we were a little scepticle about our visit. The whole experience was amazing. We arrived early having transferred from a different hotel for the second week of our holiday in Folrida. We were surprised that our room was ready and were checked in and given our room cards very quickly. The staff were very friendly and polite. Our room was gorgeous. Two double beds, plenty of room and a lovely balcony overlooking the amazing pool area. The beds were so comfy and would be hard to beat. The pool area was amazing and the sand bottomed pool was wonderfuly wierd. The location of the hotel in relation to Epcot and The Boardwalk cannot be beaten and was perfect. Watchin movies on the beach at 9pm every night with the fireworks at Epcot in the background added even more pleasure to they stay. All the staff at the hotel, whether they be cleaners, concierge or shop staff were pleasant and very helpful. This was our 3rd visit to Disney World and I had always wanted to stay at The Beach Club. I would recommend it to anyone and will definitley be retuning.

Reviews.Title: “This resort was the icing on my birthday cake!”
Reviews.Author: MissMinnie3
Reviews.Content: Our plans included spending my birthday at one of the Disney resorts and originally called for us to stay at the All-Star Sports complex....big mistake...unless you don't mind being inundated by kids morning, noon & night. Our room was very basic...right down to the 'love bugs', which, unfortunately, Disney cannot control! Along with this, our traveling partners room was not ready and our luggage did not arrive in the room until 11:00pm! Next day our breakfast was at the Yacht Club Resort...OMG! It was like stepping into another world! NO screaming or running in the lobby, staff greeting you, opening & closing doors for you & just wishing you 'good day'! We checked for availability but nothing was open; however if we wanted to just hop over to the Beach Club Resorts, they could accomodate us. We jumped at the chance! We spoke to a gentleman named Warner who could not do enough for us. He was very concerned that we were dissatisfied with the Sports Complex and serviced us even as far as a complementary taxi cab ride so that we would not miss our dinner reservations that night! Our room(s) was just divine..and we adjoined with our friends..at Sports Complex we were in one building and they were in another! Our new gentleman friend Warner made this the best Disney vacation we have EVER had, and we have been to Disney several times in the past, staying both on the grounds and outside of the park. In the future, our vacation destination for Disney will either be the Yacht Club Resort or the Beach Club Resort. They catered to our every need, even down to delivering a paper to our room every morning..now how's that for service?? I cannot say enough about this man that saved our vacation dream and about the wonderful and courteous staff at both of these resorts. Our hats are off to them! Thank you a hundred fold!!

Reviews.Title: “Disney fans”
Reviews.Author: bamatravelfan
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay. We normally stay at the Grand Floridian and I have to say we liked the Beach Club better. Our room had recently been updated...it was great and perfect for my family of five. My kids loved the waterslide and we loved the convenience to Epcot and Hollywood studios. The only negative for my kids was the monorail wasn't at our front door. However, when they realized we could walk through Epcot to catch the monorail they were fine (it is a long walk; however, you expect to walk a lot when you come to Disney). I will have to complain to Disney about the number of scooters in the parks. I have no problem if you are disabled and need a scooter. However, most of the people I saw riding scooters were too lazy to walk. I lost count of the of number of times my youngest almost got runover by one. Disney really needs to limit the scooters to those who really need one.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Ilovedisney2009
Reviews.Content: Everything about the Beach Club was amazing. The view, the sevice, the pool, the distance to EPCOT and H.S., everything. Can't wait to go back next year...it's so sad when you leave =[

Reviews.Title: “Beach Club location near Epcot can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: LisaF4UA
Reviews.Content: The Beach Club is the closest to Epcot of the Disney hotels. We like to eat in the World Showcase, so the location is particularly convenient. We stayed during the "Buy 4, Get 3 Free" deal which made the stay in a Deluxe resort affordable, but on top of that we were upgraded to the concierge floor, only adding to the value. We had breakfast, afternoon snacks and beverages, evening hors d'ouevres with wine and beer, and nightly desserts right down the hall from our room, in addition to a concierge desk to help with reservations, etc. We felt pampered the entire time. The rooms aren't large, but there were five in our party, including my 70-year-old mom, and we never experienced feeling crowded. The day bed was very comfortable. The balcony is also an added plus at The Beach Club. The pool is so huge, I later found there were sections I never experienced, and there is a water slide even the adults can enjoy. The Beach Club is also walking distance to Fantasia Gardens mini-golf, so when the kids start to tire of the parks there are other options. Although I would like to experience staying in one of hotels on the monorail sometime, I'm not sure I could give up the convenience and amenities of the Epcot area resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty much perfect”
Reviews.Author: plumpuddingflea
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two weeks in August and had a great time. We returned to the hotel for R&R in the afternoon after making an early start at the theme parks. The room we had was on the fifth floor overlooking the pool, which looked pretty when lit up at night. We had two queen size beds, a desk and plenty of drawers and hanging space, even with clothes for four people for ten days. The room was more tastefully decorated than the photos I could find of rooms on the web. The service we received was ultra-friendly and efficient and very "Disney". To be really picky, the only tiny flaws were that the music and noise from the pool was slightly intrusive in the afternoons and evenings, even with the balcony doors shut and sometimes we had trouble finding somewhere to sit and eat our "grab & go" breakfast. The other thing I couldn't understand was why there were no sun umbrellas on the fake beach looking across to the Boardwalk. There were sun loungers there and it would have been a pleasant place to sit and read if there had been any shade available. Otherwise it was all good.

Reviews.Title: “As if I was on the beach!”
Reviews.Author: worktvlr
Reviews.Content: Great view of the lake and the beach front, and quick walking distance to Epcot. Right across from the Boardwalk. A great greeting every time we walked in, and the coference rooms were so comfortable, it didn't feel as if we were there all day.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: KaitlynS10
Reviews.Content: So far I have stayed at the Beach Club twice with my family,once in July of 2008 and once again in January 2009 and will be returning there next month for Mickeys Not So Scary Halloween Party. All my time spent at the resort thus far as been quite enjoyable. Both times my family has been on the 5th floor which in itself is a perk. The views from the room no matter what have a side of beauty. The location is wonderful as it is in the middle of so much. Both Epcot and the Studios are within walking distance of the resort. The pools are wonderful,especially the sand bottom. Although the resort does not have much to offer small children there is the fun of movie nights on the beach,the several pools, a childrens play area and an arcade. There are several places to catch a bite to eat around the resort. All are good choices. In no way shape or form have I or my family had a bad experience at this resort and will deeply recommend this to any of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: claire0208
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 weeks here in August followed by a week at the Portofino at Universal. The Beach Club was outstanding - the rooms were a good size, the pools fantastic and there were a great selection of dining options! By far the biggest plus is how close Epcot is - it was fab being able to go into Epcot and get fish and chips from England and take them back for my husband and kids at the pool! We could even see illuminations fireworks from our balcony. The service was outstanding and any queries we had with the consierge were dealt with very quickly and professionally - all in all have nothing negative to say at all - it certainly made the Portofino at Universal seem like a poor alternative!! Fantastic!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: willie66669999
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean and spacious. The characters decorated our room for my 60th birthday-WHAT A GREAT SUPRISE. The only bad thing was we had to walk a great distance to our room. The resort is a huge building.

Reviews.Title: “ROACH INFESTED”
Reviews.Author: SHERKANBear_De_
Reviews.Content: not what was expected. The room was never vaccumed and the sheets were just smoothed over . We had to ask for wash cloths Also there were roaches in the room and on the balcony. When we told the front desk, all they said was, we will send an exterminator. He arrived and sprayed. Two days later they were still there.. We stayed from 8/16-23/09, The room number is 3515. The hotel could care less. We asked to be moved, and was told as soon as one was available, which never was. One does not expect this from a $400+ per night room. In the past we have stayed at the Floridian, Swan and the Yacht Club, we even took the Disney cruise, but we will not be returning to Disney for quite some time, or until they update there hotels or add some new ones.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Putina
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our three daughters, 7, 9, 11 loved the Beach Club, it was clean, decor was inviting and the staff was very friendly. The rooms were very nice and comfortable. The location is one of the best things about staying here and we all loved the pool!! We felt like we were really on vacation. My daughters could not get enough of the pool slide! I enjoyed it myself. We would definitely recommend the Beach Club Resort - it met our needs and expectations.

Reviews.Title: “The Good and the Bad at the Beach Club”
Reviews.Author: all5kids
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from a week in Disney with our kids (ages 7, 9, and 10). It was our first Disney trip, we booked the Beach Club on the recommendation of our friends and in part on some of the reviews on Trip Advisor. We also booked the Beach Club because Diseny had sent me something called a "PIN Number" in the mail, it got us a very good deal, so good in fact that I was able to book what I was told would be a room on the 5th floor, entitling us to concierge service, use of what they call the "Beach Club Planning Staff" prior to our arrival, and the promise of the use of a breakfast area on the 5th floor (complimentary continental breakfast every day). The planning staff were wonderful, they made all of our dining reservations for us (I just sent them an e-mail 90 days in advance of arrival). Unfortunately, when we checked in, a problem arose. I was given our room keys, told to have a magical day, and immediately noticed that we were in room #3691. Even I can tell that a room with a number like 3691 is probably not on the 5th floor, so I mentioned this. I was told that yes, the room was indeed on the third floor, and yes, we were supposed to be on 5, but it was a suite room, just like the one we would have had on the 5th. I was then told that the "pool side" of 5th was closed for renovations. So we go up to the room, it's great, a lovely room with a big balcony, no complaints there (and mercifully no sign of roaches or Palmetto Bugs like in another review). My wife then raises two issues: the first is, if the 5th floor really is closed on the pool side, how come we can see a family with young children standing on a balcony on the 5th floor? The second is about the breakfast that was supposed to be available. When I raised this with the staff, there response was to suggest that I could just "use all our snack credits on breakfast" (we were on the dining plan). Not so much as an apology for not even mentioning the relocation of the room. And of course we would have been "snackless in Orlando" if Disney had had its way. I kept all our receipts from the market place for breakfast, I intend to write Disney and ask for a partial refund. What bothers me most though is that I had to raise the issue of the room relocation, and I didn't even get so much as a sorry out of Disney over the breakfast thing. As for other features of the Beach Club, the location for Epcot and HS is excellent, but I agree that with the other parks (and especially DownTownDisney) the bus service is so slow to the Beach Club, and with so many stops, that you could probably drive to Tampa in the time it takes to get back to the Hotel. The pool at the Beach Club is wonderful, but it and the hotel were very full and the place is frankly becoming rather run down (it's a little too "well loved", especially by families with young children). My kids did, however, think it was the best pool they had ever been too. Would I recommend the Beach Club? Yes, I would, but not at the regular full price Diseny sometimes expects. It is very close now to what I would think of as a "moderate" rather than a deluxe, the Caribbean beach is just as nice.

Reviews.Title: “50th B-day”
Reviews.Author: TeddyboyNj
Reviews.Content: We stayed Beech Cub Resort 7-14 ,the hotel was great .we where by the pool side 1st floor . we had dinner most night at epcot. I love Disney at chrismas time of the year. My 50th B-Day was a great time......... Thank You All !!! Marion & Rudy N.J

Reviews.Title: “I truely believe the raving reviews are written by Disney!”
Reviews.Author: jennlikesflowers
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel only to find the room we were promised (a balcony room) was on the first floor and had no balcony. We were on our way to the room when we were stopped and told to go to a different room due to "something going on in that room." Next, we were moved to a fourth floor room with a "balcony" big enough for only one person at a time to stand on, a broken hair dryer, cracked sink and no working lights. Then after bringing this to the attention of the manager we were moved to another room which offered a new experience. Roaches in the bathroom, as well as in the beds! They literally crawled out from under the sheets and across my mother's feet while she lay in bed. After she jumped up and we began to strip the bed in search of more, surprise! Another one ran across the pillows. Again I placed a call to the front desk and I was told that it was not a roach, but a palmetto bug. After informing the woman at the front desk that I had managed to catch two of the bugs, that they were trapped under a glass and asked if she would like to see them; she replied," Well, they are in the roach family." And yet again we were on our way to another room; this time on the Yacht Club side. This has been by far the most MAGICAL FREE vacation at Disney World we have EVER had. NEVER again will I stay at this Resort. The only reasons they received even one star from me is due to the fact that when it rained - we didn't get wet.

Reviews.Title: “Best I have experienced. End of story!”
Reviews.Author: FREYES64
Reviews.Content: We loved Beach Club! The rooms were perfect, we were steps from Epcot, and the pool was so amazing that we skipped the waterparks and stayed at the pool. We have been hotel hopping at Disney for years. Done! I will not go to WDW if I can't afford Beach (or Yacht) Club.

Reviews.Title: “Defines the word "resort"”
Reviews.Author: Chiefy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here August 3-7, 2009, our first time at a Deluxe Resort at Disney. Previously, we have stayed off-site, and at Port Orleans and Caribbean Beach. While the physical room is similar to the ones you would find elsewhere at Disney, it is evrything else that makes this a fantastic experience. First, the employees; Any that we interacted with, from the bellmen, to the concierge, even the staff at the Marketplace, were all pleasant and helpful. Even those we didn't have dealings with offered a polite greeting and smile. The housekeeping was perfect. Other than the carts in the hallway, you'd never know they were around. No matter when we came back to the room, it was made up, and one day even had the towel animals and posed stuffed animals that we had heard about but never experienced. Our 10 y/o was thrilled. Balcony was great...morning coffee, afternoon relaxing, or nighttime wind-down, really great to have. Amenities: The pool is everything that everyone says, and more. Comfortable, warm, refreshing, with sandy bottom and a slide that the kids (and I) couldn't get enough of. Never too crowded, and as others have said, exclusive to Beach Club/Yacht Club guests. The Restaurants: we were not on the dining plan, so grabbed quick stuff at the Marketplace, ice cream at Beaches and Cream( No Kitchen Sink for us, but you gotta see it!!) We had the Character Breakfast on our last morning, and enjoyed it. Crowded, but efficient, with good food and excellent service. Hurricane Hannas was mixed: Boys loved the burgers, girls didn't care for the veggie wrap. The lobby and common areas were meticulously maintained, and immaculate. Room was big enough for 5. Location: Again, a winner. Walked to Epcot several times, took the boat and one time walked to MGM. (hot, but definitely doable); walked over to the Boardwalk as well. Super convenient. Could even see some of the fireworks from the parks from the hotel. Took busses to Dowtown Disney, AK, and Magic Kingdom. Busses were crowded, but we were traveling at peak times, so what do you expect? MK was soooo crowded, we took the monorail to Epcot and walked, and I think it was faster than waiting for the bus! Magic Hours, early and late, are definitely worth taking advantage of. Magical Transportation makes it effortless and stress free going to and from the airport. Did not take advantage of the myriad of kids activities run by the hotel. This really is a destination by itself. For a little bit of a relaxed place, its definitely worth it. If you are a person who is at the park from open to close every day, then you don't know what you are missing.

Reviews.Title: “Beach Club Resort Rocks Our World !!!”
Reviews.Author: staciboo
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough about what a fabulous resort The Beach Club was for my family. The Short walk to EPCOT was THE BEST ! The staff was superior to anyplace we've ever stayed ! And we have stayed at four other Resorts on the Disney property. When we arrived, we were waiting for the room, and were hungry ! We ate quick meals at Hurricane Hana's at the grill located between the beach area and the pool. They had really good music piped in, like Jimmy Buffet, Sting, Phil Collins, The Beach Boys, Blondie, The Go-go's....! Once the room was ready, the kids immediately wanted to swim and my husband napped ! I took the kids and we had a blast at the pool. The lazy river was great, the sand bottom pool and terrific water slide was great , and the little "quick sand" holes were alot of fun for them ! They had beach ball volleyball set up and about 30 people were playing and you just joined in and played, so that was fun. All ages played ! The Short walk to EPCOT was THE BEST ! We walked over to Epcot and saw the tribute to U2 band (called 2U)... it was cool ! We had reservations at The Japan Habachi Restauraunt Teppa Edu ! Really very good food and totally entertaining ! The dining plan really worked out great for us !We ate at: The Coral Reef Restaurant in Epcot near The Land area and that was the best food we had. The salad and veggies were grown at Disney hydoponically in green houses) ..And the Mahi-Mahi and Halibut entrees oh so yummy. Lobster Bisque flavorful,velvety, and savory. A Mushroom risotto went with the Halibut and was the best I think I'd ever had! The Yahtsman Steakhouse in the Resort was also very good. The Scallop Appetizer was great ! The Filet was perfect! The Lobster Bisque, divine. And even the kids had steak, potatoes, and carrots ( a nice choice) and their desert was a white chocolate puzzle that came in pieces that they arranged themselves into a Mickey Puzzle. Then, they had a paint brush and could paint the puzzle with edible paint and then eat it ! Hahaha! I got that desert too. And the creme brule was yummy, too. By the way, the vegetarian meals offered at Disney are really good too. We stayed at Magic Kingdom until 2AM !! Cause we were "Resort People" Yayayayayayayyyyyy! And at EPCOT till 11PM ! Each night had a different "late" night... Cause we were "Resort People" Yayayayayayayyyyyy! The toy story 4-D ride had the longest line in the history of my visits to Disney, so my husband and I decided to convince the kids to pick anything they wanted to go back and do in exchange to get the heck out of that long , hot gruelling, line! Guess what they wanted? To go back to the Beach Club to swim! Hahaha! So off we went, they two kids swam and played vollyball, hubby and I hit the hot tub !!!! with a few ice cold imported draft beers from the lovely bar in the resort-- Yay !! A few hours later we boated over to Hollywood again and stood in a line for about 50 minutes and did the Toy Story ride and it was all good. Very cool ride ! Friday, our last day, we had time to pack, check out, swim again and then catch the Magic Express to the airport !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: bokat
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay - our first visit to Disney and the access and amenities were excellent. EASY acces to Boardwalk and EpCot. Pool is fantastic - plenty of room never crowded - lots of fun for the kids - great slide.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: NetteCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Visited July 25-July 31, 2009. First trip to WDW with a 10,12, and 16 year old. We had a wonderful stay at this resort. There is something for everyone: Character dining, swimming, water slide, volleyball, boat rentals, arcade, and movies on the beach. The resort is a destination by itself with EPCOT a short walk away. We walked there three times. Once to get fish and chips from the UK. Transportation to/from parks via the bus, ferry is efficient and runs about every 15 minutes with stops to nearby resorts. Our room was nicely appointed with a small refrigerator, coffee maker, safe, double sinks, daybed, and we had a nice balcony with a partial pool view. Lots of Disney channels. The pool area is staffed with plenty of lifeguards. Beaches and Cream is a quaint restaurant with great burgers and hot dogs. If you have room, order the kitchen sink. Unfortunately, reservations are not accepted, but they're open until midnight. The market place is another quick bite option serving sandwiches, soups, fruit, salads, and a few groceries. There are other dining options at the resort, and I highly recommend that you make reservations. We rented a car for three days and parking is free to hotel guest. While off site, we picked up snacks and water, which cost around $2.50 each at the parks. With tempertures in the 90's, water/snacks for five could add up quickly. So take your backpacks, patience, and expectation that you're not going to be able to see and do everything with four parks, a resort that has everything, and you should have the time of your life. We are planning to stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back! And we WILL!”
Reviews.Author: mommyoftwo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Beach Club from July 16-23, 2009. My husband had a conference at the Gaylord Palms, but we decided to stay at the Beach Club after doing much research on hotels in the area, and after reading MUCH info on tripadvisor! And the tripadvisor gang didn't let me down! It was an AMAZING trip! Our very first to Disney World, and definatly not our last! First, some details about our trip: This was our very first Disney experience. We traveled with my two boys, ages 7 and 5, my 7 month old daugther, my hubby and my mother-in-law. We visited every one of the parks, but no water parks. (Didn't need to, the pool at the resort was a waterpark in itself!) Check in- great! We didn't get to the hotel until 10:30, so our group was TIRED. They front desk was corteous, fast, and we were in our room within 15 minutes. We got a roll-away crib for my daughter (delivered within 10 minutes of our request), and the room size was perfect for our group. Motherinlaw slept on the hideabed, boys in one bed and me and hubby in the other. We ordered groceries from gardengrocer.com and after a bit of confusion from the front desk as to where they were delivered to, we had them in our room within an hour of our arrival. Hotel: amazing. Clean, friendly, easy to naviate. We had booked a standard room, but upon arrival requested a quiet room for the baby to sleep during the day and they switched us and upgraded us to a waterfront room with a half-balcony. and this view was AWESOME! Perfect view of the boardwalk and fireworks from Hollywood Studios. We were on the 4th floor, room 4616? I can't remember our exact room number...sorry! We had a couple of concerns about the way we were billed during the week from various places (we had the dining plan and sometimes the snack venues would accidentally charge our ROOM instead of placing the snacks on our dining plan), and a few other concerns, and even though occasionally the front desk personnel would give us different answers to our questions, they would ALWAYS work to remedy our problem to where we were satisfied. That was probably what impressed us the most about our hotel (and Disney in general) was that if you made a request, they always tried to honor it, if they could. one of the bus drivers told us that Disney policy was that if a customer requested something of a cast member, and if the request didn't violate safety standards, then that cast member needed to move Heaven and earth to honor the request. That attitude was obvious to us throughout the week wherever we went! Parks: Had a blast! We took the boys to the parks during the day while my mother in law stayed at the resort with the baby. It was hot, but not unbearably so. We brought our spray fans everywhere and they were lifesavers. More on the parks later, in another review, but if you do have any questions about our park experiences, please feel free to send me a message! location of hotel: Couldn't be better! we visited a few other resorts during our stay and on our next trip, I honestly think we'll stay at the Beach Club again. The walk to Epcot was 3 minutes tops, you take a quick ferry ride to Hollywood Studios, and the buses to Magic Kingdom, Animal Kingdom and Downtown Disney were always on time and efficient. I think the average bus ride was 20 minutes or so, and the longest we ever waited on a bus was 20 mintues. no issues with any transportation during the week. What was great about the location of the Beach Club was the boardwalk! Sooo much fun! At night we walked around with the kids and ate icecream, watched magicians and rode tandom bikes around. Such a laid-back atmosphere, we lOVED the boardwalk! there is a dance club there, and a comedy club, but we were too busy to visit those. Pool: Water park is a more accurate description! This alone was worth our stay at the Beach Club. My boys LOVED it. Lazy river (that gets DEEP, 8 feet I think), sand-bottom pool, waterslides...they had it all. AND it was heated, so even after rain it never got cold. My baby loved the pool too. This is where my mother in law and baby hung out during the day. Plenty of shade, convenient food, snacks, pool side service, it was wonderful! If you have kids that like water, you cannot go wrong with the Beach club! We all enjoyed this pool so much! Food: we were on the Disney dining plan, and restaruants we experienced were: Ohana, The Flying Fish, Yak and Yetti, Mama Melrose, and Tony's Time Square in Magic Kingdom and a character breakfast at the Cape May cafe...I think more but can't remember the names! No issues with food anywhere. The flying fish was EXCEPTIONAL! our trip was amazing. Any questions, dont' hesitate to ask! Thank you tripadvisor gang for helping me plan a wonderful first trip to Disney World!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Awesome Pool, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: LaxDad615
Reviews.Content: Several reasons why this is such a great value: (1) Location, location, location - it's an easy walk to Epcot, and an easy boat ride to Hollywood Studios. We have a 13 yo boy who loves the more thrilling rides at Epcot (Space, Soaring, Test Track) and Studios (Tower of Terror, Rock N Roller Coaster). We really enjoyed the simplicity of just walking to or from Epcot whenever we wanted - quick trip for shopping, to see fireworks, to grab a bite to eat at one of the international pavilions - super easy and convenient. It's also nice to have the Boardwalk right there so you can visit their many eateries as well. (2) The Pool - we've stayed at 5 other resorts and the pool at Beach Club (Stormalong bay) is without question THE best of all we've seen. It is massive in size, has a great water slide, has a lazy river, and has a sandy bottom. We spent more time than expected in the pool, but it was definitely worthwhile. (3) Atmosphere - great family atmosphere, but not chaotic like some of the moderate or value resorts. They truly have captured the Atlantic Coast feeling and it's really a great place to just hang out. A few lessons for the future we'll try and remember (because we will stay here again): ** We stopped at Target on our way to the resort and bought a case of water - very worthwhile, we saved big $$ on buying water! ** The dining options in late July are not as simple as I had hoped - many places were booked, so next time we'll do what a lot of others do and plan our visits around dining (when we want to visit a particular restaurant that is). ** Beaches & Cream is a great place to have ice cream PLUS they have an awesome burger! ** We stayed on the first floor which was an easier walk to the pool, just around the corner from the Marketplace (shopping plus quick serve food), had a public rest room near by, and wasn't far from the laundry. Will try and do this again next time! ** The boat to Hollywood Studios is convenient - but slow. Need to block out 25 minutes minimum - it stops at Swan/Dolphin plus goes slow to avoid wake. Not a problem - we enjoyed the ride - just need to plan accordingly. ** The surrey bikes at Boardwalk are a lot of fun, but also a lot of work pedaling up the hills - make sure everyone is energetic when you rent the bikes! ** There are two walk-up restaurants on the boardwalk and at 6:00 pm aren't too busy - if you wait later they are.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the sand on the bottom of the pool!!”
Reviews.Author: ckst1star
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Disney with our 6 year old daughter. The Beach Club came highly recommended. We were greeted as we got off the bus and walked personally to the chwck in desk, our room was ready when we arrived about 12, so that was a nice surprise! Our room was nice and comfy but I was shocked at the dust on the furniture, lamps t.v. Definelty not what you expect to find for this kind of money!! Housekeeping was VERY inconsistent! Our first two days I think the housekeeper was in a huge hurry and not very attentive to details....thank goodness someone new took over for the remainder of our stay, only 2 days we had to call for washcloths...details, details!!! The dust was never touched during our 8 day stay! When I pay this much for a room I expect top notch cleaning.........When I did call with a problem it was handled within minutes...literally! Food was ok, character breakfast was fun for my daughter, the buffet was good.....husband said it was the best flavored boiled shrimp he had ever had.......... All the staff were friendly and accomodating! Enjoyed the Beaches and Cream ice cream shop for our late night snack! If you go be sure you see the "kitchen sink" they offer! We liked the location of the hotel and transportation was great, only one small hiccup but the hotel and park made it right!! The beds were very comfortable!!If we go back to Disney would we stay there..........possibly, but we like to explore new places so we might choose another resort but that is certainly no reflection on this hotel, just personal preference. I would definetly recommend this hotel to family and friends!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved the Beach Club resort! Would go back in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: caper2009
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to the Beach Club resort for our honeymoon from July 13-20. We wish we were back there now! Disney Beach Club Resort is a beautiful resort in a gorgeous setting. The lobby was very pretty and inviting, with a beach sent floating through the air. The employees treated us like we were royalty and made sure every one of our needs was attended to. Our room: We had a wonderful room (2598) that had all refurbished furniture and decor. It also had a gorgeous long balcony with two lawn chairs. We were extremely pleased with our room and would stay at this hotel again without a doubt! The pool area is beautiful and has lots for everyone to do. The pool even has a big waterslide. We especially enjoyed the sand bottom feature. There is definitely plenty of space for adults and children to swim, with even a very shallow pool for very small children. The only restaurant we tried at our resort was Beaches and Cream. This restaurant serves as a location for quick service breakfast. We had a delicious breakfast everyday with choices of pancakes, omelettes, bacon, eggs, yogurt and fruit plus lots of juice and coffee. In the afternoon and evening (until midnight) this restaurant is an ice cream bar/quick service for dinner and lunch. They have delicious ice cream and waffle cones...definitely recommended for a hot day! Transportation to and from the resort was pretty good. This resort is literally a five minute walk from Epcot (walk outside the resort and turn left). You can also walk about 15-20 minutes to Hollywood Studios; however, it was about 40 degrees when we were there so we opted for the boat. There is a boat that goes continuously from Beach Club to Epcot and Hollywood studios. This is a very convenient method of transportation, much quicker than the buses. The buses were on time and provided us with rides to all of the parks within 20 minutes. The only day we had a problem was getting the bus to Typhoon Lagoon. This bus took about 45 minutes-an hour to pick us up heading to the water park and probably took another 45 minutes to pick us up on the way back to the resort. Other than this we had no problems with transportation. There is lots to do around the Beach Club resort. The Boardwalk area features lots of fun shops and restaurants with two bars. It's a also a great place to catch a glimpse of the fireworks at Epcot. It's also really nice to be able to walk over to Epcot to watch the fireworks or check out the pavillons in the evening. All in all this resort is a fantastic spot for people to stay in Disney. We loved every minute at the Beach Club Resort and would go back without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Beach Club Resort Especially the Pool area”
Reviews.Author: GRIFKIRCH
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 7 night stay at the Beach Club resort. Our room was very nice, our housekeeping was up to par. We were a family of 4, grandparents, 11 year old grandaughter, 14 year old grandson. Our room had 2 queen beds and a day bed. The Day bed was a bit small for the teenage boy but fine for an 11 year old girl. A nice size dresser and closet held all of our stuff just fine. Had a small fridge and coffee maker. The best bargain of the week was the $13 refillable mugs at the small cafe in the hotel. They had coffeee, tea, ice tea, soft drinks and hot chocolate from 6 am until 11 pm. So definitely the best bargain. Also the ice cream at the Beaches and Cream shop on the Boardwalk outside the hotel. The single scoop in a cup was a large serviing. The kids really enjoyed the large pool and slide and sandy bottom pool. All in all a great first stay, but still we love the Wilderness Lodge the best at Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cemory268
Reviews.Content: Well, where shall I begin.... The Beach Club has recently been refurbished, so the hotel has a new feel to it. Lovely rooms with nice furniture and bed linens. The beds are VERY comfortable! The pool is fabulous! It has a fun waterslide for kids and adults and a lazy river. You can rent tubes to float around the river in. Food at the hotel is pretty typical. Not great, but not terrible. We ate at the Cape May Cafe for dinner one night. The buffet was just ok. It did have a lot of variety, so that was nice. Of course, Disney's food is way overpriced, so don't expect too much for the $$ you spend. One nice perk is that you can purchase a mug for around $15 and get as much soda, water, and lemonade as you like for the length of your stay. We ate at Don Shula's at the Dolphin and it was TERRIFIC! Very pricey, but good! The downside to most Disney Hotels is the transportation. It takes at least 30-45 minutes to get anywhere- including to parks and other resorts. Buses and ferries run about every 20 minutes or so, but sometimes it's longer. Then, when you finally get on a bus or ferry, it's standing room only. I think if we vacation at Disney again, we'll definitely rent a car. Perhaps during an off season it isn't as bad, but I can tell you that in July, you'll be standing and waiting and then standing and riding! The Beach club shares transportation with the Yacht Club, the Dolphin, the Swan and the Boardwalk Hotels, so it's very crowded on the transportation. All in all I would say this is an 8 out of a 10! It was a beautiful hotel and the staff is really accomodating. Overall, a very enjoyable vacation and hotel!

Reviews.Title: “beach club?! more like [- -] club”
Reviews.Author: hotelhater69
Reviews.Content: we booked our room and we were going to be put on the 4th floor, but they made a mistake and upgraded us to a villa. there was only ONE bed, but we had 4 people, so 2 of us had to sleep on a pullout mattress which had poop stains all over it. we called to complain over 8 times, and someone finally came up to the room, and all he did was flipped the mattress over to the other side. after we got over that, we went outside to the pool that was just for the villas, we saw a dead gecko and a baby's diaper full of caca. EW!! NASTY!! the pool water was cold, i guess the heater had broke and no one even attempted to fix it... room service was horrible, the food made the people i was with throw up. the wake up call came 10 minutes late. the ferry that takes you to MGM and epcot was NEVER on time and the ferry driver swore at me when i told him to drive faster because he was driving wicked slowwww!!! the theme of this hotel is victorian, come on disney, this is the 21ST CENTURY!!! at least modernize it, will ya?!?!?! WORST HOTEL EVER. even comfort inn or motel 6 would have been a better stay. BEWARE OF THIS HORRIBLE HOTEL!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great except the transpo!”
Reviews.Author: annberg1969
Reviews.Content: Great room, beautiful lobby, accommodating staff, great activites, amazing pool, super restaurants, and easy access to Epcot! Only down side is transporation returning to hotel from other parks. Most hotels have their own bus for direct trip, but the Beach Club is paired with multiple hotels and the wait time is insane!

Reviews.Title: “Greatest Resort, steps away from Epcot”
Reviews.Author: jaice222
Reviews.Content: We frequent Disney every year all the way from AZ. We've stayed at almost all the resorts and this one is definitely the best. We (husband and 3 boys, 9,7,4) all love Epcot, so to start and end our day there is the BEST given that it's steps away. We stayed in the room overlooking the lagoon and to open the drapes every morning to that beautiful view is unsurpassed. Love it! My boys go crazy at the pool and absolutely love the slide. Because we do not have beaches close to where we live, this is an exceptional consulation. The boys think it's the coolest to walk in a pool with sand in between their toes. The rooms are amazing, lots of space for the 5 of us- 2 sinks, big beds etc. The drawer space could improve a little. There's not much space to put all the clothes away. We always go for 10 nights- so with that times 5 people, that's a lot of clothes. Grant it I don't pack for 10 nights as I do laundry (bring lots of quarters- you're paying Disney prices to do laundry), but there still isn't enough space to put your clothes away. The only thing I wish they would improve are the restaurants. After a late night at the parks, we would love the option to eat a counter service (we always do the dining plan) which offers pastas, burgers etc. The value resorts have it mastered, with all the dining options. The Beach Club unfortunately does not have that- only Peaches and Cream where it counts as a sit-down meal. The little cafe they have is great for breakfast, but not for thos late night burgers, pastas and pizza. There are only 2 things with this resort I wish they would improve upon: drawer space in the rooms and restaurant options. Those 2 things are certainly not a deterrent from returning. We've already booked our next stay for September 2009. We can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, great location!”
Reviews.Author: wdw4me
Reviews.Content: When we checked into the Beach Club Resort at 11am our room was ready. We were very excited to go and see the room that was just on the second floor which we were told was an 'upgrade'. We open the door to the 'suite' as it was described in the hall only to find that we were upgraded to a KING room with two adults and two children. We went back down to the desk and were given a hard time. We requested a crib for our two year old son but sometimes he won't sleep in the crib so we needed to have a spot on the bed just in case. The front desk person was not very nice about it since we were UPGRADED. She switched our room to two queens on the 4th floor but it was very, very far from the elevator ( you had to walk down two long hallways). This was difficult with the kids but at least it was quiet. The mousekeeping staff was superb, the room was always cleaned early and was immaculate. We never had any 'extra's' like towels made into mickey shapes, etc. but at least it was clean! Always were given fresh soap as well which my kids loved. The hotel has a nice gift shop with a quick service food area and beverage fountains for the Disney refillable mug program. During peak times this area often had very sticky floors and messy counters and soda's that were out....but that is probably common for such a large resort with such a small beverage counter. The food choices here are minimal but at least it is something. Self parking is fairly convenient which is also a plus. Bus service is a short walk from the front entrance and the bus is only shared with immediately located resorts so travel time is kept to a minimum (although we almost always drove to where we were going). One HUGE benefit to this resort is the very short walk to the International Gateway of Epcot and the boat to the Disney Hollywood Studios. The pools are wonderful although a bit of a walk from the guest elevators. There also aren't enough chairs since most people plop down towels on 4-5 chairs only to spend the majority of their time in the pool. ON several occassions we had to put our things off to the side by the railing because we could not find a chair. I would definitely stay there again if there is a promotion going on but for the regular cost I'd probably consider the Dolphin or the Swan first!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Had a wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: kaz110965
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Orlando and made our way to the Disney Magical Express Bus,the staff were helpful and friendly. We boarded the air conditioned bus for the short journey to our hotel. Upon arrivel at the hotel we were welcomed home and taken to the consierge level where we were given all the Disney Information and room keys. The consierge level was well worth it with friendly attentitive staff who helped us with changeing dinner reservations and booking an Aloha Show. Included on this level is continental breakfast with pastries.muffins etc and throughout the day at different times they would lay out snacks and drinks. Would reccomend putting cold drinks in your fridge. All beer and wine aswell as hot and cold drinks all included. I like the fact you could walk to Epcot and take the boat to Hollywood studios it is possible to walk which we did once. The boardwalk is across from the hotel and is a good place to eat and also has a very nice bakery. You can take the boat across but quicker to walk. We ate at the Flying Fish and Spoodles at the Boardwalk and both meals were very enjoyable. We also ate at the Yachtman Steakhouse which was really nice and excellent service. We had a character breakfast which I was disapointed at and felt the characters were rushed even though the breakfast area was quite. Our server was slow and took ages to get butter for the toast. The pool area is amazeing with a beach area and sand bottom, the lazy river was a little disapointing but the pirate slide was fun. They had three hot tubs which my husband enjoyed. Beaches & Cream has nice ice cream and if you can manage th kitchen sink its worth a try!!! Nice food but found it small for such a large hotel. You can order food or have a waiter deliver it your sunbed. There is also a bar. We took the Disney Dining Plan which inc 1 snack 1 counter service meal and 1 table service meal. Although this was ok we did not use all the counter service meals as the large portions were too much for us to eat. It is a good deal for those who can eat large portions. Just a note if you are on the dining plan and book the aloha show you get seated the furthest awayfrom the show if you use the plan. The bus that takes you too Magic Kingdon etc were very reliable and never took too long to get to your destination. We were lucky one morning to be driven to Animal Kingdon the hotel likes to choose a family to make a magical day which for us was magical. A tip for british guests if you cant live without a english paper then nip next door to the dolphin hotel and go to virgins desk and pick up a complimentry daily mail. The hotel is 5 mins walk away. The mouse keeping was excellent and the bed turn down service was excellent too with the nice touch off mint chocolates on the pillows. The room was clean and my son soon found the hidden mickeys in the pillows.wallpaper etc and it was a nice touch making a mickey head with the towels. A hidden mickey is above one of the elevators on the concerierge level. Went to play crazy golf and is a short walk away. Downtown Disney is easy to get too. Ok you have to pay $10 a day for internet access but its free within the hotel lobby. Over all a good holiday was had by us and cannot wait to go back.. Thanks to all those staff at the hotel/parks etc that made it a magical holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven at the Disney Beach Club Resort”
Reviews.Author: BKTK
Reviews.Content: When you arrive at the resort they welcome you by saying "welcome home" and truly, you feel at home ! The service at this resort is outstanding. We were catered to every minute of our stay. Upon arrival to the resort ( we arrived early that morning) our room naturally was not ready, however we were upgraded at no charge to a lagoon view room that was ready and available ( what a nice treat!)The rooms have been updated and the decor is so mellow and relaxing. You truly felt like you are on a beach vacation. The location is exceptional with only a 3-5 minute walk to epcot or the boardwalk. You are able to take a boat to the boardwalk, Hollywood Studios or Epcot. ( worth it on very hot days) Out of all the Deluxe Disney Resorts, this is by far our favorite. It is so cozy and enjoyable. The Pool is amazing. Truly amazing, with sand islands for the kids to play on, a large pirate ship waterslide, a small baby watersilde, a quiet pool and more. The "mousekeeping" was good. Beds were made daily (but at random times) and items refilled as needed. I can't say enough about the service we received at this resort. It was unlike anything we have had before. We arrived tired and cranky after a long car trip and were greeted with such warmth and hospitality our moods changed instantly. Normally at the end of any vacation our family looks forward to getting home. But this time, we were very sad to leave the Beach Club Resort and Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “Better than we hoped! We will definitely come back on our next trip.”
Reviews.Author: jackaholic
Reviews.Content: We used the Disney Vacation Planning DVD to help narrow down the many choices of on-property Disney resorts. The pool sold us, as we have two boys, ages 5 and 3. Unfortunately, our pool time was cut drastically short since we were in Orlando during "Epic Rain" in from May 18-23. However, we still swam a couple times and enjoyed the pool so much that I can't imagine how much fun we would have during normal Florida weather! Highlights: Pool: sand bottoms in areas, sandy "beaches" in areas, giving kids a fake beach experience. They don't care - they love to dig weather it's a real beach or not. The big water slide is fun for kids and adults alike. The small water slide appeases the little kids. The shallow bottom area of the pool makes for a fun, low stress pool time for parents. Cleanliness: Our room was very clean each day, even after all our wet and soggy clothes were strewn everywhere around the room. Quick maintenance: The elevator was broken one morning, it was fixed within an hour. Friendly staff: Our oldest lost his first tooth while we were there. My husband went down to the counter to see if they had any special celebration things... they set him up with all kinds of goodies from the "tooth fairy." Location: 7 minute ferry to Hollywood Studios, 7 minute ferry to Epcot (or walk!), 12 minute bus to Magic Kingdom and 15 minute bus to Animal Kingdom. We never had to wait long for a bus, and the walkway to the bus pick up is covered so sheltered from rain and/or sun and heat. Sleeping: Bedding and bed were both comfortable. Overall, sleep was easy in these rooms. Negative: Size: Hotel is huge, we had to walk 7-8 minutes just to the lobby but this didn't bother anyone in my family but me, including my kids. On our next Disney trip, we will immediately book at The Beach Club without any consideration.

Reviews.Title: “I will be back, The most wonderful experience.”
Reviews.Author: stwgfam6
Reviews.Content: We are passholders and came in with my mother in law and kids. The rooms were more than big enough for 5 people and the beds were the most comfortable I have ever slept on. The pillows were awesome. I felt so relaxed and comfortable in our room and housekeeping and bell services were excellent. staff and concerierge were excellent and I was traveling with a young child with autism and the hotel bent over backwards to make sure my needs were met and they went the extra mile( hint: if you are traveling with special needscall hotel directly 3 days prior to arrival for special requests) I have stayed at alot of disney hotels and this is a new favorite. The pool was awesome and the location to epcot and hollywood studios was perfect. try the crewscup lounge at the yachtsman next door to the yachtsman steakhouse for awesome cocktails.The hotel was very very very clean and the staff at the marketplace was excellent help with the dining plan options to get the best for your dollar. I will be back !!! I The rooms were roomy, the linens were wondeful(hard getting out of bed) nice flat screen tv and newspaper in the am. I can't wait to go back!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Everthing was Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: CJB1972
Reviews.Content: Will always love The Beach Club.The staff were nice,the rooms were beautiful,the pool is the greatest of all.You can't beat the walk to Epcot and The Boardwalk.Will be back again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Disney's Beach Club Resort far surpassed our expectations!!”
Reviews.Author: disneydreamer7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from an 8 day stay at Disney's Beach Club resort and I must say that we felt completely spoiled by the treatment received at this hotel. We had a difficult time selecting a resort, but the proximity to Epcot and the Boardwalk solidified our choice of the Beach Club. Because it is in the Deluxe category, we expected a lot from this resort - and we were very pleasantly surprised when it surpassed our expectations. We checked in online the night before we left, which ended up working out perfectly. Upon arrival at our hotel (at 11:00 am) we were immediately greeted by a cast member who addressed us by name and walked us to the registration desk. Once we arrived at the desk, they presented us with a folder which included all of the information that we would need for our stay. Plus, we were provided our room key (yes, that early in the morning!!) and proceeded directly to our room. Upon arrival at our room, we realized that they booked us in a double bed room instead of the king room that we requested. A quick phonecall to the front desk resolved the situation and they promptly provided us with new keys to a beautiful king bed room overlooking a quiet courtyard and the Boardwalk. One of the best perks of our room location was that the building we were staying in was literallly a 4 minute walk to Epcot. The guestroom was extremely spacious and very comfortable. The bedding was heavenly - 6 super fluffy down pillows, pillow-top bed, and down comforter with duvet ensured that every night offered the best night's sleep I've had in awhile! There is a ceiling fan in the room as well - which was nice addition. There was a mini-fridge in the room which was good - we had stopped at Target and picked up bottled water (bottles of Dasani cost $2.50 in the parks) so we had cold water to take with us each morning. The bathroom could have been just a little bit larger, but it was comfortable for one person to be getting ready at a time. There are two sinks, the amenities were nice - a clean, aromatic scent to the soaps and shower gel. The towels were plentiful and plush. There was a flat screen tv in the room, as well as Mickey lamps, two desks (one which pulled out from under another for room service trays). There were two closets in the room as well. The only slight complaint that I had about the room was that there were not enough drawers to keep our clothing in...but we made it work with both the closets and drawers. Our balcony was nice, relaxing space to enjoy our morning coffee and afternoon breaks. The room was quiet - even with a family staying next to us, we hardly heard a thing through the wall (it was an adjoining room which typically means you will hear every conversation the other party is having but to our surprise, it was very quiet). Upon returning from the park that afternoon, we had a message on our phone from the Director of the hotel welcoming us to the resort, explaining the myriad of services that were available to us. Even though I know that this recording is provided to all guests, it still made a good impression on me - they really cover every single detail to make sure that your stay is a very pleasant experience. The pool was one of the best things about the resort. Although I have to admit that I was a little disappointed that the lazy river was not consistenly one depth the entire way around (I do not swim and the depths ranged from 4 ft to 8 ft), the fact that the pool floor was covered with sand was a nice touch. The slide looked amazing, however, you will need to travel outside of the immediate pool area to climb the steps to the top. The kids appeared to love it - the adults were just as happy to stay by the pool. We had breakfast with the characters at the Cape May Cafe. Minnie, Donald, and Goofy were the main attraction and they made certain to visit each and every table. The buffet was good - they offered everything from scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon, potatoes, fruit, danishes, and even mini-Mickey waffles. The service was nicely paced and they did not rush you out of there (we had an 8:00 am reservation - the line to get in was long, but the wait was short). I would recommend this breakfast if you are staying at the resort, it is worth it. We also had lunch at Beaches and Cream one afternoon. The menu is not extensive, just your basic burger, hot dog, chicken sandwich variety. The food was delicious - however this restaurant tends to get very crowded. Try to visit on an off-hour or you will be waiting about 25 minutes to get in. We visited again one evening for ice cream - again, it was crowded, but it was worth it (personally, I would've rather visited Ghirardelli at the Marketplace instead). There is also a "Marketplace" just off of the hotel lobby that offers gift items, food, snacks, beverages, etc. A good option is to purchase the Disney mugs for one price and you get unlimited refills of coffee, tea, soft drinks, lemonade throughout your stay. For $10, I think it is worth it. Plus you can refill the mugs at the Marketplace, Beaches and Cream, Hurricane Hannas, as well as Boardwalk Bakery. This resort has a lot to offer guests. The lobby provides the following: concierge, photopass station, vacation club desk, a photographer on hand to take family photos, atm, and many cast members to greet you upon entering. Overall, this was a fantastic experience and we look forward to staying at this resort again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Over Priced! Stay Somewhere Else........”
Reviews.Author: fj74582
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for business and stay at many different hotels around the globe...I was invited to a conference that was being hosted at the Disney Beach Club Resort...the conference was fantastic, well planned and well executed...but this is not the place to stay by any means. The bad... 1..There is no wireless internet, anywhere except the lobby, which cuts off every once in a while. 2..The food is over priced disney land junk food. 3..Room service is 2 star at best. 4..The resort is big and you have to walk a lot to get to a restaurant, a bar, a business center...it really isnt practical for a person who is looking for quick access. 5..Restaurants are open and have limited items available at odd times. The good... 1..walking distance to Disney. To summarize, I have stayed at many places and have to say that this is near the worst that I have experienced. This place needs a major upgrade. The price you pay whether you are here for pleasure or business, is over priced! TRAVELER BEWARE....

Reviews.Title: “Our second stay at the Beach Club was even better than the first!!!”
Reviews.Author: logcabinlady
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel!! We stayed there May 4th - 10th of 2009 and in May 2007. I can't say enough positive things about this resort. We paid for a "standard room with standard view" and were upgraded to an excellent room right off of the quiet pool. The hotel/rooms were lovely and clean. The location is great - just a 1-2 minute walk to Epcot, and it's located on a boardwalk that has lots of restaurants, shops, a dance club, other deluxe resorts. The staff is helpful and informative. The main pool "Stormalong Bay" has a great waterslide (adults welcome), a tide pool, a lazy river current area, hot tubs, and both shallow and deep areas. The smaller pools ("quiet pools") are open 24 hours. Cape May Cafe has a good buffet "clam bake" of seafood and non-seafood, and the "blue glowtini" is an excellent adult beverage that tastes great and actually glows. The ice cream and burgers at Beaches and Cream are great. The marketplace has lots of breakfast items and snacks (and gift items). I think they serve lunch, too. There is a cozy area near the marketplace called the solarium. It's a great place to eat or relax. You can check your email at the business center located in the Conference Center. Just head into the Yacht Club Resort (which is attached to the Beach Club) and they will direct you to which door to take to exit the Yacht Club and walk to the Conference Center which is a separate building but very close. The downside is that they charge a $6.00 fee for 10 minutes usage. You can get other time increments. The hotel offers a lot of activities like movies on the beach (The boardwalk and beach surround Crescent Lake) and karaoke by the pool, etc. My husband and I loved this hotel, and we highly recommend it for couples or families.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place to stay at on your honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: miller15
Reviews.Content: On our last day we went to the park got back to the hotel at 10:30 and found out that the hotel checked us out and threw all of our carry on belonging in the garbage and our passports and thousands of dollars were in the safe. They also checked people in our room while it was still ours.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing to Say the Least”
Reviews.Author: marjasVancouver
Reviews.Content: It has taken me this long (more than a year) to finally put this review in writing. We chose The Beach Club Resort because it was a "deluxe" Disney resort and I'm being frank when I say that we certainly had expectations for a Disney Deluxe Resort. We paid a lot of money for a deluxe resort and received less than mediocre service and cleanliness. Yes, we expected more from Disney. I cannot, however, fault the location. It is ideal and we loved being able to just walk over to Epcot for dinner or check out the night life. The boardwalk was a wonderful stroll. We stayed for 18 nights. I'm still wondering why myself, but all I can say is at the time, we kept hoping that Disney would come through. They did not. Even after we left, I was dealing with them in the aftermath. To sum it up, if things are going well with Disney, things are great! However, if any problems arise, you can forget about any epathy or caring from Disney in any shape or form. It's all about the hard cash for them. Once they have your money, you're done for. The ego of many of the staff in that company is beyond belief. I beg to differ that Disney is the 'be all and end all'. We had no hot water for the first three days. I finally REQUESTED to be moved to another room; they did not offer when they couldn't fix the problem. And we were made to feel as though WE were being the imposition. After that, it was a hit and miss as to whether we got even lukewarm water for the duration of our stay. We could not get clean glasses. Even when we asked housekeeping to send us clean ones, we got back a cracked glass or filthy ones. I'm not sure what their idea of clean is, but ours is not receiving glasses with lipstick or mouth prints on them in any form! Nor gunk in the bottom. We finally took some of the glasses to the front desk to show them and asked if they would drink out of them. None of them volunteered! It got better for two days and then reverted right back to the filth. We had some horrible gunk on the wall by our sink and had to ask them to clean it. The bathroom never got cleaned pretty much the whole time we were there. They did not vacuum until we asked them. Even though the pencil shavings from our kids were very visible. We picked up what we could, but expected housekeeping to vacuum the rest. Three days later, we finally asked. Housekeeping slopped coffee on the wall and didn't wipe it until we asked them to. Did I mention the questionable white stuff on the bed skirt that my daughter brought to our attention because 'it smelled horrible'? I won't go any further into that one, except to say it was disgusting. Our fan wasn't working and when Engineering came in to fix it, they could only keep it on one speed and told us we couldn't use the other two. We went through three microwaves because none of them were working properly. Garbage was strewn on the bushes outside our room that had been there for months, if not years. We even found an old airplane boarding pass that belonged to someone from 18 months prior to our stay! And so much for the smoking sections! They allowed adults to smoke right in front of all the children at the children's poolside. When I requested they ask a gentleman to butt out his cigar at the children's pool, the staff told me they couldn't, but that I could either a) ask him politely myself or b) leave. It was the worst experience we've had on any of our travels, let alone the attitude we received in return. We've even had difficulties once before at a hot springs resort (as these things do happen), but how we were treated makes all the difference and we still return again and again to the hot springs resort. I will never return to Disney World. There are so many better places to go and even better theme parks.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: buckeye627
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Beach Club from Apr. 10 to Apr. 16 and it was a fabulous experience. When we arrived we were upgraded to the concierge floor which was a very nice surprise! Brett was the one who told us of our upgrade and got us checked in and he was there for us the entire trip making sure we had everything we needed. Our room had been recently renovated with a flat screen TV, 2 very comfortable queen beds, and a couch that converted into a day bed that was very comfortable to sleep on. The room was spacious enough for the four of us and our children are 15 and 22. Being on the concierge floor gives you the food that is available in the concierge lounge. They have a continental breakfast, and different snacks throughout the day. The hotel was very clean, the staff was very attentive to their guests, and the grounds were very appealing. There are 2 pools and both are very nice. We used the quiet pool more and had no trouble finding chairs and a table when we went. It is a very easy 5 minute walk to Epcot and you can take a boat to Hollywood Studios or a 20 minute walk along a canal. The Boardwalk is right across the lake which is also a very easy and nice walk to make.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: sokrmom88
Reviews.Content: They classify this hotel as one of their high end properties. It is not worth the extra money. We have stayed at many of the Disney World properties and have never been disappointed until now. Many unfriendly and unhelpful employees. The bathroom was comparable to that of an off the freeway Motel 6 type. My husband broke his clavicle the first day at Typhoon Lagoon and the concierge gave us the options of a 10 minute cab ride to an urgent care or a 15 minute cab ride to the ER. We chose the urgent care and learned that they offer a complimentary shuttle. How could the concierge not know this?

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: naynay1
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 3 night stay at the Beach Club Resort. Room was very clean and spacious, beds were comfortable. Service at the front desk and Cape May restaurant was good.
