Our 4 year old loved the water slide (free rentals on life jackets at the pool area). Having a character breakfast at the hotel you are staying at is the best, we just walked down in the morning and got right in. We also loved being able to take the boat over to the Boardwalk area for more dining options. Rent a surrey bike on the Boardwalk, tons of fun for kids and adults. Camp fire and movies on the beach at night were great too.

Reviews.Title: “Sandy Bottom Pool !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Krakolis
Reviews.Content: Yet another amazing stay. My family just recently purchased more DVC points at the Beach Club, only hearing a little about it I didn't know what to expect. Man this place blew me out of the water. The villas are great and currently being redone in order to keep them up to date. The pool is shared with the Yatch Club, don't be worried its HUGE, complete with a sand bottom and an island in the middle made entirely of sand, for all the kids (and adults) to play in. It has a lazy river that hits a max depth of (if I can remember) 9 ft., it also provides wonderful poolside entertainment for kids and adults of all ages...something i found a lot of other places lack. The Beach Club is a hop step away from Epcot and we walked there in under 10 mins, also providing boat and bus transportation to the other theme parks. The staff are incredible...we ran into some wireless internet complications on our end... and they provided us with their own computer as well as complimentary internet and printing. The end result is....this place is AMAZING personally one of the greatest places to consider purchasing DVC points or just visiting for a couple of nights. Can't wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “We LOVE the BEACH CLUB!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: skiwin
Reviews.Content: My husband and first spent time at the Beach Club for our honeymoon and we have stayed here ever since. The greeting by the staff each time we go is the BEST and anytime we need anything they are there. We even keep contact with them before and after our stays. We look forward to seeing them as soon as we can. This goes from the moment we set foot on property to the mousekeeping staff. Especially the greeting by Captain Art! The atomosphere is perfect for us and everyone else we have ever taken. It is very family friendly as well as wonderful for an adults only trip, like there was in October. Look for 'Hidden Mickey's' throughout the resort. Including the easy to find ones in the hallway carpet. We always eat the Cape Mays for the clam bake and Beaches and Cream at least once. When you have a group (3 plus people) ask for the Kitchen Sink! :) Book at least 90 days in advance for any sit down dining reservations to ensure you are able to eat where you want. Otherwise it will be difficult to obtain a reservation. The pool is out of this world, especially the sand bottom. The workout area is just as nice, plus you can get an access card to go when the club is closed. We used Magic Express as we have each visit since it was in place. We never have a problem with our luggage or checking-in on the departure date. Movies on the beach are great fun! Lots of activities to do at the resort if you are not at a park. Get a list from the front desk. Enjoy evening walks around the Boardwalk or a surrey bike ride. You are even within walking distance to a miniature golf course which is great fun! As for anything Disney - this is a place where you need to semi-plan before you go, although planning in relaxing days can be done. This resort is the only reason we bought into the Beach Club Villas DVC program years ago, but we still spend time at the main resort as well. The location of this resort is FANTASTIC and fairly central to all of WDW. If you ever have any problems while at Disney or after the trip let the Cast Members know Right Away! Call when you get home. Let them know of your problems so they can help or offer alternative options. That is what we have found out through repeated stays and talking to others.

Reviews.Title: “Disney was as nice experience...would return”
Reviews.Author: Saysum
Reviews.Content: My family and I (2 boys 3 and 4 y/o) spent 5 nights (2/25-3/2) there for a conference. We had never had any experience with Disney (aside from Disneyland) and looked forward to this vacation. We booked via the conference and got great rates. All in all, we had a wonderful time. I will break trip down by category. Check-in: Prior to our trip, I booked transportation via Disney Magical Express. I was curious to see how the whole process would work out. I couldn't imagine not having to pick up our luggage and was skeptical that all would arrive at our hotel. When we disembarked from the plane, I headed over to the counter and was sent directly onto a bus. We waited approx 10 mins and the bus departed. We made 1 stop at the Yacht club and then arrived at the Beach. The trip was uneventful. Checkin was as breeze. They were really friendly and gave pins to our kids. We also had grandparents arriving the following day and they were able to arrange for adjoining rooms under those circumstances. Room: The room was a basic one on the first floor. We liked the little couch that was there. The TV was smaller than expected (prob around 34inch flat screen). We liked having a small fridge and requested a microwave (free of charge). The beds were comfortable and had 2 different pillow options. The room initially had a smoke like odor, but the front desk reassured me that there were no "smoking rooms" and it was impossible that the prev occupants smoked. They did offer an air purifier. However, once we aired out the room it was ok. Pool/Restaurants: We really enjoyed the pool. Although the middle section was closed off for repair, we still were able to enjoy the beach area plus the water slide section. My only complaint was that due to the construction, you had to walk around the slide to get to the Hurricane grill. You couldn't access it by crossing to the other side of the pool. There were plenty of lifeguards (in contrast to resorts in Mexico) and we felt safe to have our kids play in the beach water. The boys love the shallowness of the water and had a great time. We ate at the Cape May for breakfast twice. The food was so-so, but the kids loved the characters. Breakfast was $20 per person and that seemed reasonable considering the other cost. There was a Marketplace store that sold everything from cold medicine to frozen dinners. That was good place to buy snacks and things. Service: I really saw the difference in terms of friendliness and service. Anything you need or asked for was properly addressed. We requested adjoining rooms and that was granted, even though the arrival dates were off by 2 days. We asked to extend our stay and that was granted. Concierge could only do so much with dining reservations. Book in advance people! Location: We loved the idea of being able to walk around a lake (be it man made). We liked the close proximity to the Boardwalk and Epcot. For fun, our boys would just ride the boat shuttle around. It was a really peaceful and nice resort. Cost: We came to Disneyworld expecting to spend money. Don't come here hoping to get the best deal. Things do cost more at Disney. You can get a burger at the Hurricane Grill for $7. Sodas cost approx $3 (see tip below). Being able to charge anything and everything to our key card was convenient. just be prepared for the large bill at the end of the stay. Tips: Buy a refillable mug. IT will cost you $13 but will save you a ton. We were able to refill it anywhere in the hotel and at Boardwalk as well. Very very nice. Tip #2, book dining reservations well in advance. Things get booked up pretty fast at the nicer restaurants. Tip #3, if you have some time, tour the Disney Vacation Club. They are really cool and do no pressuring at all. You will learn alot, and if nothing else, will get offered VIP Fastpass to 3 rides. Worth the 90 min presentation I think. Departure: Check out was nice. We received our boarding pass that morning. Luggage was checked in at the hotel. The only thing is that they still require you to get picked up 3 hours in advance. Travel time is 1 hr so you have 2 hour to hang out at the airport. If you can, fly with United Air, because on departure, they don't charge you for luggage (they have contract with Disney). Complaints: At night, shuttle service takes a long time from non park areas (ie Downtown Disney).

Reviews.Title: “The Beach Club.... My Disney Dream Come True!”
Reviews.Author: jresle
Reviews.Content: My husband, 12-year-old son and I went on our annual trip to Disney World on 30 Nov - 6 Dec 08. After many other trips to WDW in the last 13 years, this was our first stay at the Beach Club. We were greeted with the overwhelmingly lovely smell of chocolate and gingerbread from the carasoul horse in the middle of the lobby. YUM! The staff that checked us in and personally escorted us to the concierge level were WONDERFUL! We requested a lagoon view and were not disappointed. The room overlooked the pool and we were able to enjoy the 'changing of the guards' each afternoon that we were 'home'.... changing of the lifeguards that is. :) All the lifeguards gather together and perform a line dance - along with anyone else that wants to participate. It's a really cool thing to watch. Make sure to get an activities list because there are fun things to do all day long. Each evening they offer a Disney movie on the beach. Just pull a lounge chair over to the sandy beach near the HUGE inflatable movie screen, sit back and enjoy! What a neat concept! Back to the room.... we were fortunate enough to get a recently renovated room, with all new decor and a really nice flat-screen TV. The concierge lounge is GREAT! The food offerings, from early in the morning to late in the evening, are really good. The concierge staff are true treasures! They are more than willing to help with any request! A couple evenings we went back to the room early and they provided us with some movies to watch.... free of charge. What a nice touch! Turn-down service with the chocolate mints is nice too. We love the proximity to EPCOT - our favorite park. The boat ride to Hollywood Studios was very relaxing. Of course the pool is the BEST!!! The food options are good also... Cape May Cafe (Clambake buffet for dinner) and the Beaches and Cream ice cream parlor. If you really want to try something unique, ask for the kitchen sink sundae! :) There are only 2 negative things I can say, which happen to apply to all Disney resorts, and I've mentioned it every time I get asked to fill out a survery about my stay on-property... Disney needs to offer free wireless internet and offer more movie channels. When a family can go to almost any other national hotel chain (even the low-cost ones) and surf the internet for free, Disney should definitely do the same! As for the movie channels, it's one thing to have a few channels with Disney shows and infomercials but 10 or 12 channels worth of Disney, Disney XD, Stacy and the Top 10 things to see/do (we do enjoy Stacy though), several devoted to the Disney Vacation Club, Disney hotel information, etc etc etc. Enough already! Give us adults some Showtime, HBO, or Starz or something! That's another option that you'll find at most other hotels. With all of that said, if you're going to stay at WDW please try the Beach Club! You'll be soooooooo glad you did!! :)

Reviews.Title: “The Absolute Best Place On Earth!”
Reviews.Author: lhmll
Reviews.Content: My family and I (my mom, dad, and little sister) went to the Beach Club as our first Disney World stay. None of us had ever been to Disney before, and I'm not sure I can understand why. PROS: -Delicious restaraunts (although without the meal plan I'm sure it'd be mighty expensive!) -Very large pool -Beautiful scenery -Within walking distance to our favorite park (Epcot) as well as Hollywood Studios. -Wonderful maid service (Cleaned our room when we were out!) -Easy to find rooms (Compared to reviews for moderate hotels) -Definately bang! for your buck! -Always clean smelling. CONS: -VERY small balcony, but so what? It's hot enough to go outside! -We heard leaf blowers outside our balcony at 6 a.m. -The lobby had an overwhelming soap smell-- suprised my dad's nose could handle it! -$10 charged to your room if you used the wireless internet! Other than that, I have no complaints. This hotel was the obvious best stay of my life.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing and comfortable with an outstanding location”
Reviews.Author: Marywhotravels
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Beach Club resort with my parents and sister, and we were thrilled with the whole experience. As soon as we walked in I felt calm and relaxed in the peach and ivory tones of the spacious lobby. The staff was always very prompt and pleasant, and they even gave roses to all the ladies in our party upon arrival. Our rooms had small balconies over looking a lovely flower garden, always very quiet and peaceful. My one complaint about the location was that it required a rather roundabout walk through the lobby to get in and out. But I loved being so close to Epcot and the surrounding resorts. It's very easy to walk to the park or the many other hotel restaurants, plus there's easy boat and bus service to the other Disney areas. My room was of a very standard size and shape, but all of the furnishings were clean and attractive. There's turn-down service in the evening, which is nice, since when I first checked in I felt a bit overwhelmed and confused by the dozens of pillows on our beds. The hotel has some very nice amenities. The highlight is its amazing pool. Sadly, the pool's slide was closed for refurbishment while I was there, but I still thoroughly enjoyed the drifting pool nearby. The bottom of the feature pool is covered in sand, which really was a very novel and fun thing to play in. I saw lots of little kids having a blast building sandcastles on the pool's "beach." There's also a beach by the lake, a very pleasant place to sit and have a drink. The hotel offers a wide variety of special activities as well. Most of them are geared towards kids, such as the evening movies on the beach or making s'mores by a campfire, but adults are welcome to participate as well. There's a pleasant little bar and a couple of restaurants at the resort as well. Beaches & Cream had excellent ice cream and good (though pricey) hamburgers. One morning we tried the character breakfast at the Cape May Cafe, which was wonderful. Lots of hearty, traditional breakfast food and a chance to chat with Minnie, Goofy, and Donald, all dressed up for the beach. Adorable! The biggest drawback to the Beach Club is the steep sticker price. Because I was staying with a castmember, we had a greatly reduced rate. If not for this discount, I'm not sure that I'd feel the cost was worth it, since there are so many more affordable luxury hotels in Orlando. But if cost is no object, this place is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, Great Location, very comfortalbe rooms, very expensive”
Reviews.Author: Jww1962
Reviews.Content: We had a suite but purchased the club level concierge service along with it. Did not realize that that the club level/5th floor did not have one bed room suites thus our room was on the 3rd floor. I booked the rooms online thus it was my fault for not calling and getting full information and dealing with a live person. I was also confused by the Disney booking website I expected the one bedroom suite I booked to have a kitchenette, but was told by the concierge that those rooms are only in the villa’s (Next time I will know), but the concierge service is not available in the villas’. We still had use of the club level amenities and service but our room 3501 was as far from the lobby and the elevator as you could get (264 steps to be exact). But our room was the closest room to Epcot as you can get, so you have to take the good with the bad. The room was very nice, though I would not call it outstanding. The bedding was very plush and comfortable. We had turn down service but was not at all what I had read about or expected, maybe because we were not on the 5th floor. The concierge employees were very, very nice and very helpful with any need. They helped change dinner reservation, transportation arrangements to the airport and had any park info we needed this was a big plus not having to wait in line in the lobby. The little refreshment room was much smaller than I expected, but the service and food and snacks available were beyond what I expected. The staff in this room went out of there way to be nice to my 2.5 year old daughter and if we needed a bottled water for the room or a couple of drinks or snacks to take to the room they always were accommodating. The pool was under reconstruction, but the pool at the Yacht Club was open to us and was not any farther of a walk than our pool would have been. The Yacht club pools were very nice with a sand bottom and a big sand dune for kids to play on. There was also a tubing lazy river ride that looked like fun. We went to a character breakfast at the restaurant right in the hotel and the food was great and our daughter loved the characters. The hotel is very clean as you would expect at Disney. The people were friendly and helpful. I would love to stay again but with park tickets and rooms for 6 nights we paid over $600 a day I am not sure it was worth it. One negative I could not believe was you had to pay for the Internet. I was shocked paying this kind of money they charged $10 a day for internet. I have stayed at $60/night hotels with free wi fi.

Reviews.Title: “Practically perfect in every way and if it wasnt...they made up for it!!”
Reviews.Author: MickeysfriendJ
Reviews.Content: I take my mother and two sons every year. We usually book a villa which we get through an owner but we are treated just like we are the owner. Welcome home is the first thing you hear and I have always found the hotel to be very clean. Now with that said, do the rooms not have normal wear and tear...of course. Lets face it they cant go in every time someone stays and paint. But aside from minor marks on the walls etc its great. Hey to be honest my kids might leave a few marks before we leave. Nothing at Disney is ALWAYS perfect as much as Disney would like it to be. BUT, If I was ever not happy I just told people about my experience. One time we had horrible service at the princess breakfast in Norway. When I spoke to someone about it at guest services to see if they could recomend another breakfast for another time. Not only did they fit us in, we returned that night to have HUGE cupcakes, balloons for the kids and an autographed picture of MICKEY MOUSE HIMSELF!! This past october I did have a run in with a horrible worker at the fireworks in the Magic Kingdom, which resulted in getting my wallet stolen. She should have been fired or picking up the poop behind the horse, but I would not hold Mickey Mouse responsible for her. I did tell them about her in a letter and they did offer us VIP seating for the epcot fireworks on our next trip in a couple weeks. Doesnt give me my wallet back, but what can you do. Thank goe it happend the last night there. This hotel pool is perfect!! We always had reasonable wait times for buses and boats although when we went back this past october and stayed at the boardwalk the wait was WAY TO LONG. Maybe they have cut down on buses because of the economy?? We are actually heading back this month(yes we are going twice in one year) on the 23 of January so I will post again to see if things have changed either for the better or worse. For now, Disney is my home, Mickey is my friend and my son says he will one day RUN Disney world. After all his middle name is WALTER!! Cant wait to go in two weeks

Reviews.Title: “Awesome setting”
Reviews.Author: 5maduns
Reviews.Content: Just returned to the UK after a split centre Florida holiday booked thru Virgin. One week at Disney Beach Club and one week self catering in a 4 bed house outside Orlando. The Disney Beach Club was wonderful, the service and kindness of the staff amazing and the setting - overlooking the lake and with a fabulous pool - is awesome. We enjoyed every minute. We arrived a bit jet lagged after a flight delay and were immediately whisked up to the fifth floor concierge level as an upgrade. The catering staff conjured up a beer for my partner and drinks for the kids before showing us our suite with stunning views across the water and a Christmas tree in the lounge! It took us several days to take it all in. The concierge facilities provide a good continental breakfast with croissants, bagels, muffins etc and later in the day snacks, wine, juices and sodas for the kids. Staff were more than happy to look things up on the internet, book restaurants and were generally on hand for advice with a cheery smile. Mousekeeping left chocolates every day, arranged the children's soft toys in different positions on their pillows every night and someone else (maybe Mickey & Minnie?) left us cards and balloons in our room. The Beach Club is barely 5 mins walk from Epcot (don't bother taking the ferry), 10 mins walk around the lake to the Boardwalk and 10 mins by ferry (jetty right on the beach by the hotel) to Hollywood Studios. Although we were there at Christmas, and therefore fully expected a mad crush, by getting to the parks reasonably early around 9-9.30am we managed to spend a good half a day, get on the rides we wanted to (except Soarin at Epcot which was crammed) and still return to the hotel for a leisurely swim in the late afternoon. We took the Disney bus to Magic Kingdom and Animal Kingdom but didn't have to wait more than 15 mins and there were plenty of seats. We were advised to use our car to go to Downtown Disney as the bus takes a long route picking up from various hotels. It took about 10 minutes to drive. Park advice: 1/ Get to MK early - this is the furthest away and most popular with the most theatrical setting. 2/ Do make time to walk around the World Showcase at Epcot 3/ At Animal Kingdom do the Safari ride, Expedition Everest, Kali River Rapids (wear a poncho or get soaked) and Lion King musical 4/ If you have Star Wars fans try and get them involved with the Jedi Training Academy at Hollywood Studios - one of our got picked and enjoyed a battle with Darth Vader! 5/ Get activity sheets from each park as this tells you times of shows, character meeting locations etc Other thoughts: The world of Disney is delivered on a grand scale. Everything is very spacious and it takes a fair bit of time to get from one place to another. Don't think that park-hopping is an easy option. Get a good map of Orlando and the parks and get some orientation going early on! We've also never seen so many buggies and motorised wheelchairs anywhere - all for hire if necessary. Disney is very 'disabled-friendly'. Word of warning: The US is expensive now for travellers from the UK, for example there was little change from $50 for small hot dogs and drinks for 5 as a snack during the day. The Disney shops sell every type of mouse shaped gift you could ever imagine but for basic Disney T shirts, retailing in parks way over $20, Walmart sells the same around $10. Even without our unexpected upgrade I can recommend the Beach Club for its location and for the pool with its whirlpool, flume, lazy river, hot tubs, it's own crystal-like sandy beach and highly attentive lifeguards. We'd love to go back again one day.

Reviews.Title: “Leaves a lot to be desired”
Reviews.Author: NYCAADL
Reviews.Content: I have visited many Disney Resorts in the past twenty years and this was the worst. The only thing that makes this property worthwhile is you can walk to Epcot. The rooms seem to be smaller than some of the other deluxe resorts and the room we stayed in seemed to need some repairs. There were a few ink stains on the wall and when you turned the sink faucet on the letter "C" kept falling off. The odd thing was that this happened on both sinks. The most annoying thing was the frequency of transportation. One thing I like about staying at a Disney Resort is the convenience of the transporation system. After staying at the Beach Club I think this no longer. Our first night we waited for close to 30 minutes for a bus to Downtown Disney and of course it was full to capacity. The next morning we waited for over 30 minutes for a bus to the Animal Kingdom, we finally gave up and used a taxi. That same evening after waiting 10 minutes for the water taxi to the studios we decided to walk. We did not see ONE boat heading in either direction from the hotel to the park. On our walk back we did see one launch heading to the studios. The next day we rented a car. I would avoid this property unless you plan to spend the majority of your time at Epcot.

Reviews.Title: “Alright Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuy1001
Reviews.Content: I went with my parents and my best freind for the second time. It was ok the first time I went in 2006 but it wasn't as good the second. The room was peaceful but fireworks went off at Epcot by the hotel while we were asleep it was quite loud. The lobby wasn't that enviting but it was ok. The staff was great, nice and attentive. The view of the garden was beautiful. The dining was great and the gift shop had everything. Clean pool and clean rooms. Overall a ok stay yet juat a few problems.

Reviews.Title: “Good and not so good”
Reviews.Author: Momof8Denver
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the best pool of all the resorts. The kids just loved it and it's short walk to Epcot. Our housekeeping was awful. I have read that in several reviews so it's not just me. We have stayed in many Disney resorts over the years but for a weeks stay I think our room was cleaned only once at the end of our trip. We were brought clean towels everyday but our beds were not made and the pillows that I put on on the beds were never moved. We finally got duvet (sp) covers for our down comforters on the last day of our trip! My husband said he encountered some rude reception people when he would cheerfully say..."Merry Christmas!" and just recieve a glare in return. We also had two very unhappy and uncommunicative waitresses at the Cape May Cafe on two separate visits. One of our bills was $500 so you think they should have filled our water glasses or asked how things were even once! This is not the Disney I have known for 40 years. It makes me so sad. We will go back to the Grand Floridian if we ever go back to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Ew!!”
Reviews.Author: BallroomDancer29
Reviews.Content: I made reservations for my husband & children in July of 2008 for my birthday. Friends came along with children, too. All I have to say is ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE! The staff is rude. We specifically reserved for 2 king-size beds. When we came to our room, there were no 2 king-size beds. Only one queen-size beds. My husband called the lobby and asked for 2 king-size beds & all they said was, "Sir, we're with a customer. We'll call you later." How rude! I will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beach Club Resort was the highlight of our Disney stay”
Reviews.Author: northwestnerd
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our very first Disney vacation ever. We stayed in a junior suite, concierge level, at the Beach Club Resort. The suite provided ample room for me, my husband and our 10-year-old daughter. The room was configured with a master bedroom area, living room area, walk-in closet, and bathroom. The master bedroom and living room are separated by French doors which are covered with sheer curtains. The room was quiet, and we had no noise or traffic issues. Our daughter slept on a daybed in the living room area. The daybed was adequate for her size, but would probably be uncomfortable for a teen. There was a safe, ironing board, and iron in the closet. The bathroom in the junior suite does not have a jacuzzi tub, just a regular tub, which was fine with us. There are two sinks located outside the toilet/bathtub area with storage space provided underneath the sinks. Bathroom amenities include a blow dryer, coffee/tea maker, and toiletries. The toiletries are skin lotion, bath gel, shampoo, and conditioner. We had a very long, narrow verandah with chairs and small side tables. There were lots of drawers, cupboards, and extra space for storage. We were very satisfied with all aspects of our stay at the Beach Club with the exception of the housekeeping department, which was inconsistent. However, any issues that required rectifying were handled promptly and courteously. It's just a shame that we had to request items as basic as toilet paper and tissue when they were not replenished during the daily cleaning. A USA Today newspaper was delivered to our room daily at no extra charge. Laundry/dry cleaning is available via housekeeping, and there is also a laundry facility near the quiet pool area for those who wish to do their own laundry. With the exception of the uneven housekeeping service (which was friendly and cheerful nonetheless), all the resort employees, from the bell staff to the concierge, lobby, restaurant, engineering, and retail staff in the Marketplace shop were all most helpful and welcoming. Most exceptional of all were the concierge staff at the Stone Harbor Club, who handled all arrangements for us during our stay, and did an outstanding job. They are very professional. Available to concierge guests are a continental breakfast in the morning, snacks and beverages throughout the day, wine/beer with hot and cold hors d'oeuvres in the evening, desserts and cordials at night. The NY TImes and Wall Street Journal papers are also available for no extra charge, as are DVDs. There is a children's area in the lounge, with its own seating/TV area. The location of this resort was excellent in terms of easy access to the Boardwalk area, Epcot, Hollywood Studios, the Swan and Dolphin hotel complex, Fantasia mini-golf, and of course, all the restaurants in the Yacht Club/Beach Club complex. We loved Epcot the most of all the parks, so it was wonderful to be able to get there and back again so easily. The setting on the small lake with the white sand beach is lovely, and we enjoyed the services of the marina one evening when we were lucky enough to embark on a cruise to view the Illuminations Fireworks at Epcot. Our daughter loved swimming at both the exotic Stormalong Bay and even the quiet pool complex, which is calm and shallow. There are ping-pong tables at Stormalong Bay, as well as activities in the evening on the beach, such as a camp fire sing-along with s'mores, and a family-friendly movie each evening. I would recommend both the Beach Club and the Yacht Club in terms of activities and amenities for the entire family. There is plenty to see, do and enjoy within the hotel complex itself.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible! We LOVED it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: irunnoft
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the negative reviews on this site, I was a little nervous about our trip to the Beach Club; however, I still had a very high expectation for this resort nonetheless. Those expectations were all exceeded. When we arrived for check-in, I was told that our room was ready. Since it was early in the morning, this was definitely a plus. I had a Standard View room that wound up having a nice garden view with a private patio area. Although the patio area was small, it was still a nice place to sit and have morning coffee and peruse the USA Today. Our room was located very close to the Marketplace, which gave me a sense of trepidation at first. I could only imagine hearing all the noise of the foot traffic of people going to and from the Marketplace at all hours of the night and morning. That just wasn't the case. Even though the room was located near a very busy thoroughfare, it was as quiet as could be. I never heard any noise from other rooms through the walls. The room was very spacious and nicely appointed. We loved the soft pastels and ocean accents. The beds were very large and comfortable. I especially appreciated the thick comforter and the five pillows of varying softness that adorned the beds. There's nothing I hate more than a pancake for a pillow - and a shapeless, formless one at that. Not so at the Beach Club. The pillows were thick and maintained their shape nicely. Some were firmer than others which offered a nice selection. The bathroom was beautifully tiled and boasted a nice shower head that not only looked cool, but also put out the water pressure! The double sink at the bathroom counter is always a plus! Our room also had a flat panel LG LCD TV hung on the wall inside a wooden frame. It was very chic, but yet still within the theming for the resort. Speaking of wood, the furniture in this room was extremely nice. The Mickey in the lifeguard tower lamp was a cute touch. All in all, the room was VERY nice. We did have a few issues with our room that were quickly rectified by engineering. We had two lightbulbs that burned out over the sink. The same one burned out twice. Both times I called, somebody was out to fix it in less than ten minutes. We also had a problem with an outlet. Again, in a matter of minutes from placing a call, somebody was there to fix that. As it turns out, the resort hairdryer was the culprit and a new one was installed. Even though a few minor things happened, the staff were very quick and attentive. The only area where I felt the staff dropped the ball was with mousekeeping. I requested to have our room made up early in the day so as to allow us to come back during the afternoon and rest and relax. My room was never made up before three in the afternoon. The thing that irked me just a bit with this was that I called housekeeping three times to request this on three separate days. After the third call to housekeeping being ineffective, I approached the front desk and spoke to somebody at concierge. He assured me he would call them personally. I thought that would have taken care of it, but sadly, it didn't. We never had our room made up early like I requested. After the fourth try didn't net any results, we just resigned it to be so for the rest of our stay and planned accordingly. I will say this, mousekeeping did an outstanding job each time they cleaned the room. It was always thoroughly cleaned and we never felt like they did a poor job. We never received any towel animals beyond the requisite mickey ears that are now left on the bed for the first day you check in. Even though I tipped every day, that made no difference with regards to towel animals or critters. However, as long as the room was being taken care of well, I didn't really care. I know my son always loved getting those little surprises. He was the only reason I would care about that being done at all. Stormalong Bay is the best pool in WDW. The sand bottom was awesome! We all loved the sheer diversity of fun and recreation the pool offered. We also loved the movies under the stars down on the beach. Beaches and Cream is VERY good and very crowded. You really have to wait just to get in, but if you are patient, it's one of the best burgers on WDW property (that is if you like good old fashioned fried burgers). Finally, NOTHING beats walking into and out of EPCOT - especially after seeing the fireworks. It was just a short five minute walk into EPCOT. The boat transportation to Hollywood Studios was quite another story. We took the boat once. It was already crowded with people (it started out at the Boardwalk). When we embarked, the already crowded boat then stopped at the Swan and Dolphin resort to take on more people. It was a very slow and crowded trip. After that we opted to drive to Hollywood Studios. Speaking of opting to drive, we also waited over 20 minutes for a bus to take us to the Animal Kingdom. After getting tired of standing around in the cold (it was in the upper 30's that day), I decided to return to my room and get the car keys. From that point on, we drove everywhere. The only real downfall for this resort is the same one shared by the Swan, Dolphin and Boardwalk - transportation. The buses are shared between the Boardwalk, the Swan, the Dolphin, the Yacht and the Beach club. That means that the buses stop five times before getting to any theme park. They also hit those stops on the return journey. That makes things tough when you're trying to get somewhere for an ADR or a park opening. We never had an issue with driving and that kept things less stressful than having to deal with the bus situation. Even though the parks weren't at their busiest, the transportation situation was still less than desirable. All in all, the Beach Club has become our new favorite resort. The sand bottomed pool is fantastic. There was always something going on for the kids down by the pool. The resort was staffed with some very friendly and helpful people. We especially loved talking to Art the Greeter! His fame is well-deserved! He's an icon at the resort for good reason. Everything about the Beach Club made us so glad we'd decided to stay there and so sad to have to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Not what I was expecting...”
Reviews.Author: Colleen S
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many different levels of hotels and I was highly disappointed in this one. First of all, upon check-in, the staff said they could not find my husbands reservation and it took twenty minutes until finally the rude receptionist asked someone and they found it in all of 5 seconds. Next the room... the walls in this place are paper thin and I mean paper! I could hear the people in the room next to us having a conversation and they were speaking in normal tones. I could hear their alarm clock go off. I could hear kids crying from down the hall. Be sure to bring ear plugs because I did not get any sleep. Then when we went down to the marketplace, it was a zoo, no organization at all. It took me 45 mins to get a cup of coffee. Highly irritated and will not be staying again. Only 3 people in the entire place was pleasant and I must have seen about 50 employees. The only thing I liked was the decor was cute and well put together. I wouldn't complain about a long walk because it is a larger hotel so that could happen. It is a nice location being a short distance to Epcot and shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not as nice as the Grand Floridian”
Reviews.Author: REattorney
Reviews.Content: My wife and 2 kids, 7 and 3 just returned from a trip to Disneyworld. We spent 5 nights at the Beach Club. Our overall experience was wonderfull but its not as nice as the Grand Floridian. We visit Disney once a year and stay and the Grand Floridian however this time we decided to stay at the Beach Club which is also considered to be a high end Disney resort. The resort seemed cramped and crowded. The lobby is small the we had to wait 15 mins to check in. After checking in we had to walk another 10 mins to find our room, unlike the Grand Floridian where you are escorted to your room. The rooms are not very big and the bathroom is small. It does feel cramped for a family of 4 especially with all the luggage strollers etc... This resort has a mega pool which is shared with the Yacht Club resort next door. The pool is very nice, the kids loved it but since it is shared it was very crowded and was hard to find a chairs. The poolside service is very very slow. The room service was excellent howver we did have to wait about 45 mins to an hour for our orders. I would not have minded the delay but its hard when you have little kids who get impatient. The resort is close to MGM and Epcot, both are walking distance, the Magic Kingdom and Animal Kingdom takes 20-30 mins mins via the Disney Bus. The bus stops at 3 other resorts before you get to the parks, this is very annoying and the bus gets very crowded. Disney recommends that you make dinner reservations every night you are there, but this is difficult to do with young kids who have been at the parks all day and the difficulty of timing your return since you have to rely on the busses. All restaruants had aleast a 60 min wait, thus we stuck to room service. The room service menu is very very limited, i guess they want you to wait in line at the restaraunts. We had a good time and will return but will go back to the Grand Floridian.

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort You'll Ever Stay At”
Reviews.Author: florida1528
Reviews.Content: The Beach Club is the best resort I've ever been to! It's so close to Epcot, with the Boardwalk and Hollywood Studios just around the corner. The pool is absolutely amazing. It is ginormous with soft sand across the bottom. Along with that is a fun waterslide. The service was excellent and the lobby is beautiful. When you step inside the lobby after a long day at the parks, you feel so welcomed and comfortable. The rooms are a lot better in person than they look like in the pictures you see online. You can spend your whole trip at this resort without going to the parks and still have an awesome time! Now I don't recommend you do that, but if you go to Disney, this is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Nov 8-15 2008”
Reviews.Author: CDNtraveller66
Reviews.Content: This was the first time we stayed at the Beach Club - previously we had stayed at the Caribbean. We loved the location - walk to Epcot (great during the Wine Festival) and short boat ride to Hollywood. We never had more than a 10 minute wait for a bus to the other parks and they were never full. Only drawback is that kids couldn't get Mickey Waffles at the Marketplace and we did not feel like sitting down for the Cape May buffet. If you like the concept of the cafeteria breakfast, this is not the resort for you. Definitely a step up from the moderate resorts, although we did not find the mousekeepers as thoughtful, even though we tipped generously every day..oh well. Pool is the best we have seen in the resorts, it was busy all day and evening. Expensive by ordinary standards, but for the convenience of being near our favorite parks with little hassle, a decent sized, well appointed room it was well worth it and we will be back to the Beach Club.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Beach Club”
Reviews.Author: BuckeyefanHill33
Reviews.Content: Anytime my family and me go to Disney World we always stay at The Beach Club Resort. It's been our hotel of choice whenever we go down. Just looking at it gives you a chill and whenever you walk in, you are just in awe of it. To me it is one of the most unique hotels you'll be at. It is so elegant and beautiful you won't believe your eyes. It's also perfect for walking to Epcot and Hollywood studios by boatride. You even have the Boardwalk to go and have fun at. It's the perfect spot at Disney World, it's really right in the heart of Disney. The only question you'll have is what to do next. From the spectacular pool to the great and friendly service of the workers, to the beautiful scenery and rooms, and to Beaches and Cream for the "Kitchen Sink", it's one resort you'll never forget, you'll never want to leave. If you're looking for a relaxing resort with the disney magic to go with it, Beach Club is the way to go. You are going to wish that you lived there.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Pool”
Reviews.Author: tripgirl76
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing time, but it's Disney World how could you not!!! The hotel staff was great, very helpfull and friendly. The rooms were very clean and always made up. The resort is only a few floors high so it's fairly spralled out which made for a pretty long walk if you went though the lobby. A few days after we arrived we found some other ways in and out which cut down the walking. The only thing there was to complain about was the bathroom sink would not hold water and with a 3month old son and a 2yr old daughter it wasn't very handy. They came and fixed it and gave us a free breakfast for the inconvenience

Reviews.Title: “The best location”
Reviews.Author: gol122
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. If you like hanging out at Epcot this is the place to stay. Do ask for a view before you go. We did not and had nothing to look at. Do bring hand sanitizers as they do not have any available at the parks. You would think if your county fairs had them they would to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: Cheffyguy
Reviews.Content: Hatfield, PA Oct17-26th We stayed at this property for 10days. It was packed with many conventions. The hotel mgr said that this hotel has been at 95% occupancy for 3 weeks now. It was busy. The hotel was really nice and comfortable. It was clean and smelled clean. Since the hotel was busy you would think that it would accomodate with increased staffing at the pool bar. Lines were long. The snack bar closed at 8 and you couldnt find any food except in the marketplace inside. The life guards were great. One night my husband and I went to the wine and food festival while my mom watched the kids at the pool. My mom lost track of my daughter and asked the lifeguards to help find her. The walkie talkie and lost child guard and came over to help my mom. They took all the info about my daughter and put it out thru ALL the Walkie Talkies. The found her right away and took her to my mom. My mom was relieved and amazed on how it all work. Housekeeping- Was awesome the first half of the week. The last half was lacking even after tipping every day. One day we had no toliet paper and I had to go and find some. Restaurants- Yachtsman steakhouse fantastic... Hurricane Hannahs kids meal. I thought was a good deal. $5.99 for a bucket and shovel, juice box, fruit, veggie and hamburger. Beaches and Cream- Great ice cream, small place always long lines. Went in the middle of the day to avoid any lines. Marketplace- sandwiches were good. Buses and Transportation were fine. Buses were running a little slow. We didnt have to wait too long, but some people waited 45- 1 hour for a bus to Magic Kingdom.. One day we did take a taxi over so we didnt have to wait. It was a $15.00 ride thats including the tip. Boat ride over to Hollywood Studies was packed both ways a couple days. I just didnt expect it to be so crowded this time of year.... Would stay there again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Mini water park hotel”
Reviews.Author: cumberlandga
Reviews.Content: We are DVC members and this was our second stay at the hotel. We love because we usually leave the parks in the middle of the day when it's hot and crowded. We hang out at the mini water park for awhile and then back to the theme parks. Every afternoon they have poolside activities for the kids. Our son's friend who is a very good pitcher hit the bullseye and a water balloon dropped on someone's head. Very funny. The hotel is great for Epcot. We saw the fireworks display(Disney has a name for it but I can't think of it) and afterward we crossed the bridge and we were back at the resort. They have ducks that swim in the pool with you. The room was nice and having a kitchen for breakfast is nice. They also have a quiet pool if you want to get away from the action for awhile. We were also recipents of an special promotion disney was running(million dreams?) When we were in the waiting room for The Twilight Zone Ride two "cast members" gave everyone a one day fast pass for all major rides. That was MAGICAL! The only other resort we would stay at would be the Animal Kingdom Lodge but as of yet we have had no luck with reservations. It would be nice to have the savannah view and watch giraffes with coffee. Otherwise, we will always stay at The Beach Club.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort for Little Ones”
Reviews.Author: YoungDubsFan
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time I have stayed at the Beach Club. It is a great property. The sand bottom pool @ Storm Along Bay is great for little ones. The lifeguards and wait staff @ the pool are very attentive. The room was really nice. The first room I was given, the Air Conditioning wasn't working. I contacted the front desk. They sent engineering up to fix and put me in a MUCH better room with a view of the Lagoon / Boardwalk. The location is great with easy access to Epcot / Hollywood studios and the Boardwalk. Disney bus service to Downtown Disney and Magic Kingdom was also very easy.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort......too many people!”
Reviews.Author: seahawksteve
Reviews.Content: The Beach Club Resort is beautiful with great access to Epcot and Hollywood Studios. The property is well landscaped and the lobby is charming and nice! Overall, I found the rooms to be really nice and comfortable. Be sure to get a room with a separate balcony, not one where the balcony is shared with other rooms. The staff was quite friendly. When one of my family members had a medical emergency they were very understanding and let me stay very late the day of my checkout without any charge. Be sure to book this hotel well in advance as they fill up fast! The only real downside of the hotel was the sheer volume of people there. You hardly would've known the economy was in the toilet by the amount of people!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Getaway at the Beach Club”
Reviews.Author: houkris
Reviews.Content: My family's Disney World vacation and stay at the Beach Club couldn't have happened at a better time. We had been a week without power due to Hurricane Ike. I don't know if I was just happy to be somewhere with working lights and AC, but the Beach Club resort was amazing. I had booked the standard room. Our room was larger than I expected with a nice little balcony. There was a partial view of the lake and Boardwalk from our room (see the photo). The room was clean when we arrived and mousekeeping staff did a fantastic job cleaning the rrom everyday of our stay. Nice little touch with a Mickey shaped towel on the bed when we arrived. All of the staff that I encounted during my stay was informative and very Disney-like with excitement. The Stormalong Bay pool is definitely the highlight of the hotel. The sand bottom pool was great for my 3 year old who could easily stand and walk across the pool on his own. He is totally obsessed with pirates and was thrilled with the Pirate Ship slide. The other great benefit to the Boardwalk hotels is the location. It was a 5 minute walk to epcot and a boat ride to Hollywood Studios. The boat was a problem after the Fantasmic show was over. The line was really long. We opted to walk back to the hotel which was about 15 minutes. The Magic Express transportation to and from the airport was easy. However, they tell you that your luggage should arrive within 3 hours, but it was more like 6 hours! I made sure to pack our swimsuits in a carry-on so we could enjoy the pool that day we arrived. The only negative to our stay was that there was a water leak in our room on the second day of our stay. The carpet near the bathroom was soaked. The front desk gave us an upgraded room on the same floor when we were required to change rooms. But they were very nice about the situation and sent someone to help us move our luggage. This is the only reason I am giving the hotel a 4 instead of a 5. Highly recommend this hotel! Absolutely beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Disney's Beach Club - a Magical New England Beach Resort in the heart of Florid”
Reviews.Author: ahorst
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at Disney’s Beach Club Resort August 14-22, 2008 for a combination family vacation and research as a travel agent for Dream Makers Vacation Services. My first impression of the resort was absolutely beautiful. From the moment we stepped off the Magical Express bus, it was as if we had stepped back in time to a New England beach resort, complete with sandy beach and washed up pirate shipwreck…which we later discovered was the pool slide! We were instantly greeted by a very courteous cast member who took our name, gave us a quick tour of the lobby – including the cartoon area where the kids could wait while we were checked in. Check in was very quick and they even noticed that it my older son’s birthday was coming up and gave him a “Happy Birthday” button (which he proudly wore the whole week). The concierge took our carry on bags that we had in tow and we were off to Epcot! [With Magical Express, you are sent special luggage tags prior to your trip. Then you check your luggage at your home airport and it is delivered to your room at your Walt Disney World Resort. There is no waiting at baggage claim. If you are traveling with children, the complimentary service will be a highlight of your trip!] Location The Beach Club Resort is one of the Epcot resorts at Walt Disney World. It is connected to the Yacht Club and is across the lagoon from The Boardwalk Inn. It is located within walking distance to the World Showcase entrance to Epcot. This alone is one of the greatest perks of this resort! It’s a real treat to be walking back to your resort with the Illuminations Fireworks bursting over you and reflecting in the lagoon. The Beach Club is considered a Deluxe Resort in Disney’s categories. The resort also has the Beach Club Villas, which are in the Deluxe Villa Resort category. Cast Members If you are familiar with Disney, you know that all of the individuals who work there are called Cast Members. The most famous cast member at the Beach Club is Art the Greeter. He is the most pleasant person you will ever meet and greets every guest with a joyous welcome! (picture) Rooms There are two parts to the Beach Club Resort and the Beach Club and the Beach Club Villas. We stayed in a Standard View Studio that overlooked the smaller, “quiet” pool. The room was beautifully decorated in soft beach tones and had a queen bed and a sleeper sofa. It also had a mini-kitchen with a refrigerator, microwave, toaster, small sink and kitchen necessities. There was a large vanity area and a separate room with the toilet and shower. The extra space in the studio, which is slightly larger than the standard hotel room, was a real benefit. Our first floor room had a small patio that led right to the walkway to the quiet pool, which we enjoyed several times! Pool Another highlight of staying at the Beach Club and Yacht Club is admission to Stormalong Bay. Stormalong Bay is the largest sand bottomed pool in the world. The bottom of the pool is layered with wonderful, soft sand that is brought in from Arizona! The water complex includes a lazy river, with a gentle current that allows you swim along. Water tubes can be rented at an extra charge. There is a zero entry area with a sand beach that never gets deeper than a couple feet for the younger members. There are several hot tubs tucked away in the rocks surround the pool. There is even a current pool, where you can go around and around in a small area pushed along by the current. By far, the most amazing part of Stormalong Bay is the Pirate Slide. (picture). To enter the slide, you actually leave the pool area and take a quick walk across the walkway leading to Epcot. This two minute walk leads you the steps of the pirate ship. Once you climb the first set of steps, you will discover another small, shallow pool, complete with a small slide for the younger adventurers in the family. For those who are a little more adventurous, you begin the climb up another staircase, to a spiral staircase that takes you to the top of the Pirate Ship’s lookout. This is the top of the slide. You start by going through a long enclosed tube that shoots you right over top of that walkway you just crossed and then come out only to wind your way through the shipwreck and the “havoc” of rocks it created on the “beach”. It is a really cool slide! When entering the Stormalong Bay area you will be asked to show your room key and be given a wristband. This pool is very popular and the cast members do a great job at making sure that it is enjoyed by the guests who are staying at the Beach and Yacht clubs. Water Sports The Beach Club Resort is located on a lake that connects Epcot with the Epcot Resorts and then Hollywood Studios. Just out in front of the Yacht Club is Bayside Marina, a water craft rental station. There you can rent a pontoon boat, canopy boat or even a Mercury Water Mouse or book a specialty cruise! Dining There are many dining options located both in the Beach Club resort, the Yacht Club, the Boardwalk Inn and the boardwalk area outside it and of course Epcot is just minutes away. One of the most famous eateries at the Beach Club is a small soda shop, called Beaches and Cream. (picture) Known for its sandwiches and burgers, but mostly for its AMAZING ice cream concoctions, seats are in high demand! We had a 45 minute wait one evening, but it proved to be well worth it. [It doesn’t hurt that the Lafferty Place Arcade is right next door. There were lots of parents enjoying quiet conversation while waiting for Beaches and Cream tables while the kids were having a blast in the Arcade!] The décor of the shop is everything you would expect from a soda shop done right: gleaming counter top, small tables, smiling servers and shiny glasses just waiting to be filled with yummy ice cream. We all ordered large sundaes and they were fantastic. I had a “No Way Jose” that was chocolate ice cream with peanut butter sauce, hot fudge, chocolate chunks and lots of whipped cream! We even got to witness several families ordering what is called the “kitchen sink”. It actually comes in a small sink. It has a mound of ice cream scoops, loads of toppings, whipped cream, sprinkles, sauces and cherries…and as many spoons as you need. Other restaurants at the Beach Club include: Beach Club Grill – Clam Bake/Seafood buffet at night, Character Breakfast Buffet in the morning, located just off the main Beach Club Lobby Hurricane Hannah’s – Burgers and Sandwiches located by the pool Marketplace – small snack items, made to order breakfast sandwiches (my husband thought these were great), made to order granola parfaits (which were delicious and my personal favorite) and various other staples. Located in the lobby Room Service is available to all resort rooms. There are several excellent dining choices at the Yacht Club as well, but more about that in my next review! Sandcastle Club Disney is a great place for families, there is no doubt! However, there are times in every family vacation, where everyone (read..parents and kids) could use a little space! We decided to check out the Sandcastle Club for our two boys for an evening. We checked them in at 6 pm., upon which we were introduced to all of the cast members who would be supervising the children that evening. The Club area looked like something out of every kid’s biggest dream. There was one whole wall of arcade games and gaming systems – with very appropriate games, I might add! The far wall was full of toys, puzzles, board games and fun looking things. There was an art station full of craft supplies. There was a movie room (fully lit) that had the Lion King playing and lots of bean bags. Finally there was an eating area off to the side with a hand washing sink. We were given a menu from which the kids could order dinner and pick the time it would be served. My guys thought that was really great. We then complete a form with our cell phone numbers, where we planned to go, what time we expected to be back and if there was anything else we thought they needed to know about our kids to make sure they had a great time. Finally we were handed a pager that would be used if one of boys needed us and told to have a great evening. When we came back several hours later, the boys asked if they could come back every night. The cost is $11 per hour, per child and includes dinner for the children! Transportation Transportation to all the Disney Parks is available through buses and watercraft. To travel to Epcot or Hollywood Studios we had the option of walking or taking one of the Friendship Boats to each of the parks. Bus transportation to all of the other parks, including water parks and Downtown Disney, was available at the front of the resort. Our wait times were never long and there was always a cast member there to monitor lines and make sure the right busses were on their way! A Couple of Other Things… There is a great workout facility called Ship Shape Health club, located close to Stormalong Bay. Overall Recommendation I have stayed at many Walt Disney Resorts and this ranks among my favorites. The cast members were very friendly and ready to help at a moments notice. I should note that we were there during Tropical Storm Faye. I was incredibly impressed by the level of communication we received about operational changes and emergency information. While there were no major alterations, other than Illuminations being cancelled one evening, we received several voice mails with park hour changes and offers of assistance if we encountered any problems due to weather.

Reviews.Title: “First time at BC”
Reviews.Author: disneyO8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the BC for the first time in August. We have stayed at the Poly, Wilderness lodge, Corranado, Floridian, Swan and Port Orleans B4. We compare this to the Poly (which is our favorite) as second best. Yes better than the Floridian, which we felt was overrated for the money. We booked our package with the free dining plan. The best deal ever given out by Disney in my opinion. Pluses for the BC, Location, so much to do during the day and at night. There is Epcot and Studios, Boardwalk and the resort itself. Kids loved the movie on the beach every night, parents liked it too with a drink or too, Pool was nice but in late August was not very refreshing. Minuses, if you travel with young kids, STAY AT THE POLYNESIAN. Rides to MK are long with the Bus transportation. Also, if you book a dining package make sure you make your reservations as soon as you can. Make many so you can cancel once you figure out where you will be on which night/day. Disney offered free dining again to return travelers for next year so we booked again, we may cancel, we have wait and see. STAY AT THE BC, YOU WON'T BE DISSAPOINTED.

Reviews.Title: “Magic at the Beach Club!”
Reviews.Author: OhioCouple15
Reviews.Content: My husband and I vacationed in Walt Disney World to celebrate our first wedding anniversary. We love Disney and have been to Disney World five times in the last five years. The Beach Club has always been our favorite resort and that fact remains unchanged after this trip. We actually split our week's stay between the Polynesian and the Beach Club. We honeymooned in the Hawaiian islands, so we thought we'd give the Polynesian a try to re-create our honeymoon trip. A bit of background about us: we are a young professional couple with no children that travels frequently. Epcot is our favorite Disney park, so the Beach Club is the most convenient resort for us. The International Gateway of the World Showcase in Epcot is literally steps from this resort. First and foremost, I must say that I completely disagree with other reviewers that say the Polynesian is better than the Beach Club! Please see my separate review of the Polynesian. Everyone has different preferences, but the Polynesian was not for us. We were actually happy to check out and move into the Beach Club! We felt like we came "home". For our anniversary, the Beach Club upgraded us to a club level room. The rooms were beautiful and we were on a private floor which was much quieter than the rest of the resort. The room was light, newly renovated, and had nice Disney touches. The bed linens were a nice upgrade from the last time we stayed in this resort (December 2007). We had a full balcony with a nice view of the pool and lake with a set of chairs and table. We enjoyed breakfast on our balcony every day and loved it. Upon check-in when we learned about the upgrade, we were escorted to our room by a cast member and told about all the priviledges of the club level. It was a nice touch! We also stayed in the club building at the Poly and received no escort; we were left to find the building on our own. I have many more examples of the quality of service being better at the Beach Club than the Polynesian...too many to list! One other example is our packages bought in the theme parks were picked up by the concierges at the Beach Club and placed in our room. It was so nice to come back after a long day and have our packages waiting for us in our room! At the Polynesian, we had to pick them up ourselves (and walk to a different building, mind you). The clientele was more our style at the Beach Club: couples, families with well-behaved children, and just more respectful people. We had no issues at all. The selection of food and drinks in the club lounge was better at the Beach Club than the Poly. We appreciated the location of the Beach Club better, as we prefer Epcot and Hollywood Studios over the Magic Kingdom. The pool is also very large and warm at the Beach/Yacht Club and we saw many people enjoying it. Everyone in the Disney parks, restaurants, and the Beach Club went out of their way to make our anniversary trip special. We will never forget all the great memories from this trip. We love everything about the Beach Club and will be back in December when we vacation with my in-laws. Don't let the negative reviews scare you: this is a fabulous resort! The Beach Club has always been our favorite but it took a stay at another Disney deluxe resort to really make us appreciate this place. We WILL be back and look forward to it!

Reviews.Title: “Beach Club Met Expectations But Prefer Poly”
Reviews.Author: abelb1
Reviews.Content: We booked five nights at the Beach Club on a recommendation by our travel agent. I have been to Disney many times, but this was our second family vacation with our children. I have stayed in moderate and deluxe resorts. Last year we stayed at the Polynesian. The Beach Club was what I expected, typical Disney property...not luxurious by any means, but met our needs very well. The staff was excellent. Very service oriented, friendly, and helpful. In my opinion, Deluxe at Disney means you have more amenities and you are more conveniently located. We wanted something that didn't require us to wait in long bus lines, and the Beach Club was very convenient to Epcot and Hollywood Studios. We must have gotten one of the older rooms, because ours smelled musty and the bedding etc was clearly worn. Since we don't spend a ton of time in the room, I didn't really care. The pool was fun..but frankly some of the pool reviews I have read are bit overrated. It isn't exactly a substitute for one of the water parks. But if you plan to take an afternoon out of the parks to relax, this pool is great. My kids, 3 and 4, really enjoyed the kiddie sized waterslide, and the sandy, graduated, 2-foot pool areas since they don't swim. Cape May offered a great character breakfast with Goofy, Minnie, and Chip & Dale. Similar buffet as the Crystal Palace, and so convenient if you are staying right in the hotel. We were on the Disney Dining plan and were a bit disappointed with the Quick Service meals available at the Beach Club. Seemed to me the Polynesian had more choices of Quick Service foods. We definitely plan on returning again to Disney, but will probably book the Poly again over the Beach Club. Given the money, and the ages of my kids, the Poly is just much more convenient to where they want to go...the Magic Kingdom.

Reviews.Title: “One of Disney World's Best Hotels”
Reviews.Author: Westcliffe6
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 4 night stay at the Disney World Beach Club in Orlando. The hotel was beautiful, clean, and well managed. My husband and I both agreed that the service was excellent. The location is great too!

Reviews.Title: “Happy with the Beach Club!”
Reviews.Author: georgiagrl
Reviews.Content: We are new Florida residents, so have started staying a night here and there at various Disney Resorts (normally value or moderate). For my birthday, we splurged on the Beach Club. With the value and moderate Disney resorts, I tend to fax and email a special request for view/ room and have been lucky as my requests have always been granted. Did the same with Beach Club, faxed it was my birthday & requested full balcony. This time, got a patio room, not so great location, overlooking a bush. Felt pretty disappointed. So I thought, ok, we will splurge & ask how much it would cost for water view and called the front desk. Was on hold for a few moments and told we had received a complimentary upgrade to waterview. It was a lovely room, with the new furnishings, carpet & bedding, with a fantastic view of the Boardwalk. We were so pleased and excited! Everyone was super friendly, it is less busy this time of the year, so everything just feels like it's at a much more leisurely and relaxing pace around the Boardwalk. But we will definately come back to the Beach Club again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay in Refurbished Room”
Reviews.Author: tarheelblue822
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at BC - our first stay at this resort - and it was wonderful. I called the week before and requested a refurbished room as I'd heard the older rooms were starting to look worn. I was granted the new room upon arrival with no problem. It was not ready yet at 8 a.m. so they held our luggage and we hit the parks for the day. Upon returning at night, the room was like a sanctuary. Fresh paint and carpet, well-appointed, separate shower/vanity area, and a daybed that was perfect for one of the kids. It was cleaned very well every day, and one day the housekeeper forgot to leave a bath mat, so I went out to get one from her cart, and she was so upset, we had 8 bath mats and far too many towels in the bath every day from there on. Stormalong Bay was fun when we had time to hit it after the parks closed. The Marketplace was fine for breakfast - we eat on the go so we weren't looking for a sit down meal. Never any lines at 7 a.m., easy to bring the tray back up to the room to eat. Was never back there at lunchtime to comment. Tried to eat at Beaches and Cream on our last day out but the wait for lunch was 45 minutes. Ate elsewhere on the Boardwalk. In the evenings the line was out the door there for ice cream and they closed at 11. Got ice cream late-night at the Marketplace with no line and it was fine. Best thing about BC is the easy proximity to Epcot and Hollywood Studios. You can walk easily to both - I would never take the boat to Hollywood, we can walk faster than it can drive. Extremely convenient as we spend most of our time in Epcot and always end the night there. Best of all, we had a Bounceback offer waiting in our room so we were able to book the BC for our Food and Wine Festival trip in October at a discounted rate. I highly recommend this hotel - it definitely had Deluxe amenities similar to Polynesian. I would just say to always look for a discount of some sort so you don't have to pay Deluxe prices. I used an Annual Passholder discount for this trip. You just have to do your research and keep your eyes open and you can find one.

Reviews.Title: “Beach Club is the Best!!”
Reviews.Author: coledean
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at several Disney properties, but this has to be our favorite. We were lucky enough on this last stay to be upgraded to a suite as a part of the current Disney promotions, but we have stayed in regular rooms and found them to be great. The pool and location are the great qualities of this hotel. We are always more than satisfied with the staff and the service, and we never have been treated poorly. Being able to walk to EPCOT is amazing and the boat and bus service is fine. We certainly look forward to our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Yawn......”
Reviews.Author: siestaclaud
Reviews.Content: Things around the Beach Club are looking a bit tired. I remember our first stay - WOW - everything was crisp, shiny and polished. Not so anymore. We arrived at the very beginning of what looks like a major renovation however, so future guests might not have our experience. Our one week stay was marred by the following: The room was worn - carpet stains, hair in the bath area (stuck to the molding- lots of it) dusty and just not clean to Disney standards. For $300 plus a night - I would expect enough towels for our party of 5 (no) the day bed to be made up daily (no) upgraded amenities (plasma? refridge that works? micro?) clean windows (no) and no construction - or at least a notice telling us that construction and workers would be on the grounds during our stay. This was disappointing. The entire halway of the second floor leading to the lobby was boarded up and under constuction from 8 am to 6 pm - construction cars parked in guest parking spaces and even in the valet area. Workers carried large beds and furniture through the hotel and guest areas. What is going on? We pay for convenience at the Beach Club but we also pay top dollar because it is a premium Disney Resort. We did not have that experience at the Beach Club this time. Management needs to inform guest BEFORE they book that this hotel is being renovated and offer them the choice to stay elsewhere. Hopefully these renovations will bring the Beach Club up to par. We will be staying elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome time!”
Reviews.Author: kateland18
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a seven day stay at the Beach Club resort. Our hotel room was large and clean, and we are able to check in early at no charge. All of the cast members were friendly and helpful. The pools and the view are fantastic, and the walk to Epcot is a huge timesaver. The only downfall to this hotel is the transportation. The buses also serve four other hotels, making them crowded during busy times and it also increases your travel time quite a bit. There isn't any bus service to Hollywood Studios. You can walk (but it's a hike), or take a boat. The boat is extremely slow and hot, it takes FOREVER.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: ROBBO66NY
Reviews.Content: I had my doubts regarding a Disney vacation (never been there), but by the time we left I felt like a kid again. We were upgraded to a really nice lakefront room. We had the deluxe dining plan so we ate like kings and queens (and princesses too)...The hotel's proximity to Epcot was a big plus and the Pool was outrageously nice! I would definitely stay there again some time in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Beachbumandie
Reviews.Content: We are Disney Vacation Club members and have been to several of their other resorts. The place is beautiful, by all means, but the staff needs to improve their attitude. We never had our room cleaned as promised. Several cast members complained about being overworked and tired (I don't want to feel guilty while staying at this $400 a night hotel!). Some were just plain sullen and rude. I would not return to this resort. What a shame. The pool is gorgeous and our kids loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience/CockRoaches!!”
Reviews.Author: needtropicalbeach
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because we were told by many it was a Deluxe hotel. But our experience was less than satisfactory. The hotel management did not follow up as promised, they over charged our room stay unnecessarily (charged for extra nights). The biggest complaint is of upkeep, dirty, lack of care, hallways had lots of mess. Had to endure cockroach - which is a big problem for us. Called the front desk but they could not move us until I asked for the manager. Still after a long day at the Disney Parks there was limited help in getting packed to move to another resort (which was the Yacht Club). Manager offered to check in with us after we moved to the new room but no follow up-- Not the kind of service for a so called Deluxe hotel. Staff in the gift shop like to ring in items more than once and takes a long time for them to figure out how to reverse the charge. Not a top quality hotel nor experience for what one pays. Sent a note to Disney Communications about our experience and they have not bothered to reply. Very disappointed with this experience. Maybe find another hotel with a good upkeep as these cockroaches are every where and its important for the upkeep to prevent them from infesting your room.

Reviews.Title: “Our Third and not last Stay at The Beach Club”
Reviews.Author: BatonRougeFamily
Reviews.Content: While this was our Third time to visit The Beach Club...it is my First Review of this Resort. If you are visiting Disney...and have extra funds to enjoy a Deluxe room and a "Pool Day"...then book The Beach Club. The Beach Club boasts the most wonderful pool I will ever see in my lifetime including a whirlpool, sandy bottom, fantastic water slide, baby water slide, volleyball area, waterfalls, spa's, young child area, beach area, etc. This is why we booked The Beach Club for 3 years running. This year, We booked 2 standard adjoining rooms for our family of Dad, Mom, and 3 teens. All the rooms I have stayed in (all 3 times) have a Daybed in the room (sleeps 5) , but the kids have outgrown it and we need the extra bathroom. We have always been provided a refrigerator and microwave. Did not receive the microwave this time initially but requested it and received it within 3 hours the second day we were there. Our Standard rooms had a nice balcony and view from the back and a quick walk (2nd floor - down the stairs) to everything on the first floor. There is a convenience type store/gift shop called the Marketplace which offers grocery items and "Counter Service" and "snacks" on the Disney DIning Plan. The Roast Beef at the Marketplace was excellent...they can substitute the "Brie" cheese for Cheddar from the salad bar. The Rooms were comfortable and beds had plenty of pillows. They offered the new Disney Shampoo, Conditioner, lotion, plenty of soap. There is a Coffee maker, Ironing board, iron in the room and you get a USA Today newspaper most days. Room service is available until about 11:00pm. We ordered Pizza from Domino's one night ....expect one pizza to be about $20. You will get a wristband at the pool with your room card. Towels at the pool are plentiful with your wristband. On property: Hurricane Hanna's Grill: Kids Loved the Hamburgers....We loved the Chicken Flatbread with hummus. If you are on the DIning plan and ask to pick up your icecream later..you need to get it the same day. Cape May Cafe Buffet: Get your reservations 90 days in advance. We always love the Buffet which includes Seafood plus Roast, RIbs, Chicken Nuggets, a great Salad Buffet and wonderful dessert buffet but will probably try something else next time....was just so crowded. The Arcade and Spa were superior to other DIsney Resorts we have seen. Walk out the back of the Resort to the Beach and turn left...and walk 10 minutes to Epcot! Quick walk to Boardwalk's restaurants and Fun! The Beach Club will always be our 'home' base although we may wander off a year or two - we will always return!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Disney World”
Reviews.Author: jameygamer
Reviews.Content: I always stay at the Beach Club because of several things. First, it is really nice. Second, it has some good restaurants, including those in its sister hotel, the Yacht Club. Third, the rooms are very comfortable. Fourth, it has the best hotel pool in the world (basically, it's a mini-water park.)
