But most of all, the location allows you easy access to both Epcot and Disney's Hollywood Studios (they changed the name from Disney-MGM Studios) as well as the Boardwalk, so a lot of great attractions are within walking distance. Oh, and it has a game arcade, a health club, a hair salon, and a mini-grocery store. This was Michael Eisner's favorite hotel in Disney World for a reason. Its my favorite too. If you come only once, try to stay here or at the Yacht Club next door, which is also very nice. This hotel is a true family resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: super mommy
Reviews.Content: Disney's Beach Club is a great resort with just a quick walk (approximately 10 or less depending on where your room is located) to Disney's Epcot. The lobby is very airy and nice. The entire staff was very friendly and helpful. Make reservations at all the sit down restaurants you'd like to eat at long before leaving home. The hotel will provide you with a great map of the hotel and nearby Boardwalk eateries. The room was nice (not spectacular but VERY NICE). Definitely enough room for two adults and two children (and I would even say a small third child on the day bed). Ask for a water view if available (our room overlooked the lake and boardwalk--very nice view). The zero entry pool was a definite hit with our 4 and 6 year olds. Even my husband and I relaxed in it. Another feature appreciated was the awesome ship slide. My 6 year old loved it! Overall, I would definitely stay here again. You can't beat the location and the view & pool were great!!! A little Epcot advice here: Akershus Princess dinner at Epcot was expensive but relatively good with the princesses as entertainment for the kids and the portions & appetizer buffet were decent. Another good option is the German sit down buffet in Germany (at Epcot, as well). You get a great show and lots to eat. I won't say that it's a 100% German (chicken strips versus real Putenschnitzel [turkey schnitzel]). Something to consider--it IS authentic when it comes to the seating--if you have a small party you'll get other guests at your table (just like in Germany) so be prepared for a real German experience there.

Reviews.Title: “Family of 5 vacation to Disney”
Reviews.Author: Jeannequi
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights as a family in Disney. I booked everything through Disney directly by phone. We knew we wanted this hotel. We used the Magical Express for transportation which was great. We stayed at the resort with park hopper plus water park tickets and Disney Dining Plan. Did not go off property. The hotel was great! Big room and best pool in Disney. Very convenient location to Epcot & Hollywood Studio. Movies on the beach every night at 9pm. View of Epcot fireworks, too. Recommend the dining plan and make dinner reservations in advance. Good character breakfast at hotel. Stay away from buffets - better meals at sit down dinners.

Reviews.Title: “grounds great, room not so great, expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: chatternc
Reviews.Content: as with everyone else here, we really enjoyed the location and grounds of this property but the rooms are definitely showing wear and tear. the carpet was worn and old and not what i would expect for $350/night, my kids thought the sinks smelled bad (smelled like mildew even though you couldn't see it), i had lukewarm water in my shower 2 days in a row and after complaining twice they finally found one of their boilers was off. on the other hand, the pool and lagoon were great, location to epcot and hollywood studios can't be beat. still i definitely do not think its worth the money--but disney has such a monopoly its hard to find a combination of reasonable view, convenience and good hotel rooms at a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “great pool/location”
Reviews.Author: dodo333
Reviews.Content: My wife and 2 children stay in orlando often and have stayed at many of the disney resorts. We just stayed at the beach club for the weekend and it was a great experience. The staff was pleasant and responsive to simple requests with no difficulties. The hotel rooms are standard/small with no actual balcony to speak of. The advantage to this hotel is the location near epcot/mgm/boardwalk, the fantastic pool and the cape may cafe for the kids. The Pool is the best in the area for kids-it has sand bottom which is very light on the feet, the kids slide was great for my young children and the big slide was fun for my wife. The game room was well kept for the kids, and the cape may cafe has a nice buffett and great character breakfast for the kids. If you plan to visit the parks all day and just sleep in a room then this is not a good choice hotel as the rooms are nothing to write home about, for that i would suggest a lower end disney hotel or the omni. If you plan to use the pool and activities in the nearby boardwalk which is not too crowded and a fun place to go considering the crowds everywhere else than this hotel is an excellent choice. For adult only/honeymoon style the yacht club would be a better choice, but for kids/pool/fun the beach club is a hit.

Reviews.Title: “Disney magic a bit tarnished”
Reviews.Author: cpassant
Reviews.Content: The Beach Club is a deluxe resort on Disney property. But I have to say the Disney touch is showing some wear and tear. Here's my review in points: Pros: Walking distance to EPCOT Great pool Beautiful rooms Ice cream parlor Cons: Internet service broken during stay Zero food options after 11 pm (except price gouging room service) Unstocked minibar Expensive valet The bottomline is for $400 a night, you expect and deserve Four Seasons service. This a three star hotel at 5 star prices.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was OK”
Reviews.Author: ceshell
Reviews.Content: My husband and two young children stayed here in the summer of 2007. We chose this place primarily because of it's closeness to Epcot and the awesome pool. The pool is the best and the largest at the Disney resorts. Our room was unfortunately about a 15 min. walk to the pool. We had a nice garden view room, but it was quite a walk to the lobby, pool and restaurants. About 2 days into our stay, there was a large wet area by our front door. We had to make multiple requests for maintance, and it took about two days for them to see that an air conditioning unit in a room above ours was leaking. They then placed a very loud fan in our room to dry it. This was a hassle and a major inconvience considering the money we spent at this deluxe resort. We were also overcharged several hundred dollars on our credit card, and the front desk workers were not very helpful. After haggling for 2 hours over the charges we finally left for our long drive home. We were compensated also with free park hopper passes for us to use in the future because of the water leak in our room. I would not stay here again, I would choose another resort.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome time!”
Reviews.Author: hannasgrace
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August 2007, for five days, with our two kids, aged 8 and 4. We originally booked our stay at the Animal Kingdom Lodge, but due to the construction at the time, we were given a free upgrade to the Beach Club resort. The best amenity has to be the pool/waterpark area. Our kids loved it. Our eight year old enjoyed the pirate ship waterslide. Our four year old enjoyed the smaller waterslide located in the pirate ship pool. We did not have trouble getting pool chairs. Towels were always available. Our kids also really enjoyed the zero entry pool. our four year old spent a lot of time building sand castles and playing in the shallow water. They also really enjoyed the nightly beach movies. Upon check in the staff will give you a calendar of the events occurring at the hotel, including a list of the movies playing each evening. You can also catch the fireworks from the theme parks at night. The hotel is conveniently located close to the Boardwalk area, and Epcot. We walked to Epcot one morning- it took us about five minutes but it was worth it as there was not a line to get in. We also made use of the Bakery at the Boardwalk. The rooms were clean and comfortable. We had a small refrigerator and a balcony. The housekeeping staff were excellent. Our children brought their stuffed animals with them and the staff arranged them creatively on the bed each morning. The kids enjoyed coming back from the park to see what they had done with their toys. The only downfall would be the complimentary transportation provided by the hotel. It was shared with several other hotels, and one of the last stops. Several times the buses were too crowded and we had to wait 30-45 minutes. Toward the end of the trip we used our own vehicle to get to the parks as it was much quicker and free since we were a guest at the resort. All in all, this was a great hotel. Probably the best Disney hotel we have stayed at so far. They had a lot to offer- including great activities for the kids. Be sure to get a schedule from the hotel in order ot make the most of what they offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great With Kids”
Reviews.Author: Murray66
Reviews.Content: This is an incredible resort for families with young kids. Our 2 year old loved the huge, warm, sand filled free form, foot deep pool. Plenty of pool chairs any time you come.Disney character buffet breakfasts delighted him and the excellent buffet dinners were just perfect for us. Courteous, friendly staff, nice size room and Epcot fireworks at night worked perfectly for us. Active young kids playing and enjoying themselves were the norm, not the exception, and just what we were looking for. The boardwalk and the water taxi after dinner help unwind busy, fun filled and happy days. If you're looking for a vacation that you and your kids will love stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, bad housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: GAnne
Reviews.Content: Disney's Beach Resort was a good hotel, but the Housekeeping needs improvement. After traveling all day with a 4 year old, when we arrived in our room late at night, there was no bed set up for him - it was a pull-out arm chair that turned into a bed, and we had to make it up ourselves - they took an hour to get to the room. We stayed there for 7 nights and only on the last day, did someone actually make up my child's bed, otherwise they just pulled the blanket up and left the bed rumpled up. Also housekeeping left dirty wash cloths in the bathroom, and didn't bother changing them. The pool was good, which is why we chose this hotel, and the buses to & from the parks were convenient when they ran on time, some days we waited 30 - 40 minutes for a bus, but that seemed to be a problem with all the hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Best Family Vacation to Date”
Reviews.Author: deadra5505
Reviews.Content: This was by far one fo the best family trips we've had to date. A few things we LOVED! Pools - The pools are all perfect tempurature. They all have sand bottoms which is something differnt and cool. There is a really cool slide and there is also a small pool by the access to the big slide so if you have big kids that want to be on the slide you can hang out at the access area with your younger ones and they can go down the little slide. My 3 yr old loved it back there while her big brother (6yrs. old) enjoyed the bigger slide. (dad enjoyed it as well). There is also a beach area, it's actually the pool with a little beach built into it, this is where my 3 yr. old wanted to spent the entire trip. Rooms - We stayed in a standard room which was nice, a little on the small side. Once the kids were ready and dad and I needed to get ready the kids had very little room to play - they kinda went crazy. I think larger room would have been a great idea. The standard rooms all have balconies/patios (ours did) this was nice. We spent mornings out there having coffe etc. while the kids watched cartoons. Resturants - We weren't really pleased with the food situation it was nearly impossible to get reservations, although we did book our trip at the last minute. Dinner reservations were the hardest - we mostly ate room service for dinner (which was all good). Breakfast wasn't to bad we were able to do character breakfasts on 3 occasions I think, maybe 4. We also did a lunch with the princesses at Epcot which the girls LOVED!!! The ferry boat was nice to have there as well. We rode to MGM/Hollywood for that, and we also toke random rides, the kids enjoyed that. Don't bother getting on the boat to go to Epcot it is literally a 3 min. walk. The boardwalk is right across from the resort which was alot of fun, nice resturants, shopping, etc. Great vacation, would HIGHLY recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay!!”
Reviews.Author: JKobr
Reviews.Content: My wife, I and our two boys (aged 6 and 1) stayed at the Beach Club for three nights from March 13-16 as the front end of Disney's Land/Sea 7 night vacation cruise package. It was our second stay at this property, and once again we found it to be spectacular. The grounds are amazing, clean and picturesque whether strolling around the hotel, using the pool, along the boardwalk or the beach. Our check in was effortless, but can't say the same about our luggage which was being transferred over from our previous two day stay across the lake at the Boardwalk Inn. While told it would arrive around 4pm while were at the parks, upon our midnight return to the hotel, had to call Bell Captain again to get it up to our room. It also took 4 phone calls to the Bell Captain over the span of two days to get a package we had delivered, up to our room. Luckily our need for said package wasn't urgent so didn't cast a bad cloud on our stay. The room was excellent, large and clean, good size bathroom, and ample space to accommodate the crib for our one year old and the day bed for my 6 year old. Turn down service was nice, and my son enjoyed the staff leaving chocolates behind each night. The hotel pool, Stormalong Bay, is as great as advertised. Sand bottom zero entry pool was fantastic for both kids & adults, spacious and warm. The pirate slide was a great thrill, as was the mini lazy river and whirlpool. Staying here just for the pool is reason enough. We only ate at the resort one night, and it was both delicious and plentiful at the Cape May Buffet. We would definetely recommend this property again. Expensive, but great rooms, grounds, pools, staff in general and proximity to Epcot and Hollywood Studios a huge plus as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great place; Little pricey, but worth it.”
Reviews.Author: rampage23
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Disney Beach Club for three nights in late March. For families with kids, this place is great to take a break from the parks and take a swim. We loved the large waterslide and pool area. Views were excellent all around. Rooms were a little less impressive. Nothing to write home about. Very plain. Balconies were nice, but small. Bathroom was tiny. TV was similiar to what I had ten years ago, with less channel selection. But, hey, you're not here to watch TV, right? The grounds are definitely what makes this place worth staying at. Very close proximity to Epcot and Boardwalk, which are two of our faves. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I felt the Disney magic!!!”
Reviews.Author: turddlovestravel94
Reviews.Content: I loved the disney beach club resort!!! It was very charming. When we got there we were immediately upgraded to the conceige level. A manager personaly took us up there and the conceige gave us a brief talk about the hotel and disney. The conceige level was great. Some bonus's you got were: Two conceige's there all day. A section on the level that had free snacks(little sandwiches,pretzels,chips and dip,beverages,etc.) and breakfast(bagels,cereal,coffee,krispy creme donuts yumm!) Lobby: The resort's lobby was okay.Nothing extrodinary but nice. Pool: The pool was amazing!!! It had a sandbottom pool so it was like hanging out at the beach and a regular pool. It also had a really cool slide.The ducks like dto swim in it alot so don't be suprised! Beach: The resort had a little beach right by the lake that connected it to the boardwalk, dolphin,epcot, etc. one down side is that you couldn't swim in it, but i guess thats because alot of boats go through it. At night the beach club has movies on the beach with a big blow up screen. I didn't try it but it looked fun! also has yoga on the beach in the morning. Rooms: The rooms were great, better then I expected.It had a beachy theme. We had a nice Large balcony in our room.Comfortable beds and very clean.We even had an i-home in our room. Dining: The beach club only had two restaurants.Cape May Cafe. We ate breakfast there one day. The food was only okay.But the characters were cool. Minnie,chip,dale,etc. all walked around greeting everyone. The resort also has an old fashion ice cream place called beaches and cream.It had huge sundaes,burgers,fries all the normal american food. Right next to there is the arcade(had a good time in there!).We also ate at the yachtman steakhouse located at the yachtclub resort(A little more up scale then beachclub i thought) next door. All I can say is EXPENSIVE. Location: The last thing about the beach club is that it is in great location to epcot. a five minute walk! And for the rest of the parks the disney resorts provide a bus srvice located at each hotel. Overall I would definatly saty there again! An awsome resort! feel free to message me any questions! : D

Reviews.Title: “Great area - hotel OK”
Reviews.Author: Christina_Jorgensen
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Disney Beach Club while attending a conference. The hotel is OK, but really nothing to write home about. Compared to hotels elsewhere, I was surprised that there was just an empty refrigerator that you then had to purchase items for. Even though I purchased items through room service nobody really bothered to check whether the refrigerator was on - which it wasn't. But again, that might have been my responsibility even though I could not figure it out. One of the electrical outlets broke down and some others did not work, because they had not been plugged in. I am just surprised that these things not are checked as part of the cleaning of the rooms. I requested a room change, because of an annoying noise in my first room (3rd floor above the Martha's Vineyard bar) and they managed to accomodate that well, but did not see to that the content of the refrigerator was moved as well, and I had to request that 3 times and still they did not restock with all items I bought. The area is great though, and for families with children this would definitely be a place to recommend. The breakfast buffet is USD 18 + taxes, which I find a lot considering that the relatively dull and unhealthy choice of food. But then again, the kids would love having breakfast with the Disney characters - and the service is nice and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “poor maintenance”
Reviews.Author: thcatt
Reviews.Content: 1) exaust duct in bath was inaffective due to the heavily caked dust and soot built up over the years; I alerted maintenance of this and a few days later it was taken care of. 2) in the middle of our stay the hot water system broke down and our showers weren't even lukewarm; a friend of ours lodged there a few weeks later and told us that she had the same problem. 3) we told the concierge(s) of these problems and although they were very nice and courteous I really don't think they cared very much. It's too bad. The Beach Club is in such a great location, but it felt like the hotel was managed by amateurs.

Reviews.Title: “Grounds were very nice, room was just ok”
Reviews.Author: shmedly123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Beach Club with my wife and two daughters from March 2-7, 2008 and here is my review in the form of likes and dislikes: Likes: -The grounds were absolutely beautiful. -Stormalong bay was great for the kids. My 3 1/2 yr old loved playing in the sand it really felt like you were at a small waterpark. -The proximity to Epcot and the Boardwalk were great. -The lobby was very nice -The Cape May Cafe was surprisingly good (I am not a seafood eater) but there was enough variety of non seafood. Dislikes: - The rooms are really starting to show their age. They are in need of a refurb. (fading wallpaper, ceilings need a fresh coat of paint, shower could use a good bleaching). - The "mousekeeping" service was sub-par the first night (sock left in a drawer from previous guest, had to call down twice for a crib, when the crib did arrive the crib sheet was heavily soiled.) - Balcony was too small to sit out at (the balconies were much larger at the Yacht Club). All in all it was an above average stay for us and the pluses definitely outweighed the minuses. The mousekeeping was fine the rest of the stay. I would stay here again but I would probably wait until after the next scheduled refurb and try the Yacht club instead as you can also take care of the grounds from that resort and the grounds is really what you are paying for.

Reviews.Title: “BEST Vascation EVER!!”
Reviews.Author: BeachG0ddess
Reviews.Content: The Beach Club was PERFECT! Mo mom and I went on a girls' week out trip to Disney and we just LOVED the Beach Club. The hotel is beautiful. The lobby is gorgeous. The rooms are beautifully furnished, cheerful, and have these amazing beds that lull you to sleep after a hard day at the parks. You don't need to pay extra for the pool view- the garden views are very pretty. They have the most friendly, helpful, and professional hotel staff you will ever find. The pool is really fun and what sets this hotel apart from the other themed resorts. Rent one of the floats; they're very relaxing, even with kids all around. The sandy botom is great. It really is a beach atmosphere. One of the best things about the Beach Club (and Yacht Club and Boardwalk) is they are located in easy walking distance of Epcot. Because believe me, you might well need a break. We spent the morning and afternnon doing FutureWorld, Living Seas, et cetera, then we went back to the Beach Club, cooled off in the pool, and changed clothes to go back to World Showcase and lightshow in the evening. A great day. Food: The clambake buffet at the Cape May Cafe is very good, make sure you go if you like seafood. The snack bar near the pool has the best french fries I've ever had, and I'm a fry expert. Money savers: get the refillable mug as soon as you get there and you'll save lots of $$ on drinks, as they can add up VERY quickly in the heat. Also, the the gift shop has a deli which has very good breakfast sandwiches for two or three dollars, and made-to-order salads which are very fresh and only six bucks. This is important because you will be spending loads of money on other stuff. But make sure you treat yourself to a night out at Downtown Disney, and eat at Fulton's Crab House. It's on a riverboat in the water, and if it's not too crowded (go after 8), you can get a table outside with lovely views. Entrees are spendy, but get some appetizers and drinks and you'll be a very happy. Save the calories for the Ghiradelli chocolate shop! No matter what, if you choose the Beach Ckub, you'll be very, very happy. .

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed this time”
Reviews.Author: Esther32
Reviews.Content: We go to Disneyworld every year or so and usually stay at Disneys Yacht Club. This time we could only get the Yacht club for part of our stay so we booked the Beach club for 4 nights. We had been assured the room and amenities would be the same as the Yacht Club. The room was not as nice. The amenties were less (one little shampoo, had to ask for soap!) Each night the cleaning carts were left in the hallway on our floor (2nd FLoor). Not one cart, but 8 of them. Usually the service at WDW is terrific across the board. However this stay was vastly inferior than the usual disney standard. I will go back to Disneyworld but not to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Ultimate Upgrade at Disney's Beach Club!”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravel422
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Disney's Beach Club for one night prior to our Disney cruise. Our stay was on Saturday, Feb. 9th. We are big Disney fans and have eaten at this resort before so we always wanted to try it and since we had one night before our cruise, we figured we'd splurge. We booked through a link on this website through bookit.com and saved about $100 off the price on Disney's website. We were able to use Disney's Magical Express too even though we didn't book the room through Disney. Anyway, we arrived around 1:30pm to check in and our only hope was that the room would be ready so we could get to the fabulous pool they have here. Check in took awhile as it appeared there was a problem. I was nervous at first since I'd never used bookit.com before. Well the problem came when it said we were only registered for 1 adult. We actually were 2 adults and our daughters ages 11 & 15. So the person checking us in said she had to speak to a manager to get it changed. I was nervous we'd have to pay more or something. Well the process of getting the manager, etc. took awhile. We were patient but nervous. After some whispering between the manager and cast member, she came back saying our room was not ready but it would be worth the wait. I didn't ask why, but she said to wait another minute and went away to check on something else. When she finally came back she said they had given us a complimentary upgrade to the "club level" which is their conceirge floor! We were thrilled as I'd read reports about people staying at this level and it sounded wonderful! Soon conceirge John came to help us with our few carry-on bags and give us a tour of the conceirge floor. We got our special "gold" keys and off we went up the elevator. We were welcomed by the 2 staff members at the desk by the elevators and John told us about all of the amenities. Since we were staying only one night we didn't need help with dining reservations or tickets. However, we loved the room (standard but with a good size balcony) and we LOVED the free food & beverages in the lounge. There was sodas, cookies, snacks, dinner and breakfast. We had budgeted about $100 for food for dinner and breakfast the following morning but didn't spend 1 penny of it as all food & drinks were included with the club level. For dinner they served barbeque ribs, a few assorted salads, cheese & crackers, assorted veggies & fruits, soda, alcoholic beverages, cookies, uncrustable pb & j's, etc. It was fabulous! There were always snacks and drinks available. Breakfast included assorted bagels, donuts, fruit, etc. We loved the service on this level! We also found the rooms to be nice. There were 2 queen sized beds, a small fridge, a balcony with 2 chairs (we could see the Epcot ball from our balcony), a sink area with 2 sinks outside the bathroom, a good size bathroom, dresser, ceiling fan, etc. We also LOVED the pool area and spent a few hours there. The pool area is huge! You do need to get wristbands when you enter the pool area by showing your room key. They also have towels there to use. Overall, the Beach Club was everything we hoped it would be and much more! We wound up buying into Disney's Vacation Club on our cruise with our new home resort being at the Animal Kingdom Villas, but we know we'll use our points soon to stay at the Beach Club Villas too as we loved this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Mickey Should Be Proud”
Reviews.Author: wetravelanywhere
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently returned from a trip to Disney. While there we stayed at the Disney Beach Club Resort. To say that the resort is nice is a tremendous understatement. As with any Disney product, the resort and its amenities were first rate. The room, with its New England charm, was very comfortable. The staff is obviously trained to make everyone feel as if they were the only people using the facilities. In short, if you are planning a trip to Disney World, the Beach Club Resort is a perfect choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel/Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cathycomfort
Reviews.Content: Our family of 3 (12 year old daughter) stayed at the BC for 6 nights in February. We had a great time and loved the location and amenities this hotel had to offer. I booked a standard room but I think we were upgraded to a water view (although they didn't tell us that at check in - which was a breeze by the way. Our room had a nice size balcony (another nice surprise) and a view of the quiet pool and Boardwalk, on the Epcot end of the hotel - defn. a location I would recommend. The room was very clean, with a small fridge and 2 queen beds. The murphy bed was not something I would want to sleep on and I'm glad we didn't have to use it. Housekeeping did a nice job but they did come late in the day (3 or 4oclock). The quiet pool was very nice, warm and quiet. I only stuck my foot in 'stormalong bay' and it seemed very cold to me. There were plenty of lifeguards around the large pool but none by the quiet pool. Plenty of lounge chairs by the pool and along the beach. Staff was always very polite, always with a warm hello. I could complain about the lateness of housekeeping, room service trays left in the hall a bit too long and the temp of the big pool, but all the other services and amenities more than made up for any small inconveniences along the way.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: adawosdi
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a convention. The convention facilities were great. Including the food. The hotel was very nice. The room was spacious and very clean. Close to Epcot and the Boardwalk was fun to walk. The Concierge service was excellent and very helpful. There is a very special magic staying on site. Hurricane Hanna's Grill had very slow service. And the Yachtsman Steakhouse was an expensive disappointment. The Garden View tea at the Grand Floridian was wonderful. Looking forward to our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Beach Club - a GREAT resort!”
Reviews.Author: Taperman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Beach Club from Jan. 18 thru Jan. 26. It was our first time there and we loved it. We are a family of five and the room size was fine, two queen beds and a day bed. We were upgraded to the concierge' level on the fifth floor. We loved the lounge with the food available all day long. The pool and the location of the hotel were the primary reason's we booked this hotel. You won't find a better pool in all of Disney! Also the proximity to EPCOT and the Boardwalk area and also Hollywood Studios cannot be beat. We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the beach club.”
Reviews.Author: briny319
Reviews.Content: We just checked out of the Beach Club and loved it. Once we arrived we received a free upgrade to the Club Level floor which made a world of difference. Had we not received this upgrade the review would only be above average. From our room we were able to see the beautiful epcot fireworks at night. I didn't have a chance to try room service but the Beachs and Cream Ice Cream shop at great burgers and ice cream. The staff was excellent. If I visit epcot again we will certainly stay at the beach club. But we most likely will skip epcot and stay somewhere closer to the magic kingdom.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: cimicats
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband at the Beach Club for our honeymoon and had a great stay. Our room was a waterview overlooking the lagoon. We had a nice deck and the room was spacious and very clean. I found the location to be excellent. We walked into EPCOT and took the ferry to MGM. We used the buses to get to Magic Kingdown and it went directly to and from. Maybe because of the time of year but we made no other stops except to the Yacht/Beach clubs so it was great. I liked having the sit down restaurants at the hotel as well as the Marketplace. We didn't realize this til after the fact but you can use your dining plan "snacks" in the marketplace to buy water/soda and snacks, so that is handy to stock up. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Disney”
Reviews.Author: Paddy_Power2673
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the the Disney Beach Club Hotel and all I can say it was the best hotel I have ever stayed in the USA. Very friendly staff, best hotel pool I have ever used. Worth every penny!! Thanks Mark UK

Reviews.Title: “Still Awesome - Possibly best on Property!”
Reviews.Author: Happy_TravelersNY
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 days 12/2 - 12/7 and The Beach/Yacht Club is still one of the best if not the best hotel on the Disney Property. The Pool - aka Stormalong Bay is the only one with sand in the bottom so you feel like you are at the beach. Direct walking access to Epcot (enter near France) and this is one of the most romantic (and yet still kid friendly) places to be at Disney. You can also walk to the Boardwalk entertainment area (with ESPN, several restaurants and bars). LOVED IT!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Quite Hotel for visiting Disney”
Reviews.Author: JayHTexas
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite nice. It is right next door to Epcot, and about a 10 minute ride on the bus to the Magic Kingdom. The food is generally good, except for the breakfast buffet, which was less than average. Rooms are average size. My only complaint was that I was apparently booked into a room designed for a handicapped person, and the door could not be closed manually. You had to wait for the automatic door opener/closer to decide when it wanted to close.

Reviews.Title: “Large black snake in the pool changing rooms !!!”
Reviews.Author: vic001
Reviews.Content: Spent a few days at the DBC with wife and 2 young children. This resort was quite good except for the "large black snake" I discovered in the changing rooms by stormalong bay. I immediately Informed nearby staff of this and was told that they would tend to it. I was however shocked to find that no real attempt at all by staff was made to shut the changing room facility until the snake was removed. The resort is very close to Epcot and MGM but found the general attitude of some staff to be "it's not my problem" - not much disney magic here! Maid service was hit and miss and had to phone to complain when the room wasn't cleaned by 9pm after our return from the parks. This was resolved the following day with no other major problems thereafter. We have stayed at both AKL and Wilderness Lodge many times in the past and both of those resorts to have a much higher level of service and disney magic one would expect from any delux resort. There was total lack of decent quick bite restaurants on site however, with Epcot nearby it should create too much of a problem for guests who are happy to eat off site. The main advantage of staying at the DBC is its close proximity to Epcot and MGM otherwise, I feel there are many other delux resorts such as Wilderness Lodge and Animal Kingdom Lodge ( our favourate ) where you can get much more for your money with a much better quality of service and on-site facilities. Finally on a more positive note the stormalong bay pool area is very large and good fun though very crowded most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Definately a Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ChillyinBoston
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our honeymoon this November. We arrived by the Disney bus transportation from the airport, limo would have been better, as you wouldn't make stops before your destination but the bus wasn't bad at all. It actually gave us a chance to check out the other hotels. When we arrived someone actually greeted us outside before we even made it in! She greeted us by our name and mentioned that she had a surprise for us. We were very excited. Well, they upgraded our room for free because we were on our honeymoon! We were now on the club level, which by the way is great and well worth the extra money, it included a huge room with double balconies and the club room that has food and snacks all day. They even had complimentary wine and beer in the evening with appetizers, hot appetizers!! The hotel is very nice, their beach is really nice too... but no swimming allowed. This doesn't matter much due to the fact they have a great pool. They also have a great pirate ship with a water slide for the kids, very cute. Staff was very nice throughout our entire stay, very helpful with dinner reservations. If you need dinner reservations, I highly recommend booking well in advance, if not, have the concierge do it for you... they have special privileges and I believe the restaurants hold some spots for them. We highly recommend the Yachtmand Steakhouse.... excellent! Bottom line, we would definately stay there again. Like I have always said, "No one quite does it the same as Disney". You could probably pay less at a non-disney resort, but if you want an experience to remember, stay at a Disney resort it really makes a difference, especially if you have kids... I forgot to mention all the activities they had in the lobby everyday for the kids. We'll definately be back hopefully next year.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Holiday”
Reviews.Author: fabulous3
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my husband and 2 daughters aged 10 and 8 this August. On arrival at the magical Express desk in Orlando, we were given a free limousine transfer to the hotel as part of Disney's year of a million dreams. really special, the girls loved it! When we arrived at the hotel, we were given a fanfare and our room was upgraded to the concierge level on the 5th floor.This was just great. It had staff available just for you to book excursions, table reservations or do just about anything for you. This also entilted you to free breakfast, and snacks all day long til 10pm. The rooms were gorgeous and the staff could not do enough for you. The hotel is in a great location within walking distance to Epcot and close to all of the other parks. I have stayed in Disney before and this was far better then other properties I have stayed in. I would definitely recommend it and would go back there myself. If you're going, then lucky you, it will be wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “A brief overview of why we love the Beach Club”
Reviews.Author: cwgriswold
Reviews.Content: We like to halve trips between 2 resorts - it's a fun way to break up a week, cram in some relaxing and experience new little corners of the 'World. The Beach Club is light and airy with great restaurants, an awesome pool and is a hop/skip/jump to Epcot. That's why we love it. On our first trip in March 04 we stayed at the Beach Club and loved it so much we stayed there again for 1/2 our Aug 2007 trip. [We stayed at the Polynesian for the second 1/2 of our 2007 trip, separate review.] Splitting the vacation in 2 like this is becoming increasingly popular, according to the fella who helped me book the trip. However, doing so compunds an already ardous planning process, but it's well worth it. You really need a good Disney operator on the line to assist you, some operators are better at their jobs than others, if you get a surly one, call back. I had the pleasure of Russel giving it his best effort - he was outstanding! The Deluxe resorts all have specific pros, proximity to parks in particular is key -- the Beach Club is a short walk from the 'back door' to Epcot [brings you in right around England]. The BC is connected to the Yacht Club and these 2 hotels share Stormalong Bay - the most fabulous pool complex. I like the whole vibe of the Beach Club more than the YC, can't really articulate why, they are almost the same, but BC seems more dynamic. BC - again, very close to Epcot, and an easy, restful quick [10 min] ferry ride to MGM, bus to MK - manageable but can be a drag at night with little ones fatigued from all the fun. If you have little-little kids and plan to focus on MK, the BC might not be the best option in terms of proximity to the park if you are planning long hours there, [see Polynsesian review] but if you don't mind a little shlepping, the Beach Club is beautiful and offers tons of fun in and of itself. Plan to spend time just enjoying the resort on its own, i.e., non-park days. Epcot is so awesome, I could spend a week there, easily, but truthfully, not as much fun for little kids as MK, and is 10x more walking. Pool: gorgeous, huge, fun and relaxing, only for hotel guests. There is one v large waterslide and a small one for little kids that empties into its own pool, 2 huge spas, plus 'sandy' bottom/beach, lazy river and, when we were there last time, a volleyball net where anyone who wanted to got into a serious game of pool volleyball with a 3 ft-diameter beach ball. V fun. There is also a quiet pool somewhere, but we never tried to find it because Stormalong Bay is such fun. One caveat, when we were there, the pool chemistry-irritant level was high, may have something to do with the 'sand' and the challenges faced to keep it clean; the pool is on the chemical-heavy side - if your kids will be in there for a while, goggles are a must, and if you prize a particular bathing suit, maybe opt for a back-up. The pool is awesome, give it at least a day - if you don't get into the pool and experience the waterslide, you will miss out and regret it. Resort: very clean, crisp and fresh- they seem to be continually refreshing here [unobtrusive carpet cleaning and painting going on, both visits], darling Disney-nautical theme. It's a fairly casual vibe, not at all uncommon to see people in the lobby in their pool gear en route to the fun outside; a friend told me of ladies at the G Floridian pool in Chanel ballet flats, shi-shi pool ensembles and don't-take-my-picture large brimmed hats.... nothing like that at BC, not stuffy at all. We had standard rooms both times, last time = an end unit [much larger but at the standard prix, just a bit more walk to the elevator] w/ 2 doubles plus roll-away. We also brought an aerobed because, though I do love this place, if you aren't well-rested, the appurtenant travails of WDW will drive you over the edge and you will see flashes of yourself rattling the gates of Wally World... bring an aerobed, they are happy to provide blankets/sheets. Staff was excellent, friendly and very accomodating, always there to help when asked and prompt, full of personality, etc. There were walk-up wash cloth/towel animal making sessions in the lobby for the kids, very cute. Great store/mini cafe in the hotel. We had our kids' portrait done by the resident pastel artist - she does great work and prefers to work from photo, handy so you need not waste precious Disney time being idle. Not to be too cheesy, but night-time at the BC was also great, such fun to fill you with warm happy memories...After sunset the hotel held campfires with s'mores on the beach [lake beach, not pool beach - they are right next to each other, however] and movies under the stars -projected on a huge movie sceen on the beach with loungechairs arranged in front, complete with popcorn; highly recommend! The arcade was quite large and very crowded, really good blacklight airhockey...if you must, go at an off hour, like in the a.m., when the soda shop is not packed. Speaking of the soda shop - Beach Club / Yacht Club Dining: this last time we were on the dining plan, which should really be called the eat-til-you-explode plan. It is so much food, there is no humanly possible way to consume all that it includes, but we would do it again for convenience's sake and for ease in planning. There are several restaurants between the Beach Club and adjacent Yacht Club. The store/cafe in the BC has more than adequate counter service options and lots of snacks / minimarket. The soda shop is super cute, esp for kids who have not experienced an authentic version - the potential flavor combos of old-fashioned sodas enthralled our kids- chocolate coke, the best of all possible worlds! Good sandwiches, fun atmosphere, but go for early lunch. The soda shop was so crowded at dinner time that it should be avoided. It's physically a small space, very popular, and those waiting head to the arcade next door- the attendant bells, whistles, noise, fullness from overeating because of the dining plan and chocolate coke-buzzed children meld into an aura from hell that is totally overwhelming, could easily sour your experience or give you a migraine. The Yachtsman Steakhouse was simply excellent. It has a quiet, elegant yachtclub / countryclub type atmosphere and the restaurant overlooks the pool. We had a fantastic dinner there with the kids, but this place would also work for grownups-only. There are a couple of other lovely restaurants in these 2 hotels, one with character breakfast, but we got our character meal fix elsewhere - can find under separate review. In all, the fact that there are so many hotel options at WDW and that we went back a second time and plan to return to the BC again next time for 1/2 the trip mean that this place is great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: lilspitfire
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to let anyone know who may be on the fence about this resort to go ahead and book it. Keeping in mind that any 5star hotel in Disney isn't equivalent to 5 stars in other places. Our last 2 trips were cruises, so housekeeping and food didn't hold a candle to our cruise experiences... That being said, the room was very nice, beds/pillows were extremely comfortable, pool was awesome and if you have little ones or people who don't swim well, you don't have to worry, b/c the lifeguards practically stalk you! They are very diligent! Housekeeping was lacking until the 3rd day, when we finally established a time to have our room made up (it seemed we kept missing them, b/c at times during the 1st few days, we had the "do no disturb" sign out. When we finally set it up to have the room done at 10, since we knew that we'd be out for a while by then, she kept coming around 8:30/9 when we were still getting ready . It was a bit annoying...but that's really the only complaint. The counter service food offerred is only fair. However, we toured many of the resorts that we were considering, and we concluded that if we went back, we'd stay at the Beach Club again in a heartbeat. We liked the resort itself and the location can't be beat. Approx. 3-5 min. enjoyable walk to Epcot and any other place that we had to take a bus to was very easy and convenient. It seemed that as soon as we got out to the spot to be picked up, the bus came 80% of the time. The longest we ever waited was 10 (if that) Buses are very efficient! Did not care for monorail transportation, so it's a good thing we didn't stay at a resort near Magic Kingdom.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Resort”
Reviews.Author: VacanowNj
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth visit to Disney with the kids (ages 8 and 7) but our first to The Beach Club. By the 2nd day of our visit, the entire family agreed that we will never stay anywhere else. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful throughout our 8 day stay. Our room was spacious, extremely clean, and full of cute animals made out of towels, which really amused the kids. We had a standard view room on the third floor and were able to watch the Epcot fireworks at night. We loved the 5 minute walk to Epcot and made the most of it by having dinner in a different Epcot country nearly every night (this worked wonderfully with the dining plan). Since it was over 90 degrees each day of our trip, we spent a couple of hours each afternoon in the swimming pool. This was a real treat! The pool complex was beautiful and large. The lazy river and slide were lots of fun. However, as other reviewers have noted, the water is quite deep and the current pretty fast in the Lazy River. Even though our children are strong swimmers, I wouldn't have been comfortable letting them out of my site for a minute in the lazy river. Daily visits in the lobby from Lilo and Stitch were extremely popular with the kids and the whole family appreciated the evening campfire and movies on the beach. Night volleyball in the pool was also a big hit. We used Disney transportation to get everywhere and it was always quick and reliable. We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Nice family resort”
Reviews.Author: 4Ds
Reviews.Content: Disney's Beach Club Resort is a nice oasis after spending time at the Disney parks. Nice features include a short walk to Epcot, easy boat ride to Disney Studios, easy access in front of the resort to buses that take you to the parks, convenient car parking, great pool, friendly staff, the Marketplace store is super convenient for food, drinks, souveniers, and basic toiletries, lots of restaurant options between the Beach Club and the neighboring Yacht Club Resort, nice kid activites especially in the evenings on the beach by the lake and there is a character breakfast in the morning and games with Lilo and Stich in the afternoons. Some drawbacks, the large water slide entrance is outside the main pool area so little kids are out of sight for some time getting to the slide. Housekeeping was ok but we found lots of trash on the floor that was covered by the bed spreads and curtains that showed vacuuming and cleanup were not very thorough. The lobby area however was exceptionally clean especially considering all the traffic from the pools and outside. I would definitely recommend the Beach Club for families visting the Disney parks and would even recommend it as a vacation spot on its own without the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Nice...but we like the Polynesian better”
Reviews.Author: skeeziks
Reviews.Content: Great things about the resort: - Clean and nicely decorated rooms - Very easy walk to Epcot and the Boardwalk - Pleasant and accomodating staff Why we like the Polynesian better: - The Beach Club feels too 'big' because the yacht and beach bulidings all meld together into one. The Polynesian's separate three floor buildings spread among the tropical setting feels less crowded and more relaxed. - The Beach Club pool area, while large, felt crowded and had too much deep water. I chose the Beach Club over the Poly this time because I felt the Poly's smaller pools would be too crowded in August (we ususally go in Nov/Dec). But, in retrospect, I don't think they could have felt more crowded than Storm-a-long did. Also, much of pool area at the Beach club has deeper water...with the water in the lazy river reaching 8 feet deep. I felt that was way too dangerous with such a large pool area where it can be difficult to keep track of kids. The depth and currents of the lazy river also proved dangerous for adults...as we watched the lifeguard jump in to help pull out a man that came close to drowning. --The Polynesian's newly renovated rooms are nicer and have more modern ammenities than the beach club.

Reviews.Title: “Almost everything you need for a magical stay.”
Reviews.Author: BippyBee
Reviews.Content: I came here for a family holiday earlier this year. You of course get the amazing customer service which comes as standard in the USA, and which you would expect at at Disney resort. Staff are unflaggingly cheerful and helpful, and are a big part of making your stay so special. The resort has loads of great facilities: a gym, beauty salon, a brilliant pool complex, and there's a Disney Club where kids can go in the evenings (although my nephew informed me their evening activities involved "playing video games and washing our hands a lot"). The only thing which let us down here was the hotel catering, There is a great buffet breakfast (which even includes pizza, lard lovers), with Disney characters in attendance, which the kids just love. However, but their facilities are too small to cope with the number of guests, so you can end up queuing for half an hour for breakfast, or having to book in advance (who wants to book for breakfast?!); this seems like a considerable oversight. The hotel provides a "clambake" buffet style restaurant in the evening too, which is OK if you like a buffet and seafood, but there's nothing else on offer in the hotel. In fairness there are places within walking distance where you can go off and eat, and we found the steak restaurant in the Yacht Club was by far and away the best (if pricey). The Yacht Club Galley on the other hand was so dire on our visit we ended up getting our meal for free. Still, if you're aware of these minor shortcomings before your trip you can plan accordingly, and the rest of your holiday should be magical.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to improve”
Reviews.Author: BigDisneyFan
Reviews.Content: We booked a concierge room at The Beach Club after finally making a decision between there and the Yacht Club. Bad choice! The room was very small and dark and our 'view' was of the shale roof below. The wallpaper was dirty, the comforters were old and faded and the beds desperately need replacing. I really don't feel it deserves to be classed as a deluxe. If you are thinking concierge will be a nice treat, please think again. The 'lounge' is like a converted broom cupboard compared to the other WDW concierge lounges. We checked out early and moved across to the Yacht Club which was much nicer and shares the same facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: TeachLuvBeach
Reviews.Content: This was the closest I've stayed to a Disney theme park, and it was well worth it. We walked to Epcot and took the ferry right outside the hotel to MGM. The staff was wonderful, as would be expected from Disney, and the character breakfast at Cape May Cafe was a delight.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice for my family”
Reviews.Author: basnight
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Orlando and the mecca known as Disney World. Me plus wife and two kids. We chose the Beach Club primarily for the pool area and the proximity to Epcot. Well, the pool area did not disappoint. There was a small pool for toddlers which was perfect for my one year old. A beach area which kept my four year old busy making sandcastles for hours. There was a lazy river, a whirlpool area, kids club pool area, and a waterslide which started from the pirate ship. Even had a tiny waterslide for the little ones who aren't tall enough to go on the big slide. There are tons of lifeguards, plenty of towels and lounge chairs, and a convenient snack bar. Epcot is the only park you can walk to although the Boardwalk resort is across the street should you desire to walk to eat or shop. The shuttles to take you to the other parks are easy to pick up outside the hotel. Since my kids were younger we spent more time at the Magic Kingdom than anywhere else and at the end of the day the shuttle ride seemed longer than it was. I would probably consider the Grand Floridian next time with it's proximity to the Magic Kingdom if that would be the focus with younger children as opposed to Epcot where there is not much for young kids to see. We ate at the buffet two nights because it was really our only choice. Found it to be OK food and overpriced. One night we ate at the 50's diner and thought the value was better. The gym was outstanding. Lots of cardio machines and plenty of weights. We stayed at the Club Level which had it's own concierges who were certainly very helpful. New York Times, USA Today and Wall Street Journal complimentary. There was also food available from morning til night and so we always ended up having breakfast in the Club Lounge with a spread of cereals, juices, coffee, breads, pastries, Krispy Kremes, etc...At night they had beer, wines, cheese, crackers, and a lamb or beef appetizer. Certainly helped to always grab some bottles of water and fruit to throw in the backpack when heading out in that heat and humidity. Lastly, the rooms were OK, a tad small and dated but we could see the fireworks from Epcot and the Magic Kingdom every night from our balcony. The staff were tremendous. I would certainly go back. Just not in July, 90+ temp and 80% humidity every day.

Reviews.Title: “Beach Club Top Notch EPCOT Resort”
Reviews.Author: Courtesy_Flush
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Beach Club for a convection and had a wonderful time. I stayed at the Boardwalk previously and hated it so I was pleasantly surprised at how much I enjoyed the Beach Club. First, the rooms have plenty of space and comfy beds. The bathroom is plain, but again, very spacious. The pool is the highlight of the resort. I could have spent the whole day wading around and drinking the yummy espresso and ice cream cocktails. I was happy with the staff which was a relief since the people I encountered at the Boardwalk were so rude. Everyone was curteous and efficient. I loved the theme of the Beach Club and much preferred it to the drab Yacht Club. The best part was the VERY short walk to the back door entrance to EPCOT. I exited the resort and had a Grey Goose slush in my hand in under 10 minutes! A few things will need to be updated at resort to still be considered deluxe: the coffee make and TVs. They both are Motel 6 quality and not what I have been accustomed to at the Hyatt and Hilton properties I have stayed at recently. As much as I enjoyed this resort, I don't think I would have liked it quite as much had I paid full price. Thanks to our convention, the rate was $159/night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location; fun ambiance”
Reviews.Author: Marnie33
Reviews.Content: My two childen (ages 4 and 6), my husband and I just returned from a week-long "Land and Sea" vacation--during which we had the pleasure of staying at the Beach Club and the Animal Kingdom Lodge and enjoying a three-night cruise on "Disney Wonder." I admit, I approached our Disney blow-out with both excitement and trepidation: I really wasn't sure if the Beach Club would live up to our rather high expectations. I was pleasantly surprised on most accounts. The Beach Club's location is absolutely unbeatable, as is the informal, cozy ambiance of the property itself. The rooms are a bit cramped for a family of four, but the pool, water slide and faux beach more than make up for this quibble. It's not meant to be a Four Seasons, after all; it's an entirely family-friendly property with a surfeit of fun options for the kids. The very instant the pool was closed due to thunder storms, activities were set up in the lobby. The ice cream parlor and arcade are open late and the quality of the counter-service food in the gift shop is a cut above. We ordered room service frequently or ate at one of the excellent restaurants in World Pavilion. It's a bit of a mystery to me why singles, couples without kids, honeymooners or business travelers would opt for any Disney property save the Grand Floridian. The effort at Disney is directed towards pleasing families--this is a tough bill to fill and, of course, some amenities one may expect from less family-oriented resorts may be missing.

Reviews.Title: “Not For Business Travelers”
Reviews.Author: Blackbears
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at the Dolphin/Swan. I registered for the conference late, so I spent one night at Dolpin and second night here. I was very disappointed that the hotel said they would honor the "conference rate" offered at the Dolphin and then didn't. I am working to try and resolve this issue with hotel management. Overall, this is a very nice hotel, especially if you are traveling with a family. The location is great, short walk to Epcot, water taxi to MGM, and the Boardwalk just another short walk.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not great, especially for a "Deluxe resort"”
Reviews.Author: animefangirl
Reviews.Content: This past week I spent a week at Disney for my 32nd B-day. I went with my mom and dad. I have stayed at other Deluxe hotels on Disney property including the Contemporary & the Dolphin. I liked the Epcot Resort Area and wanted a hotel this time around in that same area. After doing some research and even seeing Samantha Brown on the Travel Channel glorify this resort I planned to stay here. I was a bit disappointed in the result. The other resorts were much better. This is how my experience of the hotel and my trip went: Well I had a blast going on vacation with my mom and dad...The flight to Florida got their earlier than we expected ...We got the Magical Express bus right away (I love not having to deal with the luggage as well, Disney outdid themselves with these perks). We got to the resort super early...when I went to check-in the room was already ready...YES!...my travel agent had made note that it was my b-day and the girl at the counter gave me a button that I proudly wore...she advised me to wear it cuz "you never know what could happen". We were a 5 min walk to the entrance of Epcot so we walked over their and the fun started right away...the weather was great for most of the week. I got a call from "Goofy" to sing me happy birthday and I got b-day wishes all through the park...at one ride they mention to the whole audience that it was my b-day..yes mighty embarassing...and at 2 resteraunts I got free desert. Another guy gave me "b-day stickers". So I kept my button on ALL week. It was pretty cool. Also my cousins that live in Orlando came and we went to dinner at Rainforest Cafe (Which I OVE) and they surprised me with a cake at the resteraunt too...needless to say there was more singing and more embarrassment:-D Now for the bad: Although the Beach Club was a "deluxe" resort and it got rave reviews I was a bit disappointed with it as opposed to other resorts I had stayed in at Disney. First although I had a room with a balcony the view was of a gravel roof and if you looked far to the right you could get a glimpse of part of the pool. With the exception of one day housekeeping did not do a very good job...when I first arrived I found a package of coffee that was open, coffee cups we used were not properly rinsed, towels we used were NOT replaced instead the ones that weren't used were rearranged to cover up the missing towels, there was crayon marks all over the balcony floor and the balcony wall, a towel that had a black mark on it was folded and placed in the bathroom...needless to say I never used ANY towels there except to wipe down a counter or place on the bathroom floor since there were no bath mats. Actually I never use towels ANYWHERE else but my own...Even at home I have my own towel that NO ONE is allowed to use. Call me picky but I am NOT going to use a towel to wipe myself with something that god knows who was wiping what just before! Also the floor needed vacumming. Then our coffee maker stopped working half way through the trip. On 2 occassions our "tickets" (Which are also our room keys) got demagnetized and had to go to guest services to get new ones....Don't get me wrong the hotel was not bad but I have stayed at other hotels there that were sooooo clean you could eat off the floor. I think it may have been more lazy staff than a problem with the hotel but it kind of put me off. The staff however resolved any issues I had right away...I told them about the tickets and the coffee maker and they resolved it right away without any obnoxious questions. Also there had been no hotel stationary in the room which I always bring back for scrapbooking purposes and I asked guest services and they sent some up to my room and layed it out nicely for me. The staff (Aside from housekeeping) was wonderful. Even in the store my dad had purchased something at another store and even though it was not an item sold in the hotel store they let us exchange it for something else with no problem. I know this is Disney policy because we had something similiar happen on a previous trip but there was still no hassle which is always great. On Tuesday (The actual day of my b-day) we were on a ride and a man was sneezing in front of us on line...that night I got a really bad sore throat. I woke up the next day sick as a dog. We made our way to Downtown Disney to do some shopping... we also had lunch at Bongo's...I made an effort as I did not want to miss out but after a couple of hours I had to go back to the hotel and stayed in bed...I found cold medicine in the hotel store and slept the day away...so I basically lost half a day of vacation in bed sick...the rest of the trip I went on to the parks and stuff but still continue to recover from my cold...I haven't had a cold in YEARS but I was just glad it wasn't my usual resperatory infections because those would have had be in bed for the rest of the trip and at least with a cold I can cure it with over the counter meds and I recover pretty quick and can at least fuction even if I am sick....I missed out on a couple of the "water" rides as I did not want to get wet (Especially with all the AC) and get more sick... but that moves me on to the next thing. RAIN...Florida had been going through a dry spell so of course it decides to correct its issue on the final days of my trip...it rained for about 2 days off and on...the day before we left it poured all night and was cloudy and rainy in the day but we went to the parks because we wanted to make due of our last day...the sun peaked out for about 5 mins...and seeing as it was rainy and cloudy all day I forgot to put on sunblock...and wahlah I got sunburn on my shoulders... Another thing that drove me nuts were these friggin' bugs...I noticed as soon as we got there these bugs that were EVERYWHERE...it was like a bad horror movie...these bugs were litterally flying around "attached". It was mating season for these bugs and they would fly around attached to each other and land on anything, including YOU...which I HATE bugs...they were a nusance and I killed my fair share...I asked my cousin about it and he told me that they only come out like this 2 weeks a year...and of course it had to be in the 1 week I was there *Sigh*. While Florida was rainy and high winds with a tropical storm I was watching how NY weather was sunny and in the 90's. Then the day we are coming back the weather forcast for Florida for that week 90's and sunny and NY rainy. I was starting to think it was ME! We left sunny warm wonderful Florida for NY which was pouring rain our flight was supposed to come in at 7:00pm but due to the weather we had to keep flying around and around till the plane got clearance...my dad was not a happy camper (as he hates to fly) and we did not get into NY till 8:30 and it WAS pouring and chilly...not the best weather for trying to recover from a cold. I was just glad I chose to go through Jet-Blue as I kept myself entertained watching "Cris Angel-Mind Freak" on Direct-TV and they got plenty of leg room and snacks. This was the first time I flew Jet Blue but I will fly with them again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Running-Swim-Dad
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Resort this past week. Was disappointed with resort in general. specifically, dining options, room size and bed size. Expected larger room with queen size beds given delexe designation of property and deluxe room rate. Unfortunately room was only slightly larger than moderate resort rooms (Coronado Springs, Port Oleans, etc.) and room had double beds not queen sized. Dining options are very limited - one-hour wait for sit-down restaturants on 2 nights and no real quick dining option. The Marketplace has very limited dinner/breakfest choices, pre-made sandwiches, Ceasar salads and muffins/danishes. Only quick service restaurant on property was ice cream shops with less than 20 tables. Have stayed over the past several years at nearly every Disney resort property, deluxe, moderate and value and this was by far the most dissappointing resort to date. Better choices for the money include Animal Kingdom & Wilderness Lodgesand the monorail hotels, Contemporary or Polynesisan. Or save some money and stay at one of the moderate hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Other Deluxes Better”
Reviews.Author: DisneyFan_natic
Reviews.Content: May 17-21st. 2007 - Our sixth trip to WDW in a year(20 overall) - we've stayed in nearly every resort on property and this is the first Deluxe we would not recommend. A few quirks add up to a not so deluxe hotel. At the Poly, guests and castmembers alike greet each other warmly, a nice Aloha, almost like family. At the Beach club it was an entirely different feel: stuffy, pretentious people everywhere. If all your clothing has an IZOD gator logo on it, you always turn your collars up, and you greet your guests with a "Dahhrliiing its been so longggg" with a couple of "air-kisses" thrown in for good measure then this is the place for you... The much bragged about pool was okay - hardly a "miniature water park" as one site listed it. Nice but again other resorts have equally nice pools. No food court for breakfast - just a small selection of muffins and one hot entree in the gift shop. The bathrooms at this resort were smaller and more cramped than those at the moderates, and we were in a deluxe room. No privacy at the sinks from the rest of the room ( again the moderates offer a door or curtain to separate the bathroom area from the rest of the room. Pluses: Super close to EPCOT - literally a few hundred yards from the corner of the property, and close to Boardwalk, A fun pool for the kids, but again not the only one on WDW property. For the cost involved and considering all aspects, cleanliness, closeness to the parks, resort amenities, staff friendliness, and professionalism and food availability. I would have to go with a thumbs down on this one. If you're looking for a good moderate I recommend the Port Orleans French Quarter, top of the line. And for Deluxe - nothing beats the Polynesian considering all criteria listed above.

Reviews.Title: “Back for a second time.”
Reviews.Author: dentalhy
Reviews.Content: Using a employee discount, we (two adults, two teens) stayed here from May 2 through May 6th. We used the Magical Bus to get to the hotel. It was a bit delayed at the airport, which added to the anxiety of wanting to 'just get there already'. Check-in was easy. Our room was on the lower level, right near the kids babysitting area. At first I was a bit leary, but honestly we never heard the kiddos. However, the people in the hallway were very loud......don't people realize that when it is 7 am, not everyone is up? Having stayed here before, once in the villa, and once in the resort; I knew what to expect for atmosphere and amenities. I was surprised to see that his room was very different (smaller, not as well appointed) as the one I stayed in last July. When I asked about this at the desk, no one could tell me the reason. In fact, I think they thought I was nuts. But I know it was smaller and seemed a bit 'older'. Anyway....the room was immaculate, and was made up perfectly each day. Our second to last day, we did get a knock at 8 am for mousekeeping. I knew I should have asked for one of those 'do not disturb' signs. The location of the Beach Club is perfect. Walk to Epcot and you can walk to MGM. The pools are wonderful, the beach and looking out over the boardwalk area is just fun! Mostly families and older couples stay here. No problems with unsupervised teens, etc. The employees in the Marketplace (where you can get food, etc.,) were very friendly. We did buy the $11.99 refillable mug and got a lot of use from it. We brought our own breakfast items (bagels, yogurt) and supplemented with the fresh fruit purchased in the Marketplace. We did eat at Beaches and Cream for our last lunch there. The food was really good and great, friendly service. What it boils down to is you are paying for the location. We were hardly ever in our room. We did use the pools. But for $200+ to just 'sleep' it is a lot of money. But, having stayed elsewhere in Disney; it is our favorite location by far. I would stay again, but try to get an upstairs room, and in the newer area.

Reviews.Title: “You pay for what you get.”
Reviews.Author: Vegastrip
Reviews.Content: Let's face it... Anything in Disney is overpriced. You pay for what you get not get what you pay for. We stayed here for 4 nights and then went on the Disney Cruise. (We were disappointed with the cruise as the food for children under 10 to choose from was very minimal, among other things) We found the location and property to be as expected. We were upgraded for free to the concierge level without even asking which was nice but we still felt the upgrade was not worth the price.(and as mentioned, it was free.) As other's have mentioned, some of the property is in need of updating. The room had to have been a recent renovate because it was as expected, very nice. I found the pool area really run down. However, it may be do to the unruly guests and not the lack of trying by the hotel staff. We also were assigned a room at the very end of a hallway. We did not care as we are mid aged and "somewhat" fit however, I noticed a few people who where having trouble and complaining of the distance they were away from the elevators. Everything in Disney is a far walk, including your room. We stayed at the Hard Rock for 3 nights and it just seemed to be a better run facility and was in much nicer condition. It was also cheaper than the beach club. (not by much though) I feel since we stayed there first I had a comparable park hotel to go apples to apples with the beach club, although nice, it just lacked the Magic. I will also mention that Disney Fast Pass doesn't even come close to the Universal express. (The express is what you hope for for the money.) In summary, I liked this property and it pretty much delivered what I thought it would. I can only give it an average rating do to the cost for what you get. And again, that is not fault of this property... That is just Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Pool and Proximity to Epcot and MGM Worth the Price”
Reviews.Author: LongIsland53
Reviews.Content: My family of five just returned from a week's vacation at Walt Disney World and we had a very positive experience with Disney's Beach Club resort. Five of us (kids ages 9, 7 and 5) fit comfortably in a standard room with two queen size beds and a single day bed. Although a little tight, the only time we spent in the room was to sleep and change our clothes. The room, including the bathroom, was clean and we did not experience any of the problems others referred to in their reviews. Disney offers a number of resort choices for a variety of budgets. The two things that make the Beach Club standout from the others is the amazing pool and it's close proximity to Epcot and MGM. The pool was awesome for people of all ages. First, it was huge and meandered around the property. While there were alot of people using the pool, it never felt crowded and you could find a chair or two, particularly in the sun. Unlike other resorts I have visited, the chairs in the shade were the first to go. The depth ranged from 2 feet to 6 feet. The big hit with my family was the part of the pool that had a large mound of sand in the middle of it. It was like going to the beach and my five year old son loved sitting in the water and playing in the sand with the bucket and shovel that could be found all over the place. The sand is the unique feature of this pool...it is on the bottom of the entire pool. For the older kids and adults there is a real nice water slide and a whirlpool area in the main pool. As I said before, the other thing that makes the Beach Club standout is it's promximity to Epcot and MGM. For Epoct it is a five minute walk to the back gate. This was great as we were able to run and catch Illuminations several times during our stay. To get to MGM it is a short boat ride or about a mile long walk. We always took the boat which seemed to run on a 15 minute schedule. Bus transportation is provided to reach all of the other parts of Walt Disney World. All in all, a very pleasant experience and we will definitely return to the Beach Club when we return to Disney. If you have a young family, the pool and the proximity to Epcot and MGM are well worth the premium price.

Reviews.Title: “Oh yeah!”
Reviews.Author: alipkin911
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite activities is walking. Now saying that, my room was the farthest away from civilization that I could find. It was great. The hallways were nicely decorated, the carpets clean, and flowers set on tables every few feet. My room was large with no strange odors. My daughter loved the fact that the offered a stocked fridge and candy, but after I explained that they charged for even picking up a candy bar, she understood. The main reason I picked this hotel was for the pool! It is awesome! The slide is the best and I have no idea how they make that sandy "sinkiing" bottom. Another section of the pool has a slight current to it, so you can enjoy a nice lazy ride in a tube if you want. And still another section of the 3 acre pool is especially made for children. Very nice, Disney. The burgers at Hurricane Hannas are the best! I didn't partake in the character breakfast, as we have done plenty of those in the past years, so I cannot comment. I will say that when we walked by, it looked as though patrons were enjoying themselves. I do recommend that if you stay at a Disney hotel and you have purchased a vacation package, add the dining package too, it will save you some serious $$. The proximity of this hotel to not only Epcot, but also to MGM Studios is ideal. If you are just going to be visiting the Disney parks, then you can utilize the Disney transportation, and not have to waste money on a car rental. I will say though, the buses are not the greatest. Oh they are very clean - but if you don't time it right - there can be quite a wait. I found the staff to be quite attentive. I am a pretty laid back person, and I like to joke around a lot and I found that most of the staff were much like I am. We are all just big kids! I can highly recommend this property. The best time of year to visit is during the months of September and the week or two prior to Christmas. I don't ever recommend anyone to come to Disney at the peak seasons, it is just too chaotic!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, excellent pool...pricey!”
Reviews.Author: Caseyno
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed at this property in March 2007 while attending a 4-day conference. We have visited DisneyWorld before and have stayed both on- and off-property, but never in one of the "Deluxe" resorts (one of the conference perks). Throughout the trip, I tried to anticipate whether we would return with the entire family (kids) at some later date, and offer the following observations. Check-in was a little slow....we got into the room at 3:30. Not terrible, but we did have to kill a couple of hours before we got into the room. The room itself was nice...clean, comfy beds, fridge, safe and plenty of storage. The toilet/tub were separated by a door from a double-sink vanity, and our room had a nice balcony overlooking the lagoon. Bed linens and towels were adequate, but certainly not anything above-average or luxurious. Maid service was prompt and efficient on a daily basis. Definitely enough storage for a family of four, and the bath setup works well for a family, too. There is a fabulous pool complex on this property (shared with Disney's Yacht Club). I counted 3 separate pool areas...a "lazy river", a sand-bottom swimming pool, and a "beach" pool...lots of sand for the little ones to build sand castles...reminded me of the beach! Towel service was great...I actually liked the pool towels better than the ones in the room! The pool was heated to just about the perfect temperature.
