There was a water slide (similar to one you would expect to see in a large water park) and it looked fun. There didn't appear to be a huge wait at any particular time. The pool hours seemed "short"...I know that my kids would not have been happy about the closing time of 8 p.m.! There was another small pool close to our room, and I'm not sure if the 8pm rule applied, but swimmers stayed in that pool longer (noise was not an issue). It is literally a 5-minute walk to Epcot, and a short water-taxi ride (10-15 minutes) to MGM. There was never a huge wait for the water taxis. Bus service to the other parks and Downtown Disney was regular and efficient. The "Boardwalk" with restaurants and entertainment was also a short walk (5-10 minutes) from the property. There is a marketplace where one can purchase souvenirs, sundries and deli-types foods (pre-made sandwiches, salads) along with beverages (including beer/wine). We did purchase a bottle of wine, but had to request an opener from housekeeping...it was delivered very quickly! There were also several other restaurants on the property with various price ranges and levels of service. The resort does charge a fee for internet service. Overall, we had a very enjoyable stay. However, the room was in the $450 price range--and for someone such as myself, who does occasionally like to splurge on vacation, this is a little more "splurge" than I can handle.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location tropical pool”
Reviews.Author: clubbeach
Reviews.Content: We have never stayed at a Disney hotel before, but this experience was very good. The staff for the most part is so friendly. We felt like royalty. Our children 6 and 1 loved the sand surrounding the pool. They give you a bucket and shovel when you order a kids lunch. They also had entertainment and games poolside for kids. My husband and I loved the sand bottom pool and the spas. We walked to Epcot three or four times it was only about a five minute walk. We took the boat to MGM,and we were thier in ten minutes. The bus ride to Magic Kingdom was only about fifteen minutes. Animal Kingdom seemed the longest around 20-25 minutes. We thought the room was very roomy. We had a baby so we were able to have her tucked near the sink area and she had her own little space. We thought the room could have been a little cleaner thier was some old spilled juice and dust. Overall we loved the pool and it had a great location. We would return for sure.

Reviews.Title: “nice resort”
Reviews.Author: DJNyc
Reviews.Content: I booked a concierge room and was a little disappointed. I didn't expect a room that cost hundreds of dollars to look a little tired, a little worn. It was also on the plain side compared to other Disney resorts I have stayed at including the Polynesian, the Grand Floridian, Coronado Springs, Port Orleans, Dixie Landings and Wilderness Lodge. Our room was paper thin at the Beach Club and were always woken up by people in the hallways either late at night or early in the morning. The pool and the grounds were beautiful. I love the sandy bottom pool that winds around . My toddler could build sand castles while wading in the sparkling, blue water. The beach was also very nice. We took walks there everyday, feeding the ducks and swinging in the hammocks and chairs stairing across at the Boardwalk Inn. The walk to epcot was a five minute pleasure and the walk to the Boardwalk was also convenient. You have several great restaurants within walking distance. Never took the buses to the other parks. The lobby of the hotel is grand and beautiful. They need to spruce up the rooms with new carpeting and paint. I read that the Yacht Club next door is a slight notch above the Beach Club. The Polynesian is my favorite Disney resort, especially with the newly refurbished rooms. Concierge at the Beach Club is a waste of money, especially with all the nearby restaurants. Magical Express is great. I've done it on two trips now and never had a long wait.

Reviews.Title: “great location doesn't make up for mediocre service”
Reviews.Author: patswamber
Reviews.Content: This is a first for me. I've stayed at a number of the deluxe and moderate Disney resorts over the years and this is the first time I've provided anything less than 4 or 5 stars. While the hotel has the best location and most amazing pools of all the Disney resorts, it couldn't make up for the frustrations we experienced. One of the reasons we stay at the Beach Club is for the gracious service we receive. Unfortunately, service on this trip was lacking. There were multiple problems with rooms for our gathering (required handicap accomodations), there were mistakes with dining reservations, and bus service was pretty bad (waited 50 minutes for animal kingdom). Purchases were not delivered to correct rooms and upon check out, room charges were placed on the wrong credit cards. I don't go on vacations expecting them to be perfect, I think it's normal for there to be a slip-up every now and then. I do, however, expect better when paying $315.00 per night. We got locked out of our room one night because the carpet cleaners knocked the door handle off our door. While waiting for maintenance, I chatted with one of the employees from the concierge desk and told her about some of the problems we'd experienced. She told me the service issues were due to the conventions and conferences booked by Disney during the slower times. She stated that there are two different areas that coordinate reservations - one for family-oriented travel and one for large groups - the two do not do a good job communicating or coordinating activity. There were lot's of conferences the week we were there (GF, Poly and Contemporary all sold out) so I'm starting to think she was right. Positives - boat service, cleaning staff, bell staff, pools, proximity to Boardwalk, Epcot and MGM. Negatives- too many mistakes with rooms at check in and check out, bus service, pool hours (closes at 8pm), Concierge desk (dining reservation mistakes, failure to deliver purchases) and the staff in general. Sometimes, just saying "sorry, we made a mistake," makes all the difference in the world. I will probably go back to Disney but I'm not so sure about staying at one of the Disney properties.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: StephieM
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend for a 3 night getaway in November 2006. It was a nice hotel, we opted to stay at a deluxe resort because there weren't as many children staying at these properties compared to the value and moderate resorts. The rooms were nothing fancy, but they were comfortable and had all needed amenities. FYI: They do charge $10 a day for internet access in the room. The location is great, you can take a 5 minute walk around the lake and get to the Boardwalk, where there are many restaurants and shops. The pool area is awesome, as well as the beach. There is also a boat dock right outside where you can catch a ride to Epcot and MGM. The Epcot dropoff is very neat, takes you to the International Gate, not the maingate, so there isn't a big crowd to get in. Also, there are clearly marked bus stops at the hotel where you can catch a shuttle to all the parks and Downtown Disney. If you are flying into Orlando, I highly recommend the Disney Magical Express, you don't even have to stop and get your luggage, they get it for you and bring it right to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Beachy Keen Beach Club”
Reviews.Author: MelvinaSt.Louis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with our two teenish sons (16 and 12) stayed at the Beach Club Jan 9-15th. We had a standard room, facing Epcot and the woods, near the quiet pool, just as we requested. I highly recommend this area of the resort as a respite from the many, many families with small children. I loved being so close to Epcot, walking there for a snack or lunch any time we wanted. The room was pretty clean and in fairly good shape. The hallway and room carpets are a little stained, but nothing major. The CM.s were friendly. We had someone in training check us in, which caused a few problems with our room charge down the road, but nothing unfixable. Overall I really like this resort. I do wish they would double sheet the blankets as I am a germaphobe, but I don't see this happening with a resort of this size. I would not classify this as a "luxury" resort, but it is one of Disney's better hotels.

Reviews.Title: “great location ,small room for a family of 5”
Reviews.Author: thetripplanner5
Reviews.Content: Our family was eagerly awaiting out trip to disney world and I would say our overall experience met or exceeded our expectations. I think as a family trip Disney was our best ever and would definetly recommend all families if they can to take thier kids at least once. Our big debate upon going was whether to stay in a disney property or not. Everyone I spoke to said that it was worth while to stay on site as you did not have to rent a car and could maximize your stay in the park. I would agree with that as if you want to get to the parks early then it is best to stay on site. We found the disney transportation very easy to use and much much easier than parking a car. In fact, one of the highlights of our trip was our 6 year old son having to sit in the front of the bus behind the driver on every trip to make sure we didn't miss our stop. We enjoyed all the parks especially epcot and mk. We felt with the fast pass we were generally able to see what ever we wanted to see without an excessive amount of waiting. As far as the hotel property itself the pool was amazing and we spent 2 of our 9 days just relaxing at the "beach". They also have a guy who plays soccer with the kids at around 2 every afternoon which my boys really enjoyed. The slides were really fun for kids and adults and they have a smaller pool by the slide with slides for the smaller kids which was quite fun. The layout of the hotel is vey spread out which makes for alot of walking. Service was good and the people who worked in the giftshop were really nice. Some of the front desk staff were not especially knowledgable. Our only real complaint was the size of the room. Our kids walked into the hotel and said is this the little peoples room. We generally stay in suite hotels and even in mexico a one room was much bigger than this. Our youngest slept in a day bed and i dont think you could expect any over 10 to sleep in a bed like that. However, we all said that we spent so little time in the room it didnt matter. However that being the case we would defintely not spend the extra to stay in a more expensive property but instead gget 2 connecting rooms in an budget hotel and be more comfortable at night and spend less money. In fact on our next trip we would likely stay off site in a suites hotel and go to disney and other attractions but for a first trip with young kids this was a great place to stay and would reccommend the property. We also thought the disney dining plan and enjoyed all the sit down restaurants. We went Beaches and Cream on site and our kids stll talk about the kitchen sink. We also enjoyed the Yacht club Galley where they had a great desserts for the kids. It was a puzzle that they put together made out of white chocolate with eedible colored paint. Never saw anything like that before. we also enjoyed the under the sea restaurant at Epcot where you ccan watch scuba divers in an undersea environment. We also eenjoyed the Crystal Palace restaurant where they had Winnie the Pooh characters. The restaurant on site was a buffet and we went there for breakfast and the dinner. We enjoyed it as well> All and all it was an amazing trip and a great experience>

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: miranda
Reviews.Content: We stayed between 02nd December-08th December. The hotel was in a great location for us as its only a 2 minute walk from Epcot so we had quite a few nice evening meals in Epcot. Its also a 2 minute walk from Disney Boardwalk again with restaurants and shops. Our room was the largest room we have ever had in any hotel and was kept clean on a daily basis. The only problem was that we were located on the 1st floor above reception and so it was quite noisy. I would request a high floor in the future when I stay. The hotel had a shop that provided food, drink, gifts etc... I would definately stay at this hotel again and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic but maid service is iffy!”
Reviews.Author: Stephlovestravel
Reviews.Content: I was a bit concerned about staying here as it seems to be getting some bad press. The resort was awesome. Our room was the biggest we've had @ Disney (beating the AKL, the WL, and the Poly!). I had requested a room close to Epcot and the hotel honored the request - we could walk to Epcot in under 5 minutes! There is tons to do @ the resort - we ate in the Yacht Club Steakhouse one night and it was great. You are 5 minutes from Epcot and the Boardwalk so there is tons to do. Great bars, shops, etc. This is one of the true Disney hotels where if you never saw a theme park you could be amused for a week. We did run into some problems with maid service. Our room wasn't that clean and we had no hot water one night. There are a lot of maids carts in the hallway and they seem to spend a lot of time talking amongst themselves. Loudly. A complaint to the concierge helped get all of our needs fixed and they were kind enough to credit us back for 1/2 of a nights stay for our trouble. We will definitely stay here again. I miss it already!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury but not enough stuff to do!”
Reviews.Author: alfred123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at beach club resort for two nights. We had planned to stay for three nights but we realized there wasn't anything else to do in the the resort for another night. We ended up paying $360 per night which we felt was a little too expensive. Nevertheless, it was gorgeous. The pool was amazing! It wound around a huge area and was sandy!! Great decor in the rooms even though we didn't have a very nice view. The boardwalk was great and enjoyable to stroll along at night. Overall - beautifull!!!

Reviews.Title: “Prepare to be pampered at the Beach Club Resort”
Reviews.Author: JGP4
Reviews.Content: Husband, self, 3 grown sons and friend stayed three nights at the Beach Club in two rooms. Room #1 on concierge level and Room #2 on first level with sheltered patio adjacent to hot tub (Room 1557). Both rooms were excellent. Our room had the patio, was a larger room than the standard ones - two queen beds and a day bed. It was very comfortable for three adults. Nice sized bathroom area with double vanity. Plenty of hangers in the closet. High speed internet (for a modest daily fee). Room was very clean. My husband noticed that the lock on the patio door was not working and reported it to the front desk in the a.m. It was replaced (not just repaired) by the time we returned in the evening. Lots of fun Disney touches in the rooms from the soaps to the the chocolate picture frame with a "picture" of the hotel in white chocolate! There was a fruit plate and a vase of fresh roses in the room as part of the greeting. Beach Club is also great for location, location, location. The water taxi is just steps away and we used it to get to Epcot, but it's also just a 3 minute walk from BC to Epcot. Buses were efficient and got us to and from Magic Kingdom, Animal Kingdom, MGM. Longest we had to wait was probably 10 minutes for a bus or boat. The Marketplace store in the hotel is perfect for picking up snacks (packaged or food they prepare on site). Much more than a gift store. Making reservations for dinners was very easy - we didn't plan ahead so we didn't always get our first choice for dinner, but we weren't disappointed. Well, maybe the first night, when we had limited options and ate at the Yacht Club Galley. 2nd night we ate at Oktoberfest buffet in Epcot (Germany) and thoroughly enjoyed the food and drink. For a buffet, it was outstanding. Next night we dined at the Moroccan restaurant and that also was very good. But the best meal came on our last evening when we ate at Jiko located in the Animal Kingdom Lodge. One son had the beef shortribs marinated in a tamarind sauce and served over a sweet potato gratin. Another had lamb (both these dishes were generous portions). Others had the shrimp or char (like salmon), and scallops. All very well prepared and delicious. They have a wonderful dinner salad where the dressing is a combination of watermelon, cantaloupe, and honeydew juices. Wonderful! We sampled cheeses and shared a bottle of South African wine, and had dessert. Total bill was around $320 for six adults. Back to the Beach Club Resort though. They delivered on all promises, including the hassle-free transportation from and back to the airport. We checked in for our return flight at the hotel and zipped right through everything at the Orlando airport. Check in at the hotel was trouble free and we didn't have to check out - all handled to minimize waiting in lines. We will return to the Beach Club again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, be prepared to pay”
Reviews.Author: traveller5678
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 BR suite, with concierge access. The resort is well maintained, with a superb main pool area (for all ages), along with other smaller pools were are fine for doing laps early or late in the day. The "beach" - Stormalong Bay, is perfect for young children, with its "0 depth entry" and its shallow maximum depth. The 4 year old and 3 year old in our party could both play for hours without having an adult hold them at all times. The resort puts on a short (30-60 minutes) kids physical activity program at the "beach" part of the pool, which is a nice touch (and free, but the times are somewhat random). The kiddie waterslide and larger waterslide are both great fun for the kids (and some of our adults!). The suite, along with the other standard room our party occupied, were certainly clean and well maintained, but were nowhere near the fit and finish one might expect for the price. The maid service was efficient. What you do get, in exchange for the obvious premium that you pay on the room (relative to a similarly priced non-Disney hotel), is excellent walking access to Epcot (5 min.) and MGM (15 min.), and decently close bus or car/taxi access to Magic Kingdom and Animal Kingdom. The boardwalk, with restaurants, a few nightclubs, and stores, is also only a five minute walk from the pool. The The extra-magic hours concept, with access to the theme parks for a few extra hours, during which only Disney resort guests are allowed to visit, is a nice touch. The valet service was efficient, as was the "magic express" airport service for those members of our party who used it. The concierge service was also efficient. My only real complaint was that the Cape May restaurant dinner bookings were a bit of a farce, and advance reservations were not appropriately honoured. I understand that this is a chronic problem there, and so the place might best be avoided until they can sort out their reservations system. So, overall: excellent pool, excellent location/park access, average room (for the price, but still perfectly nice) - all pretty much what we expected from a Disney resort.

Reviews.Title: “Family had a great time here.”
Reviews.Author: TakingThe5th
Reviews.Content: My husband, my 20 month old daughter, and I stayed here for a week. My daughter absolutely loved the pools, as did we. We spent most of our time in the lazy river pool, on the baby water slide, and DH and I had a blast on the big slide. Hurricane Hannah's, the poolside restaurant, had great margaritas, although the food was not stellar there. The hotel had a lovely wine bar, and we enjoyed very good breakfasts at the Cape May Cafe with the Disney characters. We got a corporate rate on the rooms - not sure if we could afford to stay there at regular prices. Rooms were very nice, staff was helpful and friendly. Budget allowing, we will definitely stay here again. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “At Disney, it doesn't get much better”
Reviews.Author: 2goSomeplace
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 rooms on the concierge level of the Disney Beach Club for a week. The concierge staff was outstanding and the Service at the hotel was impeccable (with two exceptions - a miserable bartender and a greedy waitress out by the pool who would take drink and food orders for our party of 10 but would put in the effort to refill one child’s drink with the same order - needless to say the tip was commensurate with the service.) The location of this resort can't be beat and the access to the multitude of restaurants and entertainment is wonderful. The pool is the best on Disney property So far this is our favorite resort at Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs Rude Workers Lost Reservation”
Reviews.Author: princessjsoiebird
Reviews.Content: We just got back last night from the beach club resort. My daughters legs are covered in bed bug bites. The one night she slept in the other bed with out pj pants on she got her legs biten up by bugs in the bed. The rest of us had our pj pants on(she is 5 long day feel asleep in her shorts let her sleep). The parking staff was rude was told to "hey lady move it" thought I heard wrong (no please could you move was not in the way was way out of the way) I asked what he said he yelled loader and in a move rude tone move it now move it lady don't you know anything you can't park there. I responded in a not very lady like way but I had had it. The gift shop/market place is run very poorly don't try to buy a juice box they won't sell it. The room smelled of smoke and that was our second room. They lost part of our groups revervation and it was only fixed after I asked for a manager and told them I would not check in until it was fixed. The staff treated my husband and I like we were doing something wrong when we needed a new room key. I will say the maid made a nice show of the things my children got they like that. The pool is really neat and fun and it is very close to epcot which is neat but I will NEVER NEVER stay there agian. We have stayed at almost all the disney resorts and this was the pits the trip was great but Beach club is a big no . We will stay at the polyinessain or animal kingdom maybe even a mid level next time just shows you don't always get what you paid for!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Island_Gen
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I needed a quick getaway to relax and have some fun so we opted for Disney. We arranged for a standard room with a King bed but when we checked in we were upgraded to a suite! The property is beautiful and has every amenity one could ask for. The food was awesome, the staff was helpful, and the located was perfect. I would definately stay here again, but there are still so many other Disney properties to check out too... :)

Reviews.Title: “My kids don't want to go anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: twintravelers
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Beach Club 7 times now. Although I do think the service is not what it used to be and certainly could be better for the price, I don't think you can beat this place for the overall experience if you have kids and maybe even without. The pool is without comparison in our experience and is surrounded by a 50s soda shop theme restaurant, a large game arcade, another restaurant serving tropical drinks and sandwiches, and the lagoon with boats that take you to MGM Studios, Boardwalk and Epcot. We walk to all but MGM since it's easy and faster. There are also games at the pool in the afternoon and a giant waterslide which can be enjoyed by all ages as long as you can swim unassisted to the side. At 50 I still like it! Oh and 3 hot tubs too. The only disappointment for us is that Disney keeps on taking things away. This year we were very disappointed to find the main pool hours reduced. Every year we go there is less on the buffet at Cape May. It used to be good and now is merely convenient, but there is very good dining at The Boardwalk or Epcot which are just a short stroll away. Many of the old "magical" touches have vanished. But it is still our favorite place. If you are seeking a quiet getaway, forget it. With very young children it might be a bit overwhelming too. This is where the action is and the perfect place for kids who are old enough to swim and wander a little bit on their own. You don't stay here for the room which is just clean and adequate. It is for the entire experience. We love it.

Reviews.Title: “beware of cape may resturant”
Reviews.Author: victoria03
Reviews.Content: Be ware of the diningroom in the Beach Club Resort. The breakfast buffet was ordinary and the evening clam bake was very dissapointing. We had a 6:40pm reservation for the clam bake buffet. We were finally seated 1hr and 20 mins later. The wait wasn;t worth it .Also, if you use the Disney premium meal plan be sure to watch your receipts after each meal is deducted. We had trouble 2 times with meals being deducted wrong and ending up with 0 meals left when we had 3& 4 days left to eat. The hotel did correct the problem each time, but it is very embarrsing when you hand your ticket in at the end of a fine meal only to be told you don't have anymore meals left on your ticket All in all I would recommend the meal plan, but don't use it at the Beach Club Resort --there are too many other fine resturants in the many parks that will give you a meal that is up to Disney standards.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pools, Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: metsmojo
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Disney Beach Club with my wife and 2 small children for a long weekend. The Hotel was everything we expected from Disney, great service, fun atmosphere and kid friendly. The pools were great, must have went down the water slide 100 times. Everyone at the pool looked like they were having a great time. No need to even visit the expensive parks with all that is offered. The arcade was a big hit with my kids. We walked daily to the Boardwalk across the lake (10 min. walk) and enjoyed the ESPN Zone. Since staying at the Beach Club, I have recommended it to everyone who asks.

Reviews.Title: “Disheartened in Disney”
Reviews.Author: mulks
Reviews.Content: First, let me start by saying that I am a huge fan of Disney and of Disney properties. The use of the "magical express" is actually enough of a reason to stay on property in my opinion. With that in mind, I am very sad to have to write this review. We've been to Disney several times in the past few years, and we really enjoy the location and what the property at the BC has to offer. The pool is wonderful, the buffet at the clambake is good, as is the character breakfast. The property itself is still in nice shape, but the entire time we were there, (4 days) one elevator was broken and never fixed. Anyone who has never stayed at this hotel before and isn't a fan of the magic and energy that Disney has to offer, will probably think this place is just fine. In our family's case, we spent the extra money to give the children (2, 9, 10) that Disney feeling--the one where everyone is happy, polite, and goes out of their way to make your stay "magical"---it's what Disney is supposed to be all about. Unfortunately, this is no longer the case at the Beach Club. Upon check-in the girl behind the desk gave us a slight room upgrade with a better view--that was the one and only time someone went out of their way to do something nice. Actually, to see someone on the staff happy, or to hear a greeting when you passed by them was an oddity rather than the norm. We actually heard the staff complaining about their jobs by the pool--it wasn't hard, they were yelling across to one another and having a sort of count down until they were off duty while guests were right there. Their only consulation was that as of the week we were there they now closed the pool at 8:00--great for them, but not so good for us, as it was August in Florida. Also, while there, my 2 year old son got sick and we had to have a prescription delivered. When the prescription arrived at the front desk, I asked the girl there if someone could please bring it to my room. I was told no, they didn't have anyone to do that, but I could pick it up. The lack of customer service has slipped at the parks as well,and that is really sad! (i.e.--staff at kiosks that didn't know where changing stations or certain rides were, trash on the floor of the teacups) Overall, when you pay for Disney, you pay for the "magic" that has always come with it. Afterall, they call every worker on property a "cast member", they are there to put on a happy show and to make you feel like reality is a million miles away. If you take that away, Disney properties are just hotels, and the Magic Kingdom is just another theme park.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel, and we're spoiled travellers.”
Reviews.Author: alexnewberry
Reviews.Content: My wife, my sister-in-law and I brought three kids to Disney World and stayed at the Beach Club resort. We are seasoned travellers used to staying in some of the best hotels in the United States and Caribbean. I was all set not to like this place, but I was very impressed with this hotel. It was expensive, but worth it. We stayed in a suite allowing us to use a lounge on the 5th floor where there was constant food served for free. Also free Wall Street Journal, New York Times and USA Today. A nice respite after hours of fantasyland and plastic. The beds were wonderful. High-quality linens, soft, clean and cushy. Very nice after a long day at Disney. Be warned, the A/C in these rooms will take you to Ice Age level. We had three separate thermostats to help bring it back to a sensible level. But it was nice to know if you want to cool off, you can. The swimming pools are a marvel. They link in a series of sand bottom lagoons; some have currents where you can float in cirlcles. Yes, pools in which they have dumped sand. Weird, but nice. There's a great store on the first floor where everything you need is available. Breakfast cereals for kids, clothes, gelato, coffee, fresh-baked pastries. Disney characters are apparently at breakfast downstairs. My wife said the Mickey Mouse shaped waffles were delicious. Most of the time we had breakfast upstairs at the free lounge. Room service was fast and I think it runs all night. We ate at midnight twice. The only place we had trouble was waiting for the free buses. They took a long time to arrive and then a long time to get to the destinations. Get a cab. They're about $6-$10, depending which attraction you're going to. Be warned, they will not drop you at the front gate of the Magic Kingdom. You will still have to take a monorail to get to the Kingdom. Staff was kind and helpful. We needed an extra day bed in the room and they brought one up at 11 p.m. I would surely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Terrible”
Reviews.Author: TravelMomNYC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is supposed to be one of Disney's "deluxe" resorts. As such, you would expect service and ammenties to meet certain standards. Not only is the Beach Club resort a cramped and overcrowded mega-hotel, the staff is completely unprepared to deal with the day to day realities of running such an establishment. To begin with, turnover of rooms is inefficient. On a daily basis, there are families camped out in the lobby waiting to check in to their miniscule rooms. It reminds one of an airport terminal- only louder- as there is no carpeting to dampen the din of weary travellers and crying babies. When the families do finally get to check in to their room, they are usually sorely disappointed with the size and location of their room. The rooms are cramped and provide only one desk chair- inconvenient if your party wishes to dine on room serivce (the only readily available means to get fed on site since all of the restaurants in the resort have been fully booked 180 days in advance). During our stay, we had to change rooms twice because of the overwhelming stench of cigarettes that seemed to be pumped throught the bathroom exhaust vents. There is only one elevator bank that is located in the middle of the huge complex. It is typically a very long walk to get from that elevator to your room....and the walk from your room- to elevator- to outdoor pool complex could take 15 minutes and qualify as daily exercise! Try doing this twice a day with a toddler- it is pure torture. The only saving grace of the entire place is the fact that you can walk to Epcot in less than 10 minutes. It seems as if Disney has done everything possible to make the Beach Club Resort an inconvenient and uncomfortable place to stay- so that you will be forced to spend most of your time in one of the themes parks where you will most likely spend more money. After our recent experience, I will never stay at another Disney on-site hotel. For the same rate, we could have stayed at the Ritz Carlton, which surely would have been more peaceful, serene and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Beach Club was awesome”
Reviews.Author: nollvis33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the beach club resort with a grand gathering. This place was exactly what the family needed. The pool is awesome and my ten year old loved the slide into the pool. It is centrally located between all the resorts by ferry or bus. The room was nice size as we have a family of four with a 14 year old and we were not on each others nerves. I would highly recommend the dining plan as the food was awesome and you can eat at many places so it is paid. Reccomendation for dinner was Boma in Animal Kingdom Lodge. The only downside was the fod at the Hannah grill was not good at the poolside and you can only get one drink per person so your wife must be in line for another alcholic drink. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: SJE123
Reviews.Content: I booked the Disney Beach Club Resort, among other factors, based on Travel Advisor reviews. Were my and my family's high expectations partly responsible for the score I have given it? Positives: * Good pool * Good accessibility to MGM/Epcot/Boardwalk Negatives: * More like a factory than a hotel * Overpriced * Queues everywhere * Room needs modernising * No sound insulation to room next door; every word spoken by them was audible to us (& vice versa, I guess!) * The "Disney experience". In summary, my jaundiced view of the hotel is affected by the dreadful experience of Disney after a wonderful time at Universal. The stay was expensive and was characterised by queues and nothing else. * Long waits for buses from hotel to elsewhere and back * Spending 80% of time in parks waiting to do something rather than being entertained * Difficulty to find restaurants in Downtown Disney able to seat us in the evening - yep, more queuing Disney, please please please use some of your revenues to upgrade your hotel & resort facilities in order to satisfy customers as well as stockholders.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing like Disney”
Reviews.Author: EDSALLKIDS
Reviews.Content: Maybe I'm just a little bias since Disney is one of our favorite places to go, but there really is something different when getting to the Disney hotels. This being on 3rd trip in 5 years, and falling on our 15th Anniversary we splurged and decided to step up and stay in the park. It was well worth it. Room was a nice size, slept 5 comfortably. Pluses were a mini fridge, always great with 3 kids. A nice upgrade at check in to a pool view with a balcony. The pool is awesome, actually has a sand bottom, a great water slide and goes on forever as it is shared with the adjoining Yacht Club Resort. Good frozen drinks pool side with nice bartenders. Convenience can't be beat, especially to Epcot and MGM parks. Short 5 minute walk to Epcot and boat ride to MGM. The buffet at the Cape May Restaurant was good for dinner but a little pricey as most eating establishments there are. The hotel has all the amenities wanted and the staff friendly and accomodating. The one negative,housekeeping wasn't up to par to the rest of the hotel. Always shorted on the amount of towels, saw some garbage receptacles over flowing near the elevators stuff our family has not seen in other 4 star hotels that we have stayed in. But these are only minor complaints, I give the place a major thumbs up. We will never stay outside the park again.

Reviews.Title: “Best family hotel with ideal location”
Reviews.Author: LOG51
Reviews.Content: We just spent 4 nights at the Beach club in a standard room with our two nine year old children and really enjoyed the experience. The pool area was a terrific afternoon outlet for the kids after an early day in the parks. The water slide was a big hit as well as the sandy beach area. The only problem was getting a place to sit poolside in the late afternoon on the hot days, but since they stay open until 10 pm that made up for that experience. We did the character breakfast which was fun, but felt the Beaches and Cream was a bit McDonaldish to pay so much for a burger. The best part for us was the proximity to Epcot as we could walk there in about 3 min as our room was on that end of the resort. Look out for the side gate if you are on that end as we were able to walk in there and take the stairs to our floor. We tried to eat our dinners in Epcot at the International Pavillons as they were excellent. The bus transport was fine when we used it. We did find the maid service spotty as they didn't do our room by 3 pm one day when we returned wanting clean towels but they responded to our phone request quickly. The place is quite large so we did do a lot of walking to get back to the lobby. The employees were nice enough but the few times we asked questions we didn't get very helpful answers. You can take the boat to MGM though we didn't particularly enjoy that park as there is a lot of concrete absorbing that 90 degree heat and then many of the shows are outside, just too hot. We were really glad we stayed at this hotel as it was perfect for the kids and we enjoyed it just as much. The only problem we had was that there was more to do than we had time for.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Beach Club”
Reviews.Author: HarryE
Reviews.Content: My husband, 3 oldest grandkids, and I just returned from a week at Disney's Beach Club Resort and loved the resort! We especially loved the pool because the kiddie pool was just right for a 5, 6, and 8 year old to play without having to be held or stay in a float. They loved the sand to build castles and felt like they were at the ocean. We talked to a lot of nice families there as well. We liked being so close to Epcot and Boardwalk and only a boat ride from MGM. We never felt like the bus ride to Magic Kingdom or Animal Kingdom was long either. We did have a longer ride to Downtown Disney but luckily we started out early enough to make the Bibbidi Bobbidi Boutique appointments to turn the 3 girls into princesses, which they loved! The girls loved the stuffed animal arrangements housekeeping provided each day on our return from a park to our room (one day Minnie was reading a story to Thumper, Marie, and Miss Piggy). Beaches and Cream Icecream Parlor was a big hit, too, for ice cream and for hamburgers and hotdogs. We bought groceries from the hotel store for breakfast so the girls could wake up slowly, watch TV, and eat while we helped them get ready each morning. One morning we ate at the character breakfast in the hotel, which the girls loved. We ate lunch at Cinderella's castle with the princesses one day, too, which was a big hit. Our room was big enough for 5 (2 queens and a daybed), clean, and plenty of storage, with a refrigerator. My only complaint was that we were so far from the lobby, even after I asked to be closer 11 months ahead of time, but after the 1st day I forgot about it because the stay was so nice and pleasant. The night we tried to eat at Cape May at the last minute and couldn't get in, we went to ESPN at Boardwalk and enjoyed that as much. We will definitely stay here with the next set of grands in a few years.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service & worn room, but good location & pool”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 2BR concierge -- Location is wonderful. We could walk to the Epcot in 10min even with 3 small children. *Room is so old & worn. They got to refurnish, especially the carpet and sofas. *Concierge lounge is so crowded. Couldn't take a seat to have a breakfast for almost 10min. Not a great selection of food except for the breakfast. *Towels are soooo thin! *Hot water wasn't hot enough. Major Problem: One day in the Animal Kingdom, we found our key cards (ticket also) don't work because they were magnetized. So when we came back to the BC, I asked the staff to de-magnetize the cards. Then, boom! Computer erased all the info on the card. They had to reboot our reservation. So, here we were, so exhausted from walking in the park in 95 degrees, but can't get in the room! Our concierge room at Deluxe hotel! My impatient husband was waiting during this whole process for 10 minutes in the lobby. He's getting really mad. So, I asked them to take us to the concierge level with their master key. (I should have asked them to take us to the ROOM by their key, instead. Or, they should have done that without ME suggesting it). It took about 30 minutes till we finally could get in our room. There was NO apology from the management later. My husband is really upset about this incident. I don't think we will go back to the Beach Club again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Super place - great for older kids”
Reviews.Author: kellyfromohio
Reviews.Content: Our family of four spent 5 nights at the Beach Club Resort during the last week of March and had an absolutely wonderful time. This is a great resort with a super pool and lots of things to do. The location is excellent if you plan on spending a lot of time at Epcot, the Boardwalk, or MGM. It is within walking distance of both Epcot and the Boardwalk and a short boat ride to MGM. Bus service is offered if traveling to the Magic Kingdom, Animal Kingdom, or water parks, and we never had to wait for very long. The hotel itself is very large and sprawling. It is attached to the Yacht Club Resort, but you would never know it unless taking a stroll around the grounds. Upon entering the large lobby, the rooms of the resort are to the left and spread out in a "stair-step" pattern, with some of them being very remote. The restaurant (Cape May Cafe), lounge, arcade, and ice cream parlor (Beaches and Cream) are all located to the right of the lobby and face the pool, so that all the "common" areas of the resort are actually in the center of the two resorts, which form a semi-circle around the very large pool. There is also a gift shop right off the lobby, which now serves sandwiches and breakfast items, drinks, and snacks served from 7am-11pm and is extremely handy as there is no "food court/quick service" available as in other Disney resorts. There is also an outdoor poolside "grill" serving the usual hot dogs and hamburgers. I would have to say that the one downfall of this resort is the lack of dining options, but with the Boardwalk and Epcot so close, there is a vast array of great dining choices available nearby...just remember to make your priority seating arrangements (especially for dinner). The rooms at the Beach Club, as in all the Disney resorts, were very clean and comfortable. There have been comments that the rooms are not spacious enough, but we did not have any problems with 2 adults and 2 kids (ages 7 & 11). They are decorated with a beach theme and very pleasing, with two queen beds and a small daybed/sofa for sleeping, upright bureau and closet space for your clothes, and countertop area with a small built-in refrigerator and storage underneath for food items. The bathroom was nice because it had a double sink area outside the bath/toilet area so that more than one person can get ready at the same time. We paid extra for a "water-view" room and requested a ground-floor room which was great because it had a small patio which we very much enjoyed sitting out on during the evenings. The upper level rooms have small "walk-out" balconies which look as if they would only accommodate one or maybe two people; although some of the rooms do have larger sitting balconies. This is simply in keeping with the overall theme of the resort by keeping it architecturally correct (as with all the Disney resorts). Now on to the pool area. The pool at the Beach Club can only be described as...WOW! This is a very large pool which wraps in, out and all around a 3 acre area. The pool is very unique in that it has a sandy bottom throughout and changes between shallow and deep water areas all throughout. There is also a kiddie pool area with a small sandy beach for the little ones; however, it still has some deeper water areas. Separate but adjacent to these pool areas is a lazy river area - but beware, it is very deep (over 6 feet) and the water moves very fast. Also within the main pool is a "whirlpool" which is something I have never seen before in a pool. There is a large waterslide that is really cool because it is accessed by climbing up a "sunken" ship and then curves and plummets into the pool. This waterslide is not a small one, either! The only downfall of the pool area is the size. If you have small children it will definitely be hard to keep track of them, and the waterslide access is actually not even in the pool area. You must walk out of the pool area and across a walkway that separates the lawn from the sandy beach area fronting the lake. Oh, did I mention that this resort sits on a small lake with beautiful views of the Boardwalk across the way and plenty of room to spread out in the sun and build sand castles with the kids. Just don't try to swim in the lake, as none of the Disney resorts allow swimming the the surrounding lakes. There are so many things to do here, you won't have enough time. All throughout the day, the pool staff organized games of volleyball and other cool things for the kids to do, there is a large arcade, an awesome ice cream parlor (check out the "kitchen sink" concoction...but only if you enough mouths to eat it all!), the Boardwalk for entertainment and surrey bike rentals, the large pool and also a quiet pool, and a large beautiful lawn for enjoying a game of catch or frisbee with the kids. This is the best place to stay if you like Epcot as you can walk to Epcot and enter into the World Showcase between England and France. I would recommend the Beach Club more for families with older kids or teens, but it would be a great choice for anyone. We have stayed at the Polynesian several times and the Animal Kingdom Lodge, and have visited almost all the other Disney resorts, and I can absolutely say that this is an amazing place!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location in WDW”
Reviews.Author: susanu
Reviews.Content: We've visited WDW many times and stayed in quite a few hotels both on and off property. It is absolutely worth it to stay in Disney properties, and to choose a location nearest the attractions where you plan to spend the most time. Use of the WDW transportation system alone makes it worthwhile to spend a bit more on Disney resorts. We just returned from our second stay at Disney's Beach Club Resort. We always have dinner at the Epcot restaurants and usually at the Boardwalk, so it's easy to walk to dinner at either place from the Beach Club, as well as to attractions at Epcot. It's also just a short pleasant boat ride to MGM Studios, which is our favorite for attractions. We don't spend much time in the Magic Kingdom (if we did, we'd stay at the Grand Floridian) and the Animal Kingdom is a bus ride from anywhere. We stayed in a water view room this time, and received a complimentary upgrade to concierge level. Our room had a full balcony overlooking the lake and boardwalk, and the concierge amenities were nice - they would be especially appealing if you have kids. They have complimentary drinks and snacks all day. At breakfast there are cereals, donuts, bagels, fruit and all breakfast beverages. It's very convenient to eat prior to going to the parks. They also serve wine, beer and snacks at happy hour - plus great desserts and afterdinner drinks later in the evening. Our experience at Disney resorts has always been very good (except for one time I stayed in Dixie Landings on a business trip - imagine having a conference call in a place where "Zip-A-Dee-Do-Dah" plays non-stop). The rooms are a bit small, but always immaculately clean and well-equipped. The deluxe resorts have better proximity to the parks and boat/monorail transportation, but the moderate resorts also have excellent bus service. All the resorts have super pools. We had dinner at Boma at the Animal Kingdom lodge, based in part on recommendations on this site. The Animal Kingdom Lodge itself is just spectacular, and the Boma buffet was excellent. After dinner, we walked to the perimeter of the property where it borders the animal park. We were offered night vision goggle, and saw a herd of gazelles, a couple bongos and five giraffes (including a baby giraffe). The giraffes came within 20 feet of us to graze! It was all so impressive we've decided to stay at the Animal Kingdom Lodge the next time we return. Following the suggestion in the Unofficial Guide, we also booked the Fantasmic! dinner package at the Brown Derby in MGM Studios. The dinner was excellent, but the priority seating for the Fantasmic show was a bit overrated - at least for the time we were there. We would not have waited any longer for regular seating. I was pleasantly surprised that we didn't have to wait in any long lines this trip. We usually visit in mid-December, and are rather spoiled because there are no lines for anything at that time of year. But the lines were quite short in April as well. The longest posted wait was 30 minutes, and the wait was always shorter than the time posted. The Animal Kingdom was extremely crowded (it always is due to the bottleneck design of the park) since Expedition Everest had just opened. But we went to Expedition Everest first thing and got a FastPass, and then decided to wait in line since the posted time was 20 minutes. We were in line just long enough to take in all the pre-ride details - and then returned later to ride a second time with our FastPass. It's a great ride!

Reviews.Title: “Great locations - tiny rooms for the $$$$”
Reviews.Author: velk19976
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a quick stay at Disneyworld. I needed rooms with two queen beds so I had to upgrade from a moderate room ($200) night to deluxe ($400) a night. Stayed one night at the Beach Club Resort and one night at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. The rooms were tiny. I would recommend getting two adjoining rooms with double beds for the same price. We could barely walk in the room with 4 people, 4 suitcases and all the stuff we had. On the positive side, Beach Club is a beautiful and peaceful resort. Animal Kingdom Lodge is a place where you actually want to stay in your room as the views of the savannah were wonderful and the kids took tons of photos right from the balcony. The pool at Animal Kingdom Lodge was a bit green colored and there is not much to do on the resort itself. Both resorts were very conveniently located to Blizzard Beach and the Animal Kingdom Park where we chose to go. So that was a big plus. Lastly, Expedition Everest is one blast of a ride! Everyone loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Disney Resort”
Reviews.Author: Jeff38094
Reviews.Content: My family and I (2 kids 10 & 12) loved this resort. Here is a list of the goods and bads. Good Location- 5 minute walk to Epcot great view of the Boardwalk resort short boat ride to MGM Huge pool with sand bottom beautiful, large room we got a great upgrade with a view of the pool and Boardwalk at no charge just for asking. very friendly staff great breakfast buffet Bad prices kind of steep - as are other deluxe Disney resorts access to the pool could be improved - kind of a walk to get to it even though it is adjacent to the hotel pool is large and therefore somewhat difficult to keep and eye on your kids. Overall we loved this place. This was our 6th trip to Disney. My kids like Carribean Beach the best. If Epcot is a favorite for you then this is the place. Jeff Anderson Clear Lake IA

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: notadq
Reviews.Content: Very decent Disney hotel. Pretty thin walls however. Note to travelers w/ small kids. If your baby wakes up at 5am EVERY DAY, please try to comfort or quiet them. The entire rest of the hotel can hear you. Very obvious they were doing nothing to calm the child. This might be a home practice, but a hotel is not your home. You are a guest! The pool was very chilly despite unseasonally warm March weather. Easier to walk to Epcot than take the boat. Literally 3 min walk to the gate. Decent gift shop. Restaurant/buffet good. Overall a pleasant experience. Loved the Disney bath products!

Reviews.Title: “Convention City”
Reviews.Author: esbatm
Reviews.Content: Nice place, but mixed between conventions and family vacations. Can be a bit off-putting trying to relax with your family while surrounded by sports coats and name tags. Too busy....

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for Marathon families”
Reviews.Author: Galatae
Reviews.Content: We were pretty pleased with our overall stay. The staff was friendly and extremely helpful. Breakfast was a chore, though, because Beach Club has one of the few character breakfasts and you MUST have reservations if you want to eat. You can get ala carte type stuff in the gift shop, but it's mostly premade omelets and pastries. I ordered room service one morning in desperation, and was pleased with the quick response. Our room was on the 2nd floor close to the elevator & lobby, but noise was not an issue at all. Although bits of our hotel room were falling apart (towel rack & door stop), the response was almost immediate when we notified staff. They also managed to clean our room every day, even though we spent a lot of time there for toddler naps and race recovery. We booked this property to be close to the Epcot start on Disney's Marathon weekend. This was just a perfect location for that, especially on Marathon Day as you can watch the runners go by the lake and walk over to the finish if you want. Unfortunately you still have to take the shuttle to the start at 4:30a.m., but that's more of an issue for the marathon organizers, not the hotel. We found being able to watch the runners from the resort a lot more convenient than shuttling to the parks. Also, if you're here for the marathon you will want to get the park hopper option on your pass, otherwise you have to pay to go through Epcot each day if you walk over to the finish (or back from the finish). We were also pleased with the convenience of the boat launch to MGM and Epcot, though it's easier just to walk to Epcot from this property. The weather was too cool while we were there to use the pool, however it seemed like a great place for kids, what with the sand beach, slide, and the floating river. If this was in the budget I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Beach Resort”
Reviews.Author: blauhund
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Beach Club as part of a land/sea tour (4 nights at the beach club/ 3 mights on the Disney Wonder) and were very very happy with our stay. We had arrived two days prior to the beginning of our 7 day package tour, and had stayed at the horrible (if inexpensive) All Star movies; in comparison this was fabulous, and further they upgraded us to the concierge floor, which was stupendous. There were 2 adults and 2 kids in a single room with 2 queen size beds, and no-one felt cramped. The room was spotless, the view so-so, the decor was exellent and the bathroom was great but not spectacular. The concierge service was really great with very friendly and helpful staff. The only complaint is that there was a small mix-up with transferring our luggage between hotels and the person at the luggage desk had no record of its arrival. even though after one phonecall I found out it had arrived hours before; she seemed pretty clued out. The pool area was wonderful and enjoyed by both our 10 and 4 year old. The sandy bottoms were a nice touch and the water slide was lots of fun. We had some cool nights and so the heated water was appreciated and everyone thought the temperature was perfect. If not part of a land/sea tour I doubt we would stay here again as a single night was quoted as 340/night, but as part of the tour (about 1000/person) I thought it was good value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not over the top...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Beach Club for the first time although we have been to various Disney hotels many times. Because we expect to pay more for Disney properties, we are realistic about the price but after visiting WDW for 30+ years, acknowledge that the service and hospitality is not what it once was. We were there 5 nights and after the first night, noticed the A/C unit was leaking. The water soaked the carpet over a 25+ square foot area. The staff responded promptly bringing towels to soak up the excess on the first call from us but the problem was never fixed and it stayed wet the entire time. We called the main restaurant one morning about 9:00am to inquire how late the breakfast buffet was served and was told 11:00am. We went right down and when we requested a table, were told that it was reservations only seating and they were booked for the rest of the morning. We explained that we had just called about being seated and had been told we could come as late as 11:00am and suggested that perhaps the person we had spoken with had reserved something for us. The hostess could have probably been more rude if she had cussed us out or gotten physical but suffice it to say that I was surprized at her nasty attitude. She made no effort to check, acted like we were invisible then a great annoyance in turns. We asked to speak to a manager but one never showed up. We had to catch our flight so we had to let it go but left with a bad taste in our mouths for the Beach Club restaurant. The rooms were nice and comfy. The location is the best in Disneyworld (IMO). Next time we'll stay at one of the others near Epcot and hope for a better experience. I emailed my displeasure when we returned home and in 4 months have not received a response which really surprized us. Not the Disney we once knew.

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: LollyMoz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Disney's Beach Club Resort for one night, Saturday, January 14, 2006. Things I loved about this hotel: Location, decor, layout of the facility, pool area/beach, convenience, staff. Our room (3578), while not having a great view, was a straight on shot of the Epcot fireworks. We could even hear the music if we opened the door to our mini balcony. It was great to be able to walk out and grab the ferry either to the Boardwalk or to Epcot or MGM. Actually, the Boardwalk was an easy walk as were the Swan and Dolphin hotels. There is a great dance hall on the Boardwalk and we did also visit Jelly Rolls which was so much fun - very crowded but a very upbeat fun atmosphere. The hotel has a great little deli in the gift shop that has very good sandwiches and soups (Saturday was a chilly day and they ran out of soup pretty early) and is a convenient and quick stop for a cup of coffee or tea in the morning. They also have a little mini-mart section where you can buy heat and eat type food as well as beer and wine (one important note: a bottle of Mich Ultra was $5.25 - yes, ONE bottle) and there is a microwave to heat up your food to take it back to your room. The pastries there are to die for! I really liked the way the room was decorated - obviously in a beach theme - with blue/white/yellow running throughout. The vanity area is spacious and well-lighted with a make-up mirror and lots of nice Disney toiletries. Plenty of good water pressure and hot water. There is a dresser with good drawer space and several luggage stands tucked away in the closet. There is a mini-fridge. Also, tucked under the desk is a rolling table which I thought was a great idea. I do wish there had been an easy chair, but really wasn't room (we had two double beds - perhaps in the king rooms they have one). We got an especially good deal on the room but I think they can get a bit pricey. Nonetheless, I'd definitely recommend this resort to one and all. Oh, one thing to note for folks that do not have children. This is a family-friendly resort and kids do tend to enjoy themselves running up and down the halls. Lots of strollers and little ones about, so if that is not your cup of tea, just be aware. We happened to be there on a weekend - a long one at that - so perhaps there are times of year when there are fewer young people about.

Reviews.Title: “Location the only reason to stay here”
Reviews.Author: Marykatesmom
Reviews.Content: I write this review after many stays in WDW. The Beach Club is a terrible value for the money but it does have the location. I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE being able to walk to Epcot. The view of the Boardwalk from the hotel is awesome. However, if you are used to 5 star hotels this isn't it. The lobby does not have the ahhh factor. I've stayed in better Marriotts for half the price. The rooms are starting to look tired and their idea of a water view is just plain funny. Trying to get a decent quick meal is impossible. The breakfast choices where abysmal. If you were unlucky then you were sent to Siberia, waaaayyy at the other end of the resort. The pool is great but it is impossible for one adult to easily watch two children of different ages. We had a terrible time getting seats due to seat savers. They need to monitor empty seats and remove items meant to save the seat. It seems people head out to the park first thing and throw stuff on the chairs. I do like the wristbands. So to summarize, if you are used to high end luxury accomadations you will not get them here but if you want to be as close as possible to Epcot then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good, not great.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 12/21-12/25. The location is great and it really wasnt that crowded the week before Christmas, in fact the hotel self park lot was half full at best and the pool area was never crowded. The pool was cold compared to what it has been in the past, apparently there was some problem, but it was bearable. Our room was clean, the beds (obviously new) were super comfortable. As everyone knows the shower/toilet room is absurdly small in WDW hotels, but no big deal. Housekeeping was spotty. They did clean the room in a timely manner each day but they did the bare minimum and the last 3 days NEVER cleaned up my coffee pot or restocked the coffee (?) even though I was leaving a reasonable tip for them, until the last 2 days anyway...The lobby and common areas were nicely decorated and the Santa they had in the lobby Christmas Eve looked very authentic. Price: Expensive, if it wasnt walking distance to EPCOT it would be outrageous, but at Disney you are paying for location too.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Beach Club”
Reviews.Author: healin1
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Beach Club and our first stay in a one bedroom villa which was approximately 750 square feet, perfect for a family of 4. I don't recommend the studios as I took a peek and are quite small at 350 square feet you might as well stay in a standard room at the Beach Club. We love the Beach Club's location as it is a 5 minute walk to Epcot and a 10 minute boat ride to MGM with efficient bus service to Magic and Animal Kingdom. It's nice to be located on the Boardwalk which is surrounds a pretty lake to stroll along in the evenings while sipping on a cup of coffee or hot chocolate you can purchase. There are a few restaurants and a bakery also. Beaches and Cream at the Beach Club has great cheeseburgers and ice cream creations but has very few tables and the wait was 45 minutes for a table so plan on putting your name on the list before your starving! The Yacht and Beach Club has the best pool facilities out of all of the Disney Resorts. Stormalong Bay is a 3 acre sand bottom pool with a shipwrecked boat and slide for the kids. There is also a sand area for the little ones to build sand castles. We have stayed at many of the Disney Resorts over the years but the Beach Club is our favorite. We utilized Disney's Magical Express with pause because of all the mixed reviews however we had a very good experience. It was so convienent not having to deal with our luggage to and from the resort. It does take approximately 3 hours for you to receive your luggage so be sure to bring a carry on with the items you will be needing before your luggage arrives. Bring your suits so you can relax at the pool! Have a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Choose another hotel”
Reviews.Author: howeboyz
Reviews.Content: Stay on site if you don't have a car or you want to take in the extra hours only offered to resort guests. Consider just how much time you will be at the hotel therefore is the extra $$$ worth it and will you actually use those amenities. Beach Club Pros: 1)Walk to Epcot - about 5mins. Great for our teenagers. 2) Beaches & Cream great for burgers and shakes - walk in only so it's hit or miss on the waiting time. Marketplace (only opened a few months) has good salads and offers the refillable mug ($12) for your length of stay - great for sodas and morning coffee - a must. Purchase continental breakfast and snacks and sub sandwiches. 3)Solarium was nice to get an hour of quiet 4) having a hard time thinking of one - okay the room was quiet. Cons: 1) Room was VERY small for 5 people - big mistake for us. Sleeper is actually just the couch with one flimsy sheet covering it. Tall people cannot sleep on this. Beds -not great - one sheet and one foam blanket-not cozy therefore not restful. Bathroom - yikes was it small. Door swung an inch from the toilet -was like a walk in closet. View? No, although if you hung out the balcony and tilted your head you could see half of the Epcot fireworks! Decor - bland. Extras - 1 tiny shampoo, 1 lotion and soap. Room was clean - not spotless. 2) For 5 days the POOL was not being heated so that you could get into it. At $500 a night we paid to look at it. The spas were not hot either - just warm. Recreation knew about it, lifeguards knew about it, front desk knew about and so did Engineering - I spoke with all of them. Front desk was superb at avoiding the question of when would they heat the pool? (Took two trips to Wilderness Lodge - steam was coming off their pool and it was beautiful) 3) Tennis was great although no sign-up and over at the Yacht Club so make sure you stick around if it seems busy. 4) Cape May Restaurant - overpriced. 5) Very quiet bar in the back corner perfect for a quick break. 6) Kids enjoyed the arcade. 7) If walking is a problem or kids are very little ask for a room in the center - ours was like finding our room in Vegas. 8) Hallways weren't clean and the elevator near our room was broken a few times during our stay. 9) Friendliest staff was in Beaches & Cream, Hurricane Hanna's and Marketplace plus the maids. Front desk was bad, bad, bad. I know it's a busy time, sorry you have to work but it's not an assembly line. So would we return? - all of us said No Way. Recommend: Wilderness Lodge (has never disappointed us and sorry that we tried elsewhere); Take advantage of Magic hours at night. We all napped after Christmas dinner and got up at 11pm. Went to Magic Kingdom with kids (14, 14 & 5) and completed the entire park in three hours! It was fantastic. No lines. Followed the same pattern for the rest of the trip. Only Animal Kingdom wasn't worth it as 75% of the park is closed - although started with a great dinner at Rainforest Cafe. Have Fun!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are nice. Service is poor. No one goes the extra mile.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We paid over $700 per night for a 2 bedroom villa at the Beach Club. For this price, I would expect that the staff go the extra mile. You will not find it here. Face it, Disney is a make-believe world and the staff ("cast members") act like they want to help. They just don't help much. Specific issues: 1) Asked for a late check-out of an hour or two. Staff told us that it was in our "contract" that we could not check out late. When was the last time that a front desk person called your reservation a "contract"? Not a good sign. 2) Ferry captain left us as we were walking up to the boat and refused to wait despite the fact that we were standing on the dock when he arrived and he clearly saw that we were waiting for the ferry. We waited in the cold for 30 mins until the next boat came. 3)Asked for directions to ESPN-restaurant. "Cast member" confidently told us in was in Downtown Disney. When we got to Downtown Disney, another cast member told us that we got bad information--the restaurant was actually at the Boardwalk--several miles in the other direction. He told us it was a common mistake made by Disney employees and laughed. Meanwhile we wasted a couple of hours. Overall my impression is that the Disney people could care less about their clients...reminds me of flying American or United. Recommendations: Stay off site. Get up early and be there when the park opens. Go to the popular rides and get "Fast Passes" as soon as you can. Get a parkhopper pass so you can move from one park to the other on the same day. Leave at 1-2 pm to miss the crowds. Eat off site. There is not superb restaurant in the entire resort. For the price and the waiting times, you are much better off a few miles off the resort where restaurants abound. We went to Islands of Adventure at Universal for the day and the folks there seemed more friendly and sincere than the Disney folks--but then they are not "cast members", just real people with a job to do. By the way, the staff at Disney would not assist us in any way with our tickets to Universal. The concierge rudely said, "I can give you their phone numer but that's it." Not the answer I would get for a similar room rate at the Ritz or the Four Seasons. I will not stay at Disney again.

Reviews.Title: “Our Fav. Disney Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at several of the Disney resort hotels and this one is our favorite so far, we have 3 kids who loved the pool, the arcade is larger than typical, Beachs and Cream soda shop is great for hotdogs and hamburgers and there deserts are huge. The breakfast buffet at Cape May Cafe is good too and for fine dining theres the Yachtsman steakhouse on the grounds, although I have had much better steak elsewhere. The walk around the lake to the boardwalk is nice to if your tired of the hussle at the parks and the proximity to Epcot is nice for that too, several times we just walked in and traveled to world shops and dined. We have stayed at the Beach Club, Polynisian, Riverside, Animal Kingdom Lodge, Coronado, Saratoga Springs (probably nicer if you like the home away from home resorts, we didn't), French Quarter, and Contemporary (blauch! wouldn't even think about staying again for free until major room renovations) and rank them in that order more or less.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families who like to do lots!”
Reviews.Author: Angelmonkey
Reviews.Content: We really liked the Beach Club. I was nervous of a family of four staying in one room (we usually get a suite), but it worked out just fine! Here are some things I noted: 1) Marketplace is not well publicized-- it's a little gift shop/grocery in the resort. They have really expensive cereals, so be sure to bring your own. But you can get things like beer/wine and milk for a higher price (but cheaper than cab fare to the nearest grocer). I will bring our own cereal next time though. 2) Marketplace doesn't open till 7am!! So if you want early morning coffee- you can get it at the Yacht club as early as 6am. I don't know why they open so "late". 3) The kids club at the Y&B club is WAY-better than the one at the Grand Floridian. Lots more space and just generally nicer. We took our kids to the GF club because we "assumed" it would be nicer-- wrong! (It was fine, but my kids are 8 & 11 and they felt cramped). 4) The beach area by the big boat is quiet-- so if you are looking to get away from the loudness by the big pool area, hang out there. 5) Yacht Club steakhouse is expensive but really great. We had the lobster/steak dinner and it was wonderful. I liked this dinner better than the one at Citricos. 6) Housekeeping was not very good. They cleaned well enough (when they came), but it was terribly unreliable. We asked for turndown and never got it. One afternoon, we put the privacy sign out on our door so we could nap (since they hadn't come to clean our room yet although we asked for an early morning cleanup). Then within 20 minutes into our 2pm nap, housekeeping calls us to ask if we want maid service! (They evidently wanted to clean our room regardless of our "privacy" sign). We reported this to management but they weren't too sympathetic really. ) Needless to say, there was no nap after that wake-up call! We were really surprised it was so inconsistent and unreliable (we are housekeeping tippers too!). 7) Pool is awesome. The quiet pool was also a nice place to swim (and the water warmer there too). The lifeguards are very alert (and many of them)! 8) Most of the people working there are very nice. There seem to be issues in the busier spots (like Hurrican Hannahs and some in the marketplace) where they have lost that "Disney magic". But most folks were really very courteous and nice. The gentleman at the front door greeting folks was especially nice with the kiddos. If we ever go again (and can afford it), we will stay at the Beach (or Yacht) club again. The proximity to Epcot can't be beat (and only a short boat ride to MGM). Plus, all the facilities at this resort are great!

Reviews.Title: “We love The Beach Club!”
Reviews.Author: mamasan38
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a fantastic week at the Beach Club 11/13-11/18. The location is great and the facility is well, awesome. I just don't understand the bad reviews. We stayed in the villas so I can not comment on the resort rooms but the villas are wonderful. The room was clean, well equipped and quite. We never heard anyone in another room and all of the staff was polite and very helpful. The pool was wonderful, my 3 and 4 year old girls loved it. The location to EPCOT and MGM can't be beat and we never had to wait more the 15 minutes for a bus to The Magic Kingdom. We did go at a slower time of year so it might take longer at peak season. We did the character breakfast with Minnie and Goofy and the girls loved it. This is a pricey resort, but well worth the money spent in my opinion. Don't be put off my the negative reviews this is a resort worth staying at. Have fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't understand the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: ltgmead
Reviews.Content: I took my 10-year-old to WDW for a special mom/son long weekend 10/29 - 11/1. We stayed at the Beach Club and loved it. The room (2555) was spotless, large and extremely quiet with a nice view of the smaller pool closest to the International Gateway at EPCOT. The staff was very helpful and the location was great. We were in and out of EPCOT in a flash and really enjoyed the Boardwalk. No problem with the transportation to the other parks, though sometimes a little slow. When my kids were younger, our whole family (mom, dad, 3 boys) had stayed at the Wilderness Lodge (3 times). We always loved the atmosphere there, but the rooms were very small and the walls were so thin that you heard every sound next door and out in the halls. This time we could actually sleep and spread out. My Disney days are probably over - til we have grandkids - but if we do go back, I would defintly opt for the Beach Club. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Beach Club”
Reviews.Author: bitirish
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Beach Club from 10/3-10/8/2005. We enjoyed the area very much.. it was just a short walk to Epcot. Our room was by the quiet pool.. just outside our door. The rooms were large enough for 5 of us and the disney hospitality is something no one could match... The room wasn't cleaned when we arrived (carton of milk left on the counter and a baby crib set up in the room).. Called the front desk, they were both removed immediately and we came home that night to an offer for VIP Illumination viewing and a signed auto of disney characters... I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the area, hotel was mediocre”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from our week at the Beach Club resort. Cons: Hotel room was very simple. 1 bed, 2 hard chairs and a TV set. My room overlooked the roof and dumpster area which kept us with the air on and balcony doors closed. Lifeguards at the pool are similar to WWII German soldiers. I can picture them with german shepards and rifles. As a 36 year old man visiting Disney with no children I certainly didn't appreciate the young lifeguard yelling from across the pool "EXIT THE POOL PLEASE". The young KGB agent got excited because my wife came to the edge of the 3 feet deep section where I was wading and handed me a 2 oz plastic cup sample of a drink she wanted me to try. As if spilling it would destroy the PH balance of 500,000 gallons of water. Another one made sure I understood there was no diving because while IN the water I pushed off the edge of the pool in the 8' deep section (once mind you) and mimic'd a diving action. While it is possible my torso left the water for an inch or two, I'd hardly consider it a dive. Still, the soldier felt inclined to mention it to me. I'm guessing because there were only 4 other people in the pool at the time and he was bored. EPCOT: France Our dinner took 2 1/2 hours. Thank God we ordered a bottle of wine and not just a glass. It's just 2 glasses each but our waiter was nowhere to be seen most of the time. The food was quite good once we got it but considering it was 2 1/2 hours, I couldn't help but think about all the things we were missing while we were held captive at their restaurant. We also ran into a French lad in their store. I'm not sure what his name was but he was a tall black man in his early to mid 20s. My wife happened to take French for 8 years in school so while she's not fluent, she can break apart a lot of what is said and translate it for me. The young man greeted us, my wife responded "hello" in French which prompted the "cast member" to ask if she was fluent and followed it up with "Ah Hah. I can shake my sholdAirs too and say a few verds, but can you hold a conversation?". There was something else he said but I was already upset that he just made my wife feel like a fraud. All she said was hello in a perfect French accent so the young man felt inclined to call her out as a fraud. Unnecessary, and I can think of 100 other ways to greet her into his store while enjoying the little French she knows instead of reminding her what she DIDN'T know.
