Not Beach Club related I know, but figured it was worth mentioning. PROS: Front Desk: I was really impressed by one young man behind the front desk who was just done with his guest and was ready to take another. Instead of calling out he walked 15 feet to his left until he was in front of another guest waiting for help and said "I'll take you down here sir" and then walked back to his "area". I found that to be very friendly, personal and professional. Beach club and Yacht club pools are fantastic. Sand bottom pools are a real joy to swim in. The entire staff (other than the lifeguards) were very friendly.The staff at the pool side food and bar was a pleasure to be around, especially Rita. The area is the perfect. You can take the ferry to EPCOT or easily walk the 5 minutes. Walking is faster but the ferry ride is kind of nice too. The boardwalk area is accessable in either direction. Just start walking. Ferry dock will take you to MGM as well and the busses out front were frequent and easy. Aside from my 2 negative experiences, the week was excellent. We used the dining plan which made things much easier. The hotel was clean and the Yacht clubs steak house was delicious. While it might look the same inside, next time we plan on staying at the Yacht club only because we prefer that side of the pool/s. Oh yeah, the elevators at the Beach Club are the fastest I've been on. Going from the 4th floor to the 1st is as fast as MGM's Tower of Terror. Considering my office has the slowest elevators in existance, it was a real treat to take an elevator that would actually beat someone taking the steps. It's the little things...

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Travelgeek0038
Reviews.Content: We just spent 5 days in the Beach Club and it was not a very pleasant experience. For the amount of money that you pay (over 270/night), you expect first class service. This hotel was not even close to an ordinary motel. From the moment we arrived, we had no evidence of courtesy or even remote interest in assisting us from the staff. Everyone seemed annoyed and disinterested. Our room was miles away from the elevator, and upon requesting a room closer to these (my father is elder and cannot go these distances) they suggested we rent a scooter. We had to call 3 times to the concierge to be able to get a phone number for the scooter company. The rooms are very common and our bathroom was dirty with sand when we arrived. We had to call room service to clean it up, which they did. If you expect to eat something other than hamburger and pizza, you need to make reservations in advance, because if not you will be waiting for hours to get a table at the ONLY restaurant they have. And of course, very expensive. The pool was good, but not worth the money or problems. That was probably the only thing nice about the hotel. When we go on vacation we do expect some problems to arise. But if I am staying at a hotel which is supposed to be of a certain category, I will expect it to perform at that level. This is definitely not a 4 star hotel. In my opinion, not even 2 stars. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Beach Club Resort!”
Reviews.Author: DigerDidoris
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Beach Club in July for 5 nites visiting from Australia having selected it for its location in the park. We were not disappointed. The location, quality and facilities were excellent. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “beach club didn't disappoint”
Reviews.Author: AC213615
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a relaxing week at the Beach Club. I have stayed at several of the Disney hotels, from the All Stars to the Grand Floridian, and I have to say that this is one of our favorites. The location is amazing- we could walk to both Epcot and MGM from the hotel. The buses to Magic Kingdom and Animal Kingdom were exceedingly slow (waits of 45 minutes for the bus were not uncommon in the middle of the day), but I have experienced that at other resorts as well. The room was a nice size for the three of us, and there was plenty of storage for our belongings. We had one of the "step-out balconies", which are literally one person wide. Next time, we will think to request a larger one. Housekeeping was great; every day we would find animal sculptures made from the towels and washcloths. Check in does seem to be a little slower than other Disney hotels; we arrived late in the evening, so it wasn't a problem for us, but we saw many families waiting in the lobby to check in well past the 3:00 posted check in time. Dining in the hotel is limited, although it was good to see that a very limited quick service area was added in the gift shop. Overall, cast members tried to be as polite and efficient as possible. As for Stormalong Bay, the famous sandy bottom pool area, my daughter had a great time! It is, however, showing its age, with many bare areas and corners that have seen better days. Overall, though, the benefits far outweigh the negatives, and if the rate is right, we'll certainly be back!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it! Stay at another WDW resort and visit this one!”
Reviews.Author: webchallenged
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Beach Club for 2 nights, then changed over to the Polynesian! DON'T stay in room 3699!!! It backs up to the room service storage/elevator area and you hear talking, banging, clanging, and the elevator 24/7. Also, although it's a non-smoking room, everyone seems to smoke on the balcony so when you open your balcony door, all the smoke comes in. Terrible! My family of 5 went on a month long driving vacation and we stayed at hotels all over the SE part of the US in all price ranges. This room was the same size at the $35 a night hotel, but louder, and smellier than than rest. For well over $200 a night, we should have gotten something after complaining; however, I just got an "oh, yeah, that room is noisy." The pool is nice, but if you have 3 kids of different ages, it's hard to keep track of them. Just stay somewhere else in the resort and bring your room key to use this pool.

Reviews.Title: “You don't get "what you pay for"”
Reviews.Author: tommel96
Reviews.Content: I was recently turned on to the Tripadvisor website in my quest to find the perfect place to go with 3 kids in Mexico. It has prompted me to write my review of last years vacation. I wish I had known about this website and read reviews on the Beach club, because I would have stayed elsewhere. We visited the week after Hurricane Charlie and Frances in September, we were postponed a week due to the storms. We were able to reschedule our reservation without penalty or problems. Except, I was not able to re-book the Princess breakfast at Cinderella's castle that I had succeeded in getting! That was a real let down to my 6 and 7 year old girls. Disney could not or would not assist us with that. We rented a car (great idea with 3 small children!) so we arrived and were greeted by lots of valet/doormen, most of whom do not smile. They might crack one if you tip them though. They seem to be waiting for that constantly. The check in was very slow. (They were training a new empolyee and took their time to explain every detail to her on our time!) But, eventually we got to our room on the 3rd floor with a standing only balcony of the lagoon. The room was adequate, a crib and refridgerator were in place as requested. Room was clean, and cool, beds comfortable. We were in a quiet area. Pool: The kids loved it! The waterslide was great, for th kids, and the zero entry sand entrance was perfect for our 18 month old. Now for the adult ONLY noticed stuff. The area where you can sit with the babies where the water is shallow is way around the back of the pool, and you have to walk all the way around to get to the restroom or bar. My husband was scolded at loudly by a career lifeguard for carrying a drink (in a plastic cup) through the water. There was an occasional drink waitress, but she didn't venture into the far end of the pool. The little wading pool and climbing area were in an obscure shaded area, the water was freezing and it looked as though it had not been cleaned in a long time. Who wants to sit in the corner of a resort? The water slide was fun for the kids, but the resort lacks security. It was very obvious that people would come in from EPCOT or where ever for a swim or a slide that were not staying at the resort. The tagging is intermittent. The pool itself also needed some renovations, areas of chipping paint, roped off stagnant area, and many bare spots of the supposed sand bottom pool. Beach bar had a very friendly bartender, just ask for a floater on you frozen margarita (drinks very weak and sickeningly sweet) By the end of the week, he knew my husband my name and did give him a freebie. Beach grill food fair at best. Hair braiding girl was very nice. My girls loved that. But be prepared to shell out around $30.00 per braid! Word about the Polynesian Luau, don't bother. The best part of the show was the half way decent picture we got under the sunset! I have to mention the next item, because it was so bad, I was horrified! The valets at The Polynesian on the way out were all talking about a girl they had "scored" last night after they all got drunk and were throwing up, etc.... nice! They practically ignored us to outdo each others drunk tales until my husband finally said, would anyone mind getting our car please? Then they practically put their hand out for the tip. Unbelievably bad service! The service issue is true throughout most of Disney now, it has gone so downhill, its really sad. A word about those who say that people who write negative reviews wouldn't be happy anywhere, Well I would have been happy there if my $7,000+ vacation had the quality and service it was supposed to. Needs some work in many regards.

Reviews.Title: “Solid accomodations”
Reviews.Author: njpmg
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Beach Club for a meeting. I was initially disappointed that it took a very long time for our room to be prepared. However, I was delighted with the complimentary upgrade to the concierge level. The snacks & beverages were wonderful, and it certainly saved me from buying breakfast in the mornings. Overall service was great. The beds were surprisingly comfortable, and the rooms were ample-sized. The double vanity in the bathroom area was also a nice touch. Despite the numerous families & young children, the room was very quiet. The Beach Club Resort is a place I'd like to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Its all about location”
Reviews.Author: mattkoko
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a 5 day stay there with my GF and her family(4 other adults and 2 little ones 16mo/5yo.) We got upgraded to the conciere level..very nice. The rooms are very spacious and clean. There's a little dining area they have set up for a quick bite before you go out(cereal,bagels,eggs,coffee,hot food,adult beverages etc). Yes its expensive but its the location that is key. You can walk to Epcot, Boardwalk and we found out you can walk to MGM if you follow the sidewalk near the Swan Hotel but on the boardwalk side. The boat stop is 50yds away if you don't want to walk. The pool is great! The slide is a lot of fun and the two pools are like bath water. The kiddie area is like a little beach all by its self. They have all the shovels and toys you need so don't bring any. There seemed to be a character breakfast every morning in the restaurant for the kids. If you don't care for that and the long wait go to the Yacht Club's restaurant they have a very good buffet (French Toast covered in cinnamon/brown sugar!) and menu and its never busy. We didn't eat L/D in the hotel so I'm not sure how it is but it looks good. The staff is extremely friendly and very helpful. I will definately come back here next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, not alot of food choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in all price range hotels and we were very happy with the Beach Club. The pool is GREAT for little ones!!!!!!! The location of the hotel is very cool, you can walk to EPCOT, take a boat to MGM,or walk over to the Boardwalk. The only problem was the food. If you dont want a sit down breakfast there is only a little store with a small selection.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for what you get”
Reviews.Author: Elkay65
Reviews.Content: After reading some negative reviews on this hotel, we booked it anyway. Well, we should have listened to the reviews. For $470 plus tax a night, I could not believe the quality of the food from room service. The steak and bean soup was, in my opinion, Chunky soup out of the can. I did not receive my side dishes with the ribs. The pizza was tasteless. Next, the walls are thin, just as another reviewer had said. The maids did a lot of loud chattering in the mornings; that was my alarm clock every morning, even though I did not want one. I could hear the couple in the next room having a good time. The room was okay, the bathroom was tight. My view was suppposed to be lake view, but was blocked by a tree. Why was that tree there???????? Honestly, I would not be writing this review if this was a Holilday Inn and half the price. On a better note, the pool was a big attraction for my 4 year old and 6 year old. the sand pool was perfect for lounging and building sand castles. The pirate ship slide was a blast for my older boy. However, I can't say I would be staying here again, unless they drastically reduce the price.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the beach club 7 years stright. Have checked out many others but still love the Beach club. goooooo beach club. McNamara's from Gloversville n.y.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel at dinsey”
Reviews.Author: johnboywallnut
Reviews.Content: great location and best pool in disney, only 5 min walk to epcot

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I, like several other reviewer's can not figure out the bad reviews. We have stayed at several Disney resorts - last trip in May 2004 we stayed at the Beach Club and the Beach Club just can't be beat. The staff at the conceirge service was great - always knew what we wanted when we came there. The pool is great-the room was totally awesome with two balconies. We also stayed at the Hard Rock at Univerisal which is really awesome to-but we can't go to Florida and not stay at both. We just split the time.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Disney hotel if someone else is footing the bill!”
Reviews.Author: cardinalgal
Reviews.Content: Yes, it is expensive. If you can get a good deal, though, it is the best hotel we've stayed at on Disney property (we've stayed at 2 other "deluxe", 2 "moderate" and one "value"). We stayed there about 2.5 years ago. The convenience to Epcot cannot be overstated, even with small children. The pool is beyond compare. The room we had was fabulous -- even had two balconies (one you could barely stand on, but the other comfortably fit our family). The room was spacious and airy, well laid out, excellent housekeeping service. The corridor probably could have used some refurbishing, but how much time do you spend in the corridor? The layout of the hotel was a bit serpentine, but the lobby always had something interesting going on, the grounds were amazing and did I mention the pool? Our kids didn't even want to go to the parks!! It was also SO convenient to Epcot that while my littlest was napping, the older kids and I could walk over there just for an hour and see a show or make a mask or buy a snack, and it was so pleasant. The boat to MGM was also nice, and we had no problems with the bus service to the other parks. We did have to share with other resorts, but it only added an extra minute or two to the trip, unlike other trips where a deluxe has shared buses with two or three other resorts that weren't right next door. Having the entire Boardwalk area there is nice if you have been to the parks before and don't need to cram everything in, and just want to have some "down" time. We only ended up spending about half our time at the parks and thoroughly enjoyed the area -- our kids loved the Sandcastle Club (child care) so much, they begged to go back the next night. The only reason we have not been back is the price. I can't justify full price there when for half the price I can get another deluxe. Beach/Yacht Club seem to have fewer specials (AP or otherwise) compared to the others. But if you have the means, it's a fabulous hotel!

Reviews.Title: “No better option for a family trip to Disney”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The bad reviews of this hotel make little sense to me. We've stayed here three times and love it. It is not the Ritz Carlton, and its not supposed to be. It is an unpretentious family hotel. Sure, the rates are Ritz Carlton like, but you are not paying for adult luxury. You are paying for the location and atmosphere. It's got a ton of that. For little kids, there is a great character breakfast every morning. And when we went at Christmas time, Mickey visited the lobby every morning. No waiting in long lines and the theme parks, you just play with him right there in your hotel. If your kids are 1 to 5, you couldn't ask for a better hotel pool. There is a sand beach and toddler pool with water that never gets above the chest of a toddler, and the plastic sand is clean, yet looks good and is fun to play with. For older kids, the rest of the pool has waterfalls, hot tubs, deep sections, and a waterpark caliber water slide. For the adults, at night, you have an excellent selection of restaurants within walking distance -- two in the beach club/yacht club, two on the boardwalk, and all of epcot, which has about ten good restaurants. If you want more restaurants, the Swan and Dolphin also have restaurants within walking distance. There are also bars and nightclubs on the boardwalk, a short walk away. The walk to epcot is about 200 yards. The walk to MGM is one mile on a nice walkway along the waterway (my preferred way of getting there) or a short boatrip. The bus trip to the Magic Kingdom takes a little longer, but hardly longer than the amount of time it takes to get from a car parked in the magic kingdom parking lot to the gate. This is a fabulous place to bring the family, don't let people's unrealistic expecations steer you away. There is no better place to stay if you are visiting Disney world.

Reviews.Title: “No Kids-Don't go”
Reviews.Author: BeenaroundRj
Reviews.Content: This place is an overpriced step up Holiday Inn. If you are going with kids to visit Disneyworld, fine. But I can't think of any other reason to go here. Rooms are very average and the noise level is what you'd expect from a thin walled Super Eight. Stay away from the rooms that border the incoming road with a lovely view of a drainage canal. Hotel is close to Epcot and Boardwalk, but bus trips to Magic Kingdom can take better than 30 minutes when you figure in bus waiting time. Also, if you have a problem, you will find the Disney Staff will always smile when they either stonewall you or refuse any accomodation. The Disney corporate philosophy is VERY regimented. Hotel is spotless and the staff is friendly. But for the prices they charge, the place could have been built a lot quieter. If you're planning on an adult only trip, don't even consider this place.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The beach club hotel is beautiful. Admittedly, it's standard seems to have decreased recently, but it's still one of the best Disney hotels. The rooms are very pretty, the Cape May Cafe breakfast buffet is excellent and the best point is it's location, right next door to Epcot, where alot of the transportation links are.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Beach Club Resort”
Reviews.Author: JJfromSD
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a stay at the Beach Club Resort and LOVED it. My husband, four year old son and I had a wonderful time. Our standard room was very nice. Plenty of room and storage space for the 3 of us. The room came with an "un-stocked" frig that you can choose to have stocked for you (for a price) or just use it to store your own drinks & snacks. Very convenient. The location of this property can't be beat, the pool area is great and the character breakfast was a high point. We loved everything about the hotel and had no complaints. It was quiet, clean and very friendly. My husband and I went back and forth about staying at a Disney vs. non-Disney hotel for our trip and I'm glad Disney won out. It was well worth it. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Beach Club”
Reviews.Author: EricABQ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Beach Club from 11/12 to 11/18. It was part of the land/sea package. We added 2 days at the beginning. My wife and I were accompanied by our 6 year old son, and 10 month old daughter. During our stay I attended a professional meeting at the Dolphin, so it was very convenient. The staff were great! We were assigned to a room on the second floor overlooking the lake. The accomodations were very nice, always clean, and sufficient for our family. We would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Beach Club!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Beach Club from 10/25/04-11/1/04 & had a great time! We had booked a standard room(with a great deal from Disney Visa), & at check-in we asked for & received a free upgrade to a room with a full balcony & a beautiful view of the lake! Stormalong Bay was great & wasn't crowded. No lines for the water slide. The resort's location can't be beat. Epcot is a five minute walk, & the Disney MGM Studios is a 22 minute walk or a 10-15 minute boat ride away. We highly recommend Cape May Cafe's character breakfast, & the food at Beaches and Cream was very good-we also enjoyed the "Kitchen Sink"! The staff was friendly & helpful, & the room was clean. All in all, we loved the Beach Club, & it helped to make our Disney vacation truly magical. A beautiful resort!

Reviews.Title: “Better service at a Super 8 motel”
Reviews.Author: wardefam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Beach Club from September 29 - October 6. Upon arrival we had dirty towels left in our bathroom, which made us wonder if our room was even cleaned. We found childrens small toys under the day bed and pin back in the little area under the bed. We over looked the small stuff and went for dinner. We expected our crib to be in our room when we arrived, but thought that they would have in it there after dinner. No, we had to request it four times. Finally my husband went down to the front desk to get it himself. We ordered groceries to be delivered, they never notified us that they were there. When we questioned them about it, they had no idea where they would be. And this was all within the first 4 hours that we arrived at the hotel. The next day my daughter had an ear infection. I asked how to get a perscription sent over. They were very nice in telling me how to get it delivered, but I needed a patient form faxed over to them, which they did not have. They told me I needed to find it maybe at another hotel. Why could they not have one faxed over from the company or another hotel. We had a room that over looked the "quiet pool", which is not quiet. The pool is to close at midnight, but there were people in there until 2:00 a.m. yelling and having fun. I called the front desk, but they did nothing about it. The worst thing was our neighbors. They came back at 3:00 a.m. fighting and drunk. She spent a half an hour pounding on the door of the room, which is not the hotels fault. We once again called the front desk. Nothing happened. She was finally got into the room and her and a man started yelling even louder. She started screaming for HELP, so we called the front desk again and then someone when up to quiet them down. They also called the police. Instead of removing them from the hall or their room, they talked with the people for an hour befor relocating them to another hotel in separate rooms. This went on for an hour and a half. All in all this was the worst hotel that I have ever stayed at...

Reviews.Title: “They've lost the magic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an 8 night stay at the Beach Club (it was supposed to be 5 nights but Hurricane Frances grounded us for a few extra days). My last stay at the Beach Club was several years ago and the decline in service is deplorable. I reserved months in advance and called several times to make sure my request for a room with a full balcony would be honored. We arrived in the "off" season and the hotel was hardly bustling, leaving one to think Disney would have no problem with this request. Wrong!!! I stressed that I had my elderly mother-in-law with us and the balcony was important to her, but they STILL smiled and assigned me a room with a standing-only balcony. It took some tenacity on my part to persuade the desk clerk to reassign us and - suprise! - they had full-balcony rooms available! It was all downhill after that. The location is still great and Stormalong Bay is still, well, Stormalong Bay, but the exceptional level of service that made Disney stand apart from other tourist destinations is clearly gone. We had just checked out of a hotel in Marco Island where the service was top-notch, so the difference was expecially acute. My advice - stay at the Beach Club if you like the location and the pool, but don't go in expecting to be treated as a "guest" - we've all been downgraded to mere "customers".

Reviews.Title: “Beach Club...Stay at another Disney Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Madborred
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at 4 hotels in Orlnado in the last eight months. We stayed at the Universal Portofino and Disney's Wilderness Lodge for our honeymoon in January and just this past wek we spent one night at the Universal Royal Pacific Bay hotel and seven nights at Disney's Beach lub resort. With that being said the Beach Club cost the most money and was our least favorite. Why stay at the Beach Club? My wife and I decided to stay here because we are suckers for Disney and loved the location of the resort. Our favorite Park is EPCOT and I like the Boardwalk. Both are within walking distance. I was also amazed at seeing what the pool, Stormalong Bay looked like. All of that is true. But here is what I did not know... 1) The transportation buses pick up guests at the Yacht Club before picking up guests at the Beach Club. This meant that we would get buses for the Magic Kingdom, Animal Kingdom and so on that were already almost full if not already full. We ended up driving to most of the parks because of this. 2) The constrution of the building seems very poor. Every morning we awoke to babies crying. I can sleep through most anything but this woke me up each and every morning. While walking through the halways you can hear people having conversations in all of the rooms. Thi did not make for a pleasant and relaxing stay. 3) I do not know if this is because of damage due to Hurricane Charley but there was a terrible smell of sewage in the hallway and outside of the resort. It smelled like garbage and raw fish!!! 4) They no longer check to see if you are a guest of the Yacht or Beach Club before swimming in the themed pool. And the pool was packed!!!! We were not able once to get a reclining chair by the pool. 5) The water is Hard!!! After sweating in the hot Florida sun all day there is nothing better then taking a shower. The problem here is that the water does not do much besides dry out your skin and hair. It made mine and my wifes hair feel like straw. So why two stars instead of none? Its still Disney. we enjoyed ourselves regardless. I enjoyed that unlike the Universal hotels that charge $15/day for use of the fitnes room it is included at the Beach Club. Valet parking was also half the price of the Universal Hotels. The view from our balcony was very nice, especially at night. We had a clear view of the Swan, Dolphin, and Boardwalk Hotels. What this all boils down to is that it was not worth the money!!! If this hotel cost $150/night that would be acceptable but for $345/night it is not acceptable at all. In fact it is getting ripped off!!! Plain and simple. Stay at the Wilderness Lodge. It will save you money and will be so much of a better experience. Heck, stay at an All Star Hotel. The rooms are almost the same size and I have stayed there 4 times and have never once heard anyone else. I hope this helps you make a good decision that will benefit you. We will be back in a year or two, hopefully at the polynessian but never again at the beach club.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Convenient Lots of Fun”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Expect to pay big bucks for a Deluxe room at Disney, regardless of size. But don't go deluxe for the room, all of the Disney Deluxe properties are absolutely beautiful, fun and convenient places to stay with fairly small standard rooms. Beach Club (all the Epcot Resorts really) is among the best for access to Epcot and MGM, best for dining options (again at a premium price). best for pools, views etc... If you're a penny pincher stay elsewhere and leave the Beach Club for the more discriminating vacationer. If you're comparing properties, Beach Club is excellent, Yacht is essentially the same place with a better view of the Boardwalk (from the water view rooms) but further from Epcot (still walkable), Boarkwalk is also excellent (better than Yacht/Beach if you like nightlife), Swan and Dolphin also look nice. Next trip I think we might stay at The Polynesian. Tip: if you don't mind a little extra walking take the Monorail to Epcot from Magic Kingdom and walk back to Beach. It's faster and fun (you get to do the loop around future world (awesome).. Readers are welcome to e-mail for more tips and questions.

HotelInfo.Name: Disney's Beach Club Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 1800 Epcot Resorts Boulevard, Orlando, FL 32830
